analyzed: mog mog por byed la sogs dang // slob ma bse ru'i lam gang dang // 'di dang gzhan pa'i yon tan gyis //
translated: and the path of the master,

original: phan yon che ba mthong ba'i lam //üîΩbyed pa dang ni mos pa dang // bstod dang bkur dang bsngags pa dang // bsngo dang rjes su yi rang dang // yid la byed pa bla med dag / sgrub dang shin tu dag pa zhes //
analyzed: phan yon che ba mthong ba'i lam // byed pa dang ni mos pa dang // bstod dang bkur dang bsngags pa dang // bsngo dang rjes su yi rang dang // yid la byed pa bla med dag / sgrub dang shin tu dag pa zhes //
translated: are taught to be the path of seeing.üîΩThe path of cultivation is taught to be

original: bya ba 'di ni sgom pa'i lam //
analyzed: bya ba 'di ni sgom pa'i lam //
translated: the path of cultivation.

original: byang chub sems dpa' mkhas rnams kyi //üîΩlam shes nyid ni de 'drar bshad //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mkhas rnams kyi // lam shes nyid ni de 'drar bshad //
translated: The path of the wise bodhisattvas

original: ces gsungs te /
analyzed: ces gsungs te /
translated: is explained to be the knowledge of paths.üîΩThe path of the student is the path of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, which is the path of the four realities and the sixteen aspects such as impermanence.

original: nga rgyal med pa nyid kyis mog mog por byed pa la sogs pa dang / gang zag gi bdag nyid med par rtogs pa nyid kyis nyan thos @6b kyi lam dang / gzung ba bdag nyid med par rtogs pa nyid kyis rang rgyal ba'i lam dang /
analyzed: nga rgyal med pa nyid kyis mog mog por byed pa la sogs pa dang / gang zag gi bdag nyid med par rtogs pa nyid kyis nyan thos @6b kyi lam dang / gzung ba bdag nyid med par rtogs pa nyid kyis rang rgyal ba'i lam dang /
translated: The path of the rhinoceros is the path of the pratyekabuddhas, which is the path of dependent origination.üîΩThe path of the master is the path of the buddhas, which is the path of the perfections.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lam la yang re zhig 'tshe ba dang nad la sogs pa mi 'byung ba nyid kyis tshe 'di'i yon tan dang / sangs rgyas dang mi 'bral zhing des dgongs pa mdzad pa la sogs pa nyid kyis pha rol gyi phan yon dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lam la yang re zhig 'tshe ba dang nad la sogs pa mi 'byung ba nyid kyis tshe 'di'i yon tan dang / sangs rgyas dang mi 'bral zhing des dgongs pa mdzad pa la sogs pa nyid kyis pha rol gyi phan yon dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The path of bodhisattvas is endowed with qualities in this life, since harm, sickness and so on do not occur and it is endowed with benefits in other lives, since one is never separated from the Buddha and he is pleased.

original: mthong ba'i lam de kho na nyid kyi yul can dang / nyon mongs pa kun nas zhi ba la sogs pa de nyid kyis byed pa dang / mos par bya ba'i yul la yang dag par mos pa nyid kyis mos pa yid la byed pa bla na med pa dang /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam de kho na nyid kyi yul can dang / nyon mongs pa kun nas zhi ba la sogs pa de nyid kyis byed pa dang / mos par bya ba'i yul la yang dag par mos pa nyid kyis mos pa yid la byed pa bla na med pa dang /
translated: It is the supreme mental contemplation of interest, since it is the path of seeing that is the subject of thatness and it is the supreme activity, since it completely pacifies defilements and so on.

original: de ltar rang gi don can gyi mos pa rnams la bstod pa dang / rang gzhan gnyis ka'i don can gyi mos pa rnams la bkur ba dang / gzhan gyi don can gyi mos pa rnams la bsngags pa dang / phyin ci ma log pa'i mtshan nyid kyis yongs su 'phen pa bsngo ba yid la byed pa bla na med pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar rang gi don can gyi mos pa rnams la bstod pa dang / rang gzhan gnyis ka'i don can gyi mos pa rnams la bkur ba dang / gzhan gyi don can gyi mos pa rnams la bsngags pa dang / phyin ci ma log pa'i mtshan nyid kyis yongs su 'phen pa bsngo ba yid la byed pa bla na med pa dang /
translated: Thus, one should have the unsurpassed mental attentions of praising those mental attentions that are for one's own purpose, honoring those mental attentions that are for one's own and others' purpose, extolling those mental attentions that are for others' purpose, and dedicating to the unsurpassed perfection of the unmistaken characteristics.üîΩOne should have the unsurpassed mental attention of obtaining manifest delight in the roots of virtue created by others, rejoicing.

original: pha rol pos byas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba la mngon par dga' ba thob pa rjes su yi rang ba nyid yid la byed pa bla na med pa dang / yon tan gyi tshogs rgya chen po'i 'byung khungs su gyur pa'i don gyis sgrub pa dang /
analyzed: pha rol pos byas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba la mngon par dga' ba thob pa rjes su yi rang ba nyid yid la byed pa bla na med pa dang / yon tan gyi tshogs rgya chen po'i 'byung khungs su gyur pa'i don gyis sgrub pa dang /
translated: One should have the mental attention of practice in the sense of being the source of a great mass of qualities.

original: nyes pa rnams kyi tshang tshing las rnam par grol ba'i don gyis shin tu rnam par dag pa de /
analyzed: nyes pa rnams kyi tshang tshing las rnam par grol ba'i don gyis shin tu rnam par dag pa de /
translated: One should have the mental attention of complete purity in the sense of being liberated from the thicket of faults.

original: yang dag par goms pas thob pa'i yul bsgom pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: yang dag par goms pas thob pa'i yul bsgom pa'i lam mo //
translated: The object that is attained through correct cultivation is the path of cultivation.

original: de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi las shes pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi las shes pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Those are called the bodhisattvas‚Äô knowledge of action.

original: chos du zhig gis gzhi thams cad shes pa nyid ces bya zhe na //
analyzed: chos du zhig gis gzhi thams cad shes pa nyid ces bya zhe na //
translated: How many dharmas are there in the knowledge of all bases?

original: shes pas srid la mi gnas shing //
analyzed: shes pas srid la mi gnas shing //
translated: Not abiding in existence through knowledge,üîΩnot abiding in peace through compassion,üîΩnot distant through lack of method,

original: snying rjes zhi la mi gnas dang // thabs ma yin pas ring ba dang / thabs kyis ring ba ma yin nyid //
analyzed: snying rjes zhi la mi gnas dang // thabs ma yin pas ring ba dang / thabs kyis ring ba ma yin nyid //
translated: and being distant through method,üîΩthe side of the discordant and the antidote,üîΩapplication, and their sameness,

original: mi mthun gnyen po'i phyogs dag dang // sbyor dang de yi mnyam nyid dang // nyan thos la sogs mthong ba'i lam //
analyzed: mi mthun gnyen po'i phyogs dag dang // sbyor dang de yi mnyam nyid dang // nyan thos la sogs mthong ba'i lam //
translated: the path of seeing of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on

original: de 'dra kun shes nyid du 'dod //
analyzed: de 'dra kun shes nyid du 'dod //
translated: are asserted as the knowledge of all aspects.

original: ces gsungs te /
analyzed: ces gsungs te /
translated: It is said:üîΩThrough the wisdom of being skilled in meditating on all phenomena as being unarisen, one does not abide in sa·πÉsƒÅra.

original: chos thams cad skye ba med pa nyid du bsgom pa la mkhas pa'i shes rab kyis 'khor ba la mi gnas pa dang / snying rje chen po rang gi ngang gis goms pa gnyis kyis mya ngan las 'das @7a * //
analyzed: chos thams cad skye ba med pa nyid du bsgom pa la mkhas pa'i shes rab kyis 'khor ba la mi gnas pa dang / snying rje chen po rang gi ngang gis goms pa gnyis kyis mya ngan las 'das @7a * //
translated: Through the two‚Äîgreat compassion that is habituated naturally and the knowledge of the unarisen‚Äîone does not abide in nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: pa de la mi gnas pa dang / mtshan mar dmigs pa nyid kyis thabs ma yin pa'i phyir ring ba dang mtshan mar dmigs pa ma yin pa nyid kyis thabs mkhas pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ring ba ma yin pa nyid dang chos su 'dzin pa dang ma bral bas mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang /
analyzed: pa de la mi gnas pa dang / mtshan mar dmigs pa nyid kyis thabs ma yin pa'i phyir ring ba dang mtshan mar dmigs pa ma yin pa nyid kyis thabs mkhas pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ring ba ma yin pa nyid dang chos su 'dzin pa dang ma bral bas mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang /
translated: It is distant because it does not abide in that, and it is not distant because it is endowed with skill in means, since it does not objectify signs.üîΩIt is the counteragent because it is the antidote to that, and it is the application because it does not objectify the conduct that consists in the attachment to all the bases.

original: de'i gnyen por gyur pa nyid kyis gnyen po'i phyogs dang / gzhi thams cad la yang yongs su zhen pa'i spyod pa mi dmigs pa nyid kyis sbyor ba dang / dngos po dang mtshan ma la sogs pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba spangs pa nyid kyis de'i mnyam pa nyid dang /
analyzed: de'i gnyen por gyur pa nyid kyis gnyen po'i phyogs dang / gzhi thams cad la yang yongs su zhen pa'i spyod pa mi dmigs pa nyid kyis sbyor ba dang / dngos po dang mtshan ma la sogs pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba spangs pa nyid kyis de'i mnyam pa nyid dang /
translated: It is the equality of that because it is the relinquishment of distraction in regard to entities and signs etc.

original: bden pa rnams kyi skad cig ma bcu drug mngon sum du mthong ba nyid kyi mthong ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: bden pa rnams kyi skad cig ma bcu drug mngon sum du mthong ba nyid kyi mthong ba'i lam mo //
translated: The path of vision is the direct realization of the sixteen aspects of the four noble truths.

original: de dag ni nyan thos la sogs pa rnams kyi thams cad shes pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni nyan thos la sogs pa rnams kyi thams cad shes pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: These are described as the 'state of all-knowledge' of the ≈õrƒÅvakas etc.

original: chos du zhig gis rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa zhes bya zhe na //
analyzed: chos du zhig gis rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa zhes bya zhe na //
translated: It is complete and perfect realization of all aspectsüîΩthat is endowed with the aspects, with application,

original: rnam pa sbyor bar bcas rnams dang // yon tan skyon ni mtshan nyid bcas //
analyzed: rnam pa sbyor bar bcas rnams dang // yon tan skyon ni mtshan nyid bcas //
translated: with qualities, with faults, with characteristics,üîΩwith liberation, with the factors conducive to penetrative insight,

original: thar dang nges 'byed cha mthun dang // slob pa phyir mi ldog pa'i tshogs //
analyzed: thar dang nges 'byed cha mthun dang // slob pa phyir mi ldog pa'i tshogs //
translated: with the assembly of training, with irreversibility,üîΩwith the equality of existence and peace,

original: srid dang zhi ba mnyam nyid dang // zhing dag bla na med pa ni //
analyzed: srid dang zhi ba mnyam nyid dang // zhing dag bla na med pa ni //
translated: with the purification of the buddhafield, with the unsurpassed,

original: thabs la mkhas bcas gang yin 'di //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas bcas gang yin 'di //
translated: and with skill in means.

original: rnam kun mngon rdzogs rtogs pa yin //
analyzed: rnam kun mngon rdzogs rtogs pa yin //
translated: It is complete and perfect realization of all aspects.

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: This is taught in the following verse.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa dang shes pa la sogs pa don nyid dang / shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa dang / sbyor ba dang rjes su sbyor ba'i gnas pa bkag pa nyid kyis sbyor ba rten dang bcas pa dang / bdud kyi mthu bcom pa la sogs pa de'i phan yon dang /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa dang shes pa la sogs pa don nyid dang / shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa dang / sbyor ba dang rjes su sbyor ba'i gnas pa bkag pa nyid kyis sbyor ba rten dang bcas pa dang / bdud kyi mthu bcom pa la sogs pa de'i phan yon dang /
translated: The meaning of the absence of essence, knowledge, and so on, is the aspect of knowledge itself, and the application and subsequent application of the state of abiding that is the negation of the essence of the absence of essence and so on.

original: ha cang myur ches pa'i spobs pa can la sogs pa skyon dang / shes pa dang khyad par gyi mtshan nyid la sogs pa mtshan nyid dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu nyid kyis dad pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang /
analyzed: ha cang myur ches pa'i spobs pa can la sogs pa skyon dang / shes pa dang khyad par gyi mtshan nyid la sogs pa mtshan nyid dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu nyid kyis dad pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang /
translated: The faults of those who are too proud, too quick and so on, the characteristics of consciousness, specific characteristics and so on, the roots of virtue such as faith that are compatible with liberation moksa because they are the cause of nirvana,

original: chos bden pa mthong ba'i rgyu nyid kyis dro ba la sogs pa'i bsod nams nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags dro ba la sogs pa dang 'brel ba thob pa'i phyir mi ldog pa'i tshogs dang /
analyzed: chos bden pa mthong ba'i rgyu nyid kyis dro ba la sogs pa'i bsod nams nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags dro ba la sogs pa dang 'brel ba thob pa'i phyir mi ldog pa'i tshogs dang /
translated: the factors conducive to penetrative insight that are merit such as heat and so on because they are the cause of seeing the four noble truths, the assembly of irreversible bodhisattvas who obtain the signs of irreversibility such as heat and so on and the assembly of bodhisattvas who are not irreversible from complete enlightenment.

original: 'khor @7b ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag ma skyes pa nyid kyis tha dad pa med par rtogs pa shes rab kyi bdag nyid srid pa dang / zhi ba mnyam pa nyid dang / rjes su mthun pa'i tshogs bskrun cing smon lam yongs su dag pas yang dag par sbyangs pa snying rje'i bdag nyid zhing dag pa bla na med pa dang /
analyzed: 'khor @7b ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag ma skyes pa nyid kyis tha dad pa med par rtogs pa shes rab kyi bdag nyid srid pa dang / zhi ba mnyam pa nyid dang / rjes su mthun pa'i tshogs bskrun cing smon lam yongs su dag pas yang dag par sbyangs pa snying rje'i bdag nyid zhing dag pa bla na med pa dang /
translated: The compassion aspect is the unsurpassable purification of the field, which is in accord with the equality of existence and peace and is the accumulation of the collection of merit and the purification of vows.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyi bdag nyid can gzhan gyi don zung du 'jug pa nyid phrin las rang byung bar 'gyur ba thabs mkhas pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyi bdag nyid can gzhan gyi don zung du 'jug pa nyid phrin las rang byung bar 'gyur ba thabs mkhas pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The skillful means aspect is the union of the benefit of others, which is the very nature of the three doors of liberation, and the self-arisen deeds.

original: de dag ni rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the complete realization of all aspects.

original: chos du zhig gis rtse mo mngon par rtogs pa zhe na //
analyzed: chos du zhig gis rtse mo mngon par rtogs pa zhe na //
translated: How many dharmas are there in the realization of the peak?üîΩIts signs, increase,üîΩstability, the abiding of the mind,

original: de yi rtags dang rnam 'phel dang // brtan dang sems kun gnas pa dang // mthong zhes bya dang bsgom pa zhes //
analyzed: de yi rtags dang rnam 'phel dang // brtan dang sems kun gnas pa dang // mthong zhes bya dang bsgom pa zhes //
translated: what is called seeing and what is called meditation,

original: bya ba'i lam ni so so la //
analyzed: bya ba'i lam ni so so la //
translated: The path of action is individual.

original: rnam par rtog pa rnam bzhi yi //üîΩgnyen po rnam pa bzhi dang ni //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnam bzhi yi // gnyen po rnam pa bzhi dang ni //
translated: The antidote to the four types of

original: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin //üîΩlog par sgrub dang bcas pa ni //üîΩrtse mo mngon rtogs /
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin // log par sgrub dang bcas pa ni // rtse mo mngon rtogs /
translated: conceptualization is the uninterrupted samadhi.

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: The summit is the realization of the summit.üîΩThe signs of the summit are as follows: In dreams, one sees the signs of the path of application, such as seeing the dreamlike nature of all phenomena.

original: rmi lam du chos thams cad rmi lam lta bur lta ba la sogs pa ltas mthong bas dra bar gyur pa de'i rtags nyid dang / 'dzam bu'i gling gi skye bos sangs rgyas la mchod pa la sogs pa las ches lhag pa'i bsod nams 'thob pas rtse mor gyur pa rnam par 'phel ba nyid dang /
analyzed: rmi lam du chos thams cad rmi lam lta bur lta ba la sogs pa ltas mthong bas dra bar gyur pa de'i rtags nyid dang / 'dzam bu'i gling gi skye bos sangs rgyas la mchod pa la sogs pa las ches lhag pa'i bsod nams 'thob pas rtse mor gyur pa rnam par 'phel ba nyid dang /
translated: One obtains merit that is greater than the merit of all beings in the world through making offerings to the Buddha and so forth.

original: mkhyen pa nyid rnam pa gsum gyis chos la mos pa mi byed pa'i sems can gyi don yongs su mi gtong ba bzod par gyur pa brtan pa nyid dang / ting nge 'dzin du mas sems nye bar gnas shing bde ba thob pas chos kyi mchog tu gyur pa'i sems gnas pa nyid dang /
analyzed: mkhyen pa nyid rnam pa gsum gyis chos la mos pa mi byed pa'i sems can gyi don yongs su mi gtong ba bzod par gyur pa brtan pa nyid dang / ting nge 'dzin du mas sems nye bar gnas shing bde ba thob pas chos kyi mchog tu gyur pa'i sems gnas pa nyid dang /
translated: It is the supreme mind of meditative concentration that is the attainment of bliss through the mind abiding in many meditative concentrations.üîΩIt is the path of seeing that is the complete abandonment of the four conceptions of apprehendeds and apprehenders that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzhi yang dag par spong ba mthong ba'i lam nyid dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzhi nye bar spong ba bsgom pa'i lam nyid dang /
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzhi yang dag par spong ba mthong ba'i lam nyid dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzhi nye bar spong ba bsgom pa'i lam nyid dang /
translated: It is the path of meditation that is the complete abandonment of the four conceptions of apprehendeds and apprehenders that are to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin dang mtshungs par gnas pa'i sgrib pa ma lus pa rab tu sel ba'i mtshan nyid can bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /üîΩkun rdzob pa dang don dam pa'i @8a * //
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin dang mtshungs par gnas pa'i sgrib pa ma lus pa rab tu sel ba'i mtshan nyid can bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /üîΩkun rdzob pa dang don dam pa'i @8a * //
translated: It is the uninterrupted meditative concentration that has the characteristic of completely eliminating all obscurations through abiding in meditative concentration that is similar to the vajra-like meditative concentration.üîΩIt is the meditative concentration of the single path that is the single path of the ƒÅrya.

original: bden pa la brten pa'i lam nyid kyis rgol ba'i log par rtog pa bcu drug sel ba dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa la brten pa'i lam nyid kyis rgol ba'i log par rtog pa bcu drug sel ba dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The path based on the truth eliminates the sixteen false conceptions of the opponent.

original: de dag ni rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the realizations of the peak.

original: chos du zhig gis mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: chos du zhig gis mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: By how many dharmas is the realization of the serial [type] called?

original: mthar gyis pa rnam bcu ;
analyzed: mthar gyis pa rnam bcu ;
translated: The serial [type] has ten.

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is said.

original: sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun dang / gtong ba dang / tshul khrims dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun dang / gtong ba dang / tshul khrims dang /
translated: The perfections of generosity, morality, patience, diligence, concentration, and wisdom, and the recollections of the Buddha, Dharma, and Sa·πÖgha, giving, morality,

original: lha rjes su dran pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis bdag nyid bcu gsum mo //
analyzed: lha rjes su dran pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis bdag nyid bcu gsum mo //
translated: and the deity, totaling thirteen.

original: de dag ni mthar gyis mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni mthar gyis mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the realizations of the serial [type].

original: chos du zhig gis skad cig ma gcig gis mngon par byang chub pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: chos du zhig gis skad cig ma gcig gis mngon par byang chub pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: By how many dharmas is the realization of the instantaneous [type] called?

original: skad cig ma gcig gis mngon rdzogs byang chub pa //
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig gis mngon rdzogs byang chub pa //
translated: and the instantaneous perfect enlightenment.

original: mtshan nyid kyis ni rnam pa bzhi //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyis ni rnam pa bzhi //
translated: By its characteristics, it is fourfold.

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is said:

original: rnam par smin pa ma yin pa dang / rnam par smin pa dang / mtshan nyid med pa dang / gnyis su med pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ma yin pa dang / rnam par smin pa dang / mtshan nyid med pa dang / gnyis su med pa ste /
translated: The unmatured, the matured, the non-characterized, and the non-dual.

original: mtshan nyid bzhir rab tu byed pa zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad cig car mngon sum du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid bzhir rab tu byed pa zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad cig car mngon sum du gyur pa'o //
translated: The four characteristics are the instantaneous realization of all the immaculate dharmas.

original: de dag ni skad cig ma gcig gis mngon par byang chub pa'i mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni skad cig ma gcig gis mngon par byang chub pa'i mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the realization of the instantaneous perfect enlightenment.

original: chos du zhig gis chos sku zhes brjod par bya zhe na //
analyzed: chos du zhig gis chos sku zhes brjod par bya zhe na //
translated: By how many dharmas is the Dharma Body to be expressed?

original: ngo bo nyid longs rdzogs bcas dang // de bzhin gzhan ni sprul pa ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid longs rdzogs bcas dang // de bzhin gzhan ni sprul pa ste /
translated: The essence, the enjoyment, and likewise the emanation,

original: chos sku mdzad pa dang bcas pa //
analyzed: chos sku mdzad pa dang bcas pa //
translated: the Dharma Body together with its activity,

original: rnam pa bzhir ni yang dag brjod //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhir ni yang dag brjod //
translated: are rightly said to be fourfold.

original: ces gsungs te /
analyzed: ces gsungs te /
translated: It is said:

original: dag cing zag pa med pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i rang bzhin ngo bo nyid kyi sku dang / mtshan dang dpe byad rab tu 'bar ba'i sku bstan pas theg pa chen po'i chos mtha' dag la rnam par brtse ba longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang /
analyzed: dag cing zag pa med pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i rang bzhin ngo bo nyid kyi sku dang / mtshan dang dpe byad rab tu 'bar ba'i sku bstan pas theg pa chen po'i chos mtha' dag la rnam par brtse ba longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang /
translated: The nature body is the essence of the body that is pure and uncontaminated. The beatific body is the body that blazes with major and minor marks and is the loving care for all the teachings of the Great Vehicle.

original: ji ltar 'tsham pa'i rnam par thar pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dag gis ma lus pa'i skye bo rnams kyi don mdzad pa sprul pa'i sku dang / sems dang sems las byung ba rnams yongs su dag pa nyid kyis ji lta ba dang ji @8b snyed pa mkhyen pa phun sum tshogs pa chos kyi sku nyid dang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: ji ltar 'tsham pa'i rnam par thar pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dag gis ma lus pa'i skye bo rnams kyi don mdzad pa sprul pa'i sku dang / sems dang sems las byung ba rnams yongs su dag pa nyid kyis ji lta ba dang ji @8b snyed pa mkhyen pa phun sum tshogs pa chos kyi sku nyid dang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The emanation body is the performance of the welfare of all beings without exception through inconceivable liberation in whatever way is necessary. The reality body is the perfection of the knowledge of the way things are and of things in their diversity through the complete purity of mind and mental factors.

original: de'i phrin las lhun gyis grub pa la sogs par 'jug pa nyid kyis 'gro ba rnams zhi ba'i lam la 'god pa la sogs pa nyi shu rtsa bdun yin no //
analyzed: de'i phrin las lhun gyis grub pa la sogs par 'jug pa nyid kyis 'gro ba rnams zhi ba'i lam la 'god pa la sogs pa nyi shu rtsa bdun yin no //
translated: These four are the twenty-seven activities of the Buddha, such as establishing beings in the path of peace, through his spontaneous activities and so on.

original: de dag chos kyi sku mdzad pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dag chos kyi sku mdzad pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: They are called the dharmakaya with its activity.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma'i phreng ba zhes bya ba las mngon par rtogs pa rnams kyi lus rnam par gzhag pa ste dum bu dang po'o /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma'i phreng ba zhes bya ba las mngon par rtogs pa rnams kyi lus rnam par gzhag pa ste dum bu dang po'o /
translated: This concludes the first chapter, the chapter on the structure of the realizations, from this Ornament of the Ornament of Clear Realization, a commentary on the ultimate intention of the perfection of wisdom.

original: // / da ni dngos po so so'i yan lag rgyas par bshad par bya ste //
analyzed: // / da ni dngos po so so'i yan lag rgyas par bshad par bya ste //
translated: Now, the individual branches of the subject matter will be explained in detail.

original: re zhig rnam pa thams cad kyis 'bad par bya ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir je rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de bshad par bzhed nas gang gis 'grub pa'i yan lag rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: re zhig rnam pa thams cad kyis 'bad par bya ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir je rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de bshad par bzhed nas gang gis 'grub pa'i yan lag rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: First, wishing to explain the knowledge of all aspects, which is the result of striving in every way, in order to realize the branch that brings it about,

original: dang po sems bskyed pa rang gi ngo bo dmigs pa dang bcas pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: dang po sems bskyed pa rang gi ngo bo dmigs pa dang bcas pa gsungs pa /
translated: he states the nature of the first generation of the thought of awakening, together with its object:

original: sems bskyed pa ni gzhan don phyir //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa ni gzhan don phyir //
translated: The generation of the thought is for the sake of others

original: yang dag rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod //
analyzed: yang dag rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod //
translated: Desiring perfect complete awakening.

original: ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o //
translated: This is stated.

original: skal ba ji lta bar gzhan gyi don bya ba'i phyir yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid smon lam gyi grogs can bsam pas smon pa dang sbyor bas 'jug pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam pa nyid rab tu dbye ba dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: skal ba ji lta bar gzhan gyi don bya ba'i phyir yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid smon lam gyi grogs can bsam pas smon pa dang sbyor bas 'jug pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam pa nyid rab tu dbye ba dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The nature of the aspiration is the desire for perfect enlightenment, which is the cause of the benefit and happiness of all beings, and the nature of the engagement is the desire to attain that enlightenment in order to benefit others in whatever way is necessary.üîΩThe aspiration is the wish to attain enlightenment, and the engagement is the actual practice of the bodhisattva deeds.üîΩThe aspiration is the wish to attain enlightenment, and the engagement is the actual practice of the bodhisattva deeds.

original: gal te byang chub 'dod pa nyid ni dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa sems las byung ba ma yin nam /üîΩsems bskyed pa ni yul khyad par du 'phags pa rnam pa can 'byung ba yin na /üîΩji ltar na de'i mtshan nyid du brtag ce na ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te byang chub 'dod pa nyid ni dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa sems las byung ba ma yin nam / sems bskyed pa ni yul khyad par du 'phags pa rnam pa can 'byung ba yin na / ji ltar na de'i mtshan nyid du brtag ce na ma yin te /
translated: The aspiration is the wish to attain enlightenment, and the engagement is the actual practice of the bodhisattva deeds.

original: don gnyer ba nyid rnam par rig pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir de skad du brda sbyar bar zad mo /
analyzed: don gnyer ba nyid rnam par rig pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir de skad du brda sbyar bar zad mo /
translated: The aspiration is the wish to attain enlightenment, and the engagement is the actual practice of the bodhisattva deeds.üîΩThe aspiration is the wish to attain enlightenment, and the engagement is the actual practice of the bodhisattva deeds.üîΩThe aspiration is the wish to attain enlightenment, and the engagement is the actual practice of the bodhisattva deeds.

original: gzhan du 'bras bu la rgyu dang grogs can la de dang lhan cig pa'i ming gis btags par brjod kyang rang gi mtshan nyid 'grub pa ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan du 'bras bu la rgyu dang grogs can la de dang lhan cig pa'i ming gis btags par brjod kyang rang gi mtshan nyid 'grub pa ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: The aspiration is the wish to attain enlightenment, and the engagement is the actual practice of the bodhisattva deeds.üîΩThe aspiration is the wish to attain enlightenment, and the engagement is the actual practice of the bodhisattva deeds.üîΩThe aspiration is the wish to attain enlightenment, and the engagement is the actual practice of the bodhisattva deeds.üîΩThe aspiration is the wish to attain enlightenment, and the engagement is the actual practice of the bodhisattva deeds.üîΩThe aspiration is the wish to attain enlightenment, and the engagement is the actual practice of the bodhisattva deeds.

original: de la gang 'dod pa'i bdag nyid yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub de ni gang yin la /
analyzed: de la gang 'dod pa'i bdag nyid yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub de ni gang yin la /
translated: What is that perfect complete enlightenment whose nature is desired?

original: gang gi don du 'dod pa gzhan gyi don de yang gang zhig yin zhe na /üîΩde dang de ni mdo bzhin du //
analyzed: gang gi don du 'dod pa gzhan gyi don de yang gang zhig yin zhe na / de dang de ni mdo bzhin du //
translated: And what is that benefit of others for whose sake it is desired?üîΩThat is expressed in brief and in detail

original: bsdus dang rgyas pa'i sgo nas brjod //üîΩces bya ba gsungs te /üîΩrgyal @9a * //
analyzed: bsdus dang rgyas pa'i sgo nas brjod // ces bya ba gsungs te / rgyal @9a * //
translated: in accordance with the sutras.

original: ba'i yum dag las /
analyzed: ba'i yum dag las /
translated: The meaning of the above verse is to be understood from the MotherüîΩSutra of the Perfection of Wisdom, where it says:üîΩOne who wishes to fully and completely awaken to all phenomena in all their aspects should practice the perfection of wisdom.üîΩAnd:

original: chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas zhes bya ba dang / sbyin par bya ba dang sbyin pa po dang len pa po la sogs pa mi dmigs par bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas shes par bya ba'i don can byang chub dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas zhes bya ba dang / sbyin par bya ba dang sbyin pa po dang len pa po la sogs pa mi dmigs par bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas shes par bya ba'i don can byang chub dang /
translated: One should practice the nonapprehension of the gift, giver, receiver, and so on.

original: sems can thams cad skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du mya ngan las 'da' bar 'dod pas zhes bya ba dang / sems can ser sna can la sogs pa rnams sbyin pa la sogs pa la dgod par 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas shes par bya ba'i don can gzhan gyi don bstan pa de
analyzed: sems can thams cad skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du mya ngan las 'da' bar 'dod pas zhes bya ba dang / sems can ser sna can la sogs pa rnams sbyin pa la sogs pa la dgod par 'dod pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas shes par bya ba'i don can gzhan gyi don bstan pa de
translated: One should understand this through such statements as ‚Äúone who wishes to lead all sentient beings to nirvana according to their lot‚Äù and ‚Äúone who wishes to establish stingy sentient beings, etc., in generosity, etc., should train in this perfection of wisdom.‚Äù

original: ltar bsdus pa dang rgyas pa'i sgo nas ji skad bstan pa dmigs pa'i bdag nyid yongs su shes par bya ba'o //
analyzed: ltar bsdus pa dang rgyas pa'i sgo nas ji skad bstan pa dmigs pa'i bdag nyid yongs su shes par bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, one should understand the object of observation that is taught through the concise and extensive sections.

original: sems bskyed pa de nyid rab tu dbye bas rnam pa du zhig ce na /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa de nyid rab tu dbye bas rnam pa du zhig ce na /
translated: How many types of generation of the Thought are there through its divisions?

original: bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs pa //
analyzed: bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs pa //
translated: Two verses are stated in the middle.

original: de yang sa gser zla ba me //
analyzed: de yang sa gser zla ba me //
translated: It is like the earth, gold, the moon,

original: gter dang rin chen 'byung gnas mtsho //
analyzed: gter dang rin chen 'byung gnas mtsho //
translated: a treasure, a jewel mine, an ocean,üîΩa diamond, a mountain, a medicine, a friend,

original: rdo rje ri sman bshes gnyen dang // yid bzhin nor bu nyi ma glu //
analyzed: rdo rje ri sman bshes gnyen dang // yid bzhin nor bu nyi ma glu //
translated: a wish-granting gem, the sun, a song,

original: rgyal po mdzod dang lam po che //
analyzed: rgyal po mdzod dang lam po che //
translated: a king, a treasury, a highway,

original: bzhon pa bkod ma'i chu dang ni //
analyzed: bzhon pa bkod ma'i chu dang ni //
translated: The water of the horse trough,

original: sgra snyan chu bo sprin rnams kyi //
analyzed: sgra snyan chu bo sprin rnams kyi //
translated: the river of the musical instrument, and the clouds.

original: rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis so //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa nyi shu rtsa gnyis so // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: These are the twenty-two types.

original: de ni chos dkar po thams cad kyi gzhi'i dngos por gyur pa'i phyir 'dun pa dang ldan pas sa lta bu dang / byang chub kyi bar du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir bsam pa dang ldan pa gser bzang po lta bu dang / dge ba'i chos mtha' dag mngon par 'phel ba'i phyir lhag pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa zla ba tshes pa lta bu dang /
analyzed: de ni chos dkar po thams cad kyi gzhi'i dngos por gyur pa'i phyir 'dun pa dang ldan pas sa lta bu dang / byang chub kyi bar du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir bsam pa dang ldan pa gser bzang po lta bu dang / dge ba'i chos mtha' dag mngon par 'phel ba'i phyir lhag pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa zla ba tshes pa lta bu dang /
translated: The bodhisattva who is endowed with aspiration is like the earth because he is the basis of all virtuous qualities. The bodhisattva who is endowed with intention is like good gold because his intention for enlightenment is unchanging. The bodhisattva who is endowed with superior intention is like the waxing moon because all virtuous qualities increase.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi sgrib pa'i bud shing sreg pa'i phyir sbyor ba dang ldan pa me lta bu dang / sems can thams cad yang dag par tshim par byed pa'i phyir sbyin pa dang ldan pa gter chen po lta bu dang / yon tan rin po che'i rten gyi dngos po yin pa'i phyir tshul khrims dang ldan pa rin po che'i 'byung khungs kyi gnas lta bu dang /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi sgrib pa'i bud shing sreg pa'i phyir sbyor ba dang ldan pa me lta bu dang / sems can thams cad yang dag par tshim par byed pa'i phyir sbyin pa dang ldan pa gter chen po lta bu dang / yon tan rin po che'i rten gyi dngos po yin pa'i phyir tshul khrims dang ldan pa rin po che'i 'byung khungs kyi gnas lta bu dang /
translated: It is like a source of precious stones, for it is the basis for the precious qualities of discipline.üîΩIt is like a great ocean, for it is not disturbed by any misfortune. It is like a diamond, for it is unshakable by any distraction of conceptualization.

original: mi 'dod pa thams cad thog tu bab pas mi 'khrugs pas bzod pa dang ldan pa rgya mtsho @9b chen po lta bu dang / yid ches pa brtan pa mi phyed pas brtson 'grus dang ldan pa rdo rje lta bu dang / dmigs pa'i rnam par g-yeng bas mi bskyod pa'i phyir bsam gtan dang ldan pa ri'i rgyal po lta bu dang /
analyzed: mi 'dod pa thams cad thog tu bab pas mi 'khrugs pas bzod pa dang ldan pa rgya mtsho @9b chen po lta bu dang / yid ches pa brtan pa mi phyed pas brtson 'grus dang ldan pa rdo rje lta bu dang / dmigs pa'i rnam par g-yeng bas mi bskyod pa'i phyir bsam gtan dang ldan pa ri'i rgyal po lta bu dang /
translated: It is like the king of mountains, for it is unshakable by the distraction of conceptualization.

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i nad rab tu zhi ba'i phyir shes rab dang ldan pa sman gyi mchog lta bu dang / gnas skabs thams cad du sems can gyi don yongs su mi gtong ba'i phyir thabs mkhas pa dang ldan pa dge ba'i bshes gnyen lta bu dang /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i nad rab tu zhi ba'i phyir shes rab dang ldan pa sman gyi mchog lta bu dang / gnas skabs thams cad du sems can gyi don yongs su mi gtong ba'i phyir thabs mkhas pa dang ldan pa dge ba'i bshes gnyen lta bu dang /
translated: They are endowed with supreme knowledge, like the best of medicines, because they completely pacify the ills of the defilement related and cognitive obscurations. They are endowed with skill in means, like spiritual masters, because they never abandon working for the benefit of sentient beings in any situation.

original: ji ltar smon pa'i 'bras bu 'grub pa'i phyir smon lam dang ldan pa yid bzhin gyi nor bu lta bu dang / gdul bya yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir stobs dang ldan pa nyi ma lta bu dang / 'gro ba 'dun par byed pa'i chos ston pa'i phyir ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa glu dbyangs lta bu dang /
analyzed: ji ltar smon pa'i 'bras bu 'grub pa'i phyir smon lam dang ldan pa yid bzhin gyi nor bu lta bu dang / gdul bya yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir stobs dang ldan pa nyi ma lta bu dang / 'gro ba 'dun par byed pa'i chos ston pa'i phyir ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa glu dbyangs lta bu dang /
translated: They are endowed with the perfection of aspiration, like wish fulfilling gems, because they accomplish the results they aspire to. They are endowed with the perfection of strength, like the sun, because they bring sentient beings to full maturity. They are endowed with the perfection of gnosis, like song and music, because they teach the Dharma to attract beings.

original: ji ltar mthu thogs pa med par gzhan gyi don sgrub pa'i phyir mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa rgyal po chen po lta bu dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs mang po'i mdzod du gyur pa'i phyir bsod nams dang ye shes dang ldan pa bang mdzod lta bu dang /
analyzed: ji ltar mthu thogs pa med par gzhan gyi don sgrub pa'i phyir mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa rgyal po chen po lta bu dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs mang po'i mdzod du gyur pa'i phyir bsod nams dang ye shes dang ldan pa bang mdzod lta bu dang /
translated: It is like a great king, for it possesses preternatural knowledge, which enables one to work for others' welfare with unobstructed power.üîΩIt is like a treasury, for it is a storehouse of the many accumulations of merit and wisdom.üîΩIt is like a great highway, for it is endowed with the elements that lead to enlightenment, which are the path taken by all the noble beings of the past and that which all the noble beings of the future will take.

original: 'phags pa thams cad gshegs shing rjes su gshegs pa'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos dang ldan pa lam chen po lta bu dang / 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gang du yang mi ltung bar bde blag tu 'gro ba'i phyir snying rje dang lhag mthong dang ldan pa bzhon pa lta bu dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa thams cad gshegs shing rjes su gshegs pa'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos dang ldan pa lam chen po lta bu dang / 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gang du yang mi ltung bar bde blag tu 'gro ba'i phyir snying rje dang lhag mthong dang ldan pa bzhon pa lta bu dang /
translated: It is like a vehicle, for it is endowed with compassion and profound insight, which enable one to travel easily without falling into either samsara or nirvana.

original: thos pa dang ma thos pa'i chos 'dzin pas mi zad pa'i phyir gzungs dang spobs pa dang ldan pa bkod ma'i chu lta bu dang / thar pa 'dod pa'i skye bo rnams la snyan pa sgrogs pa'i phyir chos kyi dga' ston dang ldan pa sgra snyan pa lta bu dang /
analyzed: thos pa dang ma thos pa'i chos 'dzin pas mi zad pa'i phyir gzungs dang spobs pa dang ldan pa bkod ma'i chu lta bu dang / thar pa 'dod pa'i skye bo rnams la snyan pa sgrogs pa'i phyir chos kyi dga' ston dang ldan pa sgra snyan pa lta bu dang /
translated: It is endowed with the feast of the teachings, like a sweet sound, because it proclaims the sweet sound of the teachings to those who desire liberation.üîΩIt is endowed with the path of the single way, like the flow of a river, because it is undifferentiated in its activity for the benefit of others.

original: gzhan gyi don bya ba la tha mi dad pa'i phyir bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam dang ldan pa chu bo'i rgyun lta bu dang / dga' lan gyi gnas na bzhugs pa la sogs pa kun tu ston par rung ba nyid kyis chos sku dang ldan pa sprin chen po lta bu rnams so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don bya ba la tha mi dad pa'i phyir bgrod pa gcig pa'i lam dang ldan pa chu bo'i rgyun lta bu dang / dga' lan gyi gnas na bzhugs pa la sogs pa kun tu ston par rung ba nyid kyis chos sku dang ldan pa sprin chen po lta bu rnams so //
translated: It is endowed with the body of the teachings, like a great cloud, because it is suitable to display the body of the teachings and so on while residing in the abode of great bliss.

original: de la dang po gsum ni chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po nyid kyis las dang po pa'i sas bsdus so //
analyzed: de la dang po gsum ni chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po nyid kyis las dang po pa'i sas bsdus so //
translated: The first three are included in the level of the beginner, by virtue of being small, middling and great.

original: bzhi pa ni sa dang po la 'jug pa'i lam gyis @10a * //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni sa dang po la 'jug pa'i lam gyis @10a * //
translated: The fourth is included in the path of entry to the first level.

original: bsdus so // da'i 'og tu bcu ni rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa sa bcus bsdus te /
analyzed: bsdus so // da'i 'og tu bcu ni rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa sa bcus bsdus te /
translated: The next ten are included in the ten grounds, the Joyous and so on.

original: mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gya spyod yul can yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gya spyod yul can yin no //
translated: They are the domain of the paths of seeing and meditation.

original: de'i 'og tu bzhi dang gnyis dang gnyis ni sa brgyad dang dgu pa dang bcu pas bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bzhi dang gnyis dang gnyis ni sa brgyad dang dgu pa dang bcu pas bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: The next four, two, and two should be understood as included in the eighth, ninth, and tenth grounds.

original: de ltar sems dang po gsum bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dus ji lta ba bzhin du don du gnyer bar byed pas gang la sems bskyed pa dang des 'phangs pa'i cho ga 'grub pa dang / yongs su bsrung ba dang / yon tan mngon par 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir 'doms pa ni gdams ngag ste /
analyzed: de ltar sems dang po gsum bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dus ji lta ba bzhin du don du gnyer bar byed pas gang la sems bskyed pa dang des 'phangs pa'i cho ga 'grub pa dang / yongs su bsrung ba dang / yon tan mngon par 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir 'doms pa ni gdams ngag ste /
translated: Thus, the instructions are the advice given to bodhisattvas who have generated the first three of the bodhisattva levels, in order to accomplish the generation of the bodhisattva levels that they have not yet attained, to accomplish the activities projected by those levels, to protect those that have been attained, and to enhance their qualities.üîΩThe instructions are as follows:

original: de yang ; sgrub dang bden pa rnams dang ni //
analyzed: de yang ; sgrub dang bden pa rnams dang ni //
translated: The practice, the truths,

original: sangs rgyas la sogs dkon mchog gsum //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs dkon mchog gsum //
translated: the three jewels,üîΩnonattachment, nonwearying,

original: ma zhen yongs su mi ngal dang // lam ni yongs su 'dzin pa dang // spyan lnga dang ni mngon shes kyi //
analyzed: ma zhen yongs su mi ngal dang // lam ni yongs su 'dzin pa dang // spyan lnga dang ni mngon shes kyi //
translated: upholding the path, the five eyes, the superknowledges,

original: yon tan drug dang mthong lam dang // bsgom zhes bya ba gdams ngag ni //
analyzed: yon tan drug dang mthong lam dang // bsgom zhes bya ba gdams ngag ni //
translated: and the path of meditation, which has six good qualities.

original: bcu yi bdag nyid shes par bya //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bcu yi bdag nyid shes par bya // zhes gsungs so //
translated: One should know that it has ten aspects.

original: de la bsgrub par bya ba nyid kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa mi dmigs pa'i rnam pa dang / de bzhin du mi dmigs pa dang / rten dang khyad par du 'gro ba'i rgyu dang / mi ldog pa'i rkyen dang / theg pa gzhan gyis mi 'gro ba dang gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog par 'gro ba nyid kyi thabs dang /
analyzed: de la bsgrub par bya ba nyid kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa mi dmigs pa'i rnam pa dang / de bzhin du mi dmigs pa dang / rten dang khyad par du 'gro ba'i rgyu dang / mi ldog pa'i rkyen dang / theg pa gzhan gyis mi 'gro ba dang gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog par 'gro ba nyid kyi thabs dang /
translated: The nature of what is to be accomplished is the aspect of non-apprehension, and likewise, non-apprehension, the cause of going to a higher stage, the condition of non-retrogression, the method of going without relying on another vehicle, and the method of going without relying on another person.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su rdzogs pa'i gzhi dang / dag pa dang mthar thug pa'i rgyu gang yin pa rnams dang bden pa la sogs pa grangs bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su rdzogs pa'i gzhi dang / dag pa dang mthar thug pa'i rgyu gang yin pa rnams dang bden pa la sogs pa grangs bzhin no //
translated: The basis of perfecting the knowledge of all aspects, and the cause of purification and consummation, are respectively the truths, etc.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi rab tu dbye ba ji skad bshad pa bsgrub pa la nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi rab tu dbye ba ji skad bshad pa bsgrub pa la nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa ni /
translated: The accomplishment of the divisions of the Thought of Enlightenment as they have been explained is not in common with the Disciples, etc.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa las mi 'da' bas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba la 'doms pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi bden pa gzugs la sogs pa 'bras bur gyur pa stong pa nyid dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dag de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bor rang bzhin gcig go zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa las mi 'da' bas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba la 'doms pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi bden pa gzugs la sogs pa 'bras bur gyur pa stong pa nyid dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dag de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bor rang bzhin gcig go zhes bya ba dang /
translated: and the instruction to engage in the perfection of wisdom by way of non-observation because it does not go beyond the conventional and ultimate truths.üîΩThe truth of suffering, which is the result, form and so on, and emptiness and the perfection of wisdom are the same in essence in that they are the entity of suchness.

original: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la stong pa nyid dang / gzugs la sogs pa rgyur gyur pa dag tha mi dad pa nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa ni @10b kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos can ma yin no zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la stong pa nyid dang / gzugs la sogs pa rgyur gyur pa dag tha mi dad pa nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa ni @10b kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos can ma yin no zhes bya ba dang /
translated: The truth of origin, which is the cause, form and so on, and emptiness are not different. Therefore form and so on are not phenomena that are origin, cessation, thoroughly afflicted, or completely pure.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa la stong pa nyid skye ba dang 'gag pa dang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba nyams pa dang 'phel ba la sogs pa dang bral ba la ni gzugs med pa nas ma rig pa skye ba yang med 'gag pa yangüîΩmed sangs rgyas kyang med byang chub kyi bar du yang med do zhes bya ba dang / lam gyi bden pa la sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa ni rang gi ngo bos dben pas bdag nyid dam /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa la stong pa nyid skye ba dang 'gag pa dang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba nyams pa dang 'phel ba la sogs pa dang bral ba la ni gzugs med pa nas ma rig pa skye ba yang med 'gag pa yang med sangs rgyas kyang med byang chub kyi bar du yang med do zhes bya ba dang / lam gyi bden pa la sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa ni rang gi ngo bos dben pas bdag nyid dam /
translated: The truth of cessation, which is free from origination and cessation, defilement and purification, decline and increase, and so on, is emptiness.üîΩIn emptiness, there is no form up to and including no ignorance, no cessation, no Buddha, and no enlightenment.

original: nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa ni phyi stong pa nyid la sogs pa dang / sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' dag phan tshun du sbyor ba dang mi sbyor ba ma yin pa nyid du sgrub po zhes ston pa bden pa la 'doms pa dang /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa ni phyi stong pa nyid la sogs pa dang / sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' dag phan tshun du sbyor ba dang mi sbyor ba ma yin pa nyid du sgrub po zhes ston pa bden pa la 'doms pa dang /
translated: The truth of the path is the instruction on the truths, which teaches that since generosity and so on, the perfections, are empty of their own entities, they are not joined with or not joined with the emptiness of internal phenomena and so on, the emptiness of the past and future, and so on.

original: sangs rgyas la sangs rgyas dang byang chub dag mtshan nyid gcig pa nyid kyis sangs rgyas su byed pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mi dmigs pa la gzugs la sogs pas mi sbyor bas dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs par byed pa mnyam pa nyid du shes pa zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sangs rgyas dang byang chub dag mtshan nyid gcig pa nyid kyis sangs rgyas su byed pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mi dmigs pa la gzugs la sogs pas mi sbyor bas dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs par byed pa mnyam pa nyid du shes pa zhes bya ba dang /
translated: In relation to the Buddha, they are the knowledge that the object and agent of observation are the same, since the Buddha does not engage in form and so on by observing the nonobservation of the knowledge of all aspects, which is the defining characteristic of the phenomenon that makes one a buddha, since buddhas and enlightenment have the same defining characteristic.

original: chos la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyis bsdus pa'i gzhi dang gnyen po dang / rnam pa mtha' dag gis bsdus pa'i chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba dang / dge 'dun la sangs rgyas dkon mchog gi khongs su gtogs pa nyid kyis dgra bcom pa ma gtogs pa skyes bu chen po bdun po rang sangs rgyas dang lhan cig brgyad po dbang po rtul po la sogs pa'i bye brag gis grangs nyi shur chad pa bang chub
analyzed: chos la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyis bsdus pa'i gzhi dang gnyen po dang / rnam pa mtha' dag gis bsdus pa'i chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba dang / dge 'dun la sangs rgyas dkon mchog gi khongs su gtogs pa nyid kyis dgra bcom pa ma gtogs pa skyes bu chen po bdun po rang sangs rgyas dang lhan cig brgyad po dbang po rtul po la sogs pa'i bye brag gis grangs nyi shur chad pa bang chub
translated: In relation to the Dharma, they are the knowledge that all phenomena included in the three knowledges are devoid of entity and the knowledge that the Sa·πÖgha is the seven great beings who are included in the Buddha Jewel and the eight who are included in the Sa·πÖgha Jewel, which is divided into twenty by the distinctions of dull faculty and so on.

original: sems dpa' 'phags pa slob pa'i phyir mi ldog pa rnams la skye ba med pa nyid du 'jug par bya'o zhes lung 'bogs pa dkon mchog gsum la 'doms pa dang / brtson 'grus brtsams pa nyid kyis ji skad bshad pa'i don la nan tan du byed pa ni lus la sogs pa'i bsod nams kyi las la mngon par zhen par 'gyur bas zhen pa'i lus la sogs pa ngo bo nyid med par bstan pa'i 'doms pa dang /
analyzed: sems dpa' 'phags pa slob pa'i phyir mi ldog pa rnams la skye ba med pa nyid du 'jug par bya'o zhes lung 'bogs pa dkon mchog gsum la 'doms pa dang / brtson 'grus brtsams pa nyid kyis ji skad bshad pa'i don la nan tan du byed pa ni lus la sogs pa'i bsod nams kyi las la mngon par zhen par 'gyur bas zhen pa'i lus la sogs pa ngo bo nyid med par bstan pa'i 'doms pa dang /
translated: The instruction in the absence of intrinsic existence of the body and so on is to teach that since those who are diligent in the meaning as it has been explained will become attached to the meritorious actions of the body and so on, the body and so on, which are the objects of attachment, are devoid of intrinsic existence.

original: dus yun ring po zhig tu goms pa byas kyang 'dod pa'i @11a * //
analyzed: dus yun ring po zhig tu goms pa byas kyang 'dod pa'i @11a * //
translated: The instruction in the absence of weariness is to teach that even if one practices for a long time, if the desired goal is not achieved, one will become weary and discouraged.

original: don ma grub na dngang ba'i rang bzhin can yongs su skyo bar 'gyur bas yongs su ngal ba med pa la gzugs la sogs pa nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar la rlom pa med pa nyid du ston pa'i gdams pa dang /
analyzed: don ma grub na dngang ba'i rang bzhin can yongs su skyo bar 'gyur bas yongs su ngal ba med pa la gzugs la sogs pa nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar la rlom pa med pa nyid du ston pa'i gdams pa dang /
translated: Therefore, one should be free of weariness and free of conceit with regard to form and so on up to perfect complete buddhahood.

original: phyogs bcu na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas la sogs pa las don re re'i phyir lam gyi lung ma nod pa la sogs pa'i cher 'bad par bya dgos na sems zhum par 'gyur bas lam yongs su bzung ba la chos rnams rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa nyid du
analyzed: phyogs bcu na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas la sogs pa las don re re'i phyir lam gyi lung ma nod pa la sogs pa'i cher 'bad par bya dgos na sems zhum par 'gyur bas lam yongs su bzung ba la chos rnams rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa nyid du
translated: Therefore, in order to fully take up the path, one is advised to bless all phenomena as being by nature unborn.

original: brlab par gdams pa dang / dbang po nyid las dngos po so sor nges pa sha'i spyan dang / rnam par smin pa las sems can thams cad 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba shes pa lha'i dang / de kho na nyid kyi chos thams cad la rnam par mi rtog pa shes rab kyi dang /
analyzed: brlab par gdams pa dang / dbang po nyid las dngos po so sor nges pa sha'i spyan dang / rnam par smin pa las sems can thams cad 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba shes pa lha'i dang / de kho na nyid kyi chos thams cad la rnam par mi rtog pa shes rab kyi dang /
translated: The eye of flesh is the definite individual thing from the sense organ itself; the divine eye is the knowledge of the death and rebirth of all sentient beings from karmic ripening; the eye of wisdom is the nonconceptual knowledge of all phenomena that are reality.

original: yongs su dag pa'i dbang gis 'phags pa'i gang zag rnams kyi dbye ba rtogs pa chos kyi rang /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i dbang gis 'phags pa'i gang zag rnams kyi dbye ba rtogs pa chos kyi rang /
translated: The eye of Dharma is the knowledge of the categories of the noble persons through the power of purification.

original: shin tu dag pa nyid kyis chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub ba sangs rgyas kyi spyan rnams de bzhin nyid gcig pa nyid du sgrub po zhes slob pa spyan lnga la gdams pa dang / thams cad du sprul zhing sgyur ba rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pa dang /
analyzed: shin tu dag pa nyid kyis chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub ba sangs rgyas kyi spyan rnams de bzhin nyid gcig pa nyid du sgrub po zhes slob pa spyan lnga la gdams pa dang / thams cad du sprul zhing sgyur ba rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pa dang /
translated: The power of diligence is the power of the mind that is not distracted by any circumstances.üîΩThe power of mindfulness is the power of the mind that is not distracted by any circumstances.üîΩThe power of samadhi is the power of the mind that is not distracted by any circumstances.üîΩThe power of praj√±a is the power of the mind that is not distracted by any circumstances.üîΩThe five strengths are as follows: The strength of faith is the power of the mind that is not distracted by any circumstances.üîΩThe strength of diligence is the power of the mind that is not distracted by any circumstances.üîΩThe strength of mindfulness is the power of the mind that is not distracted by any circumstances.üîΩThe strength of samadhi is the power of the mind that is not distracted by any circumstances.üîΩThe strength of praj√±a is the power of the mind that is not distracted by any circumstances.üîΩThe seven aspects of the branches of enlightenment are as follows: The branch of mindfulness of the body is the mindfulness of the body that is not distracted by any circumstances.

original: rab tu bskal pa'i sgra che chung thams cad thos pa lha'i rna ba dang / gzhan gyi sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang bral ba la sogs pa yongs su shes pa gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / rang dang gzhan gyi tshe rabs snga ma rjes su dran pa sngon gyi gnas shes pa dang /
analyzed: rab tu bskal pa'i sgra che chung thams cad thos pa lha'i rna ba dang / gzhan gyi sems 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang bral ba la sogs pa yongs su shes pa gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / rang dang gzhan gyi tshe rabs snga ma rjes su dran pa sngon gyi gnas shes pa dang /
translated: The branch of discerning praj√±a is the praj√±a that is not distracted by any circumstances.üîΩThe branch of diligence is the diligence that is not distracted by any circumstances.üîΩThe branch of joy is the joy that is not distracted by any circumstances.üîΩThe branch of pliancy is the pliancy that is not distracted by any circumstances.üîΩThe branch of samadhi is the samadhi that is not distracted by any circumstances.üîΩThe branch of equanimity is the equanimity that is not distracted by any circumstances.üîΩThe eight aspects of the branches of the noble eightfold path are as follows: The branch of right view is the view that is not distracted by any circumstances.üîΩThe branch of right thought is the thought that is not distracted by any circumstances.üîΩThe branch of right speech is the speech that is not distracted by any circumstances.üîΩThe branch of right action

original: gzugs thams cad yongs su mthong ba mngon par 'du byed pa las byung ba lha'i mig dang / nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spong bar byed pa zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa rnams gzod ma nas zhi ba nyid du rtogs par bya'o zhes ston pa mngon par shes pa drug la gdams pa dang /
analyzed: gzugs thams cad yongs su mthong ba mngon par 'du byed pa las byung ba lha'i mig dang / nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spong bar byed pa zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa rnams gzod ma nas zhi ba nyid du rtogs par bya'o zhes ston pa mngon par shes pa drug la gdams pa dang /
translated: The six kinds of preternatural knowledge are taught in order to show that the six kinds of preternatural knowledge should be realized as peace from the very beginning: the divine eye, which is the knowledge of the death and rebirth of all beings; the knowledge of the exhaustion of all contaminations, which is the knowledge that all phenomena are by nature unarisen; the knowledge of the exhaustion of all contaminations, which eliminates the obscurations of defilements and the knowable; and the knowledge of the exhaustion of all contaminations, which eliminates the obscurations of defilements and the knowable.

original: mthong ba'i lam la bden pa bzhis bsdus pa skad cig ma bcu drug gi ngo bo nyid chos dang rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang shes pa'i bdag nyid la rnal 'byor pa chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med par rtogs pas sgyu ma mkhan bzhin du des
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la bden pa bzhis bsdus pa skad cig ma bcu drug gi ngo bo nyid chos dang rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang shes pa'i bdag nyid la rnal 'byor pa chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med par rtogs pas sgyu ma mkhan bzhin du des
translated: On the path of seeing, which has the nature of the sixteen moments of the four truths, the yogic practitioner, by realizing that all phenomena are devoid of inherent identity, realizes the six transcendent perfections, which are the means for attaining the result, the transcendent perfection of omniscience.

original: spang bar bya ba'i @11b gnyen po nyid du rtogs par bya'o zhes 'doms pa dang / bsgom pa'i lam la ji skad bshad pa'i mthong ba'i lam nyid kyis mngon sum du byas pa'i ngo bo las tha mi dad pa la dmigs pa la ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dag ngo bo nyid gcig pa nyid kyi phan tshun tha dad par gdags par
analyzed: spang bar bya ba'i @11b gnyen po nyid du rtogs par bya'o zhes 'doms pa dang / bsgom pa'i lam la ji skad bshad pa'i mthong ba'i lam nyid kyis mngon sum du byas pa'i ngo bo las tha mi dad pa la dmigs pa la ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dag ngo bo nyid gcig pa nyid kyi phan tshun tha dad par gdags par
translated: Just as it is not possible to impute the conditioned and unconditioned as different from each other,

original: mi nus pa bzhin du mtshan nyid pa rnam par gzhag pa gzhan med kyi /
analyzed: mi nus pa bzhin du mtshan nyid pa rnam par gzhag pa gzhan med kyi /
translated: there is no other way to posit the characteristics.

original: 'on kyang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos nyid kyis des spang bar bya ba'i gnyen po nyid du bsgom par bya'o zhes 'doms pa ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos nyid kyis des spang bar bya ba'i gnyen po nyid du bsgom par bya'o zhes 'doms pa ste /
translated: However, by the reality of dependent arising, it is the antidote that abandons that which is to be abandoned.

original: 'di tsam kho nas don thams cad phun sum tshogs par nges par 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di tsam kho nas don thams cad phun sum tshogs par nges par 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: This alone is the certainty that all goals are completely perfect.

original: dge 'dun dkon mchog gi skabs su grangs nyi shur brjod pa de dag gang zhig yin zhe na /

analyzed: bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs pa /
translated: Two verses in the middleüîΩThose of dull and sharp faculties,

analyzed: dbang po rtul dang rnon po dag / dad dang mthong thob rigs nas rigs //
translated: those resolute in faith and those obtaining by insight, from family to family,üîΩborn a human, with one obstruction,

original: bar chad gcig bar skyes nas dang // byed dang byed min 'og min 'gro //
analyzed: bar chad gcig bar skyes nas dang // byed dang byed min 'og min 'gro //
translated: those going to the highest, those not going to the highest.

original: 'phar gsum srid rtse'i mthar thug 'gro //
analyzed: 'phar gsum srid rtse'i mthar thug 'gro //
translated: Those leaping over, those going to the peak of existence,

original: gzugs kyi chags bcom mthong ba yi //
analyzed: gzugs kyi chags bcom mthong ba yi //
translated: those conquering attachment to form, those seeing

original: chos la zhi lus mngon sum byed //
analyzed: chos la zhi lus mngon sum byed //
translated: the truth, those with peaceful bodies, those making manifest.

original: bse ru dang ni nyi shu'o //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bse ru dang ni nyi shu'o // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Those rhinoceros like and those with a retinue.

original: re zhig dbang po'i khyad par gyis zhugs pa la legs par sbyangs pa ma yin pa las 'dir 'ongs pa dad pa'i rjes su 'brangs pa dbang po rtul po dang / legs par yongs su sbyangs pa las 'dir 'ongs pa chos kyi rjes su 'brangs pa dbang po rnon po dang /
analyzed: re zhig dbang po'i khyad par gyis zhugs pa la legs par sbyangs pa ma yin pa las 'dir 'ongs pa dad pa'i rjes su 'brangs pa dbang po rtul po dang / legs par yongs su sbyangs pa las 'dir 'ongs pa chos kyi rjes su 'brangs pa dbang po rnon po dang /
translated: Those who enter by the distinction of faculties are those resolute in faith who are dull-facultied and have not previously trained, those who obtain by insight who are sharp-facultied and have previously trained, those born a human who have one obstruction, those going to the highest who do not go to the highest, those leaping over who leap over stages, those going to the peak of existence who go to the peak of existence, those conquering attachment to the form realm who conquer attachment to the form realm, those seeing the truth who see the four truths, those with peaceful bodies who manifest the body of peace, and those with a retinue who are like rhinoceroses.

original: thabs mkhas pa ma yin pas lha tshe ring po la sogs par skye ba dang dad pas mos pa dang / thabs la mkhas pas bsam gtan la sogs pa'i dbang gis skye ba ma yin pa mthong bas thob pa dang / 'bras bu dang po'i khyad par gyis bsam gtan la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pas rgyal po dang bram ze la sogs par brgyud de skye ba mi'i rigs nas rigs su skye ba dang /
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa ma yin pas lha tshe ring po la sogs par skye ba dang dad pas mos pa dang / thabs la mkhas pas bsam gtan la sogs pa'i dbang gis skye ba ma yin pa mthong bas thob pa dang / 'bras bu dang po'i khyad par gyis bsam gtan la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pas rgyal po dang bram ze la sogs par brgyud de skye ba mi'i rigs nas rigs su skye ba dang /
translated: Those who are not skilled in means take birth as long-lived gods and so on and are devoted through faith, but they are not born through the power of the absorptions and so on.üîΩThose who are skilled in means take birth in the human lineage, born in the family of kings, brahmins and so on, possessing the qualities of the absorptions and so forth through the special qualities of the first result.

original: de bzhin du 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha dag tu brgyud de skye ba lha'i rigs nas rigs su skye ba dang / 'bras bu gnyis pa'i khyad par gyis shin tu dag pa'i bsam gtan bzhi la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa tshe gcig gis @12a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha dag tu brgyud de skye ba lha'i rigs nas rigs su skye ba dang / 'bras bu gnyis pa'i khyad par gyis shin tu dag pa'i bsam gtan bzhi la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa tshe gcig gis @12a * //
translated: Similarly, they take birth in the lineage of gods, born in the family of gods of the desire realm through the special qualities of the second result.

original: thogs pa bar chad gcig pa dang / 'bras bu gsum pa'i khyad par gyis gzugs kyi khams dag tu sangs rgyas nas 'di dag tu sprul pas mngon par byang chub pa bar ma dor mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / 'dzam bu'i gling 'di nyid du skyes nas lam yang dag par bsgrub pas 'tshang rgya ba nyid skyes nas mya ngan las 'da' ba dang /
analyzed: thogs pa bar chad gcig pa dang / 'bras bu gsum pa'i khyad par gyis gzugs kyi khams dag tu sangs rgyas nas 'di dag tu sprul pas mngon par byang chub pa bar ma dor mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / 'dzam bu'i gling 'di nyid du skyes nas lam yang dag par bsgrub pas 'tshang rgya ba nyid skyes nas mya ngan las 'da' ba dang /
translated: Those who attain nirvana after birth are those who attain enlightenment in this world after being born here and correctly practicing the path.üîΩThose who attain nirvana through application are those who attain nirvana through the power of intense effort through the blazing of diligence.

original: brtson 'grus 'bar ba nyid mngon par 'bad pa'i shugs drag pos rdzogs par 'gyur ba mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / sems dang po bskyed pa nyid kyis skyon la 'da' zhing tshul gzhan pas mngon par byang chub par byed pa mngon par 'du byed pa med par mya ngan las 'da' ba dang /

translated: Those who attain nirvana without application are those who attain nirvana without application through the first generation of the mind of enlightenment, who pass beyond misery through faults and who attain enlightenment through another method.

original: yongs su rdzogs pa'i tshogs mngon par bsags pa de nyid kyis mngon par byang chub pa mthong ba'i chos la mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / thod rgal gyi snyoms par 'jug pa nyid la brten nas 'tshang rgya ba zhi ba lus kyi mngon sum du byed pa dang /

translated: By the very same complete accumulation of the collections, there is manifest enlightenment, nirvana in this life, and the pacification of the body, manifest enlightenment, by relying on the alternating meditative attainment.

original: sangs rgyas la sogs pa med pa'i zhing dag tu shes rab zab mo yongs su sbyangs te mngon par byang chub pa bse ru lta bu'o //

translated: In pure lands without buddhas and so on, there is manifest enlightenment through training in profound wisdom, like a rhinoceros.

original: de ltar gang gdams pa dag thos bas nan tan du byas pa las nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag 'byung ba'i phyir de bshad par bzhed pas re zhig khyad par 'phags pa'i chos gsungs pa //

translated: This is what is taught.üîΩThe bodhisattvas, by means of the generation of the mind and the perfection of the training, having reached the culmination of study and so forth, attain the roots of virtue such as faith, which are conducive to liberation.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems bskyed pa nyid dang / bslab pa phun sum tshogs pa nyid kyis thos pa la sogs pa rab kyi mthar phyin pas dad pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa thob pas de'i 'og tu 'jig rten pa'i bsgoms pa las byung ba nges par 'byed pa'i chaüîΩdang mthun pa 'di lta ste /
