translated: After that, they attain the mundane realizations conducive to penetration, which are as follows:üîΩThe heat stage, which is the non-apprehension of the apprehended object in the afflictions,üîΩthe peak stage, which is the non-apprehension of the apprehended object in purification,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa gzung ba mi dmigs pa dro bar gyur pa dang / de'i 'og tu rnam par byang ba nyid kyi gzung ba mi dmigs pa rtse mor gyur ba dang / de'i 'og tu gang zag nyid la 'dzin pa mi dmigs pa bzod par gyur pa dang /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa gzung ba mi dmigs pa dro bar gyur pa dang / de'i 'og tu rnam par byang ba nyid kyi gzung ba mi dmigs pa rtse mor gyur ba dang / de'i 'og tu gang zag nyid la 'dzin pa mi dmigs pa bzod par gyur pa dang /
translated: the forbearance stage, which is the non-apprehension of the apprehender in the person,

original: de'i 'og tu skyes bu nyid kyi 'dzin pa mi dmigs pa chos kyi mchog ces bya ba 'byung ste /üîΩchung ngu la sogs pa rim gyis skye ba'am /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu skyes bu nyid kyi 'dzin pa mi dmigs pa chos kyi mchog ces bya ba 'byung ste / chung ngu la sogs pa rim gyis skye ba'am /
translated: Then the apprehension of a person is called the supreme mundane state.üîΩIt arises either gradually, from the small stage and so on,üîΩor it is small, medium or great according to the specific faculties of dullness and so on.

original: dbang po rtul po la sogs pa'i bye brag gis chung du dang 'bring dang chen po ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i dmigs pa'i khyad par gyi ngo bo nyid bden pa bzhi'i chos la dmigs pa dang / chos su lta ba'i gnyen po nyid kyis mngon par zhen pa med pa la sogs pa'i rnam par zhugs pa dang /
analyzed: dbang po rtul po la sogs pa'i bye brag gis chung du dang 'bring dang chen po ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i dmigs pa'i khyad par gyi ngo bo nyid bden pa bzhi'i chos la dmigs pa dang / chos su lta ba'i gnyen po nyid kyis mngon par zhen pa med pa la sogs pa'i rnam par zhugs pa dang /
translated: The small, medium and great stages of heat are explained to be the supreme mundane state.

original: theg pa gsum char rtogs pa'i rgyu'i ngo bo dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang bcas pa thabs la mkhas pa'i mtshan nyid kyis yongs su bzung ba dang / mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis kyi rnam par rtog pa bzhi po dro ba la sogs pa'i mnyam par gzhag pa'i ngo bo nyid ji lta ba bzhin du sbyor ba dang rjes kyi gnas skabs kyi bsdus pa rgyur brten
analyzed: theg pa gsum char rtogs pa'i rgyu'i ngo bo dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang bcas pa thabs la mkhas pa'i mtshan nyid kyis yongs su bzung ba dang / mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis kyi rnam par rtog pa bzhi po dro ba la sogs pa'i mnyam par gzhag pa'i ngo bo nyid ji lta ba bzhin du sbyor ba dang rjes kyi gnas skabs kyi bsdus pa rgyur brten
translated: The four conceptions of subject and object to be abandoned by the paths of seeing and meditation are applied to the nature of the heat and so on of meditative equipoise and to the nature of the subsequent state of attainment.

original: cing 'bras bur ldan pa nyid de chos lngas nyan thos dang bse ru dag las khyad par du 'phags pa yin no //
analyzed: cing 'bras bur ldan pa nyid de chos lngas nyan thos dang bse ru dag las khyad par du 'phags pa yin no //
translated: They are superior to ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas through five dharmas: the essence of the cause that is the realization of the three vehicles, being embraced by the characteristic of skill in means together with the virtuous friend, being endowed with the result of the cause, and being included in the state of application and the state of subsequent attainment.

original: gang gi phyir de dag gi dro bar gyur pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ni lung dag las /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag gi dro bar gyur pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ni lung dag las /
translated: The roots of virtue of heat and so on are mentioned in the scriptures as follows.

original: dngos po'i mtshan @13a * //
analyzed: dngos po'i mtshan @13a * //
translated: The characteristics of entities

original: nyid kyis bden pa bzhi la sogs pa dmigs pa dang / bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen po tsam gyi mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par zhugs pa dang / rang gi theg pa kho na rtogs pa'i rgyur gyur ba dang / phyi dang nang gi yongs su 'dzin pa dang bral ba dang /
analyzed: nyid kyis bden pa bzhi la sogs pa dmigs pa dang / bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen po tsam gyi mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par zhugs pa dang / rang gi theg pa kho na rtogs pa'i rgyur gyur ba dang / phyi dang nang gi yongs su 'dzin pa dang bral ba dang /
translated: It arises with the four truths as its object, it engages impermanence and so on as the antidote to the view of self, it becomes the cause for realizing one's vehicle alone, it is free from internal and external grasping and

original: rnam par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi dang mi ldan par skye'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi dang mi ldan par skye'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: it arises free from the four types of conceptualization.

original: 'dir thabs la mkhas pa'i stobs kyis lus dang ngag dang yid dag pa thob pa'i rgyur gyur pa la sogs pa rgyu'i sgo nas dang / ting nge 'dzin dag gi 'bras bu sems can rnams la phan pa'i phyir byed pa can du gyur pa la sogs pa 'bras bu'i sgo nas dang /
analyzed: 'dir thabs la mkhas pa'i stobs kyis lus dang ngag dang yid dag pa thob pa'i rgyur gyur pa la sogs pa rgyu'i sgo nas dang / ting nge 'dzin dag gi 'bras bu sems can rnams la phan pa'i phyir byed pa can du gyur pa la sogs pa 'bras bu'i sgo nas dang /
translated: Here, it is the cause for obtaining a pure body, speech and mind through the power of skill in means and so on from the perspective of cause, it is an agent that benefits sentient beings through the result of concentration and so on from the perspective of result, it is the cause for obtaining the result of the three vehicles through the power of the three vehicles and so on from the perspective of the cause of the result and it is the cause for obtaining the result of the three vehicles through the power of the three vehicles and so on from the perspective of the result of the cause.

original: de kho nar ngo bo med pa nyid kun rdzob pa'i ngo bo nyid du bsgom pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi sgo nas dang / mngon par zhen par bya ba nyid kyi stong pa la sogs pa chos nyid kyi rnam pa'i sgo nas bden pa rnams kyi yul can yin no //üîΩde bzhin du rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang yul nyid du byed do zhes shes par bya ste /üîΩ'di ni rnam par gzhag pa gzhan kho na yin pas theg pa gzhan brten nas ni gang du yang sun 'byin pa brjod par mi bya'o //üîΩdmigs pa dang rnam pa gnyis khyad par ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: de kho nar ngo bo med pa nyid kun rdzob pa'i ngo bo nyid du bsgom pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi sgo nas dang / mngon par zhen par bya ba nyid kyi stong pa la sogs pa chos nyid kyi rnam pa'i sgo nas bden pa rnams kyi yul can yin no // de bzhin du rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang yul nyid du byed do zhes shes par bya ste / 'di ni rnam par gzhag pa gzhan kho na yin pas theg pa gzhan brten nas ni gang du yang sun 'byin pa brjod par mi bya'o // dmigs pa dang rnam pa gnyis khyad par ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: The objects of the truths are the subjective aspects of the meditative cultivation of the emptiness of the insubstantiality of the essential nature of the relative, etc.üîΩOne should understand that the truths are also objects in other aspects.üîΩSince this is a different system, one should not criticize it on the basis of other vehicles.üîΩWhat is the difference between the objective supports and the aspects?üîΩ

original: de dag par skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa bdun gyis 'chad par mdzad pa ni re zhig dro bar gyur pa'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa gsungs pa //üîΩdmigs pa mi rtag la sogs pa //üîΩbden pa'i rten can de yi ni //
analyzed: de dag par skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa bdun gyis 'chad par mdzad pa ni re zhig dro bar gyur pa'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa gsungs pa //üîΩdmigs pa mi rtag la sogs pa //üîΩbden pa'i rten can de yi ni //

original: rnam pa mngon zhen la sogs 'gog /
analyzed: rnam pa mngon zhen la sogs 'gog /
translated: The aspects are the cessation of manifest clinging, etc.

original: theg pa gsum char thob pa'i rgyu //
analyzed: theg pa gsum char thob pa'i rgyu //
translated: It is the cause for attaining all three vehicles.

original: gzugs sogs skye 'jig gnas bral dang // gnas dang rtags dang brjod du med //
analyzed: gzugs sogs skye 'jig gnas bral dang // gnas dang rtags dang brjod du med //
translated: Form, etc. are devoid of origination, endurance, and cessation;

original: ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o //
translated: they are inexpressible as the same or different.

original: de la drod chung ngu'i dmigs pa ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa bzhi la mi rtag pa la sogs pa rnam pa bcu drug yin no //
analyzed: de la drod chung ngu'i dmigs pa ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa bzhi la mi rtag pa la sogs pa rnam pa bcu drug yin no //
translated: The object of the weak heat is the four truths of suffering, etc. as sixteen aspects such as impermanence.

original: rnam pa ni bden pa de dag mngon par zhen pa dang dmigs pa la sogs pa 'gog pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa ni bden pa de dag mngon par zhen pa dang dmigs pa la sogs pa 'gog pa yin no //
translated: The aspects are the cessation of manifest clinging to those truths, the cessation of the object, etc.

original: de'i phyir khyad par gyi chos nyid kyi bden pa rnams la yongs su shes par bya ba 'ga' yang med pa'i mtshan nyid can ni chung ngur brtags par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyad par gyi chos nyid kyi bden pa rnams la yongs su shes par bya ba 'ga' yang med pa'i mtshan nyid can ni chung ngur brtags par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the weak should be considered to have the nature of the truths as the special object, and the nature of the truths as the special aspect.

original: 'di ni yang dag @13b par 'grub pa'i bdag nyid rgya che ba nyid kyi phyir theg pa thams cad 'thob pa'i rgyu'i ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni yang dag @13b par 'grub pa'i bdag nyid rgya che ba nyid kyi phyir theg pa thams cad 'thob pa'i rgyu'i ngo bo yin te /
translated: It is the cause for attaining all three vehicles, because it is the cause for attaining the Great Vehicle.

original: lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du khongs su chud par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams la yang de bzhin du khongs su chud par bya'o //
translated: The rest should be understood in the same way.

original: 'bring gi dmigs pa ni mos pa dang / de kho na nyid kyi yid la byed pa dag gis grangs bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa bsgrub pa dang / dgag pa mi dmigs shing mi mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: 'bring gi dmigs pa ni mos pa dang / de kho na nyid kyi yid la byed pa dag gis grangs bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa bsgrub pa dang / dgag pa mi dmigs shing mi mthong ba yin no //
translated: The object of the medium is the non-apprehension and non-perception of the establishment and negation of form, etc., by means of the mental attentions to devotedness and reality, respectively.

original: rnam pa ni ming thams cad med pa nyid kyis rgyun dang mi 'dra ba dang 'dra bar 'jug pa'i tha snyad dag med pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa ni ming thams cad med pa nyid kyis rgyun dang mi 'dra ba dang 'dra bar 'jug pa'i tha snyad dag med pa yin no //
translated: The aspect is the non-existence of all names, and the non-existence of the conventions of engagement with sameness and difference.

original: de'i phyir bden pa rnams kyi 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa med pa'i chos nyid kyi mtshan nyid can ni 'bring du brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bden pa rnams kyi 'phel ba dang / 'grib pa med pa'i chos nyid kyi mtshan nyid can ni 'bring du brtag par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the medium should be considered as having the characteristic of the reality of non-increase and non-decrease with regard to the truths.

original: chen po'i dmigs pa ni gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi chos thams cad brdar btags pa tha snyad pa nyid do zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: chen po'i dmigs pa ni gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi chos thams cad brdar btags pa tha snyad pa nyid do zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The object of the great is all dharmas from form to omniscience, which are mere conventional designations.

original: rnam pa ni de dag dge ba la sogs pa nyid kyis chos gang du yang brjod du med pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa ni de dag dge ba la sogs pa nyid kyis chos gang du yang brjod du med pa yin no //
translated: The aspect is the inexpressibility of any dharma as virtue, etc.

original: de'i phyir bden pa rnams kyi brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid can ni chen por brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bden pa rnams kyi brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid can ni chen por brtag par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the characteristic of the unreality of the truths should be considered to be the greatest.

original: de ltar na rnam par mi rtog pa'i mchog gi ye shes kyi me 'byung ba'i ri ltas su gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na rnam par mi rtog pa'i mchog gi ye shes kyi me 'byung ba'i ri ltas su gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because it is a sign of the arising of the fire of the highest nonconceptual intuition,

original: dro bar gyur pa rnam pa gsum mo//
analyzed: dro bar gyur pa rnam pa gsum mo//
translated: there are three kinds of heat.

original: de'i 'og tu rtse mor gyur pa'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa gsungs pa //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rtse mor gyur pa'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa gsungs pa //
translated: After that, the object and aspect of the summit are stated:

original: gzugs sogs mi gnas de dag ni //üîΩde yi ngo bor rang bzhin med //
analyzed: gzugs sogs mi gnas de dag ni // de yi ngo bor rang bzhin med //
translated: Forms, etc. do not abide in that,üîΩand they are empty of their own-nature.

original: de dag gcig gi rang bzhin gcig / de mi rtag sogs par mi gnas //
analyzed: de dag gcig gi rang bzhin gcig / de mi rtag sogs par mi gnas //
translated: The own-nature of one is the own-nature of all, and they do not abide as impermanent, etc.

original: de rnams de yi ngo bos stong //
analyzed: de rnams de yi ngo bos stong //
translated: They are empty of their own-nature.

original: de dag gcig gi rang bzhin gcig / chos rnams mi 'dzin gang yin dang // de dag mtshan mar mi mthong phyir //
analyzed: de dag gcig gi rang bzhin gcig / chos rnams mi 'dzin gang yin dang // de dag mtshan mar mi mthong phyir //
translated: The own-nature of one is the own-nature of all, and because one does not apprehend the dharmas and does not see their signs,

original: shes rab kyis ni yongs rtogs pa //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni yongs rtogs pa //
translated: one fully understands them with wisdom.

original: thams cad dmigs su med par ro //
analyzed: thams cad dmigs su med par ro //
translated: All are nonapprehensible.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus it is.

original: rtse mo chung du'i dmigs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa ni rang gi ngo bo dang bral ba nyid kyis rang gi rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa la mi gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: rtse mo chung du'i dmigs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa ni rang gi ngo bo dang bral ba nyid kyis rang gi rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa la mi gnas pa yin no //
translated: The object of the small peak is that form and so on do not abide in form and so on, because they are empty of their own intrinsic reality by virtue of being devoid of their own nature.

original: rnam pa ni de kho nar gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad dang stong pa nyid dag phan tshun ngo bo gcig ma yin pas stong pa nyid la mi rtag pa la sogs pa med pa nyid kyis @14a * //
analyzed: rnam pa ni de kho nar gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad dang stong pa nyid dag phan tshun ngo bo gcig ma yin pas stong pa nyid la mi rtag pa la sogs pa med pa nyid kyis @14a * //
translated: The aspect is that emptiness and all phenomena such as form are not of the same nature, so impermanence and so on do not exist in emptiness.

original: de dag la mi rtag pa la sogs pa nyid du mi gnas pa nyid do //
analyzed: de dag la mi rtag pa la sogs pa nyid du mi gnas pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, impermanence and so on do not abide in them.

original: de'i phyir bden pa rnams ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa nyid du yang dag par bya ba ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid can ni chung ngur rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bden pa rnams ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa nyid du yang dag par bya ba ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid can ni chung ngur rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the truths should be understood as small, characterized by not being established as impermanence and so on.

original: 'bring gi dmigs pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid kyis mi rtag pa la sogs pa dang stong pa nyid rnams ni ngo bo nyid med pa yin pas mi rtag pa la sogs pa dang stong pa nyid dag phan tshun bdag nyid gcig pa yin no
analyzed: 'bring gi dmigs pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid kyis mi rtag pa la sogs pa dang stong pa nyid rnams ni ngo bo nyid med pa yin pas mi rtag pa la sogs pa dang stong pa nyid dag phan tshun bdag nyid gcig pa yin no
translated: The medium object is impermanence, etc. and emptiness, which are the reality of the dharma-dhƒÅtu, because they are essenceless. Therefore, impermanence, etc. and emptiness are mutually the same identity.

original: // rnam pa ni ngo bo nyid bkag pas gzugs la sogs pa la rang gir mi byed pa yin no //
analyzed: // rnam pa ni ngo bo nyid bkag pas gzugs la sogs pa la rang gir mi byed pa yin no //
translated: The aspect is the non-appropriation of form, etc. by the negation of essence.

original: de'i phyir bden pa rnams kyis mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi stong pa nyid rnams la bdag gir bya bas bden pa'i mtshan nyid can ni 'bring du rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bden pa rnams kyis mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi stong pa nyid rnams la bdag gir bya bas bden pa'i mtshan nyid can ni 'bring du rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the emptiness of the nature of impermanence, etc. by the truths should be appropriated. The characteristic of the truth should be understood as medium.

original: chen po'i dmigs pa ni ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis gzugs la sog pa de dag la sngon po la sogs pa'i mtshan mar mi mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: chen po'i dmigs pa ni ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis gzugs la sog pa de dag la sngon po la sogs pa'i mtshan mar mi mthong ba yin no //
translated: The great object is the non-seeing of those forms, etc. as blue, etc. by the essencelessness.

original: rnam pa ni shes rab kyis dngos po thams cad mi dmigs par nges par 'byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa ni shes rab kyis dngos po thams cad mi dmigs par nges par 'byed pa yin no //
translated: The aspect is the definite emergence of wisdom through the non-observation of all things.

original: de'i phyir bden pa rnams la mtshan mar mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid can ni chen por rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bden pa rnams la mtshan mar mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid can ni chen por rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the realization of the great should be understood as having the characteristic of non-apprehension of signs in the truths.

original: de ltar na dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi rtse mo yin pa'i phyir rtse mor gyur pa rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de ltar na dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi rtse mo yin pa'i phyir rtse mor gyur pa rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Thus, the summit is threefold, because it is the summit of the wholesome roots.

original: de'i 'og tu bzod par gyur pa'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa gsungs pa //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bzod par gyur pa'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa gsungs pa //
translated: After that, the object and aspect of the summit are stated:

original: gzugs sogs ngo bo nyid med nyid //
analyzed: gzugs sogs ngo bo nyid med nyid //
translated: The unreality of form, etc.

original: de med pa ni ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: de med pa ni ngo bo nyid //
translated: Its non-existence is reality.

original: de dag skye med nges 'byung med //
analyzed: de dag skye med nges 'byung med //
translated: They are unborn and do not emerge.

original: dag dang de dag mtshan nyid med //
analyzed: dag dang de dag mtshan nyid med //
translated: They are pure and have no characteristics.

original: de yi mtshan mar mi rten pas //
analyzed: de yi mtshan mar mi rten pas //
translated: Because one does not rely on their signs,

original: mos min 'du shes med pa yin //
analyzed: mos min 'du shes med pa yin //
translated: there is no resolve and no perception.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what it says.

original: bzod pa chung ngu'i dmigs pa ni mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid dang ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid dag stong pa nyid du gcig pa nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa ngo bo nyid med pa yin no //
analyzed: bzod pa chung ngu'i dmigs pa ni mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid dang ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid dag stong pa nyid du gcig pa nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa ngo bo nyid med pa yin no //
translated: The object of lesser acceptance is the equality of the reality of characteristics and the reality of the nature through the emptiness of form, etc. being unreal.

original: rnam pa ni 'khrul pa'i dor dngos po med pa nyid gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: rnam pa ni 'khrul pa'i dor dngos po med pa nyid gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The aspect is the non-existence of the entity of error, which is the nature of form, etc.

original: de'i phyir bden pa rnams la ngo bo nyid med pa'i ngo bor shes pa'i mtshan nyid can ni chung dur nges par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bden pa rnams la ngo bo nyid med pa'i ngo bor shes pa'i mtshan nyid can ni chung dur nges par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the small should be ascertained as having the characteristic of the knowledge that the realities are of the nature of non-entityness.

original: 'bring gi dmigs pa ni rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa skye ba yang @14b med mya ngan las 'das pa yang med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bring gi dmigs pa ni rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa skye ba yang @14b med mya ngan las 'das pa yang med pa yin no //
translated: The medium's object is the non-arising of form, etc. by nature, and the non-existence of nirvana.

original: rnam pa ni chos thams cad kyi ngo bo rtogs pa kho nas lus la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad du rnam par dag pa'i rgyur gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa ni chos thams cad kyi ngo bo rtogs pa kho nas lus la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad du rnam par dag pa'i rgyur gyur pa yin no //
translated: The aspect is the cause of the complete purification of the body, etc. by merely realizing the nature of all phenomena.

original: de'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i ngo bo nyid med par rtogs pas grol ba'i mtshan nyid can ni 'bring du nges par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i ngo bo nyid med par rtogs pas grol ba'i mtshan nyid can ni 'bring du nges par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the medium should be ascertained as having the characteristic of liberation by realizing the nature of affliction and purification as non-existent.

original: chen po'i dmigs pa ni chos thams cad rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyi mi 'thad pas gzugs la sogs pa la rtag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: chen po'i dmigs pa ni chos thams cad rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyi mi 'thad pas gzugs la sogs pa la rtag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: The object of the great is the absence of signs such as permanence, etc., in form, etc., because the general and particular characteristics of all things are not tenable.

original: rnam pa ni rang bzhin kho nas gzugs la sogs pa mtshan ma rnams kyi rten dang bral ba nyid kyis mos pa yid la byed pas mi mos shing de kho na nyid yid la byed pas yongs su shes pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa ni rang bzhin kho nas gzugs la sogs pa mtshan ma rnams kyi rten dang bral ba nyid kyis mos pa yid la byed pas mi mos shing de kho na nyid yid la byed pas yongs su shes pa med pa yin no //
translated: The aspect is the non-apprehension of the absence of signs, such as form, etc., by the mental attention of conviction, due to their natural lack of support for signs.

original: de'i phyir bden pa rnams la mtshan ma med pa'i mtshan nyid can ni chen por nges par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bden pa rnams la mtshan ma med pa'i mtshan nyid can ni chen por nges par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the absence of signs, which is the characteristic of the truths, should be understood as the great.

original: de ltar na chos chen po la bzod pa'i phyir ngan 'gro med pas bzod par gyur pa rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de ltar na chos chen po la bzod pa'i phyir ngan 'gro med pas bzod par gyur pa rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Thus, because of patience with the great Dharma, there is no bad rebirth, so there are three types of patience.

original: de'i 'og tu chos kyi mchog tu gyur pa'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa gsungs pa //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu chos kyi mchog tu gyur pa'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa gsungs pa //
translated: After that, the object and aspect of the supreme mundane dharmas are stated:

original: ting 'dzin de yi byed pa nyid //
analyzed: ting 'dzin de yi byed pa nyid //
translated: That samƒÅdhi is the function itself.

original: lung ston pa dang rlom pa zad //
analyzed: lung ston pa dang rlom pa zad //
translated: Prediction and the end of conceit.

original: gsum po phan tshun ngo bo gcig / ting 'dzin rnam par mi rtog pa //
analyzed: gsum po phan tshun ngo bo gcig / ting 'dzin rnam par mi rtog pa //
translated: The three are mutually the same nature, and the samadhi is nonconceptual.

original: de ltar nges 'byed cha mthun ni //
analyzed: de ltar nges 'byed cha mthun ni //
translated: Thus the factors conducive to penetrative insight

original: chung dang 'bring dang chen po yin //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //üîΩchos mchog chung ngu'i dmigs pa ni mi dmigs pa nyid kyis chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang / dpa' bar 'gro ba la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin yang dag par bsgom pa yin no //
analyzed: chung dang 'bring dang chen po yin // zhes bya ba'o // chos mchog chung ngu'i dmigs pa ni mi dmigs pa nyid kyis chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang / dpa' bar 'gro ba la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin yang dag par bsgom pa yin no //
translated: are small, middling, and great.üîΩThe small supreme mundane state has as its object the nonapprehension of all phenomena, and it is the correct meditation on the samadhis of the hero‚Äôs progress and so on.

original: rnam pa ni rang gi smon lam la sogs pa dang / pha rol gyi skal ba nyid dang / pha rol gyi skal ba nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi stobs nyid kyis lhun gyis grub par 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du ting nge 'dzin gyis sems can gyi don sna tshogs pa bya ba la 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa ni rang gi smon lam la sogs pa dang / pha rol gyi skal ba nyid dang / pha rol gyi skal ba nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi stobs nyid kyis lhun gyis grub par 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du ting nge 'dzin gyis sems can gyi don sna tshogs pa bya ba la 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Its aspect is the spontaneous engagement in the various activities of benefiting sentient beings through samadhi in all world systems, in accordance with their fortune, by means of one‚Äôs own aspiration and so on, the power of others‚Äô merit, and the power of the dharmadhatu.

original: de'i phyir bden pa rnams la ting nge 'dzin gyis byed pa'i mtshan nyid can ni chung ngur rig par bya'o //üîΩ'bring gi dmigs pa ni yang dag par zhugs pa nyid kyis ting nge 'dzin de dang ldan pa la sangs rgyas rnams gsang ste lung ston par @15a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir bden pa rnams la ting nge 'dzin gyis byed pa'i mtshan nyid can ni chung ngur rig par bya'o // 'bring gi dmigs pa ni yang dag par zhugs pa nyid kyis ting nge 'dzin de dang ldan pa la sangs rgyas rnams gsang ste lung ston par @15a * //
translated: Therefore, the small stage is characterized by the meditative concentration that is the cause of the truths.üîΩThe medium stage is characterized by the meditative concentration that is the cause of the prediction.

original: mdzad pa'i chos nyid gang yin pa de nyid do //
analyzed: mdzad pa'i chos nyid gang yin pa de nyid do //
translated: The object of the medium stage is the very nature of the buddhas‚Äô secret prediction of those who are correctly engaged in meditative concentration.

original: rnam pa ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad mi 'thad bas rnal 'byor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa la bdag ni mnyam par gzhag pa'o snyam pa la sogs pa'i rlom pa mi 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad mi 'thad bas rnal 'byor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa la bdag ni mnyam par gzhag pa'o snyam pa la sogs pa'i rlom pa mi 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The aspect is the realization of the nature of the yogin‚Äôs meditative concentration, which is not compatible with any discursive thought, and so the conceit ‚ÄúI am in meditative equipoise‚Äù does not arise.

original: de'i phyir bden pa rnams la lung bstan pa thob pa'i rgyu rlom par mi byed pa'i mtshan nyid can ni 'bring du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bden pa rnams la lung bstan pa thob pa'i rgyu rlom par mi byed pa'i mtshan nyid can ni 'bring du shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the medium stage is characterized by the cause of attaining the prediction of the truths, which is the absence of conceit.

original: chen po'i dmigs pa ni chos nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang byang chub sems dpa' dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / don gsum phan tshun ngo bo nyid gcig pa yin no //
analyzed: chen po'i dmigs pa ni chos nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang byang chub sems dpa' dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / don gsum phan tshun ngo bo nyid gcig pa yin no //
translated: The object of the great is the samƒÅdhi of reality, the bodhisattva, and the perfection of wisdom, and the three objects are mutually identical in nature.

original: rnam pa ni chos thams cad yod pa ma yin pa nyid kyis ting nge 'dzin de la gnas nas don gsum rnam par mi rtog pa thabs dam par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa ni chos thams cad yod pa ma yin pa nyid kyis ting nge 'dzin de la gnas nas don gsum rnam par mi rtog pa thabs dam par gyur pa yin no //
translated: The aspect is that, by the nonexistence of all phenomena, one abides in that samƒÅdhi, and the three objects are the supreme method of nonconceptuality.

original: de'i phyir bden pa rnams la ting nge 'dzin gyis chos gsum gyi bdag nyid mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid can ni chen por rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bden pa rnams la ting nge 'dzin gyis chos gsum gyi bdag nyid mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid can ni chen por rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the samƒÅdhi of the truths should be known as the great, having the nature of the three objects, characterized by nonapprehending.

original: de ltar na 'jig rten pa'i chos thams cad kyi mchog yin pa'i phyir chos kyi mchog ces bya ba rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de ltar na 'jig rten pa'i chos thams cad kyi mchog yin pa'i phyir chos kyi mchog ces bya ba rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Thus, because it is the supreme of all mundane dharmas, it is called the supreme dharma, which has three aspects.

original: thog ma ji lta ba bzhin dmigs pa dang rnam pa khyad par gyi chos can dang chos brjod par rigs mod //
analyzed: thog ma ji lta ba bzhin dmigs pa dang rnam pa khyad par gyi chos can dang chos brjod par rigs mod //
translated: It is reasonable that the object, aspect, and expression of the supreme dharma are just like those of the beginning.

original: khyad par can gyis chos brjod pas thams cad du brjod pa ni tshig le'ur byas pa sdeb pa'i ngor yin pa'i phyir dang / khyad par gzhan spong ba dang mi spong ba ma gtogs pa don gyi khyad par 'ga' yang med pas mngon par zhen pa la sogs pa bkag pa dang ldan pa'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden par gtogs pa kho na dmigs pa dang rnam par bya ba yin
analyzed: khyad par can gyis chos brjod pas thams cad du brjod pa ni tshig le'ur byas pa sdeb pa'i ngor yin pa'i phyir dang / khyad par gzhan spong ba dang mi spong ba ma gtogs pa don gyi khyad par 'ga' yang med pas mngon par zhen pa la sogs pa bkag pa dang ldan pa'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden par gtogs pa kho na dmigs pa dang rnam par bya ba yin
translated: In particular, the expression of the Dharma is everywhere expressed in verse, because it is in the form of metrical composition, and because there is no difference in meaning except for the avoidance of other particularities and the nonavoidance of others.

original: pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: pa'i phyir te /
translated: Therefore, the object and aspect of the truths of suffering and so on are only those that possess the negation of manifest clinging and so on.

original: de bzhin du thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied in the same way to all.

original: rnam par rtog pa bzhi dang ldan pa skye'o zhes bya ba ji ltar rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa bzhi dang ldan pa skye'o zhes bya ba ji ltar rig par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one understand the statement that the four types of conception arise?üîΩTherefore, the two intermediate verses state the conception of the apprehended:

original: de'i phyir bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa gnyis las gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa gnyis las gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gsungs pa /
translated: The conception of the apprehended is twofold,

original: gzhi dang de yi gnyen po yis //üîΩgzung bar rtog pa rnam pa gnyis //
analyzed: gzhi dang de yi gnyen po yis // gzung bar rtog pa rnam pa gnyis //
translated: by way of the basis and its antidote.

original: rmongs dang phung sogs bye brag gis //
analyzed: rmongs dang phung sogs bye brag gis //
translated: By way of delusion and the distinctions of the aggregates and so on.

original: de ni so sor rnam pa dgu //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni so sor rnam pa dgu // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is ninefold for each.

original: gzung bar rnam par rtog pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i @15b gzhi'i rten can dang / gnyen po rnam par byang ba'i rten can gyi rnam par rtog pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gzung bar rnam par rtog pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i @15b gzhi'i rten can dang / gnyen po rnam par byang ba'i rten can gyi rnam par rtog pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of conceptualization: conceptualization that is the basis of the afflicted, and conceptualization that is the basis of the purified, the antidote.

original: de yang grangs bzhin du ma rig pa dang rnam par byang ba'i phung po la sogs ba'i rab tu dbye bas rnam pa dgu'o //
analyzed: de yang grangs bzhin du ma rig pa dang rnam par byang ba'i phung po la sogs ba'i rab tu dbye bas rnam pa dgu'o //
translated: And each of these is ninefold, according to the distinctions of the aggregates of ignorance and purification, etc.

original: de'i rjes la 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gsungs pa /üîΩrdzas dang btags pa'i rten can gyi //
analyzed: de'i rjes la 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gsungs pa / rdzas dang btags pa'i rten can gyi //
translated: After that, the conceptualization of the grasper is stated:üîΩThe grasper is also considered twofold,

original: 'dzin pa'ang rnam pa gnyis su 'dod //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'ang rnam pa gnyis su 'dod //
translated: based on substance and designation.üîΩThe nature of independence, self, etc.,

original: rang dbang bdag sogs ngo bo dang // phung sogs brten las de bzhin no //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang dbang bdag sogs ngo bo dang // phung sogs brten las de bzhin no // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and the aggregates, etc., are also like that.

original: gang zag rdzas su yod pa dang // skyes bu btags par yod pa la dmigs pa nyid kyis 'dzin par rnam par rtog pa yang gnyis yin la /
analyzed: gang zag rdzas su yod pa dang // skyes bu btags par yod pa la dmigs pa nyid kyis 'dzin par rnam par rtog pa yang gnyis yin la /
translated: The conceptualization of the grasper is also twofold, because it focuses on the substantial existence of the person and the imputed existence of the individual.

original: de yang bdag rang dbang can dang / phung po la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i dbang du byed pas de ltar so sor rnam pa dgu'o //
analyzed: de yang bdag rang dbang can dang / phung po la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i dbang du byed pas de ltar so sor rnam pa dgu'o //
translated: it is ninefold in this way.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa gzhi'i rten can dgu po gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa gzhi'i rten can dgu po gang zhe na /
translated: What are the nine bases of the afflicted?üîΩThey are: the karma of the afflicted, the ignorance of the afflicted that is confusion about reality, the form aggregate, etc.,

original: las nyid dang ; de kho na nyid la rmongs pa'i ma rig pa dang / gang gis pha rol tu phung po yongs su 'grub pa gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po dang / rtag pa dang chad pa nyid du nye bar 'dzin pa ming dang gzugs la mngon par zhen pa dang /
analyzed: las nyid dang ; de kho na nyid la rmongs pa'i ma rig pa dang / gang gis pha rol tu phung po yongs su 'grub pa gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po dang / rtag pa dang chad pa nyid du nye bar 'dzin pa ming dang gzugs la mngon par zhen pa dang /
translated: by which the aggregates are fully established in the other world, the attachment to name and form that is the apprehension of eternalism and nihilism,

original: de dag la mngon par zhen pa dang por gyur pa mtha' gnyis la chags pa dang / ma rig pa nas rga shi'i bar du kun nas nyon mongs pa mi shes pa dang sems dang po bskyed pa nyid nas sangs rgyas kyi bar du rnam par byang ba mi shes pa dang /
analyzed: de dag la mngon par zhen pa dang por gyur pa mtha' gnyis la chags pa dang / ma rig pa nas rga shi'i bar du kun nas nyon mongs pa mi shes pa dang sems dang po bskyed pa nyid nas sangs rgyas kyi bar du rnam par byang ba mi shes pa dang /
translated: the attachment to the two extremes that is the initial attachment to those, the ignorance of the afflicted that is the non-understanding of the afflicted from ignorance to aging and death, and the non-understanding of the complete purification from the initial generation of the mind of enlightenment to buddhahood.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar gyi 'phags pa'i lam la mi gnas pa dang / chos thams cad la ji lta ba bzhin ma yin par phyin ci log tu nye bar dmigs pa dang / bdag dang sems can la sogs pa byed pa'i skyes bu dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar gyi 'phags pa'i lam la mi gnas pa dang / chos thams cad la ji lta ba bzhin ma yin par phyin ci log tu nye bar dmigs pa dang / bdag dang sems can la sogs pa byed pa'i skyes bu dang /
translated: It is not to abide in the noble path from the perfection of generosity to the unentangled qualities of the Buddha. It is to observe all phenomena in a distorted way, not in accordance with reality. It is to conceive of a person who is an agent, such as a self or sentient being.

original: rnam par dag pa skye ba med pa dang ma byung ba la sogs pa la gzung bar rnam par rtog pa rnams so //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa skye ba med pa dang ma byung ba la sogs pa la gzung bar rnam par rtog pa rnams so //
translated: It is to conceive of the non-arising, non-appearance, and so on of purity as something to be apprehended.

original: 'di dag ni dgag pa'i rnam pa can gyi ngo bos nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag dang ngo bo nyid na sbyor ba dang dngos gzhi dang rjes kyi gnas skabs kyis rten cing mtshungs par gnas pa dang nye bar ldan pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni dgag pa'i rnam pa can gyi ngo bos nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag dang ngo bo nyid na sbyor ba dang dngos gzhi dang rjes kyi gnas skabs kyis rten cing mtshungs par gnas pa dang nye bar ldan pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: These should be understood as the branches of penetration that have the nature of negation, and as being concomitant with the basis, abiding in equality, and being related through the stages of preparation, actual practice, and conclusion.

original: @16a * // gnyen po'i rten can dgu po gang zhe na /
analyzed: @16a * // gnyen po'i rten can dgu po gang zhe na /
translated: What are the nine that have an antidote as their basis?

original: rigs can rnams bden pa mthong ba'i bdag nyid phung po lnga dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos skyed pa'i rkyen gyis bdag nyid skye mched bcu gnyis dang / yongs su dag pa'i chos mngon du 'gyur ba nyid kyis sa bon rigs dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos mngon par 'grub pa'i rten 'brel skye ba dang /
analyzed: rigs can rnams bden pa mthong ba'i bdag nyid phung po lnga dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos skyed pa'i rkyen gyis bdag nyid skye mched bcu gnyis dang / yongs su dag pa'i chos mngon du 'gyur ba nyid kyis sa bon rigs dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos mngon par 'grub pa'i rten 'brel skye ba dang /
translated: The five aggregates that are the identity of seeing the truth for those of the three families, the twelve sense bases that are the identity of the conditions that give rise to the phenomena of complete purification, the seed of the family that is the actualization of the phenomena of complete purity, and the dependent origination that is the establishment of the phenomena of the aspects of enlightenment.

original: ji ltar rigs pa'i rang bzhin dang glo bur ba'i dri ma las rnam par dben pa stong pa nyid dang / sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi bdag nyid mthong ba'i lam dang /
analyzed: ji ltar rigs pa'i rang bzhin dang glo bur ba'i dri ma las rnam par dben pa stong pa nyid dang / sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi bdag nyid mthong ba'i lam dang /
translated: The emptiness that is the nature of being free from the stains of the nature and the adventitious stains, the path of seeing that is the identity of the perfections such as generosity and ethical discipline,

original: bsam gtan dang mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis bsgom pa'i lam dang / stobs bcu la sogs pa mi slob pa'i lam la gzung bar rnam par rtog pa rnams so //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis bsgom pa'i lam dang / stobs bcu la sogs pa mi slob pa'i lam la gzung bar rnam par rtog pa rnams so //
translated: the path of meditation that is characterized by the dhyƒÅnas, the superknowledges, and so on, and the path of no learning that is the ten powers and so on.

original: 'di dag kyang snga ma lta bu'i rnam pas yan lag gnyis pa nyid na zhes rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag kyang snga ma lta bu'i rnam pas yan lag gnyis pa nyid na zhes rig par bya'o //
translated: These should be understood in the same way as the former, that is, in the second branch.

original: gang zag rdzas su yod pa'i rten can gyi dgu po gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zag rdzas su yod pa'i rten can gyi dgu po gang zhe na /
translated: What are the nine that are based on the substantial reality of the person?

original: 'dus byas kyi chos dag las gzhan la rag las pa med pas dbang du gyur pa bdag rang dbang can dang / phung po la zla grogs med pa nyid kyis gcig pu'i bdag nyid dang / skye mched la rnam par shes pa skyed pa nyid kyis sgor gyur pa rgyu'i bdag dang /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos dag las gzhan la rag las pa med pas dbang du gyur pa bdag rang dbang can dang / phung po la zla grogs med pa nyid kyis gcig pu'i bdag nyid dang / skye mched la rnam par shes pa skyed pa nyid kyis sgor gyur pa rgyu'i bdag dang /
translated: The independent self, which is independent because it is not dependent on other compounded phenomena; the unitary self, which is a single entity because it has no companion in the aggregates; the causal self, which is the door because consciousness arises in the sense spheres;

original: khams la longs spyod par lta ba po la sogs pa'i bdag dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rten dang / zhi ba dang ; rags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'jig rten gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rten dang /
analyzed: khams la longs spyod par lta ba po la sogs pa'i bdag dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rten dang / zhi ba dang ; rags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'jig rten gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rten dang /
translated: the self that is the viewer and so on, which is the viewer, the hearer, the feeler, the knower and the perceiver in the elements; the afflicted self, which is the support of the dependent origination of affliction; the purified self, which is the support of the dependent origination of purification; the self of the world free from attachment, which is the support of the world characterized by peace and coarseness;

original: bde ba rnams kyi mtshan nyid mngon sum du byas pa mthong ba'i rten dang / rnam par thar pa la sogs pa bdag nyid bsgom pa'i rten dang / yang dag par slob pa rnams kyi don byas pa'i rten la 'dzin par rnam par rtog pa rnams so //üîΩ'di dag kyang snga ma lta bu'i yan lag gi rnam pas gsum pa nyid na'o zhes nges par bya'o //üîΩskyes bu btags par yod pa'i rten can gyi dgu po gang zhe na /
analyzed: bde ba rnams kyi mtshan nyid mngon sum du byas pa mthong ba'i rten dang / rnam par thar pa la sogs pa bdag nyid bsgom pa'i rten dang / yang dag par slob pa rnams kyi don byas pa'i rten la 'dzin par rnam par rtog pa rnams so // 'di dag kyang snga ma lta bu'i yan lag gi rnam pas gsum pa nyid na'o zhes nges par bya'o // skyes bu btags par yod pa'i rten can gyi dgu po gang zhe na /
translated: The imagination of the object as a non-entity consists of the imagination of the object as the basis of the experience of pleasure, the imagination of the object as the basis of the experience of pain, and the imagination of the object as the basis of the experience of neither pleasure nor pain.üîΩThe imagination of the subject as a whole consists of the imagination of the subject as the basis of the experience of pleasure, the imagination of the subject as the basis of the experience of pain, and the imagination of the subject as the basis of the experience of neither pleasure nor pain.üîΩThe imagination of the subject as a particular consists of the imagination of the subject as the basis of the experience of pleasure, the imagination of the subject as the basis of the experience of pain, and the imagination of the subject as the basis of the experience of neither pleasure nor pain.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po dang / mig @16b gi dbang po la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams dang / gzugs kyi khams la sogs pa khams rnams dang / ma rig pa la sogs pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa rnam par byang ba dang /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po dang / mig @16b gi dbang po la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams dang / gzugs kyi khams la sogs pa khams rnams dang / ma rig pa la sogs pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa rnam par byang ba dang /
translated: The imagination of the subject as a non-entity consists of the imagination of the subject as the basis of the experience of pleasure, the imagination of the subject as the basis of the experience of pain, and the imagination of the subject as the basis of the experience of neither pleasure nor pain.üîΩThe imagination of the result as a whole consists of the imagination of the result as the basis of the experience of

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid la sogs pa dang / bsam gtan la sogs pa'i sgom pa dang / nyan thos la sogs pa las phul du gyur pa khyad par gyi lam dang / stobs la sogs pa'i bdag nyid mi slob pa'i lam 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams so //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid la sogs pa dang / bsam gtan la sogs pa'i sgom pa dang / nyan thos la sogs pa las phul du gyur pa khyad par gyi lam dang / stobs la sogs pa'i bdag nyid mi slob pa'i lam 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams so //
translated: The path of no-more-learning is the powers, etc.

original: 'di dag kyang rnam pa snga ma lta bus yan lag bzhi pa dag na'o zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag kyang rnam pa snga ma lta bus yan lag bzhi pa dag na'o zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: These are also to be understood as the four branches in the previous way.

original: tshigs su bcad pa sbyar ba dang mthun par yongs su 'dzin pa sngar gsungs nas yang de'i stobs kyis ji ltar bshad pa khyad par du 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir de'i 'og tu bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa sbyar ba dang mthun par yongs su 'dzin pa sngar gsungs nas yang de'i stobs kyis ji ltar bshad pa khyad par du 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir de'i 'og tu bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa gsungs pa /
translated: After the previous verses in accord with the application, in order to demonstrate that through the power of that, the explained becomes special, the intermediate verse is stated:

original: sems mi 'gong ba nyid sogs kyi //
analyzed: sems mi 'gong ba nyid sogs kyi //
translated: The essence of non-discouragement, etc.

original: ngo bo nyid med sogs ston byed //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med sogs ston byed //
translated: Is the teaching of essencelessness, etc.

original: de yi mi mthun phyogs dor ba //
analyzed: de yi mi mthun phyogs dor ba //
translated: Abandoning its resistance,

original: rnam pa kun tu yongs 'dzin yin //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa kun tu yongs 'dzin yin //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
translated: Is the complete embracing in every way.

original: thabs mkhas pas chos thams cad stong pa nyid la sems yongs su mi 'gong zhing mi skrag pa nyid dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs dmigs pa'i tshul gyis yid la byed pa dor ba dang / bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du dngos po mtha' dag bdag med pa la sogs pa ston par byed pa dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang /
analyzed: thabs mkhas pas chos thams cad stong pa nyid la sems yongs su mi 'gong zhing mi skrag pa nyid dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs dmigs pa'i tshul gyis yid la byed pa dor ba dang / bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du dngos po mtha' dag bdag med pa la sogs pa ston par byed pa dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang /
translated: By skillful means, they do not fear or shrink from the emptiness of all phenomena, they discard attention that focuses on the antithesis of emptiness and they teach all things such as selflessness in accordance with the inclinations of their disciples.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs mtshan mar mngon par zhen pa sdig pa'i grogs po yongs su dor ba ni nang dang phyi'i rgyu dang rkyen gyis rnam pa thams cad du yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs mtshan mar mngon par zhen pa sdig pa'i grogs po yongs su dor ba ni nang dang phyi'i rgyu dang rkyen gyis rnam pa thams cad du yongs su 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: They completely avoid nonvirtuous friends who cling to the antithesis of emptiness, signs.

original: de ltar nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa thob pas chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin shes par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de ltar nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa thob pas chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin shes par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Thus, by attaining the factors conducive to penetrative insight, they come to know the nature of the dharmadhatu.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i sgrub pa rnams kyang rten nges pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir sgrub pa'i rten du gyur pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i sgrub pa rnams kyang rten nges pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir sgrub pa'i rten du gyur pa gsungs pa /
translated: And since the practices to be explained are preceded by certainty in the support, the support for practice is stated.

original: rtogs pa yi ni chos drug dang // gnyen po dang ni spong ba dang // de dag yongs su gtugs pa dang // shes rab snying brtser @17a * //
analyzed: rtogs pa yi ni chos drug dang // gnyen po dang ni spong ba dang // de dag yongs su gtugs pa dang // shes rab snying brtser @17a * //
translated: wisdom, compassion,üîΩand the disciples‚Äô uniqueness,üîΩthe order of others‚Äô aims,

original: bcas pa dang // slob ma thun mong min nyid dang // gzhan gyi don gyi go rims dang // ye shes rtsol ba mi mnga' bar //
analyzed: bcas pa dang // slob ma thun mong min nyid dang // gzhan gyi don gyi go rims dang // ye shes rtsol ba mi mnga' bar //
translated: and the effortless engagement of wisdomüîΩare the basis of the support.

original: 'jug pa'i rten la rigs zhes bya //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //üîΩre zhig gzhi dang gnyen po dang / gang zag dang skyes bu la brten pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa mngon par mi dmigs pa nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag 'jig rten pa'i rtogs pa rnams dang / de'i 'og tu 'jig rten las 'das pa chos kyi dbyings kun tu 'gro ba'i don du rtogs pa dang /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rten la rigs zhes bya // zhes bya ba'o // re zhig gzhi dang gnyen po dang / gang zag dang skyes bu la brten pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa mngon par mi dmigs pa nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag 'jig rten pa'i rtogs pa rnams dang / de'i 'og tu 'jig rten las 'das pa chos kyi dbyings kun tu 'gro ba'i don du rtogs pa dang /
translated: The support is called the lineage.üîΩThe path of seeing is the realization of the six aspects of the truths, the four aspects of the truth of suffering and the two aspects of the truth of origin.üîΩThe path of meditation is the realization of the six aspects of the truths, the four aspects of the truth of cessation and the two aspects of the truth of the path.üîΩThe path of accumulation is the realization of the six aspects of the truths, the four aspects of the truth of suffering and the two aspects of the truth of origin.

original: de'i rgyun sa bdun gyi bar du rtogs pa bsgom pa'i lam dag ste rnam pa drug go //
analyzed: de'i rgyun sa bdun gyi bar du rtogs pa bsgom pa'i lam dag ste rnam pa drug go //
translated: The path of preparation is the realization of the six aspects of the truths, the four aspects of the truth of suffering and the two aspects of the truth of origin.üîΩThe path of seeing is the realization of the six aspects of the truths, the four aspects of the truth of suffering and the two aspects of the truth of origin.üîΩThe path of meditation is the realization of the six aspects of the truths, the four aspects of the truth of cessation and the two aspects of the truth of the path.üîΩThe path of no more learning is the realization of the six aspects of the truths, the four aspects of the truth of cessation and the two aspects of the truth of the path.

original: de'i 'og tu de dag skyes pa'i stobs kyis sa brgyad pa la thun mong ma yin pa'i gnyen po yongs su thob pa'o //üîΩde'i 'og tu sa dgu pa la de ni mthu phun sum tshogs par gyur pa la mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par spong ba'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de dag skyes pa'i stobs kyis sa brgyad pa la thun mong ma yin pa'i gnyen po yongs su thob pa'o // de'i 'og tu sa dgu pa la de ni mthu phun sum tshogs par gyur pa la mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par spong ba'o //
translated: Then, by the power of their arising, on the eighth stage, they obtain the uncommon antidote.üîΩThen, on the ninth stage, they have the full strength of that antidote, and they abandon the opposing side.

original: de'i 'og tu sa bcu pa la gnyen po dang mi mthun pa'i phyir mi dmigs pas de dag skye ba dang 'gag pa dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa yongs su zad pa mthar gtugs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sa bcu pa la gnyen po dang mi mthun pa'i phyir mi dmigs pas de dag skye ba dang 'gag pa dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa yongs su zad pa mthar gtugs pa'o //
translated: Then, on the tenth stage, they have the full strength of that antidote, and they abandon the opposing side.

original: de bzhin du sa de dag la go rims ltar sbyin pa la sogs pa dang sngon gyi smon lam la sogs pa'i stobs kyis 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyis shes rab dang snying rje dang / de dag phul du gyur pas nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa'i chos dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du sa de dag la go rims ltar sbyin pa la sogs pa dang sngon gyi smon lam la sogs pa'i stobs kyis 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyis shes rab dang snying rje dang / de dag phul du gyur pas nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa'i chos dang /
translated: Similarly, on those stages, in order, by the power of generosity and so on and by the power of former prayers and so on, they have wisdom and compassion, which are characterized by not abiding in cyclic existence and nirvana, and by the supremacy of those, they have the qualities uncommon to sravakas and so on.

original: rang gi rdzogs pa gzhan la phan gdags par mkhas pa nyid kyis bsam pa la sogs pa dang rjes su mthun par gzhug pa la ldem por dgongs pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas theg pa gsum gyi lam la 'god pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhan gyi don gyi go
analyzed: rang gi rdzogs pa gzhan la phan gdags par mkhas pa nyid kyis bsam pa la sogs pa dang rjes su mthun par gzhug pa la ldem por dgongs pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas theg pa gsum gyi lam la 'god pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhan gyi don gyi go
translated: The order of the benefit for others is the order in which one engages in the three vehicles, through the skill in benefiting others by perfecting oneself, by introducing them in accordance with their aspirations, etc., through indirect teachings, etc.

original: rims te / de lta bu yon tan khyad par can dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: rims te / de lta bu yon tan khyad par can dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva is endowed with these special qualities.

original: de'i 'og tu sa bcu pa khyad par la mtshan ma med cing lhun gyis grub pa nyid kyis 'khor ba ji srid par gzhan gyi don bya ba'i phyir ye shes phun sum tshogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sa bcu pa khyad par la mtshan ma med cing lhun gyis grub pa nyid kyis 'khor ba ji srid par gzhan gyi don bya ba'i phyir ye shes phun sum tshogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: After that, on the tenth stage, the perfection of knowledge arises for the sake of benefiting others for as long as cyclic existence endures, through the absence of signs and spontaneity.

original: de ltar na sgrub pa'i chos kyi gnas skabs kyi bye brag bcu gsum gyi de dag gi gzhir gyur pa chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid @17b gang yin pa de ni rigs zhes bya bar brjod do //
analyzed: de ltar na sgrub pa'i chos kyi gnas skabs kyi bye brag bcu gsum gyi de dag gi gzhir gyur pa chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid @17b gang yin pa de ni rigs zhes bya bar brjod do //
translated: Thus, the nature of the realm of reality, which is the basis of these thirteen categories of the Dharma of practice, is called the lineage gotra.

original: gal te rigs de nyid tha dad pa'am tha dad pa ma yin par brtag ce na /
analyzed: gal te rigs de nyid tha dad pa'am tha dad pa ma yin par brtag ce na /
translated: If that lineage is to be considered as different or not different,

original: bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa gsungs pa /
translated: an intermediate verse is stated:

original: chos kyi dbyings la dbyer med phyir //üîΩrigs ni tha dad rung ma yin //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la dbyer med phyir // rigs ni tha dad rung ma yin //
translated: Since there is no division in the dharma-dhƒÅtu,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the lineage is not suitable as different.

original: nam mkha' ltar yongs su dag cing khyab par gyur pa'i rigs gang yin pa de ni rang bzhin gyis dbye ba med pa'i phyir nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs tha dad pa nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' ltar yongs su dag cing khyab par gyur pa'i rigs gang yin pa de ni rang bzhin gyis dbye ba med pa'i phyir nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs tha dad pa nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: That lineage which is completely pure and pervades like space is not different as the lineage of ≈õrƒÅvakas, etc. because it is naturally undifferentiated.

original: 'o na ji lta 'grub pa'i rten rnam par dbye ba brjod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta 'grub pa'i rten rnam par dbye ba brjod ce na /
translated: Well then, how is the division of the basis of accomplishment stated?

original: rten pa'i chos tha dad pa la rten pa'i lan gsungs pa /
analyzed: rten pa'i chos tha dad pa la rten pa'i lan gsungs pa /
translated: The reply is stated in terms of the difference of the supported phenomena:üîΩThe division of the lineage is stated

original: rten pa'i chos kyi bye brag gis //üîΩde yi dbye ba yongs su brjod //üîΩces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rten pa'i chos kyi bye brag gis //üîΩde yi dbye ba yongs su brjod //üîΩces bya ba'o //
translated: through the particularity of the supported phenomena.

original: dper na 'jim pa gcig las mngon par grub cing me lce gcig gis so btang ba'i rten bum pa la sogs pa brten pa sbrang rtsi dang li kha ra la sogs pa'i snod nyid kyis tha dad pa de bzhin du chos theg pa gsum gyis bsdus pa dang
analyzed: dper na 'jim pa gcig las mngon par grub cing me lce gcig gis so btang ba'i rten bum pa la sogs pa brten pa sbrang rtsi dang li kha ra la sogs pa'i snod nyid kyis tha dad pa de bzhin du chos theg pa gsum gyis bsdus pa dang
translated: For example, just as a single lump of clay is the basis for the creation of a single fire and the single flame is the basis for the creation of a single pot, and so on, and the pot is the basis for the creation of the different substances such as honey and pomegranate juice that it contains, in the same way, the phenomena included in the three vehiclesüîΩ

original: / sgrub pa'i gnas skabs kyis bsdus pa rtogs par bya ba tha dad pa nyid kyis brten pa dang por gzhag go zhes bstan to //
analyzed: / sgrub pa'i gnas skabs kyis bsdus pa rtogs par bya ba tha dad pa nyid kyis brten pa dang por gzhag go zhes bstan to //
translated: For example, just as a single clay pot, which is produced from a single lump of clay and fired by a single flame, is a support for different things, such as honey, sugar, and so on, in the same way, the support is posited first by the difference in the things to be realized, which are included in the three vehicles and included in the stages of practice.

original: rten de las bsgrub par bya ba nyid kyi dmigs pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: rten de las bsgrub par bya ba nyid kyi dmigs pa gsungs pa /
translated: The object of observation that is to be accomplished from that support is stated:

original: dmigs pa chos rnams thams cad de //
analyzed: dmigs pa chos rnams thams cad de //
translated: The object of observation is all phenomena.

original: de yang dge la sogs pa yin //
analyzed: de yang dge la sogs pa yin //
translated: And that is virtuous and so forth.üîΩMundane realizations,üîΩthose asserted to be supramundane,üîΩdefiled and undefiled phenomena,

original: 'jig rten pa yi rtogs pa dang // gang dag 'jig rten 'das 'dod dang // zag bcas zag pa med chos dang // gang dag 'dus byas 'dus ma byas //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yi rtogs pa dang // gang dag 'jig rten 'das 'dod dang // zag bcas zag pa med chos dang // gang dag 'dus byas 'dus ma byas //
translated: compounded and uncompounded,üîΩThe phenomena common to disciples,

original: slob ma thun mong chos rnams dang // gang dag thub pa'i thun mong min //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: slob ma thun mong chos rnams dang // gang dag thub pa'i thun mong min //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
translated: and those uncommon to the Sage,üîΩare the objects of observation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'dir sgrub pa pos dmigs par bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad de /
analyzed: 'dir sgrub pa pos dmigs par bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad de /
translated: Here, the object of observation of the practitioner is all phenomena such as form and so on.

original: spyir dge sbyong gi tshul nyid la sogs pa blang bar bya ba'i mtshan nyid dge ba dang ; srog gcod pa la sogs pa spang bar bya ba'i mtshan nyid mi dge ba dang / gom pa 'dor ba la sogs pa gnyis ka ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid lung du ma bstan pa'i las so //
analyzed: spyir dge sbyong gi tshul nyid la sogs pa blang bar bya ba'i mtshan nyid dge ba dang ; srog gcod pa la sogs pa spang bar bya ba'i mtshan nyid mi dge ba dang / gom pa 'dor ba la sogs pa gnyis ka ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid lung du ma bstan pa'i las so //
translated: In general, the characteristics of virtue are the things to be taken up such as the nature of the way of virtuous endeavor, the characteristics of nonvirtue are the things to be abandoned such as taking life, and the characteristics of neutral actions are the things that are neither to be taken up nor to be abandoned such as taking a step.

original: de'i 'og tu de dag nyid rnam pa gnyis pa'i dbye ba bzhi nyid kyis brgyad de /üîΩbsam @18a * //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu de dag nyid rnam pa gnyis pa'i dbye ba bzhi nyid kyis brgyad de / bsam @18a * //
translated: After that, those are divided into two types, making four types, making eight.

original: gtan dang tshad med pa la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i rtogs par bya ba dang / yang dag pa'i bsam gtan la sogs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen po ma yin pa'i phung po lnga la sogs pa zag pa dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: gtan dang tshad med pa la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i rtogs par bya ba dang / yang dag pa'i bsam gtan la sogs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen po ma yin pa'i phung po lnga la sogs pa zag pa dang bcas pa dang /
translated: The mundane realizations such as the concentrations and the immeasurables and so on, the supramundane such as correct concentration and so on, the contaminated such as the five aggregates that are not the antidote to the view of self and so on, and the uncontaminated such as the five aggregates of the ƒÅrya that are the antidote to the view of self and so on.

original: bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa'i gnyen po dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa zag pa med pa dang / rgyu dang rkyen la rag las pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba 'dus byas dang / rag las pa de dag gi de bzhin nyid 'dus ma byas pa dang /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa'i gnyen po dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa zag pa med pa dang / rgyu dang rkyen la rag las pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba 'dus byas dang / rag las pa de dag gi de bzhin nyid 'dus ma byas pa dang /
translated: The uncontaminated foundations of mindfulness and so on are the antidotes to the view of self and so on, dependent origination pratityasamutpada is conditioned phenomena that depend on causes and conditions and the suchness tathata of those dependently arisen phenomena is unconditioned phenomena.

original: bsam gtan la sogs pa slob ma rnams dang thun mong pa dang / stobs bcu la sogs pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid kyis thun mong ma yin pa'i chos te /
analyzed: bsam gtan la sogs pa slob ma rnams dang thun mong pa dang / stobs bcu la sogs pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid kyis thun mong ma yin pa'i chos te /
translated: The concentrations and so on are common to both learners and nonlearners and the ten powers and so on are the unshared qualities of perfect buddhahood.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du dmigs par bya ba rnam pa bcu gcig go //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du dmigs par bya ba rnam pa bcu gcig go //
translated: These are the eleven types of object of observation that are to be observed as they are.

original: dmigs pa de dag la sgrub pa nyid 'bras bu ci'i phyir yin zhe na ;
analyzed: dmigs pa de dag la sgrub pa nyid 'bras bu ci'i phyir yin zhe na ;
translated: Why is the practice of those objects of observation the result?

original: ched du bya ba gang yin pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: ched du bya ba gang yin pa gsungs pa /
translated: The purpose is stated:üîΩThe mind of the supreme vehicle for all sentient beings,

original: sems can kun mchog nyid sems dang // spangs dang rtogs dang gsum po la //
analyzed: sems can kun mchog nyid sems dang // spangs dang rtogs dang gsum po la //
translated: abandonment, realization, and the threeüîΩgreatnesses are the three greatnesses

original: chen po gsum gyis rang 'byung gi //
analyzed: chen po gsum gyis rang 'byung gi //
translated: of the self arisen one.

original: ched du bya ba 'di shes bya //
analyzed: ched du bya ba 'di shes bya //
translated: This is to be understood as the purpose.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus it is.üîΩThe great thought is the thought to achieve the supreme state of buddhahood, the great mass and collection of sentient beings, by means of the knowledge of the omniscience of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su shes pa'i sgo nas sems can gyi phung po chen po dang sde chen po nyid kyi mchog sangs rgyas nyid du bsgrub par sems pa chen po dang / lta ba'i rnam pa thams cad du spangs te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su shes pa'i sgo nas sems can gyi phung po chen po dang sde chen po nyid kyi mchog sangs rgyas nyid du bsgrub par sems pa chen po dang / lta ba'i rnam pa thams cad du spangs te /
translated: The great abandonment is the abandonment of all aspects of views.

original: mtshan ma med pa spong ba chen po nyid dang / chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin yang dag par mkhyen pa rtogs pa chen po nyid de /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa spong ba chen po nyid dang / chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin yang dag par mkhyen pa rtogs pa chen po nyid de /
translated: The great realization is the realization of the perfect knowledge of all phenomena just as they are.

original: rang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ched du bya ba ni chen po nyid rnam pa gsum gyi don du 'jug par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ched du bya ba ni chen po nyid rnam pa gsum gyi don du 'jug par shes par bya'o //
translated: The purpose of the bodhisattvas who will become self-arisen should be understood as engaging for the sake of the three greatnesses.

original: da ni ji ltar sgrub pa rang gi ngo bo bshad par bzhed de /
analyzed: da ni ji ltar sgrub pa rang gi ngo bo bshad par bzhed de /
translated: Now, wishing to explain the essence of practice, it says:

original: spyir dge ba'i chos kyi rten can dang / mngon par rtogs pa bzhi po re re zhing pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi rten can gyi bya ba ni sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: spyir dge ba'i chos kyi rten can dang / mngon par rtogs pa bzhi po re re zhing pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi rten can gyi bya ba ni sgrub pa yin te /
translated: In general, the practice of the six perfections is the practice of the support of virtuous dharmas and of each of the four realizations.

original: de yang las dang po pa /
analyzed: de yang las dang po pa /
translated: Moreover, the practice of the beginner,üîΩthe practice of the nature of the paths of preparation, seeing, and meditation, is the fourfold practice of armor, engagement, accumulation, and definite emergence.

original: sbyor ba dang / mthong ba dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyi ngo bo nyid kyis sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid go cha dang / 'jug @18b pa dang / tshogs dang / nges par 'byung ba bzhi las re zhig bsam pa'i brtson 'grus nyid bdag nyid go cha'i sgrub pa gsungs pa /üîΩde dag so sor sbyin la sogs //
analyzed: sbyor ba dang / mthong ba dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyi ngo bo nyid kyis sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid go cha dang / 'jug @18b pa dang / tshogs dang / nges par 'byung ba bzhi las re zhig bsam pa'i brtson 'grus nyid bdag nyid go cha'i sgrub pa gsungs pa / de dag so sor sbyin la sogs //
translated: From among those, the practice of armor is the effort of intention.üîΩThe practice of armor is said to be

original: rnam pa drug tu bsdus pa yis //
analyzed: rnam pa drug tu bsdus pa yis //
translated: the six aspects of each of the six perfections.

original: go cha'i sgrub pa gang yin te //
analyzed: go cha'i sgrub pa gang yin te //
translated: The practice of armor is said to be

original: drug tshan drug gis gang yin bshad //üîΩces bya ba'o //
analyzed: drug tshan drug gis gang yin bshad //üîΩces bya ba'o //
translated: the six aspects of each of the six perfections.

original: chos kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa sbyin pa na 'bras bu sems can la yongs su gtong ba nyid kyis sbyin pa'i sbyin pa dang / theg pa dman pa yid la byed pa spong ba nyid kyis tshul khrims dang / chos zab mo la mi skrag pa la sogs pa nyid kyis bzod pa dang /
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa sbyin pa na 'bras bu sems can la yongs su gtong ba nyid kyis sbyin pa'i sbyin pa dang / theg pa dman pa yid la byed pa spong ba nyid kyis tshul khrims dang / chos zab mo la mi skrag pa la sogs pa nyid kyis bzod pa dang /
translated: When practicing generosity such as the generosity of Dharma, it is the perfection of generosity since one completely gives the result to sentient beings, it is the perfection of ethical discipline since one abandons attention to the lower vehicle, it is the perfection of patience since one is not frightened by the profound Dharma and so on,

original: mngon par yid ches pas spro ba nyid kyis brtson 'grus dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du bsngo bas rtse gcig tu gnas pa bsam gtan dang / sbyin par bya ba la sogs pa 'khor gsum du mi dmigs pa'i bdag nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon par yid ches pas spro ba nyid kyis brtson 'grus dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du bsngo bas rtse gcig tu gnas pa bsam gtan dang / sbyin par bya ba la sogs pa 'khor gsum du mi dmigs pa'i bdag nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
translated: it is the perfection of effort since one is enthusiastic through full confidence, it is the perfection of concentration since one abides one pointedly through dedicating to omniscience and it is the perfection of wisdom since one has the nature of not objectifying the three spheres of that which is given and so on.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims srung ba dang / bzod pa sgom pa dang / brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jog pa dang / shes rab sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims srung ba dang / bzod pa sgom pa dang / brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jog pa dang / shes rab sgrub par byed do //
translated: Similarly, one protects ethical discipline, cultivates patience, initiates effort, becomes equipoised in concentration and accomplishes wisdom.

original: de lta bas na pha rol tu phyin pa re re zhing so sor rnam pa drug drug tu rab tu dbye bas sum cu rtsa drug rnams drug tshan drug gis rigs mthun pa sbyin pa la sogs pa drug tu bsdus pa nyid kyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyiüîΩmtshon cha rnams kyis mi tshugs par bya ba'i phyir go cha'i sgrub pa rnam pa drug yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na pha rol tu phyin pa re re zhing so sor rnam pa drug drug tu rab tu dbye bas sum cu rtsa drug rnams drug tshan drug gis rigs mthun pa sbyin pa la sogs pa drug tu bsdus pa nyid kyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi mtshon cha rnams kyis mi tshugs par bya ba'i phyir go cha'i sgrub pa rnam pa drug yin no //
translated: The six groups of six are included in the six perfections, such as generosity, and so they are summarized as the six types of armor practice, in order to be invulnerable to the weapons of the counteragents.

original: de ltar go bgos nas 'jug par bya dgos pas de'i rjes la sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus kyi rang bzhin 'jug pa'i sgrub pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar go bgos nas 'jug par bya dgos pas de'i rjes la sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus kyi rang bzhin 'jug pa'i sgrub pa gsungs pa /
translated: Having thus donned the armor, one must engage in the practice. Therefore, after that, the practice of engagement is taught, which has the nature of the diligence of application.üîΩThe practice of engagement is taught in the following verse:üîΩConcentration, formlessness, generosity, and so on,üîΩthe path, love, and so on,üîΩthe absence of reference points,üîΩthe purity of the three spheres,

original: bsam gtan gzugs med sbyin sogs dang // lam dang byams la sogs pa dang // dmigs pa med dang ldan pa dang / 'khor gsum rnam par dag pa dang // ched du bya dang mngon shes drug / rnam kun mkhyen pa'i tshul la ni //
analyzed: bsam gtan gzugs med sbyin sogs dang // lam dang byams la sogs pa dang // dmigs pa med dang ldan pa dang / 'khor gsum rnam par dag pa dang // ched du bya dang mngon shes drug / rnam kun mkhyen pa'i tshul la ni //
translated: the object, the six kinds of superknowledge,üîΩand the way of omniscience

original: 'jug pa'i sgrub pa theg chen la /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i sgrub pa theg chen la /
translated: are the practice of engagement in the Great Vehicle.

original: 'dzeg pa yin par shes par bya //
analyzed: 'dzeg pa yin par shes par bya //
translated: One should understand that it is the climbing.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus it is.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba las bzlog ste bstan par byed pa @19a * //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba las bzlog ste bstan par byed pa @19a * //
translated: It is taught as the antidote to distraction.

original: bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / las su rung ba nyid kyis sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa dang / legs par bsags pas thob pa mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dang / khyad par gyi lam dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / las su rung ba nyid kyis sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa dang / legs par bsags pas thob pa mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dang / khyad par gyi lam dang /
translated: It is the practice of the six perfections such as generosity through serviceability, and the path of seeing, meditation and the distinctive path obtained through the accumulation of merit.

original: der ma chud pa la byams pa dang / snying rje dang dga' ba dang btang snyoms tshad med pa dang / nges spang bar bya ba mngon par chags pa 'gog pa mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa dang / ji ltar mi dmigs pa nyid rdzogs par byed pa 'khor gsum rnam par dag pa dang /
analyzed: der ma chud pa la byams pa dang / snying rje dang dga' ba dang btang snyoms tshad med pa dang / nges spang bar bya ba mngon par chags pa 'gog pa mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa dang / ji ltar mi dmigs pa nyid rdzogs par byed pa 'khor gsum rnam par dag pa dang /
translated: It is the immeasurables of love, compassion, joy and equanimity for those not included in that, the emptiness endowed with the supreme of all aspects that is the object of abandonment, and the complete purification of the three spheres that is the accomplishment of the very object of nonobservation.

original: tshul de nyid kyis rang gi ched du bya ba gsum sgrub pa dang / gzhan dang thun mong ma yin pa'i dbang gis mngon par shes pa drug skyed pa dang / de dag dang ldan pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la drag tu spros pas 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: tshul de nyid kyis rang gi ched du bya ba gsum sgrub pa dang / gzhan dang thun mong ma yin pa'i dbang gis mngon par shes pa drug skyed pa dang / de dag dang ldan pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la drag tu spros pas 'jug pa ste /
translated: By that very method, the three things to be done for oneself are accomplished, the six superknowledges are generated by the power of being uncommon to others, and by possessing those, one enters into the knowledge of all aspects through intense exertion.

original: yul de dag la sbyor ba nye bar gnas pa'i mtshan nyid ni spang bar bya ba nye bar bzlog pa'i phyir theg pa chen po'i chos mtha' dag gnon cing 'dzeg pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas 'jug pa'i bsgrub pa rnam pa dgu'o //
analyzed: yul de dag la sbyor ba nye bar gnas pa'i mtshan nyid ni spang bar bya ba nye bar bzlog pa'i phyir theg pa chen po'i chos mtha' dag gnon cing 'dzeg pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas 'jug pa'i bsgrub pa rnam pa dgu'o //
