translated: The characteristic of the application to those objects is the nine kinds of accomplishment of engagement, because the essence of the Great Vehicle is to overcome and ascend all the teachings of the Great Vehicle in order to avert what is to be abandoned.

original: de ltar 'jug pas zhugs par gyur pa na tshogs yang dag par 'grub pa ma zhum zhing yang dag par sgrub pa'i brtson 'grus kyi sgrub pa gsungs pa //
analyzed: de ltar 'jug pas zhugs par gyur pa na tshogs yang dag par 'grub pa ma zhum zhing yang dag par sgrub pa'i brtson 'grus kyi sgrub pa gsungs pa //
translated: Thus, when one has entered through engagement, the accomplishment of correct practice of the accumulation is taught, which is the correct practice of the accumulation without discouragement.

original: brtse dang sbyin la sogs pa drug / zhi gnas lhag mthong bcas pa dang / zung du 'brel ba'i lam gang dang / thabs la mkhas pa gang yin dang // ye shes dang ni bsod nams dang // lam dang gzungs dang sa bcu dang // gnyen po'i tshogs kyi sgrub pa yi //üîΩrim pa yin par shes par bya //
analyzed: brtse dang sbyin la sogs pa drug / zhi gnas lhag mthong bcas pa dang / zung du 'brel ba'i lam gang dang / thabs la mkhas pa gang yin dang // ye shes dang ni bsod nams dang // lam dang gzungs dang sa bcu dang // gnyen po'i tshogs kyi sgrub pa yi // rim pa yin par shes par bya //
translated: wisdom and merit,üîΩthe path, the powers, the ten grounds,üîΩand the accumulations of antidotes

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: are to be known as the stages of practice.üîΩThe practice of the bodhisattva is to be known as having six stages.üîΩThe first is the stage of great compassion, which is to benefit those sentient beings who are suffering.üîΩThe second is the stage of the six perfections, which is to practice the six perfections such as generosity, taking as one's basis a cakravartin and so on.

original: sems can sdug bsngal pa rnams la phan par byed pa snying rje chen po dang / 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs pa'i rten gyi sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgrub pa dang / gzhan gyi don la sems rtse gcig tu gnas pa zhi gnas dang /
analyzed: sems can sdug bsngal pa rnams la phan par byed pa snying rje chen po dang / 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs pa'i rten gyi sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgrub pa dang / gzhan gyi don la sems rtse gcig tu gnas pa zhi gnas dang /
translated: The third is the stage of calm abiding, which is to one-pointedly abide in the mind for the sake of others.

original: gang gi don du sems rtse gcig par gnas pa nyid mi dmigs pa lhag mthong dang / thabs dang shes rab kyis mthar mi gnas pa zung du 'brel ba'i lam dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams /
analyzed: gang gi don du sems rtse gcig par gnas pa nyid mi dmigs pa lhag mthong dang / thabs dang shes rab kyis mthar mi gnas pa zung du 'brel ba'i lam dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams /
translated: The one-pointed abiding of the mind for the sake of that is insight that does not observe anything.üîΩThe path that is the union of method and wisdom that does not abide in extremes is the skillful means of dedicating all roots of virtue to unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: @19b cad bla na med pa'i byang chub tu bsngo bas thabs la mkhas pa dang / stong pa nyid thams cad kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa ye shes dang / ting nge 'dzin du mas rnam par brtse ba'i bsod nams dang / bgrod par bya ba la mngon par zhugs pa mthong ba la sogs pa'i lam dang /
analyzed: @19b cad bla na med pa'i byang chub tu bsngo bas thabs la mkhas pa dang / stong pa nyid thams cad kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa ye shes dang / ting nge 'dzin du mas rnam par brtse ba'i bsod nams dang / bgrod par bya ba la mngon par zhugs pa mthong ba la sogs pa'i lam dang /
translated: The wisdom of being skilled in the characteristics of all emptinesses, the merit of being adorned with many samƒÅdhis, and the paths of seeing and so on that are engaged for the sake of proceeding are the branches of enlightenment.

original: legs pa'i lam las mi nyams par 'dzin pa bzod pa la sogs pa'i gzungs dang / dpag tu med pa'i yon tan gyi rten du gyur ba sa bcu dang / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i spang bya rab tu 'jil ba gnyen po'i tshogs rnams te /
analyzed: legs pa'i lam las mi nyams par 'dzin pa bzod pa la sogs pa'i gzungs dang / dpag tu med pa'i yon tan gyi rten du gyur ba sa bcu dang / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i spang bya rab tu 'jil ba gnyen po'i tshogs rnams te /
translated: The dhƒÅra·πáƒ´s of patience and so on that hold the excellent path without decline and the ten bh≈´mis that are the support for immeasurable qualities and the accumulations of antidotes that completely pacify the objects to be abandoned of apprehendeds and apprehenders are the bh≈´mis.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpung rnam par gzhom pa'i phyir rang gi sde rab tu sgrub pa mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis theg pa chen po'i don mtha' dag sgrub pa nyid kyis tshogs kyi sgrub pa rnam pa bcu bdun no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpung rnam par gzhom pa'i phyir rang gi sde rab tu sgrub pa mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis theg pa chen po'i don mtha' dag sgrub pa nyid kyis tshogs kyi sgrub pa rnam pa bcu bdun no //
translated: The accumulation of the assembly is seventeenfold, by means of the accomplishment of the whole meaning of the Great Vehicle through the nonapprehension of the characteristics of the accomplishment of one's own group in order to conquer the army of adverse factors.

original: de la ye shes kyi tshogs ni stong pa nyi shu'i bye brag gis nyi shu ste /
analyzed: de la ye shes kyi tshogs ni stong pa nyi shu'i bye brag gis nyi shu ste /
translated: The accumulation of wisdom is twentyfold, by means of the twenty varieties of emptiness.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir nang gi chos kyis dben pas nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi rol gyis dben pas gnyis kas stong pa nyid dang / stong pa'i dngos pos dben pas stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang / phyogs kyis dben pas chen po stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir nang gi chos kyis dben pas nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi rol gyis dben pas gnyis kas stong pa nyid dang / stong pa'i dngos pos dben pas stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang / phyogs kyis dben pas chen po stong pa nyid dang /
translated: The emptiness of internal phenomena is due to the absence of intrinsic reality of internal phenomena. The emptiness of both is due to the absence of external phenomena. The emptiness of emptiness is due to the absence of the entity of emptiness. The emptiness of the great is due to the absence of directions.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam gyis dben pas don dam pa stong pa nyid dang / rkyen las skyes pas dben pas 'dus byas stong pa nyid dang / cig shos kyis dben pas 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i cha gnyis kyis dben pas mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam gyis dben pas don dam pa stong pa nyid dang / rkyen las skyes pas dben pas 'dus byas stong pa nyid dang / cig shos kyis dben pas 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i cha gnyis kyis dben pas mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang /
translated: Since it is devoid of the path of nirvana, it is the emptiness of the ultimate. Since it is devoid of being produced from conditions, it is the emptiness of the conditioned. Since it is devoid of the other, it is the emptiness of the unconditioned. Since it is devoid of the two aspects of samsara and nirvana, it is the emptiness of beyond extremes.

original: 'khor ba'i sngon dang phyi mas dben pas thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dang / rtogs par bya ba nyid rnam par spangs ba med pas dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dang / rang gi rang bzhin gyis dben pas rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i sngon dang phyi mas dben pas thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dang / rtogs par bya ba nyid rnam par spangs ba med pas dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dang / rang gi rang bzhin gyis dben pas rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang /
translated: Since it is devoid of a beginning and end of samsara, it is the emptiness of no beginning or end. Since it is devoid of the object of realization being abandoned, it is the emptiness of no abandonment. Since it is devoid of its own nature, it is the emptiness of nature.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad kyis dben pas chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang / skye ba la sogs pa so so'i mtshan nyid kyis bden pas rang gi mtshan nyid dben pas rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / 'das pa la sogs pas dben pas mi dmigs @20a * //üîΩpa stong pa nyid dang / ldan pa nyid kyis dben pas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / ldan pa ma yin pas dben pas dngos po stong pa nyid dang / nam mkha' dben pa nyid kyis dngos po med pa stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad kyis dben pas chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang / skye ba la sogs pa so so'i mtshan nyid kyis bden pas rang gi mtshan nyid dben pas rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / 'das pa la sogs pas dben pas mi dmigs @20a * // pa stong pa nyid dang / ldan pa nyid kyis dben pas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / ldan pa ma yin pas dben pas dngos po stong pa nyid dang / nam mkha' dben pa nyid kyis dngos po med pa stong pa nyid dang /
translated: The emptiness of all phenomena is due to the emptiness of form and so on in every respect. The emptiness of intrinsic identity is due to the emptiness of the true existence of the individual characteristics of production and so on.üîΩThe emptiness of nonobservation is due to the emptiness of the past and so on. The emptiness of the essential nature of nonthings is due to the emptiness of the nonendowment of things. The emptiness of things is due to the emptiness of the nonendowment of things. The emptiness of the essential nature of nonthings is due to the emptiness of space.

original: thams cad rang gi chos nyid kyis dben pas rang gi ngo bo stong pa nyid dang / chos gzhan gyi ngo bos dben pas gzhan gyi ngo bo stong pa yid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad rang gi chos nyid kyis dben pas rang gi ngo bo stong pa nyid dang / chos gzhan gyi ngo bos dben pas gzhan gyi ngo bo stong pa yid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The emptiness of intrinsic essence is due to the emptiness of all phenomena by their intrinsic reality. The emptiness of the extrinsic essence is due to the emptiness of the essence of other phenomena.

original: sa'i tshogs la chos gang dag yongs su sbyangs pas mngon par thob cing rab tu rdzogs par byed pa nyid kyis yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de dag bstan pa'i phyir bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa nyi shu rtsa gsum gsungs pa las re
analyzed: sa'i tshogs la chos gang dag yongs su sbyangs pas mngon par thob cing rab tu rdzogs par byed pa nyid kyis yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de dag bstan pa'i phyir bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa nyi shu rtsa gsum gsungs pa las re
translated: In order to teach the qualities that are purified by the accumulations of the levels, which are attained and fully completed by purification, twenty-three verses are spoken.üîΩ

original: zhig sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gtsor gyur pa nyid kyis sa dang po yongs su sbyong ba gsungs pa /üîΩyongs su sbyong ba rnam bcu yis //
analyzed: zhig sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gtsor gyur pa nyid kyis sa dang po yongs su sbyong ba gsungs pa / yongs su sbyong ba rnam bcu yis //
translated: In order to teach the qualities that are purified by the perfection of generosity, the text says:

original: sa ni dang po thob 'gyur te ;
analyzed: sa ni dang po thob 'gyur te ;
translated: The first ground is attained through ten purifications:üîΩThe nature of aspiration and benefit,

original: / bsam dang phan pa'i dngos nyid dang // sems can rnams la sems mnyam nyid //
analyzed: / bsam dang phan pa'i dngos nyid dang // sems can rnams la sems mnyam nyid //
translated: the equality of mind toward sentient beings,üîΩgiving, spiritual teachers, emptiness,üîΩseeking the object of the true Dharma,

original: gtong dang bshes gnyen stong pa dang // dam chos dmigs pa tshol ba dang // rtag tu nges 'byung sems nyid dang // sangs rgyas skur 'dod dga' ba dang // chos ston pa dang bden pa yi //
analyzed: gtong dang bshes gnyen stong pa dang // dam chos dmigs pa tshol ba dang // rtag tu nges 'byung sems nyid dang // sangs rgyas skur 'dod dga' ba dang // chos ston pa dang bden pa yi //
translated: always the mind of renunciation,üîΩdelight in the desire for the Buddha‚Äôs body,üîΩteaching the Dharma, and the truth

original: tshig ni bcu pa yin par 'dod //
analyzed: tshig ni bcu pa yin par 'dod //
translated: are asserted to be the ten words.

original: 'di dag rang bzhin mi dmigs pas //
analyzed: 'di dag rang bzhin mi dmigs pas //
translated: Since these are not perceived as intrinsically real,

original: yongs su sbyong bar shes par bya //
analyzed: yongs su sbyong bar shes par bya //
translated: they should be understood as thoroughly purified.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The four immeasurables are as follows:

original: gzhi thams cad la gya gyu med cing thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i bsam pa nyid dang / rang dang gzhan gyi dgos pa la nye bar mkho zhing theg pa chen po'i ye shes don du gnyer ba'i phan pa nyid dang / sems can thams cad la sems rtse gcig par byams shing rdzogs pa'i byang chub sbyin par 'dod pas tshad med pa'i sems kyis mnyam pa nyid dang /
analyzed: gzhi thams cad la gya gyu med cing thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i bsam pa nyid dang / rang dang gzhan gyi dgos pa la nye bar mkho zhing theg pa chen po'i ye shes don du gnyer ba'i phan pa nyid dang / sems can thams cad la sems rtse gcig par byams shing rdzogs pa'i byang chub sbyin par 'dod pas tshad med pa'i sems kyis mnyam pa nyid dang /
translated: (1) The attitude of being free of deceit toward all bases and being endowed with omniscience; (2) the benefit of being useful for the purpose of oneself and others and striving for the wisdom of the Great Vehicle; (3) the sameness of mind through loving and wishing to give perfect enlightenment to all sentient beings with a one-pointed mind; and (4) the attitude of being free of obscurations through being free of the obscurations of affliction and the obscurations of knowables.

original: bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong zhing 'khor gsum du mi rtog pa nyid dang ldan pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la bskul zhing 'jog pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten cing tshul thams cad kyis mgu bar byed pa dang / theg pa gsum du gtogs pa'i @20b dam pa'i chos kyi dmigs pa tshol zhing theg pa dman par ltung bar mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong zhing 'khor gsum du mi rtog pa nyid dang ldan pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la bskul zhing 'jog pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten cing tshul thams cad kyis mgu bar byed pa dang / theg pa gsum du gtogs pa'i @20b dam pa'i chos kyi dmigs pa tshol zhing theg pa dman par ltung bar mi byed pa dang /
translated: They give away all their possessions and are free of the concepts of the three spheres. They rely on spiritual masters who encourage them to attain omniscience and who please them in every way. They seek the topics of the sacred Dharma that is included in the three vehicles and do not fall into the Lesser Vehicle.

original: khyim gnas pa na mngon par mi dga' zhing tshe rabs thams cad du rab tu 'byung ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi sku sgrub par 'dod cing sangs rgyas mthong ba yid la byed pa dang mi 'bral ba dang / thog ma dang bar dang tha mar dge ba dam pa'i chos ston cing nga rgyal med pa dang /
analyzed: khyim gnas pa na mngon par mi dga' zhing tshe rabs thams cad du rab tu 'byung ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi sku sgrub par 'dod cing sangs rgyas mthong ba yid la byed pa dang mi 'bral ba dang / thog ma dang bar dang tha mar dge ba dam pa'i chos ston cing nga rgyal med pa dang /
translated: They do not enjoy living in a household and in all their lives they go forth. They wish to attain the body of a buddha and are never separated from keeping in mind the thought of seeing the Buddha. They teach the sacred Dharma that is virtuous in the beginning, middle, and end and are free of pride.

original: ji skad smras pa de bzhin du gzhan mi bslu ba bden pa'i tshig dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: ji skad smras pa de bzhin du gzhan mi bslu ba bden pa'i tshig dang ldan pa ste /
translated: They are truthful and do not deceive others by saying one thing and doing another.

original: de lta bu'i chos bcu ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pa'i khyad par du byas pa'i mtshan nyid kyis yongs su sbyong ba kho nas sa dang po rab tu dga' ba thob cing rdzogs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i chos bcu ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pa'i khyad par du byas pa'i mtshan nyid kyis yongs su sbyong ba kho nas sa dang po rab tu dga' ba thob cing rdzogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: One attains and perfects the first ground, the Joyous, by means of the purification of just those ten dharmas, which are qualified by the non-observation of any essence.

original: de'i 'og tu tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gtsor gyur pa nyid kyis sa gnyis pa yongs su sbyong ba gsungs pa //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gtsor gyur pa nyid kyis sa gnyis pa yongs su sbyong ba gsungs pa //
translated: After that, the purification of the second ground is taught, with the perfection of morality being primary.

original: tshul khrims byas pa gzo dang bzod //
analyzed: tshul khrims byas pa gzo dang bzod //
translated: Morality, gratitude, patience,

original: rab tu dga' dang snying brtse che //
analyzed: rab tu dga' dang snying brtse che //
translated: great joy, great compassion,

original: bkur sti bla ma la gus nyan //
analyzed: bkur sti bla ma la gus nyan //
translated: respect for the guru and listening,

original: brgyad pa sbyin la sogs la brtson //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: brgyad pa sbyin la sogs la brtson //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
translated: and striving at generosity and so on.

original: nyes pa spyod pa las yang dag par ldog cing bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi gegs su gyur pa'i chos rnams spong ba'i tshul khrims dang / gzhan gyis phan btags pa'i drin chung ngu yang gzo zhing 'khor ba ji srid par don chen pos lan ldon pa dang gnod pa byed pa thams cad bzod cing chos thams cad ma skyes pa yid la byed pa dang ma bral ba dang /
analyzed: nyes pa spyod pa las yang dag par ldog cing bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi gegs su gyur pa'i chos rnams spong ba'i tshul khrims dang / gzhan gyis phan btags pa'i drin chung ngu yang gzo zhing 'khor ba ji srid par don chen pos lan ldon pa dang gnod pa byed pa thams cad bzod cing chos thams cad ma skyes pa yid la byed pa dang ma bral ba dang /
translated: Discipline is to refrain from negative actions and to avoid factors that hinder the attainment of unsurpassable enlightenment.üîΩPatience is to bear with all who harm you and to be never separate from the attitude that all phenomena are unborn.üîΩDiligence is to have no regrets about practicing virtue and to be delighted to establish all beings in the three vehicles.

original: dge ba'i chos bsgrub pa la 'gyod pa med cing sems can thams cad theg pa gsum la 'god par spro bas rab tu dga' ba dang / skye bo thams cad la byams shing re re'i phyir yang dmyal bar gnas pas mi skyo ba snying brtse ba chen po dang /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos bsgrub pa la 'gyod pa med cing sems can thams cad theg pa gsum la 'god par spro bas rab tu dga' ba dang / skye bo thams cad la byams shing re re'i phyir yang dmyal bar gnas pas mi skyo ba snying brtse ba chen po dang /
translated: Loving kindness is to love all beings and to be so compassionate that you would not be discouraged even if you had to remain in the hells for each and every one of them.

original: lus can ma lus pa la dga' ba byed cing dam pa rnams la bskur sti dang rim gro byed pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la ston pa'i 'du shes 'jog cing des bstan pa mngon par bsgrub pa dang / gzhan gyi don la brtson pas las gzhan mi byed cing sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgrub pa la rab tu spro ba ste /
analyzed: lus can ma lus pa la dga' ba byed cing dam pa rnams la bskur sti dang rim gro byed pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la ston pa'i 'du shes 'jog cing des bstan pa mngon par bsgrub pa dang / gzhan gyi don la brtson pas las gzhan mi byed cing sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug sgrub pa la rab tu spro ba ste /
translated: They delight all embodied beings, they honor and respect the holy, they regard the spiritual masters as teachers and they accomplish what they teach, they do not perform other actions but strive for the benefit of others and they are enthusiastic in accomplishing the six perfections such as generosity.

original: de lta bu'i chos brgyad @21a * //
analyzed: de lta bu'i chos brgyad @21a * //
translated: These eight qualities

original: snga ma lta bu yongs su sbyang ba byas pa'i khyad par gyis sa gnyis pa dri ma med pa 'thob cing rdzogs par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: snga ma lta bu yongs su sbyang ba byas pa'i khyad par gyis sa gnyis pa dri ma med pa 'thob cing rdzogs par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: are attained and perfected by the specific thorough preparation as described above, on the second ground, the Stainless.

original: de'i 'og tu bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gtsor gyur pa nyid kyis sa gsum pa'i yongs su sbyong ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gtsor gyur pa nyid kyis sa gsum pa'i yongs su sbyong ba gsungs pa /
translated: After that, the thorough preparation for the third ground is taught, with the perfection of patience being foremost.

original: thos pas mi ngoms nyid dang ni //
analyzed: thos pas mi ngoms nyid dang ni //
translated: They are insatiable in listening.

original: zang zing med par chos sbyin dang // sangs rgyas zhing kun sbyong ba dang // 'khor bas yongs su mi skyo dang // ngo tsha khrel yod ces bya ba //
analyzed: zang zing med par chos sbyin dang // sangs rgyas zhing kun sbyong ba dang // 'khor bas yongs su mi skyo dang // ngo tsha khrel yod ces bya ba //
translated: and having a sense of shame and decency.üîΩThe five are: not being conceited,

original: rlom med bdag nyid de rnam lnga //
analyzed: rlom med bdag nyid de rnam lnga //
translated: not being greedy,üîΩnot being discouraged,üîΩnot being deceitful,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and not being contemptuous.üîΩThe five are: not being satisfied with listening to the holy Dharma,üîΩnot being satisfied with seeing the buddhas,üîΩnot being satisfied with serving the buddhas,

original: dam pa'i chos mnyan pa rnams kyis chog mi shes shing sangs rgyas rnams kyis te /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos mnyan pa rnams kyis chog mi shes shing sangs rgyas rnams kyis te /
translated: not being satisfied with hearing the Dharma,üîΩand not being satisfied with practicing the Dharma.üîΩThe five are: not being satisfied with listening to the holy Dharma,üîΩnot being satisfied with seeing the buddhas,üîΩnot being satisfied with serving the buddhas,üîΩnot being satisfied with hearing the Dharma,

original: phyogs bcu dag tu gang gsungs pa thams cad gzung bar sems pa dang / rnyed pa la sogs pa la mi lta bas dam pa'i chos rab tu ston cing byang chub kyi 'bras bu nyid la yang re ba mi byed pa dang / rjes su mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba sgrub cing sangs rgyas kyi zhing snod dang bcud kun tu sbyong ba dang /
analyzed: phyogs bcu dag tu gang gsungs pa thams cad gzung bar sems pa dang / rnyed pa la sogs pa la mi lta bas dam pa'i chos rab tu ston cing byang chub kyi 'bras bu nyid la yang re ba mi byed pa dang / rjes su mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba sgrub cing sangs rgyas kyi zhing snod dang bcud kun tu sbyong ba dang /
translated: and not being satisfied with practicing the Dharma.

original: phan btags pa la gnod pa'i lan byed pa la sogs pas yid yongs su mi skyo zhing sdug bsngal thams cad bzod pa dang / rang dang gzhan la ltos nas mi dge ba'i chos mi byed cing nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sems spong ba ste /
analyzed: phan btags pa la gnod pa'i lan byed pa la sogs pas yid yongs su mi skyo zhing sdug bsngal thams cad bzod pa dang / rang dang gzhan la ltos nas mi dge ba'i chos mi byed cing nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sems spong ba ste /
translated: They are not discouraged by ingratitude, such as when they help someone and they harm them in return, and they are patient with all sufferings. They do not engage in nonvirtuous dharmas in relation to themselves or others and they abandon the attitude of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de lta bu'i chos lngas rlom par mi byed cing snga ma ltar yongs su sbyang pas sa gsum pa 'od byed pa rtogs shing rdzogs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i chos lngas rlom par mi byed cing snga ma ltar yongs su sbyang pas sa gsum pa 'od byed pa rtogs shing rdzogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: Through these five dharmas, they are not conceited and, as before, through thorough training, they realize and perfect the third ground, The Luminous.

original: de'i 'og tu brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gtsor gyur pa nyid kyis sa bzhi pa'i yongs su sbyong ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gtsor gyur pa nyid kyis sa bzhi pa'i yongs su sbyong ba gsungs pa /
translated: After that, through the perfection of effort being primary, the thorough training of the fourth ground is taught.üîΩDwelling in the forest, having few desires, being content,üîΩbeing pure, relying on discipline,üîΩnot forsaking the trainings,üîΩcondemning the desires,

original: nags gnas 'dod chung chog shes dang / sbyangs pa yang dag sdom brten dang // bslab pa yongs su mi gtong dang // 'dod pa rnams la smod pa dang // mya ngan 'das dang bdog kun gtong //
analyzed: nags gnas 'dod chung chog shes dang / sbyangs pa yang dag sdom brten dang // bslab pa yongs su mi gtong dang // 'dod pa rnams la smod pa dang // mya ngan 'das dang bdog kun gtong //
translated: nirvƒÅ·πáa, and giving away all possessions,

original: mi zhum pa dang lta ba med //
analyzed: mi zhum pa dang lta ba med //
translated: not being discouraged, and not having views.

original: ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o //
translated: Thus it is.

original: dgon par gnas shing theg pa dman pa'i kun tu spyod pas dben par gnas pa dang / rnyed pa ma rnyed pa la mngon par 'dod pa med cing rang gi don du byang chub kyang mi tshol ba dang / rnyed pa thob pas chog mi shes pa med cing thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob @21b cing des rlom sems su mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: dgon par gnas shing theg pa dman pa'i kun tu spyod pas dben par gnas pa dang / rnyed pa ma rnyed pa la mngon par 'dod pa med cing rang gi don du byang chub kyang mi tshol ba dang / rnyed pa thob pas chog mi shes pa med cing thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob @21b cing des rlom sems su mi byed pa dang /
translated: They dwell in solitude in the wilderness, and they dwell in solitude by avoiding the conduct of the Lesser Vehicle. They do not seek to obtain any gain for themselves, not even enlightenment. They are not satisfied with obtaining gain, but they do not become conceited by obtaining omniscience.

original: yang dag par sdom pa'i rten bsod snyoms pa nyid dang / stan gcig pa la sogs pa sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang ldan zhing chos zab mo la rtogs pa'i bzod pa dang bcas pa dang / gang blangs pa nyid kyi bslab pa srog la sogs pa'i phyir yang yongs su mi gtong zhing de dag thams cad kyang yang dag par yid la mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: yang dag par sdom pa'i rten bsod snyoms pa nyid dang / stan gcig pa la sogs pa sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang ldan zhing chos zab mo la rtogs pa'i bzod pa dang bcas pa dang / gang blangs pa nyid kyi bslab pa srog la sogs pa'i phyir yang yongs su mi gtong zhing de dag thams cad kyang yang dag par yid la mi byed pa dang /
translated: They are mendicants who rely on perfect restraint, and they possess the qualities of training, such as the single seat. They have the acceptance that realizes the profound Dharma, and they do not give up even their life for the sake of the training that they have taken up. They do not think about any of these things.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan la nyes dmigs su lta bas smod cing ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pa'i sgo nas 'dod pa'i sems mi skyed pa dang / gdul bya dang 'tsham bar mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol zhing chos thams cad la mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan la nyes dmigs su lta bas smod cing ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pa'i sgo nas 'dod pa'i sems mi skyed pa dang / gdul bya dang 'tsham bar mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol zhing chos thams cad la mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang /
translated: They are to despise the sense objects by seeing them as having drawbacks, to not give rise to thoughts of desire by not apprehending any essence, to be intent on nirvana in accordance with those to be trained, to be without any formation with regard to all phenomena,üîΩto not cling to and to give away all one‚Äôs possessions, to be without any mental slackness in accomplishing virtue and to not dwell on objects, to not view and not attend to things with attachment,

original: bdog pa thams cad mngon par nye bar mi 'dzin cing yongs su gtong ba dang / dge ba sgrub pa la sems zhum pa med cing yul dag la nye bar mi gnas pa dang / dngos po rnams la mngon par chags pas lta ba med cing yid la byed pa med pa ste /
analyzed: bdog pa thams cad mngon par nye bar mi 'dzin cing yongs su gtong ba dang / dge ba sgrub pa la sems zhum pa med cing yul dag la nye bar mi gnas pa dang / dngos po rnams la mngon par chags pas lta ba med cing yid la byed pa med pa ste /
translated: and to not be attached to one‚Äôs own happiness.

original: de lta bu chos bcus snga ma ltar yongs su sbyangs pas sa bzhi pa 'od 'phro ba can gnon cing rdzogs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu chos bcus snga ma ltar yongs su sbyangs pas sa bzhi pa 'od 'phro ba can gnon cing rdzogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: By means of these ten qualities, they perfect and master the fourth ground, the Radiant.

original: de'i 'og tu bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa gtso bor gyur pa nyid kyis sa lnga pa'i yongs su sbyong ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa gtso bor gyur pa nyid kyis sa lnga pa'i yongs su sbyong ba gsungs pa /
translated: Then, after that, the five grounds are described by way of the perfection of meditative stabilization being primary.üîΩAttachment to friends and home,

original: 'dris dang khyim la 'khren pa dang // 'du 'dzir gyur pa'i gnas dang ni //
analyzed: 'dris dang khyim la 'khren pa dang // 'du 'dzir gyur pa'i gnas dang ni //
translated: and dwelling in a place with distractions,üîΩpraising oneself, despising others,üîΩthe ten nonvirtuous actions,üîΩconceit from pride, the four errors,

original: bdag bstod gzhan la brnyas pa dang // mi dge'i las kyi lam bcu dang // rlom pas khengs dang phyin ci log / blo ngan dang ni nyon mongs bzod //
analyzed: bdag bstod gzhan la brnyas pa dang // mi dge'i las kyi lam bcu dang // rlom pas khengs dang phyin ci log / blo ngan dang ni nyon mongs bzod //
translated: bad thoughts, and the afflictions,

original: bcu po 'di ni rnam spangs na //
analyzed: bcu po 'di ni rnam spangs na //
translated: having completely abandoned these ten,

original: sa lnga pa ni yang dag 'thob //üîΩces bya ba'o //
analyzed: sa lnga pa ni yang dag 'thob // ces bya ba'o //
translated: one attains the fifth ground.

original: rnyed pa la sogs pa'i don du dge slong ma la sogs pa dang 'dris par mi byed cing brdzus te skye ba mngon par len pa dang / gzhan la dad pa can gyi khyim nye bar ston par mi byed cing sbyin bdag las rnyed pa thob pa la phrag dog mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: rnyed pa la sogs pa'i don du dge slong ma la sogs pa dang 'dris par mi byed cing brdzus te skye ba mngon par len pa dang / gzhan la dad pa can gyi khyim nye bar ston par mi byed cing sbyin bdag las rnyed pa thob pa la phrag dog mi byed pa dang /
translated: One does not associate with nuns and so on for the sake of gain and so forth, and one does not take on rebirth by means of the u·π£·πáƒ´·π£a. One does not show off to others who have faith in one, and one is not jealous of the gain obtained from benefactors.

original: grong khyer la sogs par 'du 'dzis rnam par mi g-yeng zhing gang du theg pa dman pa'i gtam dang sems 'byung bar mi gnas pa dang bdag nyid bsngags pa mi brjod cing nang gi chos thams cad @22a * //
analyzed: grong khyer la sogs par 'du 'dzis rnam par mi g-yeng zhing gang du theg pa dman pa'i gtam dang sems 'byung bar mi gnas pa dang bdag nyid bsngags pa mi brjod cing nang gi chos thams cad @22a * //
translated: In towns and so forth, they are not distracted by busyness, they do not dwell in places where there is talk of the lower vehicles, they do not praise themselves, and they do not see any internal phenomena.

original: mi mthong ba dang / gzhan la smod pa spong zhing phyi'i chos thams cad mi dmigs pa dang / mi dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu spong zhing dge ba bcu la yang dag par gnas pa dang / thos pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pas nga rgyal du mi byed cing lhag par rlom pa'i chos rjes su mi mthong ba dang /
analyzed: mi mthong ba dang / gzhan la smod pa spong zhing phyi'i chos thams cad mi dmigs pa dang / mi dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu spong zhing dge ba bcu la yang dag par gnas pa dang / thos pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pas nga rgyal du mi byed cing lhag par rlom pa'i chos rjes su mi mthong ba dang /
translated: They abandon disparaging others and do not observe any external phenomena. They abandon the ten nonvirtuous actions and abide in the ten virtues. They do not become proud of their learning, discipline, and so forth, and they do not see any phenomena that are superior to pride.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba bzlog pa'i mngon par zhen pa spong zhing dngos por dmigs pa 'dor ba dang / log par lta ba'i khyad par thams cad spong zhing the tshom dang yid gnyis su mi 'gyur ba dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa la phyogs par mi byed cing nyon mongs pa rnams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba bzlog pa'i mngon par zhen pa spong zhing dngos por dmigs pa 'dor ba dang / log par lta ba'i khyad par thams cad spong zhing the tshom dang yid gnyis su mi 'gyur ba dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa la phyogs par mi byed cing nyon mongs pa rnams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste /
translated: They abandon attachment to the reversal of virtue and nonvirtue and they abandon objectification of things. They abandon all the different kinds of wrong views and they do not have doubts or second thoughts. They do not side with attachment and so forth and they do not see the afflictions as real.

original: de lta bu'i chos bcus snga ma ltar yongs su sbyangs pas sa lnga pa sbyang dka' ba gnon cing rdzogs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i chos bcus snga ma ltar yongs su sbyangs pas sa lnga pa sbyang dka' ba gnon cing rdzogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: By means of these ten qualities, they perfect and master the fifth ground, Difficult to Master, through thorough training as described above.

original: de'i 'og tu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gtso bor gyur pa nyid kyis sa drug pa'i yongs su sbyong ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gtso bor gyur pa nyid kyis sa drug pa'i yongs su sbyong ba gsungs pa /
translated: After that, the thorough training for the sixth ground is taught, with the perfection of wisdom being primary:

original: sbyin dang tshul khrims bzod brtson 'grus //
analyzed: sbyin dang tshul khrims bzod brtson 'grus //
translated: Through perfecting generosity, ethics, patience, diligence,

original: bsam gtan shes rab yongs rdzogs pas //
analyzed: bsam gtan shes rab yongs rdzogs pas //
translated: Concentration and wisdom,

original: slob ma dang ni bse ru la //
analyzed: slob ma dang ni bse ru la //
translated: The disciples and the rhinoceroses

original: dga' dang skrag pa'i sems spangs dang // bslangs na mi zhum bdog pa kun //
analyzed: dga' dang skrag pa'i sems spangs dang // bslangs na mi zhum bdog pa kun //
translated: Abandoning the mind of joy and fear, not discouraged when asked,üîΩgiving away all possessions,

original: btang yang mi dga' med pa dang // dbul yang slong ba mi spong bas //üîΩsa ni drug pa yang dag 'thob //
analyzed: btang yang mi dga' med pa dang // dbul yang slong ba mi spong bas // sa ni drug pa yang dag 'thob //
translated: not unhappy even when poor, not rejecting the poor.

original: ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, one attains the sixth ground.

original: sngar ji ltar bshad pa'i sbyin pa nas bzung ste shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byas pa nyid dang / de nyid kyis nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la mngon pa dga' ba mi skyed pa dang /
analyzed: sngar ji ltar bshad pa'i sbyin pa nas bzung ste shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byas pa nyid dang / de nyid kyis nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la mngon pa dga' ba mi skyed pa dang /
translated: Having completed the six perfections from generosity to wisdom as previously explained, one does not generate delight in the vehicles of the hearers and solitary realizers.üîΩOne does not fear the meaning of the emptiness of inherent nature.üîΩOne is not discouraged by the stinginess that overwhelms some when they are first asked by a beggar.

original: ngo bo nyid dmigs par bya bas dben pa'i don la skrag par mi byed pa dang / thog mar slong ba po'i skye bos 'ga' zhig bslangs nas ser snas zil gyis gnon pa'i zhum pa med pa dang / bar du bdog pa thams cad ngang gis gtong bar zhugs te mi dga' ba med pa dang /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dmigs par bya bas dben pa'i don la skrag par mi byed pa dang / thog mar slong ba po'i skye bos 'ga' zhig bslangs nas ser snas zil gyis gnon pa'i zhum pa med pa dang / bar du bdog pa thams cad ngang gis gtong bar zhugs te mi dga' ba med pa dang /
translated: One is not unhappy when one naturally engages in giving away all possessions.

original: mthar btang bas bkren par gyur du zin kyang yang slob pa po'i skye bo thob pa med par dor ba spong ba nyid de de lta bu'i chos bcu gnyis kyis snga ma ltar yongs su sbyangs pas sa drug pa mngon du @22b gyur pa thob cing rdzogs parüîΩbyed pa yin no //
analyzed: mthar btang bas bkren par gyur du zin kyang yang slob pa po'i skye bo thob pa med par dor ba spong ba nyid de de lta bu'i chos bcu gnyis kyis snga ma ltar yongs su sbyangs pas sa drug pa mngon du @22b gyur pa thob cing rdzogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: By thoroughly training in these twelve qualities as above, they attain and complete the sixth bhumi, The Manifest.

original: de'i 'og tu thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gtsor gyur pa nyid kyis sa bdun pa'i yongs su sbyong ba gsungs pa //üîΩbdag dang sems can 'dzin pa dang // srog dang gang zag chad rtag dang // mtshan ma rgyu dang phung po dang // khams dang skye mched dag dang ni //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gtsor gyur pa nyid kyis sa bdun pa'i yongs su sbyong ba gsungs pa // bdag dang sems can 'dzin pa dang // srog dang gang zag chad rtag dang // mtshan ma rgyu dang phung po dang // khams dang skye mched dag dang ni //
translated: After that, the seventh bhumi is attained by thoroughly training in the seven qualities that are taught as the seven purities.

original: khams gsum pa la gnas dang chags //üîΩsems ni kun tu zhum pa dang // dkon mchog gsum dang tshul khrims la //
analyzed: khams gsum pa la gnas dang chags //üîΩsems ni kun tu zhum pa dang // dkon mchog gsum dang tshul khrims la //
translated: The seven purities are taught in the sutra:üîΩChild of good family, it is like this: for example, a gold ornament made by a skilled goldsmith is called a gold ornament from the time the gold is first made workable, and it is still called a gold ornament when it is made into various shapes.

original: der lta ba yi mngon zhen dang // stong pa nyid la rtsod pa dang // de dang 'gal ba'i nyes pa ni ;üîΩ/ nyi shu gang la rnam chad pa //
analyzed: der lta ba yi mngon zhen dang // stong pa nyid la rtsod pa dang // de dang 'gal ba'i nyes pa ni ; / nyi shu gang la rnam chad pa //
translated: the dispute about emptiness, and the faults that are incompatible withüîΩit.

original: de yis sa ni bdun pa 'thob //
analyzed: de yis sa ni bdun pa 'thob //
translated: The seventh ground is attained by one who has eliminated the twentyüîΩfaults that are incompatible with the path of seeing, such as the notionüîΩthat the view is a basis for clinging, the dispute about emptiness, and the

original: ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o //
translated: faults that are incompatible with it.üîΩThe notion that the view is a basis for clinging, the dispute about emptiness,

analyzed: nga'o zhes byed pa po'i gzhir gyur pa bdag dang // 'phro zhing yid la byed pa sems can dang / skal ba mnyam pa'i rigs rdzogs pa srog dang / 'gro bar yang dang yang du gnas pa'i rten gang zag dang / mngon par byung ba'i rgyun nyams par 'gyur ba chad pa dang /

original: rang bzhin gnas pa las gzhan du mi 'gyur ba rtag par 'dzin pa dang / 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la dor bar bya ba dang / cig shos su mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / rigs tha dad pa nyid du gyur pa'i rgyur 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: rang bzhin gnas pa las gzhan du mi 'gyur ba rtag par 'dzin pa dang / 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la dor bar bya ba dang / cig shos su mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / rigs tha dad pa nyid du gyur pa'i rgyur 'dzin pa dang /
translated: and the faults that are incompatible with it.

original: ming dang gzugs kyi chos phung po nyid du bden par 'dzin pa dang / rgyu'i rten khams dag tu bden par 'dzin pa dang / rkyen gyi khyad par phyi'i skye mched la sogs pa bden par 'dzin pa dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa la bden par 'dzin pa khams gsum pa la gnas pa dang /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi chos phung po nyid du bden par 'dzin pa dang / rgyu'i rten khams dag tu bden par 'dzin pa dang / rkyen gyi khyad par phyi'i skye mched la sogs pa bden par 'dzin pa dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa la bden par 'dzin pa khams gsum pa la gnas pa dang /
translated: It is to grasp at the aggregates of the phenomena of name and form as being real, to grasp at the causal basis of the elements as being real, to grasp at the specific conditions of the external sense sources and so forth as being real, to grasp at the incorrect imagination as being real, to abide in the three realms,

original: de la blang ba dang dor bar yongs su 'dzin pa chags pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mi thob par 'dzin pa sems kun tu zhum pa dang / gzugs kyi sku de bzhin gshegs par lta ba dang / gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis rjod par byed pa dam pa'i chos su lta ba dang /
analyzed: de la blang ba dang dor bar yongs su 'dzin pa chags pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mi thob par 'dzin pa sems kun tu zhum pa dang / gzugs kyi sku de bzhin gshegs par lta ba dang / gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis rjod par byed pa dam pa'i chos su lta ba dang /
translated: to grasp at the abandonment and adoption of those as being real, to grasp at not attaining omniscience as being real, to grasp at the form body as being the Thus-Gone One, to view the twelve branches of the scriptures as being the sublime Dharma,

original: skyes bu zung bzhi po dge 'dun du lta ba dang / tshul khrims 'chal ba nyid kyi gnyen po tshul khrims su lta ba dang / chos thams cad la stong pa nyid @23a * //
analyzed: skyes bu zung bzhi po dge 'dun du lta ba dang / tshul khrims 'chal ba nyid kyi gnyen po tshul khrims su lta ba dang / chos thams cad la stong pa nyid @23a * //
translated: The four pairs of individuals are regarded as the Sangha, and morality is regarded as the antidote to immorality.

original: la the tshom za ba'i rtsod pa dang / dngos por yongs su 'dzin pa nyid kyis de dang 'gal ba'i nyes pa ste /
analyzed: la the tshom za ba'i rtsod pa dang / dngos por yongs su 'dzin pa nyid kyis de dang 'gal ba'i nyes pa ste /
translated: The dispute of doubting emptiness with regard to all phenomena and the fault of being contrary to that by holding to substantial realityüîΩare the twenty things to be abandoned.

original: spang bar bya ba nyi shu po de yang dag par spangs te /
analyzed: spang bar bya ba nyi shu po de yang dag par spangs te /
translated: Having completely abandoned them,

original: snga ma ltar yongs su sbyangs pas sa bdun pa ring du song ba thob cing rdzogs par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: snga ma ltar yongs su sbyangs pas sa bdun pa ring du song ba thob cing rdzogs par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: one attains and perfects the seventh ground, Gone Far Beyond, as before, through thorough training.

original: de dag spong bar byed pa'i gnyen po gang dag cig yin zhe na /
analyzed: de dag spong bar byed pa'i gnyen po gang dag cig yin zhe na /
translated: What are the antidotes that abandon those?

original: grangs ji lta bas gnyen po rgyas par gsungs pa /
analyzed: grangs ji lta bas gnyen po rgyas par gsungs pa /
translated: The extensive explanation of the antidotes according to their numberüîΩis knowing the three doors of liberation,üîΩknowing the three spheres to be pure,üîΩcompassion, absence of pride,

original: rnam thar sgo gsum shes pa dang // 'khor gsum rnam par dag nyid dang // snying rje dang ni rlom med dang // chos mnyam nyid dang tshul gcig shes ;
analyzed: rnam thar sgo gsum shes pa dang // 'khor gsum rnam par dag nyid dang // snying rje dang ni rlom med dang // chos mnyam nyid dang tshul gcig shes ;
translated: knowing the sameness of phenomena and the single way.

original: / mi skye ba dang bzod shes dang // chos rnams rnams pa gcig tu ston //
analyzed: / mi skye ba dang bzod shes dang // chos rnams rnams pa gcig tu ston //
translated: Teaching the Dharma in a single mode,üîΩCrushing all conceptualization,

original: rtog pa kun tu 'joms pa dang // 'du shes lta dang nyon mongs spong //
analyzed: rtog pa kun tu 'joms pa dang // 'du shes lta dang nyon mongs spong //
translated: Abandoning the view of discriminations and afflictions,üîΩMindfulness of tranquility,üîΩSkill in insight,

original: zhi gnas nges par sems pa dang // lhag mthong la ni mkhas pa dang // sems dul ba dang thams cad la ;
analyzed: zhi gnas nges par sems pa dang // lhag mthong la ni mkhas pa dang // sems dul ba dang thams cad la ;
translated: Taming the mind, unobstructed knowledge in all things,

original: / thogs pa med pa'i ye shes dang // chags pa'i sa min gang 'dod par //
analyzed: / thogs pa med pa'i ye shes dang // chags pa'i sa min gang 'dod par //
translated: Not being a stage of attachment, going wherever one wishes,üîΩGoing to other fields,

original: zhing gzhan du ni mnyam 'gro dang // kun tu bdag gi ngo bo ni //
analyzed: zhing gzhan du ni mnyam 'gro dang // kun tu bdag gi ngo bo ni //
translated: Teaching one's own essence,

original: ston pa nyid dang nyi shu'o //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ston pa nyid dang nyi shu'o // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: And teaching the Dharma.üîΩThe emptiness gate of liberation is the realization of the absence of a self that controls the aggregates independently.

original: phung po rnams la rang dbang du byed par gyur pa'i bdag gis dben par rtogs pa nyid kyis rang gi ngo bos dben pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: phung po rnams la rang dbang du byed par gyur pa'i bdag gis dben par rtogs pa nyid kyis rang gi ngo bos dben pa rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The signless gate of liberation is the realization of the absence of the object of the view of the transitory collection.

original: rgyus rnam par dben pa mtshan ma med pa dang / 'bras bu rnam par dben pa smon pa med pa yang dag par shes pa dang / len pa po dang sbyin pa po dang sbyin par bya ba la sogs pa mi dmigs pa dang / skye bo sdug bsngal dang ldan pa la rang dang mtshungs pa'i snying brtse ba dang /
analyzed: rgyus rnam par dben pa mtshan ma med pa dang / 'bras bu rnam par dben pa smon pa med pa yang dag par shes pa dang / len pa po dang sbyin pa po dang sbyin par bya ba la sogs pa mi dmigs pa dang / skye bo sdug bsngal dang ldan pa la rang dang mtshungs pa'i snying brtse ba dang /
translated: It is to know that the cause is devoid of characteristics and that the result is devoid of aspirations. It is to not observe a recipient, a giver, or something given. It is to have compassion for beings who are suffering, as if they were one‚Äôs own children.

original: dngos po thams cad ma skyes pa nyid kyis dmigs pa med pa'i rlom pa med pa dang / 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis mnyam pa nyid dang / theg pa tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin pas theg pa chen po gcig tu nges par rtogs pa dang /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ma skyes pa nyid kyis dmigs pa med pa'i rlom pa med pa dang / 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis mnyam pa nyid dang / theg pa tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin pas theg pa chen po gcig tu nges par rtogs pa dang /
translated: It is to be free of conceit, since all things are unobservable due to being unborn. It is to realize that all phenomena of sa·πÉsƒÅra and nirvƒÅ·πáa are naturally the same. It is to realize that there is only the single vehicle, since there are no characteristics of different vehicles.

original: gdod ma nas chos thams cad kyi bdag nyid mi skye ba yongs su shes pa dang / stong pa nyid la mi skrag pa'i @23b bzod pa khong du chud pa dang / shes par bya ba thams cad la thabs kyi sgo nas chos bstan pas theg pa chen po nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa'i tshul gcig tu ston pa dang /
analyzed: gdod ma nas chos thams cad kyi bdag nyid mi skye ba yongs su shes pa dang / stong pa nyid la mi skrag pa'i @23b bzod pa khong du chud pa dang / shes par bya ba thams cad la thabs kyi sgo nas chos bstan pas theg pa chen po nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa'i tshul gcig tu ston pa dang /
translated: It is to know that all phenomena are unborn from the beginning. It is to comprehend the acceptance that is not afraid of emptiness. It is to teach the Dharma through skillful means to all those who are to be guided. It is to teach the Great Vehicle as being a single way that is free of apprehended objects and apprehending subjects.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin par mngon par zhen pa'i rtogs pa thams cad 'joms pa dang ; / mtshan mar 'dzin pa nyid kyi 'du shes spong zhing 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa lta ba lnga 'dor ba dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa sel ba dang /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin par mngon par zhen pa'i rtogs pa thams cad 'joms pa dang ; / mtshan mar 'dzin pa nyid kyi 'du shes spong zhing 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa lta ba lnga 'dor ba dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa sel ba dang /
translated: It is to destroy all conceptions that are fixated on apprehended objects and apprehending subjects. It is to abandon the five views, such as the view of the transitory collection, and to abandon the perception of grasping at signs. It is to eliminate the afflictions, such as desire.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la rtse gcig pa'i zhi gnas dang / shes rab phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pas lhag ma thong la mkhas pa dang / 'gog pa dang lam gyi mtshan nyid shes pas sems dul ba dang / gzugs la sogs pa la thogs pa med pa'i ye shes dang /üîΩrten dang gzhi ma grub pa nyid kyis mngon par chags pa'i gnas ma yin pa dang ; ji ltar 'dod pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan du cig car mnyam du 'gro zhing chos ston pa dang / gdul bya dang rjes su mthun par bdag gi lus rab tu bstan nas don byed pa nyid kyis stong pa nyid dang 'gal ba'i gnyen por gyur pa ste /
