original: de'i 'og tu smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa gtsor gyur pa nyid kyis sa brgyad pa'i yongs su sbyong ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa gtsor gyur pa nyid kyis sa brgyad pa'i yongs su sbyong ba gsungs pa /
translated: Then, because the perfection of vows is preeminent, the eight ground's thorough clearing is stated:üîΩKnowing the minds of all sentient beings,üîΩplaying with the superknowledges,üîΩaccomplishing a good buddhafield,

original: sems can kun yid shes pa dang // mngon par shes pas rtse ba dang // sangs rgyas zhing bzang bsgrub pa dang ; / yongs su brtag phyir sangs rgyas bsten //
analyzed: sems can kun yid shes pa dang // mngon par shes pas rtse ba dang // sangs rgyas zhing bzang bsgrub pa dang ; / yongs su brtag phyir sangs rgyas bsten //
translated: and relying on the Buddha for thorough investigation.

original: dbang po shes dang rgyal ba yi //üîΩzhing sbyong sgyu ma ltar gnas dang // bsams bzhin sred pa len pa dang // las ni rnam pa 'di brgyad bshad //
analyzed: dbang po shes dang rgyal ba yi // zhing sbyong sgyu ma ltar gnas dang // bsams bzhin sred pa len pa dang // las ni rnam pa 'di brgyad bshad //
translated: The knowledge of faculties, the knowledge of the victor'süîΩfield, abiding like an illusion,üîΩand taking birth through aspiration

original: ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o //
translated: are explained as the eight kinds of action.

original: sems gcig gis sems can thams cad kyi spyod pa ji lta ba bzhin shes pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams su rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pas rnam par rtse zhing de dag gi 'du shes mi 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing rten gser la sogs pa'i ngo bor yongs su sgyur ba'i 'byor pa dpag tu med pa'i sbyin pa @24a * //
analyzed: sems gcig gis sems can thams cad kyi spyod pa ji lta ba bzhin shes pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams su rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par shes pas rnam par rtse zhing de dag gi 'du shes mi 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing rten gser la sogs pa'i ngo bor yongs su sgyur ba'i 'byor pa dpag tu med pa'i sbyin pa @24a * //
translated: It is to know the conduct of all sentient beings with a single mind. It is to play with the superknowledges of magical power in the world systems without changing one‚Äôs perception. It is to give the gift of the infinite wealth of transforming the buddhafields into the essence of gold and so forth.

original: gtong yang des rlom sems su mi byed pa dang / sems can la phan gdags pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du chos yongs su brtags pas sangs rgyas bsten cing chos la bsnyen bkur ba dang / lha'i mig la sogs pa skyed cing stobs bcu la gnas pas ;
analyzed: gtong yang des rlom sems su mi byed pa dang / sems can la phan gdags pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du chos yongs su brtags pas sangs rgyas bsten cing chos la bsnyen bkur ba dang / lha'i mig la sogs pa skyed cing stobs bcu la gnas pas ;
translated: It is to not become conceited by that. It is to serve the buddhas and honor the Dharma by investigating the Dharma in all aspects in order to benefit sentient beings. It is to generate the divine eye and so forth and to abide in the ten powers.

original: sems can gyi dbang po yongs su rdzogs par shes pa dang / rgyal ba'i zhing rten pa mi dal ba spong ba la sogs pa yongs su sbyong zhing sems can gyi sems rjes su dag pa byed pa dang / thams cad du sgyu ma lta bur gnas shing de dag gi don bya ba thams cad sgrub kyang yid nye bar mi sbyor ba dang /
analyzed: sems can gyi dbang po yongs su rdzogs par shes pa dang / rgyal ba'i zhing rten pa mi dal ba spong ba la sogs pa yongs su sbyong zhing sems can gyi sems rjes su dag pa byed pa dang / thams cad du sgyu ma lta bur gnas shing de dag gi don bya ba thams cad sgrub kyang yid nye bar mi sbyor ba dang /
translated: They abide in the illusion-like state in all situations, and they accomplish all the aims of beings without ever applying their minds to them.

original: blo sngon du btang nas rang dbang du sems can yongs su smin par 'gyur ba'i lus 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: blo sngon du btang nas rang dbang du sems can yongs su smin par 'gyur ba'i lus 'dzin pa ste /
translated: And they take on bodies in accordance with their previous aspirations in order to bring sentient beings to full maturity.

original: de lta bu'i las rnam pa brgyad snga ma ltar yongs su sbyangs pas sa brgyad pa mi g-yo ba 'thob cing rdzogs par 'gyur ba yin no ;üîΩ/ de'i 'og tu stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gtsor gyur pa nyid kyis sa dgu pa'i yongs su sbyong ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: de lta bu'i las rnam pa brgyad snga ma ltar yongs su sbyangs pas sa brgyad pa mi g-yo ba 'thob cing rdzogs par 'gyur ba yin no ;üîΩ/ de'i 'og tu stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gtsor gyur pa nyid kyis sa dgu pa'i yongs su sbyong ba gsungs pa /
translated: By thoroughly training in these eight activities as described above, the eighth bhumi, Unshakable, is attained and perfected.üîΩAfter that, the ninth bhumi, Perfect Intellect, is attained and perfected by thoroughly training in the three activities of purifying the buddhafield, ripening sentient beings, and receiving empowerment from the tathagatas.

original: smon lam dag ni mtha' yas dang // lha la sogs pa'i skad shes dang // spobs pa chu bo lta bu dang // mngal du 'jug pa mchog dang ni //
analyzed: smon lam dag ni mtha' yas dang // lha la sogs pa'i skad shes dang // spobs pa chu bo lta bu dang // mngal du 'jug pa mchog dang ni //
translated: inexhaustible eloquence, supreme entry into the womb,

original: rigs dang rus dang cho 'brang dang // 'khor dang skye ba dag dang ni //
analyzed: rigs dang rus dang cho 'brang dang // 'khor dang skye ba dag dang ni //
translated: noble birth, lineage, clan, family, retinue,

original: nges 'byung byang chub shing rnams dang // yon tan phun sum tshogs pa yin //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nges 'byung byang chub shing rnams dang // yon tan phun sum tshogs pa yin // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: renunciation, the tree of enlightenment, and perfect qualities.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams legs par rdzogs pas ji ltar bsams pa 'grub pa'i smon lam mtha' yas pa dang / des pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pas lha la sogs pa sems can thams cad kyi skad shes pa dang / chos zab mo la sogs pa so so yang dag par rig pas spobs pa bkod pa'i chu bo ltar zad mi shes pa dang /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams legs par rdzogs pas ji ltar bsams pa 'grub pa'i smon lam mtha' yas pa dang / des pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pas lha la sogs pa sems can thams cad kyi skad shes pa dang / chos zab mo la sogs pa so so yang dag par rig pas spobs pa bkod pa'i chu bo ltar zad mi shes pa dang /
translated: By perfectly completing the perfections, one attains infinite aspirations that accomplish what one intends, understanding the languages of all beings such as gods through the correct understanding of eloquent speech, and inexhaustible eloquence like a river through the correct understanding of the profound Dharma and so on.

original: thabs kyi bsngags pa'i mngal du 'jug pa'am rdzus te skye ba dang / rgyal po la sogs pa'i rigs dang / nyi ma la sogs pa'i rus dang / pha dang ma'i bdun brgyud legs par 'brel pa'i cho 'brang dang / rang dbang ba dang rang gi byang chub la gzhag pa'i 'khor @24b dang /
analyzed: thabs kyi bsngags pa'i mngal du 'jug pa'am rdzus te skye ba dang / rgyal po la sogs pa'i rigs dang / nyi ma la sogs pa'i rus dang / pha dang ma'i bdun brgyud legs par 'brel pa'i cho 'brang dang / rang dbang ba dang rang gi byang chub la gzhag pa'i 'khor @24b dang /
translated: They are born miraculously or in the womb of a mother who is praised as a skillful means; they are born in the family of a king and so on, with a lineage such as the sun and so on, with a mother and father who are well related for seven generations, with independence and a retinue who are set in their own enlightenment.

original: brgya byin la sogs pas mngon par bstod cing g-yo ba dang 'od kyis snang bar byed pa la sogs pa skye ba dang / sangs rgyas la sogs pa bskul zhing rmad du byung ba'i rnam par thar pas rab tu nges par 'byung ba dang / rin po che sna tshogs kyi rgyu las grub pa'i shing aa shvadtha la sogs pa byang chub kyi shing la sku brten te 'tshang rgya ba dang /
analyzed: brgya byin la sogs pas mngon par bstod cing g-yo ba dang 'od kyis snang bar byed pa la sogs pa skye ba dang / sangs rgyas la sogs pa bskul zhing rmad du byung ba'i rnam par thar pas rab tu nges par 'byung ba dang / rin po che sna tshogs kyi rgyu las grub pa'i shing aa shvadtha la sogs pa byang chub kyi shing la sku brten te 'tshang rgya ba dang /
translated: They are born with the praise and movement of Indra and so on, with light that illuminates and so on, and they are born with the definite emergence of the marvelous liberation of being urged by the buddhas and so on. They attain enlightenment in dependence on a body that is supported by a tree of enlightenment, such as an a≈õvattha tree, which is made from various precious substances.

original: stobs la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi ngo bor gyur pa'i yon tan thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: stobs la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi ngo bor gyur pa'i yon tan thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ste /
translated: It is the perfection of all the qualities that are the essence of the qualities of a Buddha, such as the powers.

original: de lta bu'i chos bcu gnyis snga ma ltar yongs su sbyangs pa'i khyad par gyis sa dgu pa legs pa'i blo gros thob cing rdzogs par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i chos bcu gnyis snga ma ltar yongs su sbyangs pa'i khyad par gyis sa dgu pa legs pa'i blo gros thob cing rdzogs par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Thus, by the special purification of the twelve qualities as above, the ninth ground, Perfect Joy, is attained and perfected.

original: de ltar rgyu'i sa rnams kyi yongs su sbyang ba bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rgyu'i sa rnams kyi yongs su sbyang ba bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the purifications of the causal grounds,

original: da ni ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gtsor gyur pa nyid kyi sa thams cad bsdus pa'i sgo nas 'bras bu'i sa nyid du sa bcu pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa //
analyzed: da ni ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gtsor gyur pa nyid kyi sa thams cad bsdus pa'i sgo nas 'bras bu'i sa nyid du sa bcu pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa //
translated: now, in order to teach the characteristic of the tenth ground as the very ground of fruition, in terms of subsuming all the grounds within the preeminence of the perfection of wisdom, it is said:

original: sa dgu 'das nas ye shes kyi //
analyzed: sa dgu 'das nas ye shes kyi //
translated: Having gone beyond the ninth ground,

original: gang gis sangs rgyas sar gnas pa //üîΩde ni byang chub sems pa'i sa //
analyzed: gang gis sangs rgyas sar gnas pa // de ni byang chub sems pa'i sa //
translated: by which one abides on the ground of a Buddha,üîΩthat is to be known as the

original: bcu pa yin par shes par bya //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bcu pa yin par shes par bya //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
translated: bodhisattva ground of the tenth.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa so so'i rigs kyi sa dang / 'bras bu dang po la zhugs pa brgyad pa dang / rgyun tu zhugs pas bden pa mthong ba'i sa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba nyon mongs pa bsrabs pa'i sa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang bral pa'i sa dang /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa so so'i rigs kyi sa dang / 'bras bu dang po la zhugs pa brgyad pa dang / rgyun tu zhugs pas bden pa mthong ba'i sa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba nyon mongs pa bsrabs pa'i sa dang / phyir mi 'ong ba 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang bral pa'i sa dang /
translated: The levels of the individual sravaka and so forth, the eight levels of the first approach to the result, the level of seeing the truth of the sravaka stream enterer, the level of reducing afflictions of the once returner, the level of freedom from attachment of the nonreturner in the desire realm,

original: dgra bcom pa khams kyi nyon mongs pa zad pas byas pa rtogs pa'i sa dang / 'bras bu phyi ma gsum la zhugs pa nyan thos dang / rang gi byang chub mngon sum du byas pas rang sangs rgyas kyi sa dang / ji skad bshad pa'i sa rnam pa dgu po byang chub sems dpa'i rgyur gyur pa gcig kho na ste /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa khams kyi nyon mongs pa zad pas byas pa rtogs pa'i sa dang / 'bras bu phyi ma gsum la zhugs pa nyan thos dang / rang gi byang chub mngon sum du byas pas rang sangs rgyas kyi sa dang / ji skad bshad pa'i sa rnam pa dgu po byang chub sems dpa'i rgyur gyur pa gcig kho na ste /
translated: the level of the realization of the arhat who has exhausted the afflictions of the realms, the level of the sravaka who has approached the latter three results, the level of the pratyekabuddha who has actualized his or her own enlightenment and the single level of the bodhisattva that is the cause for the nine aforementioned levels.

original: de ltar sa dgu 'das nas sa bcu pa la ni byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi sar gnas pa yin pas de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu pa chos kyi sprin yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar sa dgu 'das nas sa bcu pa la ni byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi sar gnas pa yin pas de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu pa chos kyi sprin yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, having passed beyond the ninth stage, the bodhisattva is on the stage of the Buddhas on the tenth stage. This is to be known as the bodhisattva‚Äôs tenth stage, Cloud of Dharma.

original: de'i phyir rgyu'i sa yongs su sbyong ba rnams kyi khyad par phul du gyur pa nyid kyis 'bras bu'i sa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu'i sa yongs su sbyong ba rnams kyi khyad par phul du gyur pa nyid kyis 'bras bu'i sa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the stage of the cause is completely purified, and by the excellence of the distinction, the stage of the result is completely fulfilled.

original: @25a * // zhes dgongs te /
analyzed: @25a * // zhes dgongs te /
translated: This is the intention.

original: 'dir yongs su sbyong ba bcu pa gzhan ni ma gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dir yongs su sbyong ba bcu pa gzhan ni ma gsungs so //
translated: Here, the tenth complete purification is not mentioned.

original: de'i rjes la bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa gnyen po'i tshogs gang yin pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i rjes la bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa gnyen po'i tshogs gang yin pa gsungs pa /
translated: After that, two verses on the collection of antidotes.

original: mthong dang bsgom pa'i lam dag la //
analyzed: mthong dang bsgom pa'i lam dag la //
translated: On the paths of seeing and cultivation,

original: gzung dang 'dzin pa'i rnam rtog rnams //
analyzed: gzung dang 'dzin pa'i rnam rtog rnams //
translated: the conceptualizations of subject and object

original: nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i phyir //üîΩgnyen po rnam pa brgyad ces bya //
analyzed: nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i phyir // gnyen po rnam pa brgyad ces bya //
translated: are to be completely pacified.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The antidotes are said to be of eight kinds.

original: mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam dag gis so sor kun nas nyon mongs pa dang nyen po'i rten can gyi gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis dang / gang zag rdzas dang skyes bu btags par yod pas 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis go rims ltar dngos po dang rnam pa la brten pa'i dbang gis rnam par rtog pa rnam pa brgyad spong pa'i gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam dag gis so sor kun nas nyon mongs pa dang nyen po'i rten can gyi gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis dang / gang zag rdzas dang skyes bu btags par yod pas 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis go rims ltar dngos po dang rnam pa la brten pa'i dbang gis rnam par rtog pa rnam pa brgyad spong pa'i gnyen po yin no //
translated: The paths of seeing and meditation are the antidotes that eliminate the eight conceptual thoughts, which are based on the thoroughly afflicted and the pure, respectively, and which are conceptual thoughts that apprehend the two kinds of objects, as well as the two kinds of conceptual thoughts that apprehend the person as substantial and as imputed, respectively. These are conceptual thoughts that are based on entities and their aspects.

original: de ltar tshogs kyi gnyen po'i dpung legs par bsags nas nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir chog mi shes pa'i brtson 'grus kyi bdag nyid nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar tshogs kyi gnyen po'i dpung legs par bsags nas nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir chog mi shes pa'i brtson 'grus kyi bdag nyid nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, having properly gathered the army of the antidotes of the accumulations, one will definitely be liberated. Therefore, the practice of definite emergence, which is the nature of insatiable diligence, is taught.

original: ched du bya dang mnyam nyid dang // sems can don dang 'bad med dang // mtha' las 'das pa nges 'byung dang // thob pa'i mtshan nyid nges 'byung dang // rnam kun mkhyen nyid nges 'byung dang // lam gyi yul can nges 'byung ste //
analyzed: ched du bya dang mnyam nyid dang // sems can don dang 'bad med dang // mtha' las 'das pa nges 'byung dang // thob pa'i mtshan nyid nges 'byung dang // rnam kun mkhyen nyid nges 'byung dang // lam gyi yul can nges 'byung ste //
translated: the determination to be free as attainment,üîΩthe determination to be free as omniscience,üîΩand the determination to be free as the path.

original: rnam pa brgyad kyi bdag nyid 'di //üîΩnges 'byung bsgrub pa yin zhes bya //
analyzed: rnam pa brgyad kyi bdag nyid 'di // nges 'byung bsgrub pa yin zhes bya //
translated: This is the eightfold determination to be free.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is called the accomplishment of the determination to be free.

original: sems chen po la sogs pa ched du bya ba dang / shes rab kyi chos thams cad nam mkha' ltar mnyam pa dang / snying rjes sems can gyi don khyad par byed pa dang / zung du 'jug pa mtshan ma med par thams cad byed pa lhun gyis grub pa dang /
analyzed: sems chen po la sogs pa ched du bya ba dang / shes rab kyi chos thams cad nam mkha' ltar mnyam pa dang / snying rjes sems can gyi don khyad par byed pa dang / zung du 'jug pa mtshan ma med par thams cad byed pa lhun gyis grub pa dang /
translated: The great mind and so forth are the commitment, the wisdom that all phenomena are equal like space, compassion that benefits sentient beings, the union that effortlessly does everything without attributes,

original: de nyid rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' dang bral ba dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid las theg pa gsum gyi don thams cad thob pa dang mi rtog pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / de'i khyad par gyi lam mthar thug pa'i yul can gyi nges par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' dang bral ba dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid las theg pa gsum gyi don thams cad thob pa dang mi rtog pa'i mtshan nyid kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / de'i khyad par gyi lam mthar thug pa'i yul can gyi nges par 'byung ba ste /
translated: The eight kinds of fearlessness are: fearlessness in regard to the attainment of the goal of the three vehicles, through the perfection of wisdom itself; fearlessness in regard to the knowledge of all modes, through the nonconceptual characteristic; and fearlessness in regard to the path that is its special path, the object of the ultimate subject.

original: spang bar bya ba'i yul las nges par rgyal bar bya ba'i phyir 'bras bu'i mchog nyid du nges par @25b 'byung ba'i sgrub pa rnam pa brgyad do //
analyzed: spang bar bya ba'i yul las nges par rgyal bar bya ba'i phyir 'bras bu'i mchog nyid du nges par @25b 'byung ba'i sgrub pa rnam pa brgyad do //
translated: Thus, there are eight kinds of accomplishment of fearlessness, which is the supreme result, because of the definite victory over the object to be abandoned.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma'i phreng ba zhes bya ba las skabs dang po'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma'i phreng ba zhes bya ba las skabs dang po'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: This concludes the commentary on the first chapter, having 24 verses, called ‚ÄúThe Explanation of the Title.‚Äù

original: // / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rtogs pa ni lam shes pa nyid la rag las pas de 'chad par mdzad pa na dang por lam shes pa'i rten byed pa dang bcas pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: // / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rtogs pa ni lam shes pa nyid la rag las pas de 'chad par mdzad pa na dang por lam shes pa'i rten byed pa dang bcas pa gsungs pa /
translated: Realization of the knowledge of all modes depends on the knowledge of paths, so in explaining that, the knowledge of paths is first stated, along with its basis.

original: lha rnams rung bar bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: lha rnams rung bar bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to make the gods suitableüîΩthe light obscures their radiance,üîΩdetermining the place, pervading,

original: 'od kyis mog mog por mdzad dang // yul nges pa dang khyab pa dang // rang bzhin dang ni de yi las ;üîΩ/ zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'od kyis mog mog por mdzad dang // yul nges pa dang khyab pa dang // rang bzhin dang ni de yi las ; / zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the nature, and its action.

original: mdo las de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'od dag gis lha la sogs pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'od mog mog por mdzad do zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: mdo las de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'od dag gis lha la sogs pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'od mog mog por mdzad do zhes gsungs te /
translated: A scripture says, ‚ÄúThe light of the Tathagata‚Äôs nature obscures the radiance of the gods and so on, which is the result of evolution.üîΩ‚Äù

original: de ni de dag la lam shes pa nyid skye bar rung par bsgrub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni de dag la lam shes pa nyid skye bar rung par bsgrub pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is in order to make them suitable for the arising of the knowledge of paths in them.

original: de'i phyir nga rgyal bcom pa'i rgyud kho na la skye bas rten gyis khyad par 'phags par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir nga rgyal bcom pa'i rgyud kho na la skye bas rten gyis khyad par 'phags par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that the knowledge of paths is superior in its basis, since it arises only in a stream in which pride has been destroyed.

original: de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa can gyis yul so sor nges pa dang / sems can thams cad la de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyi snying po yod pa'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / cig shos kyi rnal 'byor pa la sogs pas kyang mthar bsgom par bya ba yin pas mtha' dag la khyab pa'i rigs dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa can gyis yul so sor nges pa dang / sems can thams cad la de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyi snying po yod pa'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / cig shos kyi rnal 'byor pa la sogs pas kyang mthar bsgom par bya ba yin pas mtha' dag la khyab pa'i rigs dang /
translated: Likewise, the path of the generation of the mind of omniscience is the object of individual determination, the path of the freedom from attachment is the path of the existence of the essence of the tathagatas in all sentient beings, and the path of the yogis and so on is the path of the cultivation of the end, and thus it is the lineage that pervades all.

original: 'khor ba ji srid par sems can gyi don byed par zhugs pa nyid kyis de'i rgyur gyur pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa thams cad du spangs pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin dang / shes rab dang thabs la mkhas pas yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: 'khor ba ji srid par sems can gyi don byed par zhugs pa nyid kyis de'i rgyur gyur pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa thams cad du spangs pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin dang / shes rab dang thabs la mkhas pas yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du mi byed pa dang /
translated: The path of the engagement in the benefit of sentient beings for as long as samsara exists is the path of the non abandonment of the afflictions in every way that serve as its causes, the path of the non actualization of the limit of reality by means of the skill in wisdom and method,

original: sems can yongs su ma bsdus pa sdud pa la sogs pa'i las byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can yongs su ma bsdus pa sdud pa la sogs pa'i las byed pa yin no //
translated: and the path of the performance of the actions of gathering sentient beings who are not gathered and so on.

original: de lta bu'i lam shes pa nyid kyi lam de dag ni gang zhig yin /
analyzed: de lta bu'i lam shes pa nyid kyi lam de dag ni gang zhig yin /
translated: What are those paths of the knowledge of the path that are like that?

original: ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How is it to be known?

original: re zhig nyan thos kyi lam shes pa gsungs pa //
analyzed: re zhig nyan thos kyi lam shes pa gsungs pa //
translated: First, the knowledge of the sravaka path is stated:

original: lam shes nyid kyi tshul la ni //
analyzed: lam shes nyid kyi tshul la ni //
translated: In the method of the knowledge of the path,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dag gi //üîΩrnam pa mi dmigs sgo nas ni //üîΩnyan thos lam 'di shes par bya //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dag gi // rnam pa mi dmigs sgo nas ni // nyan thos lam 'di shes par bya //
translated: the four noble truthsüîΩare known as the sravaka path

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: through the door of the non-apprehension of their aspects.

original: de la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni @26a * //üîΩskye zhing 'jig pa'i chos can gyi mtshan nyid mi rtag pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po nyid kyis 'phags pa rnams dang mi mthun pa nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba dang / byed pa po'i don gzhan gyis stong pa nyid kyis bdag med pa dang /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni @26a * // skye zhing 'jig pa'i chos can gyi mtshan nyid mi rtag pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po nyid kyis 'phags pa rnams dang mi mthun pa nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba dang / byed pa po'i don gzhan gyis stong pa nyid kyis bdag med pa dang /
translated: Therein, the truth of suffering

original: ngo bor gyur pa'i mtshan ma ma grub pa nyid kyis zhi ba'i rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: ngo bor gyur pa'i mtshan ma ma grub pa nyid kyis zhi ba'i rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: has four aspects: impermanence, characterized by being subject to birth and destruction; suffering, because of being unfavorable to the noble ones due to being defiled things; selflessness, because of being empty of another meaning, an agent; and peace, because of the non-establishment of a substantial characteristic.

original: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la tshor ba yid du mi 'ong ba'i skye ba'i rgyu'i rtsa bar gyur pa nyid kyis nad lta bu dang / 'bras bu sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba nyid kyis 'bras lta bu kun 'byung ba dang / tshor ba bzod par dka' ba skye ba'i rkyen du gyur pa nyid kyis zug rngu lta bur rab tu skye ba dang /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la tshor ba yid du mi 'ong ba'i skye ba'i rgyu'i rtsa bar gyur pa nyid kyis nad lta bu dang / 'bras bu sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba nyid kyis 'bras lta bu kun 'byung ba dang / tshor ba bzod par dka' ba skye ba'i rkyen du gyur pa nyid kyis zug rngu lta bur rab tu skye ba dang /
translated: The truth of origin is like a disease since it is the root of the origin of unpleasant feeling, like a boil since it is the origin of the result of suffering, like a thorn since it is the condition for the origin of difficult to bear feeling and

original: 'jigs pa mang po brgyud mar 'byung bas rab tu 'joms pa nyid kyis sdig pa lta bu'i rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid kyis rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa mang po brgyud mar 'byung bas rab tu 'joms pa nyid kyis sdig pa lta bu'i rkyen gyi ngo bo nyid kyis rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: like a crime since it is the nature of a condition that completely destroys through the continuous occurrence of many fears.

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba gnyis ka la yang phyir rgol pa gnod par zhugs pas pha rol dgra lta bu dang / gnod pas 'jigs shing yid brtan du mi rung bas 'jig pa'i chos can te yid 'byung ba dag gi mtshan nyid gnyis dang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba gnyis ka la yang phyir rgol pa gnod par zhugs pas pha rol dgra lta bu dang / gnod pas 'jigs shing yid brtan du mi rung bas 'jig pa'i chos can te yid 'byung ba dag gi mtshan nyid gnyis dang /
translated: Both suffering and origin are like enemies since they are adversaries that inflict harm, like destruction since they are the nature of impermanence that is feared and untrustworthy andüîΩlike disgust since they are the characteristics of renunciation.

original: rang gi ngo bo brtan par mi gnas pas g-yo ba dang / rgyu med par ngang gis 'jig pas rab tu 'jig pa ste 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba gnyis dang / 'di dang phyi ma gnod pa'i gnas su gyur pas 'jigs pa dang /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo brtan par mi gnas pas g-yo ba dang / rgyu med par ngang gis 'jig pas rab tu 'jig pa ste 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba gnyis dang / 'di dang phyi ma gnod pa'i gnas su gyur pas 'jigs pa dang /
translated: It is fearsome because it is the basis of harm in this life and the next.

original: sha za la sogs pa gnod par byed pa rnams kyis gnod pa bsgo ba'i gnas yin pas nad 'go ba dang / phyi dang nang gi rkyen sna tshogs pas gtse bar bya ba yin pas 'tshe ba'i rnam pa ste //
analyzed: sha za la sogs pa gnod par byed pa rnams kyis gnod pa bsgo ba'i gnas yin pas nad 'go ba dang / phyi dang nang gi rkyen sna tshogs pas gtse bar bya ba yin pas 'tshe ba'i rnam pa ste //
translated: It is a disease because it is the basis of being afflicted by harm from those who do harm, such as demons. It is a calamity because it is afflicted by various internal and external conditions.

original: 'gog par bya ba 'jug pa'i rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: 'gog par bya ba 'jug pa'i rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: These are the three aspects of being engaged in cessation.

original: de ltar na ngo bo gsum la rab tu dbye bas rnam pa bdun yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na ngo bo gsum la rab tu dbye bas rnam pa bdun yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, it should be understood that the three natures have seven aspects through their divisions.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa ma rig pa la sogs pa 'gags pas 'du byed la sogs pa 'gag pa'i phyir 'gog pa'i ngo bo bdag med pa nyid dang / sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po nye bar stongs pa'i phyir zhi ba nyid dang / sdug bsngal ba dang kun 'byung ba mi gtsang bas dben pa'i phyir gya nom pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa ma rig pa la sogs pa 'gags pas 'du byed la sogs pa 'gag pa'i phyir 'gog pa'i ngo bo bdag med pa nyid dang / sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po nye bar stongs pa'i phyir zhi ba nyid dang / sdug bsngal ba dang kun 'byung ba mi gtsang bas dben pa'i phyir gya nom pa nyid dang /
translated: The truth of cessation is the nature of nonself because it is the cessation of the aggregates due to the cessation of ignorance and so on, it is peace because it is the complete abandonment of the great mass of suffering, it is sublime because it is the separation of suffering and origin from impurity,

original: nges par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid de @26b 'di ltar bdag dang bdag gi ring du spangs pa stong pa nyid dang / rgyu dang rkyen gyis 'dus byas pa'i mtshan ma med pa dang / khams gsum la mngon par dga' ba'i smon pa med pa nyid kyi phyir dang /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid de @26b 'di ltar bdag dang bdag gi ring du spangs pa stong pa nyid dang / rgyu dang rkyen gyis 'dus byas pa'i mtshan ma med pa dang / khams gsum la mngon par dga' ba'i smon pa med pa nyid kyi phyir dang /
translated: and it is the characteristic of definite release because it is emptiness that is the abandonment of self and mine, it is signlessness that is the noncompounded characteristic of causes and conditions, and it is wishlessness that is the absence of desire for the three realms.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i phung po mngon par 'du bya ba med pa nyid kyis de yang ngo bo gcig la rab tu dbye ba rnam pa bdun yin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i phung po mngon par 'du bya ba med pa nyid kyis de yang ngo bo gcig la rab tu dbye ba rnam pa bdun yin no //
translated: It is also a single entity with seven classifications because it is the noncomposition of future aggregates.

original: lam gyi bden pa la mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du 'khrid par byed pa'i lam dang / rigs pa ma yin pa nyon mongs pa rnams kyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir rigs pa dang / phyin ci ma log pa nyid kyi yon tan mtha' yas pa 'byung ba'i phyir sgrub pa dang /
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa la mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du 'khrid par byed pa'i lam dang / rigs pa ma yin pa nyon mongs pa rnams kyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir rigs pa dang / phyin ci ma log pa nyid kyi yon tan mtha' yas pa 'byung ba'i phyir sgrub pa dang /
translated: practice, because it is the source of the infinite qualities of non-error;

original: rtag cing phan pa dam pa'i gnas su phyin par byed pa'i phyir nges par 'byin pa'i rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: rtag cing phan pa dam pa'i gnas su phyin par byed pa'i phyir nges par 'byin pa'i rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: and definite release, because it leads to the state of permanent benefit.

original: de ltar bden pa'i rnam pa de dag ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pa'i sgo nas lam shes pa nyid kyi gnas skabs su nyan thos rnams kyi lam byang chub sems dpas yongs su shes par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar bden pa'i rnam pa de dag ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pa'i sgo nas lam shes pa nyid kyi gnas skabs su nyan thos rnams kyi lam byang chub sems dpas yongs su shes par bya ba yin no //
translated: Thus, these aspects of the truths are to be fully understood by the bodhisattvas as the path in the context of the knowledge of the path, by means of the non-apprehension of their intrinsic reality.

original: bden pa bzhi yongs su shes pa ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pas de'i mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhi gsungs pa /
analyzed: bden pa bzhi yongs su shes pa ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pas de'i mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhi gsungs pa /
translated: Since the full understanding of the four truths is preceded by the factors conducive to penetrative insight, four characteristics of that are stated:

original: 'phags pa nyan thos lam la ni //
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos lam la ni //
translated: The noble Hearers on the path

original: gzugs la sogs pa stong pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa stong pa'i phyir //
translated: of seeing, through the emptiness of form, etc.

original: stong pa nyid rnams dbyer med pas //
analyzed: stong pa nyid rnams dbyer med pas //
translated: The emptinesses are undifferentiated.

original: dro ba de dag mi dmigs pas //
analyzed: dro ba de dag mi dmigs pas //
translated: Through the non-apprehension of those heats,

original: rtse mor gyur pa dag tu 'dod //
analyzed: rtse mor gyur pa dag tu 'dod //
translated: they are considered to be the summits.

original: de la rtag la sogs tshul gyis //
analyzed: de la rtag la sogs tshul gyis //
translated: There, through the method of permanence, etc.

original: gnas pa bkag pas bzod pa rnams //
analyzed: gnas pa bkag pas bzod pa rnams //
translated: The acceptances are explained as the cessation of abiding.

original: sa bcu dag las brtsams nas ni //
analyzed: sa bcu dag las brtsams nas ni //
translated: Beginning with the ten stages,

original: mi gnas rgyas par bstan pa yis //
analyzed: mi gnas rgyas par bstan pa yis //
translated: through the extensive teaching of non-abiding,

original: chos kyi mchog tu gyur bshad de //
analyzed: chos kyi mchog tu gyur bshad de //
translated: the supreme dharmas are explained.

original: ci phyir zhe na sangs rgyas kyis //
analyzed: ci phyir zhe na sangs rgyas kyis //
translated: Why is that? Because the Buddha,

original: mkhyen nas chos rnams ma gzigs phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mkhyen nas chos rnams ma gzigs phyir // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: having known, does not see phenomena.

original: 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams de dag shes pa dang spyod pa thob pa'i gang zag mtha' dag ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir stong pa nyid rnams phan tshun tha dad pa med pa ni dro ba'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams de dag shes pa dang spyod pa thob pa'i gang zag mtha' dag ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir stong pa nyid rnams phan tshun tha dad pa med pa ni dro ba'i rnam pa'o //
translated: Thus, because all phenomena such as form, etc. are empty of inherent nature for the person who has attained their knowledge and practice, the emptinesses are undifferentiated from each other. This is the aspect of heat.

original: gzugs la sogs pa snga ma ltar stong pa nyid kyis mi dmigs pa ni rtse mo'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa snga ma ltar stong pa nyid kyis mi dmigs pa ni rtse mo'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The form, etc. are not perceived as before by means of emptiness, this is the aspect of the summit.

original: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa ma yin no zhes dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas pa bkag pa ni bzod pa'i rnam pa'o//üîΩ@27a * // gang gi phyir yod na thams cad gzigs pa nyid kyi tshad ma skyes bus chos thams cad mkhyen par sangs rgyas nas 'ga' yang ma gzigs par zhes bya ba'i 'thad pas rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa bcu las brtsams te chos thams cad la gnas par
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa ma yin no zhes dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas pa bkag pa ni bzod pa'i rnam pa'o// @27a * // gang gi phyir yod na thams cad gzigs pa nyid kyi tshad ma skyes bus chos thams cad mkhyen par sangs rgyas nas 'ga' yang ma gzigs par zhes bya ba'i 'thad pas rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa bcu las brtsams te chos thams cad la gnas par
translated: Similarly, form, etc. are not permanent, impermanent, etc. The negation of the mode of perception is the aspect of acquiescence.

original: mi bya ba rgyas par bstan pa ni chos kyi mchog tu gyur pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: mi bya ba rgyas par bstan pa ni chos kyi mchog tu gyur pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: Since, when it exists, the omniscience of all things by a person who is the valid cognition of the omniscience of all things is generated, having become a Buddha, there is no perception of any thing, this is the reason. The extensive teaching of the non-abiding in all things beginning with the ten stages such as the Joyous is the aspect of the supreme mundane state.

original: de ltar nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa skye bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa skye bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the factors conducive to insight should be understood.

original: de'i rjes la rang sangs rgyas kyi lam 'chad par mdzad pas re zhig de dag gi lam snga ma las ji ltar khyad zhugs pa nyid du bsgrub pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i rjes la rang sangs rgyas kyi lam 'chad par mdzad pas re zhig de dag gi lam snga ma las ji ltar khyad zhugs pa nyid du bsgrub pa gsungs pa /
translated: After that, he explains the path of the pratyekabuddha. Therefore, he states how their path is superior to the previous one:

original: rang byung bdag nyid rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang byung bdag nyid rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they realize the self-originated,

original: gzhan gyis bstan yang mi dgos la //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bstan yang mi dgos la //
translated: they do not need to be taught by others.

original: bse ru lta bu'i ye shes ni //üîΩzab pa nyid du mngon par brjod //
analyzed: bse ru lta bu'i ye shes ni // zab pa nyid du mngon par brjod //
translated: The knowledge of the rhinoceros-like

original: ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o //
translated: is said to be profound.

original: rang byung bas 'tshang rgya ba nyid dbang po rnon po dang bar ma dang cung zad rtul ba'i bye brag gis gsum ste /
analyzed: rang byung bas 'tshang rgya ba nyid dbang po rnon po dang bar ma dang cung zad rtul ba'i bye brag gis gsum ste /
translated: Because they are self-originated, they are buddhas. They are of three types due to the differences in their faculties, which are sharp, medium, and slightly dull.

original: de dag ni sngon thos pa la sogs pa mngon par 'du byas pas gzhan gyis bstan pa la mi ltos par bdag nyid kyis rang gi byang chub mngon par rtogs par 'gyur pa'i phyir dang / yang gi sgras 'phangs pa gzhan dag la chos ston pa yang sgra la mi ltos pa'i phyir zab ste /
analyzed: de dag ni sngon thos pa la sogs pa mngon par 'du byas pas gzhan gyis bstan pa la mi ltos par bdag nyid kyis rang gi byang chub mngon par rtogs par 'gyur pa'i phyir dang / yang gi sgras 'phangs pa gzhan dag la chos ston pa yang sgra la mi ltos pa'i phyir zab ste /
translated: They are profound because they do not rely on the teachings of others, since they realize their own enlightenment by themselves through the prior conditioning of hearing and so on, and because they teach the dharma to others without relying on words.

original: gang gi phyir sgrar brjod pa ni rnam par g-yeng ba nyid dang / nyan pa po rnams kyis 'chad pa po'i rtsal rtogs par byed na bde blag tu rtogs par 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sgrar brjod pa ni rnam par g-yeng ba nyid dang / nyan pa po rnams kyis 'chad pa po'i rtsal rtogs par byed na bde blag tu rtogs par 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because verbal expression is distraction itself, and if the listeners understand the speaker‚Äôs skill, they will not easily understand.

original: lung dag las /
analyzed: lung dag las /
translated: In the scriptures it is said:

original: nyan thos rnams ni gzhan gyis bstan pa la ltos nas byang chub rtogs par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams ni gzhan gyis bstan pa la ltos nas byang chub rtogs par 'gyur zhing /
translated: The ≈õrƒÅvakas realize enlightenment in dependence on the teachings of others.

original: gzhan dag kyang brjod pa dang bcas pas chos bstan pas dge ba la sbyor bar byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang brjod pa dang bcas pas chos bstan pas dge ba la sbyor bar byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: And others are connected to virtue by the Dharma teaching that is verbal.

original: ji ltar na sgra med par chos ston par rung snyam pa'i dogs pa bsu ba'i lan gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar na sgra med par chos ston par rung snyam pa'i dogs pa bsu ba'i lan gsungs pa /
translated: The answer to the question, ‚ÄúHow can the Dharma be taught without words?‚Äù is stated:

original: gang gang don ni gang gang la //
analyzed: gang gang don ni gang gang la //
translated: Whatever, wherever, and in whatever way

original: ji lta ji ltar nyan 'dod pa //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar nyan 'dod pa //
translated: someone wishes to listen,

original: de de la don de dang de //üîΩsgra med kyang de de ltar snang //
analyzed: de de la don de dang de // sgra med kyang de de ltar snang //
translated: that, there, in that way,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: will appear to them even without words.

original: 'di ltar chos ston pa zhes bya ba'i don ni brjod par bya ba'i don rtogs pa nyan pa po'i rgyud la shin tu bskrun zhing rab tu bskyed pa zhes bya ba 'di yin pas de dag kyang smon lam @27b la sogs pa'i stobs kyis bstan par 'dod pa
analyzed: 'di ltar chos ston pa zhes bya ba'i don ni brjod par bya ba'i don rtogs pa nyan pa po'i rgyud la shin tu bskrun zhing rab tu bskyed pa zhes bya ba 'di yin pas de dag kyang smon lam @27b la sogs pa'i stobs kyis bstan par 'dod pa
translated: They are taught by the power of aspiration prayers and so on.

original: tsam nyid las sgra med kyang gang dang gang zhig don gang dang gang la rnam pa ji lta ji ltar nyan par 'dod cing rigs pa nyid de dang de'i rnam par shes pa la don de dang de dag nyid kyang rnam pa de kho na ltar rnam par
analyzed: tsam nyid las sgra med kyang gang dang gang zhig don gang dang gang la rnam pa ji lta ji ltar nyan par 'dod cing rigs pa nyid de dang de'i rnam par shes pa la don de dang de dag nyid kyang rnam pa de kho na ltar rnam par
translated: The mere wish to teach is the cause, and without sound, the meaning of the object to be expressed appears in the mindstream of the listener in the aspect of the object to be expressed and the mode of expression, just as it is wished to be heard.

original: snang bar 'gyur bas chos ston par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di yang rnam par ma brtags shing ma dpyad par smra ba ni don 'chol bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: snang bar 'gyur bas chos ston par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // 'di yang rnam par ma brtags shing ma dpyad par smra ba ni don 'chol bar 'gyur la /
translated: Thus the Dharma is taught.üîΩThis is stated without analysis or investigation, but if it is analyzed, it is mere verbiage.

original: de las gzhan du tshig tu sbyin pa ni spros par 'gyur ro zhes rigs pa'i dbang gis yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan du tshig tu sbyin pa ni spros par 'gyur ro zhes rigs pa'i dbang gis yin no //
translated: This is the power of reasoning.

original: khyad par de dag gis 'phags pa can gyi lam dngos po gsungs pa /
analyzed: khyad par de dag gis 'phags pa can gyi lam dngos po gsungs pa /
translated: The path of the noble ones is taught as having these special features.üîΩBecause of the abandonment of the discriminations of the apprehended object,

original: gzung don rtog pa spong phyir dang // 'dzin pa ma spangs phyir dang ni //üîΩrten gyis bse ru lta bu'i lam //
analyzed: gzung don rtog pa spong phyir dang // 'dzin pa ma spangs phyir dang ni // rten gyis bse ru lta bu'i lam //
translated: and because of the non-abandonment of the apprehending subject,

original: yang dag bsdus par shes par bya //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag bsdus par shes par bya // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the path of the rhinoceros is to be understood as being summarized in the basis.üîΩThe path of the rhinoceros is to be understood as being summarized in the basis.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i bden pa bsgom pa kho na dang / don ji lta ba bzhin du rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bsgoms pas gzung ba'i don gyi rnam par rtog pa spong ste /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i bden pa bsgom pa kho na dang / don ji lta ba bzhin du rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bsgoms pas gzung ba'i don gyi rnam par rtog pa spong ste /
translated: By the cultivation of the truths as they have been explained, and by the cultivation of dependent origination in its direct order, the discrimination of the apprehended object is abandoned.

original: ma rig pa dang phung po dang bdag la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa rab tu zhi ba nyid do //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang phung po dang bdag la sogs pa la mngon par zhen pa rab tu zhi ba nyid do //
translated: The adherence to the aggregates, the self, ignorance, etc. is completely pacified.

original: 'dis ni nyan thos rnams las rtogs pa'i khyad par ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni nyan thos rnams las rtogs pa'i khyad par ston to //
translated: This shows the difference in realization from the disciples.

original: 'on kyang chos thams cad bdag med par shin tu goms par ma byas pas 'dzin pa'i don gyi rnam par rtog pa spong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang chos thams cad bdag med par shin tu goms par ma byas pas 'dzin pa'i don gyi rnam par rtog pa spong ba ma yin te /
translated: However, the discrimination of the apprehending subject is not abandoned because of the lack of complete familiarity with the selflessness of all things.

original: phung po la sogs pa la mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang ma bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa la mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang ma bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not free from apprehending the aggregates, etc. as signs.

original: 'dis ni theg pa chen po las dman pa'i khyad par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni theg pa chen po las dman pa'i khyad par bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows the superiority of the Mahayana.

original: ye shes la sogs pa zab pa dang bcas pa'i chos nyid bsgrub pa la sogs pa'i rten gyi khyad par dang ldan pa yang yin te /
analyzed: ye shes la sogs pa zab pa dang bcas pa'i chos nyid bsgrub pa la sogs pa'i rten gyi khyad par dang ldan pa yang yin te /
translated: It is also endowed with the special support of the accomplishment of the reality of the profound intuition, etc.

original: de ltar rang sangs rgyas kyi lam yang dag par bsdus pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar rang sangs rgyas kyi lam yang dag par bsdus pa ni /
translated: Thus, the path of the Solitary Buddha is summarized.

original: mi dmigs pa'i sgo nas byang chub sems dpas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i sgo nas byang chub sems dpas shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be known by the Bodhisattva through nonapprehension.

original: lam de sngon du 'gro bas nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa gang dag yin zhe na ;
analyzed: lam de sngon du 'gro bas nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa gang dag yin zhe na ;
translated: What are the factors conducive to penetration that are preceded by that path?

original: de yi yan lag rnam pa bzhi gsungs pa /üîΩbtags pa'i chos nyid mi 'gal bar //
analyzed: de yi yan lag rnam pa bzhi gsungs pa / btags pa'i chos nyid mi 'gal bar //
translated: It is said that they have four branches.üîΩThe noncontradictory nature of the imputed

original: ston pa'i rnam pa dror gyur pa //üîΩrtse mor gyur pa gzugs la sogs //
analyzed: ston pa'i rnam pa dror gyur pa // rtse mor gyur pa gzugs la sogs //
translated: is the aspect of teaching, the state of heat.üîΩThe state of summit is the nonapprehensionüîΩof form, etc., distinguished by nondecrease, etc.

original: 'grib pa med la sogs pas phye //
analyzed: 'grib pa med la sogs pas phye //
translated: The nonapprehension of form, etc.

original: nang stong nyid la sogs pa yis //üîΩgzugs sogs mi 'dzin @28a * //
analyzed: nang stong nyid la sogs pa yis //üîΩgzugs sogs mi 'dzin @28a * //
translated: is by means of the emptiness of internal, etc.

original: phyir bzod pa //üîΩgzugs sogs skye ba med sogs kyi //
analyzed: phyir bzod pa // gzugs sogs skye ba med sogs kyi //
translated: The latter is patience.

original: rnam pa can ni chos kyi mchog / ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa can ni chos kyi mchog / ces bya ba'o //
translated: The supreme mundane qualities are the aspects of nonproduction, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa kun rdzob tu brdar btags shing brjod par bya ba dang / don dam par brjod par bya ba yin pa'i chos nyid dag mi 'gal bar rab tu ston pa can dro bar gyur pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa la don dam par kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba de bdag nyid kyi 'phel ba dang 'grib pa med pa la sogs pa'i don du bslab pa can rtse mor gyur pa dang /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa kun rdzob tu brdar btags shing brjod par bya ba dang / don dam par brjod par bya ba yin pa'i chos nyid dag mi 'gal bar rab tu ston pa can dro bar gyur pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa la don dam par kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba de bdag nyid kyi 'phel ba dang 'grib pa med pa la sogs pa'i don du bslab pa can rtse mor gyur pa dang /
translated: The heat stage is the one that clearly shows, without contradiction, the two realities of the phenomena of form, etc., which are conventionally designated and expressed and ultimately inexpressible. The peak stage is the one that trains in the ultimate nondefilement and nonpurification of form, etc., which are by nature free from increase and decrease, etc.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir gzugs la sogs pa la nang dang phyi dang gnyi ga la sogs pa stong pa nyid kyis yongs su mi 'dzin pa can bzod par gyur pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa la skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa med pa'i rnam pa can chos kyi mchog tu gyur pa ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir gzugs la sogs pa la nang dang phyi dang gnyi ga la sogs pa stong pa nyid kyis yongs su mi 'dzin pa can bzod par gyur pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa la skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa med pa'i rnam pa can chos kyi mchog tu gyur pa ste /
translated: Because of emptiness of intrinsic reality, one becomes patient with the emptiness of internal, external, and both, etc., with regard to form, etc., and one becomes the supreme mundane state with the aspect of the nonexistence of arising, cessation, etc., with regard to form, etc.

original: bden pa rnams la nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag de ltar skye bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bden pa rnams la nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag de ltar skye bar rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the factors of ascertainment with regard to the truths arise in this way.

original: de'i rjes la byang chub sems dpa'i lam bshad par bya ba yin pas thog mar mthong ba'i lam gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i rjes la byang chub sems dpa'i lam bshad par bya ba yin pas thog mar mthong ba'i lam gsungs pa /
translated: Next, the path of the bodhisattva should be explained. First, the path of seeing is stated:üîΩThe path of seeing is the knowledge of the pathüîΩwith four moments of acceptance and

original: bden dang bden la bzod pa dang // shes pa'i skad cig rnam bzhi yis //üîΩlam shes nyid la mthong ba'i lam //
analyzed: bden dang bden la bzod pa dang // shes pa'i skad cig rnam bzhi yis // lam shes nyid la mthong ba'i lam //
translated: knowledge of the truths and their meaning.

original: phan yon bcas pa 'di bshad do //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phan yon bcas pa 'di bshad do //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is explained with its benefits.

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / chos shes pa dang / de bzhin du bden pa de dag la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / rjes su shes pa zhes bya ba skad cig ma rnam pa bzhi ste /üîΩrang gi ngo bo la tshad mar gyur pa skad cig ma gcig dang / rigs dang khyad par dang bden pa'i rab tu dbye ba gnyis dang / bzhi dang bcu drug gi mtshan nyid can tshe 'di dang gzhan pa'i phan yon dang ldan pa ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / chos shes pa dang / de bzhin du bden pa de dag la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / rjes su shes pa zhes bya ba skad cig ma rnam pa bzhi ste / rang gi ngo bo la tshad mar gyur pa skad cig ma gcig dang / rigs dang khyad par dang bden pa'i rab tu dbye ba gnyis dang / bzhi dang bcu drug gi mtshan nyid can tshe 'di dang gzhan pa'i phan yon dang ldan pa ni /
translated: The four moments are the perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering, Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering, perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering and subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lam shes pa nyid kyi skabs su mthong ba'i lam yin par bstan no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lam shes pa nyid kyi skabs su mthong ba'i lam yin par bstan no //
translated: The path of seeing is taught to be the knowledge of the bodhisattva path that possesses the benefits of this life and other lives, which has the characteristics of one moment, two moments, four moments and sixteen moments.

original: bden pa rnams la mngon par rtogs pa'i skad cig ma dag gi rnam pa gang dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: bden pa rnams la mngon par rtogs pa'i skad cig ma dag gi rnam pa gang dag yin zhe na /
translated: What are the aspects of the moments of realization of the truths?

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa re re la bzhi bzhir rnam par dbye bas rnam pa bcu drug gsungs pa /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa re re la bzhi bzhir rnam par dbye bas rnam pa bcu drug gsungs pa /
translated: It is said that there are sixteen aspects because each of the four truths is divided into four.

original: de @28b bzhin nyid dang sangs rgyas dag / phan tshun rten pa rten med phyir //
analyzed: de @28b bzhin nyid dang sangs rgyas dag / phan tshun rten pa rten med phyir //
translated: Suchness and the buddhas are mutually dependent, but not in a relationship of support and supported.üîΩThe enumeration of the qualities is not accepted,üîΩthe great qualities are immeasurable,üîΩimmeasurable, limitless,

original: rnam grangs khas mi len pa dang // chen po tshad ma med bcas dang // tshad med pa dang mtha' med dang // der gnas gzugs la sogs pa la //
analyzed: rnam grangs khas mi len pa dang // chen po tshad ma med bcas dang // tshad med pa dang mtha' med dang // der gnas gzugs la sogs pa la //
translated: and those abiding in form and so onüîΩare ascertained as buddhahood.üîΩThere is no acceptance and no rejection,üîΩlove and so on, emptiness,üîΩattaining buddhahood,

original: sangs rgyas nyid du nges 'dzin dang // blang med dor ba med sogs dang // byams la sogs dang stong nyid dang // sangs rgyas nyid ni 'thob pa dang // rnam par byang chub yongs bsdus dang // nyam nga ba dang nad kun sel //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid du nges 'dzin dang // blang med dor ba med sogs dang // byams la sogs dang stong nyid dang // sangs rgyas nyid ni 'thob pa dang // rnam par byang chub yongs bsdus dang // nyam nga ba dang nad kun sel //
translated: comprehending complete enlightenment,üîΩremoving all distress and illness,üîΩpacifying the apprehension of nirvana,

original: mya ngan 'das 'dzin zhi nyid dang // sangs rgyas rnams kyis bsrung la sogs //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das 'dzin zhi nyid dang // sangs rgyas rnams kyis bsrung la sogs //
translated: being protected by the buddhas,üîΩand so on.

original: srog mi gcod pa la sogs pa //
analyzed: srog mi gcod pa la sogs pa //
translated: Not taking life and so onüîΩare the qualities of the path.

original: rnam pa kun mkhyen tshul la ni //
analyzed: rnam pa kun mkhyen tshul la ni //
translated: Abiding in the knowledge of all aspects,üîΩone establishes sentient beings

original: bdag nyid gnas te sems can dag /'god dang sbyin pa la sogs pa //
analyzed: bdag nyid gnas te sems can dag /'god dang sbyin pa la sogs pa //
translated: in generosity and so on

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo ba //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo ba //
translated: and dedicates to complete enlightenment.

original: lam shes nyid kyi skad cig ma //
analyzed: lam shes nyid kyi skad cig ma //
translated: The moment of knowing the path

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus it is.

original: don dam pa'i tshul nyid kyis yul gang yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / rtogs pa gang yin pa sangs rgyas dag rten dang brten pa'i dngos po med pas de'i phyir de dag phan tshun rnam grangs kyis gnas par khas mi len cing mi ston pa dang /
analyzed: don dam pa'i tshul nyid kyis yul gang yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / rtogs pa gang yin pa sangs rgyas dag rten dang brten pa'i dngos po med pas de'i phyir de dag phan tshun rnam grangs kyis gnas par khas mi len cing mi ston pa dang /
translated: The object is thusness, the mode of the ultimate, and the realization is the buddhas, because they are devoid of the relationship of support and supported. Therefore, they do not accept or teach that they mutually abide in a synonym.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid kyis gzugs dben pa'i bdag nyid chen po nyid dang // de bzhin du de dag la gzhal bar bya ba las yang dag par 'das pas tshad med pa dang / snga ma ltar nam mkha' tshad med pa nyid rdul phra rab la sogs pa tshad med pa zhes bya ba bzhin ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid kyis gzugs dben pa'i bdag nyid chen po nyid dang // de bzhin du de dag la gzhal bar bya ba las yang dag par 'das pas tshad med pa dang / snga ma ltar nam mkha' tshad med pa nyid rdul phra rab la sogs pa tshad med pa zhes bya ba bzhin ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag yin no //
translated: The great nature of the emptiness of form by the nature of the dharmadhatu, and similarly, they are immeasurable because they transcend being measured, like the immeasurability of space is called the immeasurability of atoms and so on. These are the aspects of the perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering and so on.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa la rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' la sogs pa dang / chos kyi dbyings ngo bo nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du gnas pa ni lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi sangs rgyas nyid du des par gzung bar bya ba dang /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa la rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' la sogs pa dang / chos kyi dbyings ngo bo nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa'i bdag nyid du gnas pa ni lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi sangs rgyas nyid du des par gzung bar bya ba dang /
translated: The four aspects of the truth of origin that are the object of the perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of origin are:üîΩthe reality realm is the nature of form and so on,üîΩthe reality realm is the nature of form and so on,üîΩthe reality realm is the nature of form and so on,
