original: gnyug ma'i rang bzhin kho nas @29a * //
analyzed: gnyug ma'i rang bzhin kho nas @29a * //
translated: the reality realm is the nature of form and so on,üîΩthe reality realm is the

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo stong pa nyid dang / de nyid dang ro gcig pa nyid kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi 'bras bu de bzhin gshegs par bsngos pas de 'thob par byed pa dang / de bzhin du rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid du bsdus pa dang /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo stong pa nyid dang / de nyid dang ro gcig pa nyid kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi 'bras bu de bzhin gshegs par bsngos pas de 'thob par byed pa dang / de bzhin du rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid du bsdus pa dang /
translated: Similarly, all phenomena of purification are included in the perfection of wisdom in every way.

original: de bzhin nyid kyis phyi dang nang gi ya nga ba dang nad la sogs pa'i 'tshe ba rab tu zhi ba zhes bya ba bzhi ni 'gog pa'i bden pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag go //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyis phyi dang nang gi ya nga ba dang nad la sogs pa'i 'tshe ba rab tu zhi ba zhes bya ba bzhi ni 'gog pa'i bden pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag go //
translated: The pacification of all inner and outer dangers such as disease through suchness are the aspects of the perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of cessation and so on.

original: rang bzhin med pa rnam par sgom pa kho nas mya ngan las 'das pa nyid thob par bya bar mngon par zhen pa dang bral pa dang / shes rab dang thabs mkhas pa la zhugs pa nyid kyis sangs rgyas rnams kyis bsrung ba dang bskyab pa dang sba ba dag mdzad pa dang /
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa rnam par sgom pa kho nas mya ngan las 'das pa nyid thob par bya bar mngon par zhen pa dang bral pa dang / shes rab dang thabs mkhas pa la zhugs pa nyid kyis sangs rgyas rnams kyis bsrung ba dang bskyab pa dang sba ba dag mdzad pa dang /
translated: They are free from the attachment that thinks that one attains nirvana by meditating on the absence of intrinsic existence alone, they are protected, guarded and concealed by the buddhas because they are engaged in wisdom and skillful means,üîΩthey abide in the abandonment of taking life and so on and they establish others in it because they aspire to buddhahood and they dedicate all their generosity and so on to perfect enlightenment because they are inexhaustible and perfect.

original: sangs rgyas nyid mngon par 'dod pas srog gcod pa spong ba la sogs pa la bdag nyid gnas shing gzhan yang dag par 'god pa dang / mi zad cing phun sum tshogs par bya ba nyid kyis sbyin pa la sogs pa thams cad yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo bar bya ba bzhi ni lam gyi bden pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid mngon par 'dod pas srog gcod pa spong ba la sogs pa la bdag nyid gnas shing gzhan yang dag par 'god pa dang / mi zad cing phun sum tshogs par bya ba nyid kyis sbyin pa la sogs pa thams cad yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo bar bya ba bzhi ni lam gyi bden pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag yin te /
translated: These four are the aspects of Dharma knowledge of the truth of path and so on.

original: de ltar na lam shes pa nyid kyi skad cig ma bcu drug yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na lam shes pa nyid kyi skad cig ma bcu drug yin no //
translated: Thus there are sixteen moments of the knowledge of the path.

original: de'i phyir tshig le'ur byas pa'i don nye bar mtshon pa lhur len pa'i gzhung gis skad cig ma bcu drug gis ye shes nyi tshe ba bstan par ma zad /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshig le'ur byas pa'i don nye bar mtshon pa lhur len pa'i gzhung gis skad cig ma bcu drug gis ye shes nyi tshe ba bstan par ma zad /
translated: Therefore, one should understand that the treatise which is intent on illustrating the meaning of the verses not only teaches a limited pristine wisdom through the sixteen moments,

original: rnam pa dang bcas pa'i don nyid kyang rnam par mtshon par zad do zhes rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa dang bcas pa'i don nyid kyang rnam par mtshon par zad do zhes rig par bya'o //
translated: but also illustrates the meaning of the aspect.

original: de'i rjes la mthong ba'i don goms par bya ba brjod par rigs pa las brjod par bya ba nyung ba nyid dang / 'bras bu shes pas de la gzhol bar ba sgrub pa'i phyir bsgom pa'i lam gyi byed pa gsungs pa //
analyzed: de'i rjes la mthong ba'i don goms par bya ba brjod par rigs pa las brjod par bya ba nyung ba nyid dang / 'bras bu shes pas de la gzhol bar ba sgrub pa'i phyir bsgom pa'i lam gyi byed pa gsungs pa //
translated: After that, it is appropriate to explain the cultivation of the meaning that is seen. Since the meaning that is to be explained is brief, and since the path of cultivation is taught in order to establish the result that is to be known, the function of the path of cultivation is stated:

original: kun nas dul dang thams cad la //
analyzed: kun nas dul dang thams cad la //
translated: Complete self-control, respect for all,üîΩvictory over the afflictions,üîΩbeing unmoved by harm,

original: 'dud dang nyon mongs las rgyal dang // gnod pas brdzi ba med nyid dang // byang chub dang ni rten mchod nyid //
analyzed: 'dud dang nyon mongs las rgyal dang // gnod pas brdzi ba med nyid dang // byang chub dang ni rten mchod nyid //
translated: enlightenment, and worship of the support.

original: ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o //
translated: This is stated.

original: rnal 'byor dang ldan pas /
analyzed: rnal 'byor dang ldan pas /
translated: One who possesses yoga

original: rnam pa thams cad du sems la rang @29b dbang nyid du byed pa dang / nga rgyal dang bral pas skye bo thams cad bla mar gyur pa rnams la rab tu 'dud pa dang / gnyen po stobs dang ldan pa nyid thob pas 'dod chags la sogs pa'i g-yul las rgyal ba dang /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du sems la rang @29b dbang nyid du byed pa dang / nga rgyal dang bral pas skye bo thams cad bla mar gyur pa rnams la rab tu 'dud pa dang / gnyen po stobs dang ldan pa nyid thob pas 'dod chags la sogs pa'i g-yul las rgyal ba dang /
translated: They have complete mastery over their minds in every respect, they bow down to all beings who are their gurus because they are free of pride, they have conquered the battle against attachment and so forth because they have acquired powerful antidotes,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems kyis shes rab kyi pha rol phyin pa shin tu bsgoms pas pha rol gyi gnod pa rjes su bsgrub pa'i yul du mi 'gyur pa dang / rgyur gyur pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su bsgoms shing rdzogs par byas pas 'bras bu yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang nye bar gyur pa dang /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems kyis shes rab kyi pha rol phyin pa shin tu bsgoms pas pha rol gyi gnod pa rjes su bsgrub pa'i yul du mi 'gyur pa dang / rgyur gyur pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su bsgoms shing rdzogs par byas pas 'bras bu yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang nye bar gyur pa dang /
translated: they are not affected by the harm of others because they have cultivated the perfection of wisdom with the mind of omniscience and they are close to perfect complete enlightenment because they have fully cultivated and completed the causal perfections.

original: yon tan bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gzhir gyur pas mchod par bya ba'i rten nyid du byed pa ste /
analyzed: yon tan bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gzhir gyur pas mchod par bya ba'i rten nyid du byed pa ste /
translated: They are the very basis of worship because they are the basis of inconceivable qualities.

original: bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa rnams kyi byed pa ni drug po de dag go //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam la gnas pa rnams kyi byed pa ni drug po de dag go //
translated: The function of those who abide in the path of cultivation is these six.

original: drug po de'i 'og tu yon tan de dag gang gis thos pa dang / bsgom pa'i lam nyid 'chad par mdzad pas re zhig zag pa dang bcas pa'i bsgom pa'i lam dang po mos pa yid la byed pa gsungs pa //üîΩmos pa rang gi don dang ni //
analyzed: drug po de'i 'og tu yon tan de dag gang gis thos pa dang / bsgom pa'i lam nyid 'chad par mdzad pas re zhig zag pa dang bcas pa'i bsgom pa'i lam dang po mos pa yid la byed pa gsungs pa // mos pa rang gi don dang ni //
translated: After these six, in order to explain the path of cultivation itself, which is the hearing and contemplation of those qualities, he first speaks of the attention of conviction on the path of cultivation with outflows.üîΩThe attention of conviction is threefold:üîΩfor one's own benefit,

original: rang gzhan don dang gzhan don dang // rnam gsum shes bya de yang ni //
analyzed: rang gzhan don dang gzhan don dang // rnam gsum shes bya de yang ni //
translated: for the benefit of oneself and others,üîΩand for the benefit of others.

original: chung dang 'bring dang chen po ste //
analyzed: chung dang 'bring dang chen po ste //
translated: It is small, middling, and great,

original: so sor rnam pa gsum du 'dod //üîΩchung ngu'i chung sogs dbye ba yis //
analyzed: so sor rnam pa gsum du 'dod // chung ngu'i chung sogs dbye ba yis //
translated: and each is considered threefold.

original: de yang rnam gsum de ltar na //üîΩrnam pa nyi shu bdun du 'dod //
analyzed: de yang rnam gsum de ltar na // rnam pa nyi shu bdun du 'dod //
translated: It is also threefold by the division of small of the small and so on.

original: ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o //
translated: Thus it is asserted to be of twenty seven types.

original: rang dang gnyis ka dang gzhan kho na'i don la dmigs pa nyid dang por mngon du mi byed na yang ji ltar mos pa bzhin mthong bas dge ba'i chos kyi rten du gyur pa gsum du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rang dang gnyis ka dang gzhan kho na'i don la dmigs pa nyid dang por mngon du mi byed na yang ji ltar mos pa bzhin mthong bas dge ba'i chos kyi rten du gyur pa gsum du shes par bya'o //
translated: Even though one does not initially make manifest the three kinds of will that focus on one's own aim, the aim of others, and the aim of both, one should know that one has the three kinds of will that are the basis of the virtues, because one sees in accordance with one's aspiration.üîΩEach of these three kinds of will is threefold, according to its lesser, middling, or greater stage.

original: de dag kyang re re zhing chung ngu la sogs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum gsum dang / de yang so sor chung ngu'i chung ngu la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba gsum gsum gyis dgu dgu ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang re re zhing chung ngu la sogs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum gsum dang / de yang so sor chung ngu'i chung ngu la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba gsum gsum gyis dgu dgu ste /
translated: And each of these is threefold, according to its lesser, middling, or greater stage.

original: de ltar dgu phrag gsum gyis mos pa nyi shu rtsa bdun no ;
analyzed: de ltar dgu phrag gsum gyis mos pa nyi shu rtsa bdun no ;
translated: Thus, there are twenty-seven kinds of will, nine groups of three.

original: / de la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mos pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung la mchod pa bas lhag go zhes bya ba dang / de'i che ba ma shes pas nyung ba'i don la mos pa nyid dang / sangs rgyas bzhugs sam mi bzhugs kyang rung ste ston pa nyid du 'du shes pa @30a * //
analyzed: / de la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mos pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung la mchod pa bas lhag go zhes bya ba dang / de'i che ba ma shes pas nyung ba'i don la mos pa nyid dang / sangs rgyas bzhugs sam mi bzhugs kyang rung ste ston pa nyid du 'du shes pa @30a * //
translated: Among these, the will to the perfection of wisdom is superior to the worship of the relics of the Tathagata.

original: zhes bya ba dag ni rang gi don can gyi mos pa chung ngu'i chung ngu la sogs pa yin no //üîΩring bsrel gyi snying po can gyi mchod rten bye ba byas pa dang / 'dzam bu'i gling gang ba nyid dang / gling bzhi gang ba la mchod pa bas lhag go zhes bya ba dag ni 'bring gi chung ngu la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dag ni rang gi don can gyi mos pa chung ngu'i chung ngu la sogs pa yin no // ring bsrel gyi snying po can gyi mchod rten bye ba byas pa dang / 'dzam bu'i gling gang ba nyid dang / gling bzhi gang ba la mchod pa bas lhag go zhes bya ba dag ni 'bring gi chung ngu la sogs pa yin no //
translated: These are the small of the small and so on of the interest that is for one's own benefit.üîΩIt is better to make offerings to a single being who has entered the fixed condition of the bodhisattva than to world-realms filled with the buddhas and pratyekabuddhas and shravakas, and to world-realms filled with the buddhas and shravakas and pratyekabuddhas, and to world-realms filled with the buddhas and shravakas and pratyekabuddhas and bodhisattvas.üîΩIt is better to make offerings to a single being who has entered the fixed condition of the pratyekabuddha than to world-realms filled with the buddhas and shravakas and pratyekabuddhas and bodhisattvas.üîΩIt is better to make offerings to a single being who has entered the fixed condition of the shravaka than to world-realms filled with the buddhas and shravakas and pratyekabuddhas and bodhisattvas.üîΩIt is better to make offerings to a single being who has entered the right and perfect enlightenment than to world-realms filled with the buddhas and shravakas and pratyekabuddhas and bodhisattvas.üîΩIt is better to make offerings to a single being who has generated the first production of the thought of enlightenment than to world-realms filled with the buddhas and shravakas and pratyekabuddhas and bodhisattvas.üîΩIt is better to make offerings to a single being who has generated the second production of the thought of enlightenment than to world-realms filled with the buddhas and shravakas and pratyekabuddhas and bodhisattvas.üîΩIt is better to make offerings to a single being who has generated the third production of the thought of enlightenment than to world-realms filled with the buddhas and shravakas and pratyekabuddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: de lta bu'i mchod rten stong spyi phud dang / stong gnyis par ma dang / stong gsum gang ba la mchod pa bas lhag go zhes bya ba dag ni chen po'i chung ngu la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i mchod rten stong spyi phud dang / stong gnyis par ma dang / stong gsum gang ba la mchod pa bas lhag go zhes bya ba dag ni chen po'i chung ngu la sogs pa yin no //
translated: It is better to make offerings to a single being who has generated the fourth production of the thought of enlightenment than to world-realms filled with the buddhas and shravakas and pratyekabuddhas and bodhisattvas.üîΩIt is better to make offerings to a single being who has generated the fifth production of the thought of enlightenment than to world-realms filled with the buddhas and

original: stong gsum gyi sems can re res de lta bu'i mchod rten mchod pa nyid dang / dkon mchog gsum gyi gdung rgyun mi 'chad par byed cing lha ma yin gyi g-yul zlog par byed pa nyid dang / pha rol tu phyin pa lnga yongs su rdzogs par bya ba bas lhag go zhes bya ba dag ni rang dang gzhan gnyis ka'i don can gyi mos chung ngu'i chung ngu la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: stong gsum gyi sems can re res de lta bu'i mchod rten mchod pa nyid dang / dkon mchog gsum gyi gdung rgyun mi 'chad par byed cing lha ma yin gyi g-yul zlog par byed pa nyid dang / pha rol tu phyin pa lnga yongs su rdzogs par bya ba bas lhag go zhes bya ba dag ni rang dang gzhan gnyis ka'i don can gyi mos chung ngu'i chung ngu la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The thought It is better to make offerings to each of the sentient beings of the trichiliocosm with such stupas, to cause the lineage of the Three Jewels to be uninterrupted, to avert the wars of the demigods, and to perfect the five perfections is the small of the small and so on that are for the sake of both oneself and others.

original: 'jig rten dang nyan thos las khyad par du 'phags pa'i phung po lnga thob pa nyid dang / lha rnams kyi spobs pa nye bar bsgrub pa nyid dang / skye bo dam pa rnams kyis bkur bar bya'o zhes bya ba dag ni 'bring gi chung ngu la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang nyan thos las khyad par du 'phags pa'i phung po lnga thob pa nyid dang / lha rnams kyi spobs pa nye bar bsgrub pa nyid dang / skye bo dam pa rnams kyis bkur bar bya'o zhes bya ba dag ni 'bring gi chung ngu la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The thought I will attain the five aggregates that are superior to those of the mundane beings and sravakas, I will accomplish the eloquence of the gods, and I will be revered by holy beings is the medium of the small and so on.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa gzhan gyis mi 'phrogs pa nyid dang / lha rnams la chos kyi sbyin pa mchog tu 'gyur ba nyid dang / lus dang sems rab tu dang zhing gzi brjid skyed pa la sogs pa dag ni chen po'i chung ngu la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa gzhan gyis mi 'phrogs pa nyid dang / lha rnams la chos kyi sbyin pa mchog tu 'gyur ba nyid dang / lus dang sems rab tu dang zhing gzi brjid skyed pa la sogs pa dag ni chen po'i chung ngu la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The small of the small and so on of the other four, generosity and so on, are the non-deprivability by others, the supreme gift of Dharma to the gods, the generation of physical and mental clarity and splendor and so on.üîΩThe small of the small and so on of the other four, generosity and so on, are the non-deprivability by others, the supreme gift of Dharma to the gods, the generation of physical and mental clarity and splendor and so on.üîΩThe small of the small and so on of the other four, generosity and so on, are the non-deprivability by others, the supreme gift of Dharma to the gods, the generation of physical and mental clarity and splendor and so on.üîΩThe small of the small and so on of the other four, generosity and so on, are the non-deprivability by others, the supreme gift of Dharma to the gods, the generation of physical and mental clarity and splendor and so on.üîΩThe small of the small and so on of the other four, generosity and so on, are the non-deprivability by others, the supreme gift of Dharma to the gods, the generation of physical and mental clarity and splendor and so on.üîΩThe small of the small and so on of the other four, generosity and so on, are the non-deprivability by others, the supreme gift of Dharma to the gods, the generation of physical and mental clarity and splendor and so on.üîΩThe small of the small and so on of the other four, generosity and so on, are the non-deprivability by others, the supreme gift of Dharma to the gods, the generation of physical and mental clarity and splendor and so on.üîΩThe small of the small and so on of the other four, generosity and so on, are the non-deprivability by others, the supreme gift of Dharma to the gods, the generation of physical and mental clarity and splendor and so on.

original: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas 'khor dang bcas pa mchod pa bas lhag go zhes bya ba dang ; 'dzam bu'i gling sku gdung gis gang ba bas gdams par bya ba nyid dang / ngan 'gro dang theg pa dman pa'i 'jigs pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba dag ni gzhan gyi don can gyi mos pa chung ngu'i chung ngu la sogs pa yin no //
