translated: The small of the small and so on of the other four, generosity and so on, are the non-deprivability by others, the supreme gift of Dharma to the gods, the generation of physical and mental clarity and splendor and so on.üîΩThe small of the small and so on of the other four, generosity and so on, are the non-deprivability by others, the supreme gift of Dharma to the gods, the generation of physical and mental clarity and

original: stong gsum gyi 'jig rten gyi khams sku gdung gis gang babs gdams par bya ba dang / phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi gsung rab mtha' dag bstan pa nyid 'dra ba nyid dang / rgyal po ltar 'jigs pa thams cad la yang ba med pa zhes bya ba dag ni 'bring gi chung ngu la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: stong gsum gyi 'jig rten gyi khams sku gdung gis gang babs gdams par bya ba dang / phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi gsung rab mtha' dag bstan pa nyid 'dra ba nyid dang / rgyal po ltar 'jigs pa thams cad la yang ba med pa zhes bya ba dag ni 'bring gi chung ngu la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The middle of the small and so on are: filling the trichiliocosm with relics, teaching all the scriptures of the Tathagatas of the ten directions, and being fearless like a king in all fears.

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig @30b rten gyi khams sku gdung gis gang ba bas gdams par bya ba dang / dus gsum gyi 'phags pa thams cad kyi byang chub rjes su 'thob pa nyid dang pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs pa'i sngon du 'gro ba zhes bya ba dag ni chen po'i chung ngu la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig @30b rten gyi khams sku gdung gis gang ba bas gdams par bya ba dang / dus gsum gyi 'phags pa thams cad kyi byang chub rjes su 'thob pa nyid dang pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs pa'i sngon du 'gro ba zhes bya ba dag ni chen po'i chung ngu la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The small of the great and so on are: filling the world systems of the ten directions with relics, attaining the enlightenment of all noble ones of the three times, and being the forerunner in perfecting the six perfections.

original: phyogs bcur mos pa de dag sgom pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni cher spro ba bskyed pa'i mngon sum du sangs rgyas la sogs pa yon tan yang dag par brjod par mdzad par 'gyur bas bstod pa la sogs pa gsungs pa /üîΩshes rab pha rol phyin pa la //üîΩmos pa'i gnas skabs rnams la ni //
analyzed: phyogs bcur mos pa de dag sgom pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni cher spro ba bskyed pa'i mngon sum du sangs rgyas la sogs pa yon tan yang dag par brjod par mdzad par 'gyur bas bstod pa la sogs pa gsungs pa / shes rab pha rol phyin pa la // mos pa'i gnas skabs rnams la ni //
translated: The bodhisattvas who aspire to the ten directions and meditate on them will be directly inspired by the buddhas and so forth to speak praises and so on, to perfectly proclaim their good qualities.üîΩPraises,üîΩhonors, and fame

original: dgu tshan gsum gyis bstod pa dang // bkur ba dang ni bsngags par 'dod //üîΩces bya ba'o //
analyzed: dgu tshan gsum gyis bstod pa dang // bkur ba dang ni bsngags par 'dod // ces bya ba'o //
translated: are desired in the three sets of nineüîΩin the stage of aspiration for the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar ba mos pa bzhin mthong ba'i chos kyi mtshan nyid mos pa yid la byed pa dang po la bstod pa dang / gnyis pa la bkur ba dang / gsum pa la bsngags pa rnams gsungs pas gong nas gong du mngon par dga' ba dang /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ji ltar ba mos pa bzhin mthong ba'i chos kyi mtshan nyid mos pa yid la byed pa dang po la bstod pa dang / gnyis pa la bkur ba dang / gsum pa la bsngags pa rnams gsungs pas gong nas gong du mngon par dga' ba dang /
translated: In the first attention of aspiration, which has the nature of seeing the Dharma as it is aspired to in the perfection of wisdom, praises are spoken; in the second, honors; and in the third, fame.

original: dang ba dang / gus par byed par 'gyur bar 'dod de /
analyzed: dang ba dang / gus par byed par 'gyur bar 'dod de /
translated: Thus, it is desired that one will be increasingly delighted,üîΩclear, and respectful.

original: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bdag nyid 'dzin pa bas slong pa la sbyin pa don che ba nyid dang / de bas snod du rung ba'i drung du song ste byin pa dang / 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can dge ba bcu la bkod pa bas sems can gcig nyid 'bras bu dang po la bkod pa dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bdag nyid 'dzin pa bas slong pa la sbyin pa don che ba nyid dang / de bas snod du rung ba'i drung du song ste byin pa dang / 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can dge ba bcu la bkod pa bas sems can gcig nyid 'bras bu dang po la bkod pa dang /
translated: It is more meaningful to establish a single sentient being in the first result than to establish the sentient beings of Jambudvƒ´pa in the ten virtues.üîΩIt is more meaningful to establish a single sentient being in the second result, in the third result, in the fourth result and in pratyekabuddhahood than to establish all the sentient beings of Jambudvƒ´pa in the first result.

original: gnyis pa la bkod pa dang / gsum pa la bkod pa dang / bzhi pa la bkod pa dang / rang byang chub la bkod pa bas don che ba nyid dang / 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can thams cad 'bras bu dang po la bkod pa bas sems can gcig nyid rdzogs pa'i byang chub la bkod pa dang /
analyzed: gnyis pa la bkod pa dang / gsum pa la bkod pa dang / bzhi pa la bkod pa dang / rang byang chub la bkod pa bas don che ba nyid dang / 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can thams cad 'bras bu dang po la bkod pa bas sems can gcig nyid rdzogs pa'i byang chub la bkod pa dang /
translated: It is more meaningful to establish a single sentient being in complete enlightenment than to establish all the sentient beings of Jambudvƒ´pa in the first result.üîΩIt is more meaningful to establish all the sentient beings of Jambudvƒ´pa in the second result than to establish a single sentient being in complete enlightenment.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can thams cad 'bras bu gnyis pa la bkod pa bas don che'o zhes bya ba rnams ni bstod pa rnams pa dgu yin no //
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can thams cad 'bras bu gnyis pa la bkod pa bas don che'o zhes bya ba rnams ni bstod pa rnams pa dgu yin no //
translated: These are the nine kinds of praise.

original: sems can gcig nyid rdzogs pa'i byang chub la bkod na 'dzam bu'i gling ge sems can thams cad 'bras bu gsum pa la bkod pa bas don che ba dang / bzhi ba la bkod pa dang / rang byang chub la bkod pas bas don che ba nyid dang /
analyzed: sems can gcig nyid rdzogs pa'i byang chub la bkod na 'dzam bu'i gling ge sems can thams cad 'bras bu gsum pa la bkod pa bas don che ba dang / bzhi ba la bkod pa dang / rang byang chub la bkod pas bas don che ba nyid dang /
translated: It is more meaningful to establish a single being in perfect enlightenment than to establish all the beings of Jambudvipa in the three results of the sravaka path, in the result of a pratyekabuddha, or in the result of a bodhisattva.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling ge sems can dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la bkod pa bas 'di'i glegs ba ma bsgrub @31a * //
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling ge sems can dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la bkod pa bas 'di'i glegs ba ma bsgrub @31a * //
translated: It is more meaningful to give a copy of this text to someone than to establish all the beings of Jambudvipa in the ten virtuous actions.

original: pa'i phyir byin pa don che ba nyid dang / 'di'i don gnyis su med par ston pa dang / 'di'i don dang yi ge dang ldan par ston pa don che ba nyid dang / phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas la mchod pa bas 'di'i don dang yi ge ma nor bar ston pa don che ba nyid dang /
analyzed: pa'i phyir byin pa don che ba nyid dang / 'di'i don gnyis su med par ston pa dang / 'di'i don dang yi ge dang ldan par ston pa don che ba nyid dang / phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas la mchod pa bas 'di'i don dang yi ge ma nor bar ston pa don che ba nyid dang /
translated: It is more meaningful to teach the nondual meaning of this text than to make offerings to the buddhas of the ten directions. It is more meaningful to teach the meaning and the words of this text correctly than to make offerings to the buddhas of the ten directions.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bskal pa grangs med par pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad pa bas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis 'di'i don dang yi ge dang ldan par ston pa don che ba dang / phyogs bcu'i bar gyi sems can thams cad 'bras bu dang po la bkod pa bas 'di'i don dang yi ge dang ldan par bstan cing gdams na don che'o zhes bya ba rnams ni bkur ba rnam pa dgu yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bskal pa grangs med par pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad pa bas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis 'di'i don dang yi ge dang ldan par ston pa don che ba dang / phyogs bcu'i bar gyi sems can thams cad 'bras bu dang po la bkod pa bas 'di'i don dang yi ge dang ldan par bstan cing gdams na don che'o zhes bya ba rnams ni bkur ba rnam pa dgu yin no //
translated: These are the nine kinds of respect.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can 'bras bu gnyis pa la bkod pa bas don che ba nyid dang / gsum pa la bkod pa dang / bzhi pa la bkod pa dang / rang byang chub la bkod pa dang / rdzogs pa'i byang chub la bskul ba bas don che ba nyid dang /
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can 'bras bu gnyis pa la bkod pa bas don che ba nyid dang / gsum pa la bkod pa dang / bzhi pa la bkod pa dang / rang byang chub la bkod pa dang / rdzogs pa'i byang chub la bskul ba bas don che ba nyid dang /
translated: It is more meaningful to establish the sentient beings of Jambudvƒ´pa in the second result, in the third result, in the fourth result, in solitary buddhahood, and in complete buddhahood than to establish all sentient beings in the ten directions in the first result.

original: gling bzhi'i sems can thams cad la rdzogs pa'i byang chub la bskul ba dang / stong spyi phud dang / stong gnyis pa dang / stong gsum gyi sems can thams cad la bskul ba dang / phyogs bcu'i bar gyi sems can thams cad phyir mi ldog pa la bkod pa bas phyir mi ldog pa 'ga' zhig myur du rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi phyir ston cing nye bar gdams pa don che'o zhes bya ba rnams ni bsngags pa rnam pa dgu yin te /
analyzed: gling bzhi'i sems can thams cad la rdzogs pa'i byang chub la bskul ba dang / stong spyi phud dang / stong gnyis pa dang / stong gsum gyi sems can thams cad la bskul ba dang / phyogs bcu'i bar gyi sems can thams cad phyir mi ldog pa la bkod pa bas phyir mi ldog pa 'ga' zhig myur du rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi phyir ston cing nye bar gdams pa don che'o zhes bya ba rnams ni bsngags pa rnam pa dgu yin te /
translated: These are the nine kinds of praise.

original: 'di dag ni don yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin thob pa'i mtshan nyid can yin gyi gcam bu'i ngo bo ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag ni don yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin thob pa'i mtshan nyid can yin gyi gcam bu'i ngo bo ni ma yin no //
translated: These are the characteristics of attaining the perfect meaning as it is, and not of flattery.

original: mos pa rnam par bsags pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams ni chud mi za zhing 'bras bu mchog gi rgyur yongs su bsgrub dgos pas de'i rjes la bsngo ba yid la byed pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: mos pa rnam par bsags pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams ni chud mi za zhing 'bras bu mchog gi rgyur yongs su bsgrub dgos pas de'i rjes la bsngo ba yid la byed pa gsungs pa /
translated: The attention of dedication is stated after the roots of virtue of accumulated interest, because they should not be wasted and should be fully accomplished as the cause of supreme fruit.

original: yongs su bsngo ba khyad par can //
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba khyad par can //
translated: The dedication is special.

original: de yi byed pa mchog yin no //üîΩde ni dmigs med rnam pa can //
analyzed: de yi byed pa mchog yin no // de ni dmigs med rnam pa can //
translated: It is the supreme activity.üîΩIt has the aspect of non-apprehension.

original: phyin ci ma log mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log mtshan nyid do //
translated: It has the characteristic of non-distortion.

original: bden dang sangs rgyas bsod nams tshogs //
analyzed: bden dang sangs rgyas bsod nams tshogs //
translated: It is the truth, the accumulation of merit of the Buddhas,

original: rang bzhin dran pa'i spyod yul can //
analyzed: rang bzhin dran pa'i spyod yul can //
translated: The sphere of mindfulness of the nature,üîΩThe signless together with the means,üîΩThe rejoicing in the Buddhas,üîΩThe non-inclusion in the three realms,

original: thabs bcas mtshan ma med pa dang // sangs rgyas rjes su yi rang dang // khams gsum gtogs pa ma yin dang // chung dang 'bring dang @31b chen po yi //
analyzed: thabs bcas mtshan ma med pa dang // sangs rgyas rjes su yi rang dang // khams gsum gtogs pa ma yin dang // chung dang 'bring dang @31b chen po yi //
translated: The small, medium, and great

original: bsngo ba gzhan ni rnam gsum po //
analyzed: bsngo ba gzhan ni rnam gsum po //
translated: The other dedications are threefold.

original: bsod nams che 'byung bdag nyid do //
analyzed: bsod nams che 'byung bdag nyid do //
translated: They are the source of great merit.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub la sogs pa yul khyad par theg pa gsum gyi lam ston pa'i rgyur gyur pa nyid kyis byed pa mchog tu gyur pa dang / der bsngo ba rab tu dbye ba ni bsngo bar bya ba nyid kyis rdzas yang dag par mi dmigs pa /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub la sogs pa yul khyad par theg pa gsum gyi lam ston pa'i rgyur gyur pa nyid kyis byed pa mchog tu gyur pa dang / der bsngo ba rab tu dbye ba ni bsngo bar bya ba nyid kyis rdzas yang dag par mi dmigs pa /
translated: The supreme activity is due to the special object, such as unsurpassed enlightenment, and the cause of revealing the path of the three vehicles. The classification of dedication is the non-apprehension of the substance itself due to being the very dedication.

original: bsngo ba byed pa nyid sems phyin ci ma log pa'i mtshan nyid dang / bsngos pa'i 'bras bu bsod nams mngon par 'du bya ba dang / byed pa pos dben pa dang / dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs kyi rang bzhin dag skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa dang tha mi dad pa dran pa dang /
analyzed: bsngo ba byed pa nyid sems phyin ci ma log pa'i mtshan nyid dang / bsngos pa'i 'bras bu bsod nams mngon par 'du bya ba dang / byed pa pos dben pa dang / dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs kyi rang bzhin dag skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa dang tha mi dad pa dran pa dang /
translated: The dedication itself is the characteristic of the unmistaken mind, the merit of the dedicated result is the formation of merit, the absence of an agent is the absence of a self of persons, and the recollection of the nature of the accumulation of the roots of virtue of the tathƒÅgatas of the three times as being unborn, unceasing, and undifferentiated is the absence of a self of phenomena.

original: thabs la mkhas pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi dge ba'i rtsa bar ma zhen pa dang / bkag pa nyid kyis mtshan mar 'dzin pa med pa dang / kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa'i ngo bos yongs su bsngo bas sangs rgyas dgyes pa dang /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi dge ba'i rtsa bar ma zhen pa dang / bkag pa nyid kyis mtshan mar 'dzin pa med pa dang / kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa'i ngo bos yongs su bsngo bas sangs rgyas dgyes pa dang /
translated: Skill in means is not clinging to the roots of virtue of the six perfections, and by virtue of that prohibition, there is no apprehension of signs, and by dedicating with the essence that is the naturelessness of the relative and ultimate, the buddhas are pleased.

original: khams gsum las 'das par bsngo bas khams gsum par gtogs pa ma yin pa dang / dge ba bcu la sogs pa'i las kyi lam la gnas pa ste chung ngu dang / rgyun tu zhugs pa la sogs pa la gnas pa ste 'bring dang / bla na med pa'i byang chub la gnas pa chen po ste /üîΩstong gsum gyi sems can thams cad dge ba bcu dang / tshad med pa la sogs pa la bkod pa bas don che'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsod nams chen po 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: khams gsum las 'das par bsngo bas khams gsum par gtogs pa ma yin pa dang / dge ba bcu la sogs pa'i las kyi lam la gnas pa ste chung ngu dang / rgyun tu zhugs pa la sogs pa la gnas pa ste 'bring dang / bla na med pa'i byang chub la gnas pa chen po ste / stong gsum gyi sems can thams cad dge ba bcu dang / tshad med pa la sogs pa la bkod pa bas don che'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsod nams chen po 'byung ba'o //
translated: The dedication that is of great purity is the dedication of the roots of virtue of the bodhisattva who is skilled in the knowledge of the path to liberation, who is skilled in the knowledge of the stages, and who is skilled in the knowledge of the signs of the spiritual levels.üîΩThe dedication that is of great relinquishment is the dedication of the roots of virtue of the bodhisattva who is skilled in the knowledge of the relinquishment of the disciples and the solitary sages.üîΩThe dedication that is of great understanding is the dedication of the roots of virtue of the bodhisattva who is skilled in the knowledge of the three doors of liberation, who is skilled in the knowledge of the emptiness of the twofold selflessness, and who is skilled in the knowledge of the signless and the wishless.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' mi dmigs pa la dmigs pa'i bdag nyid kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo ba'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa bcu gnyis yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' mi dmigs pa la dmigs pa'i bdag nyid kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo ba'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa bcu gnyis yin no //
translated: The dedication that is of great wisdom is the dedication of the roots of virtue of the bodhisattva who is skilled in the knowledge of the three doors of liberation, who is skilled in the knowledge of the emptiness of the twofold selflessness, and who is skilled in the knowledge of the signless and the wishless.üîΩThe dedication that is of great power is the dedication of the roots of virtue of the bodhisattva who is skilled in the knowledge of the three doors of liberation, who is skilled in the knowledge of the emptiness of the twofold selflessness, and who is skilled in the knowledge of the signless and the wishless.üîΩThe dedication that is of great skill in means is the dedication of the roots of virtue of the bodhisattva who is skilled in the knowledge of the three doors of liberation, who is skilled in the knowledge of the emptiness of the twofold selflessness, and who is skilled in the knowledge of the signless and the wishless.üîΩThe dedication that is of great purity is the dedication of the roots of virtue of the bodhisattva who is skilled in the knowledge of the path to liberation, who is skilled in the knowledge of the stages, and who is skilled in the knowledge of

original: yongs su bsngo ba'i bsod nams kyi phung po gya nom pa ni mngon par yongs su spel bar bya ba'i phyir rjes su yi rang ba yid la byed pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba'i bsod nams kyi phung po gya nom pa ni mngon par yongs su spel bar bya ba'i phyir rjes su yi rang ba yid la byed pa gsungs pa /
translated: The attention of rejoicing is taught in order to increase the sublime mass of merit of the dedication.

original: thabs dang mi dmigs pa dag gis //üîΩdge ba'i rtsa la yi rang ba //
analyzed: thabs dang mi dmigs pa dag gis // dge ba'i rtsa la yi rang ba //
translated: By means of skill in means and nonapprehending,üîΩone rejoices in the roots of virtue.

original: rjes su yi rang yid byed pa //
analyzed: rjes su yi rang yid byed pa //
translated: The attention of rejoicing

original: bsgom pa yin par 'dir brjod do //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa yin par 'dir brjod do // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: is said to be the meditation here.

original: rang dang gzhan gyis dus gsum du byas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba zad pa dang bcas pa dang cig shos dag la rab tu dga' ba'i sems kyis kun rdzob tu thabs la @32a * //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyis dus gsum du byas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba zad pa dang bcas pa dang cig shos dag la rab tu dga' ba'i sems kyis kun rdzob tu thabs la @32a * //
translated: One rejoices in the roots of virtue of oneself and others, together with their exhaustion, by means of skill in means in the conventional, with a mind of delight.

original: mkhas pas dmigs pa 'ga' yang med pas kun nas rjes su yi rang bar byed pa ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi skabs 'dir tshegs chung ngus bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i bsod nams mngon par 'phel bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: mkhas pas dmigs pa 'ga' yang med pas kun nas rjes su yi rang bar byed pa ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi skabs 'dir tshegs chung ngus bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i bsod nams mngon par 'phel bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Since there is no apprehension of any objective referent, one completely rejoices. In this context of the path of meditation, this is the means of increasing inconceivable merit with little difficulty.

original: de la mos pa dang bsngo ba dang rjes su yi rang ba yid la byed pa 'di dag gis ni go rims ltar 'byung khungs nas gser gyi gar bu bzhin du bsod nams mngon par 'du byed pa nyid dang / gser mkhan gyis rgyan bzhin du bla na med pa'i yan lag tu bsgyur ba dang /
analyzed: de la mos pa dang bsngo ba dang rjes su yi rang ba yid la byed pa 'di dag gis ni go rims ltar 'byung khungs nas gser gyi gar bu bzhin du bsod nams mngon par 'du byed pa nyid dang / gser mkhan gyis rgyan bzhin du bla na med pa'i yan lag tu bsgyur ba dang /
translated: These mental contemplations of admiration, dedication, and rejoicing respectively express the following: the accumulation of merit is like gold that comes from a mine; it is transformed into an unsurpassed limb by a goldsmith;

original: skye bo rab tu mang po la mdzes par 'gyur ba bzhin du dpag tu med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu 'phel bar byed do zhes bya ba 'di brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: skye bo rab tu mang po la mdzes par 'gyur ba bzhin du dpag tu med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu 'phel bar byed do zhes bya ba 'di brjod pa yin no //
translated: and it greatly increases the roots of virtue of immeasurable beings, like an ornament that beautifies many people.

original: de'i 'og tu zag pa med pa'i bsgom pa'i lam bstan par bya ba las dang por yon tan mngon par sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bsgom pa'i lam gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu zag pa med pa'i bsgom pa'i lam bstan par bya ba las dang por yon tan mngon par sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bsgom pa'i lam gsungs pa /
translated: Next, the uncontaminated path of meditation will be explained. First, the path of meditation that has the characteristic of manifesting qualities is stated:

original: de yi ngo bo nyid mchog nyid //
analyzed: de yi ngo bo nyid mchog nyid //
translated: Its nature is supreme

original: kun la mngon par 'du mi byed ;üîΩ/ chos rnams dmigs su med par ni //
analyzed: kun la mngon par 'du mi byed ; / chos rnams dmigs su med par ni //
translated: and does not engage in anything at all.üîΩIt is the great purpose

original: gtod par byed pa don chen nyid //üîΩces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gtod par byed pa don chen nyid //üîΩces bya ba'o //
translated: that focuses on the nonobservation of phenomena.

original: gzugs la sogs pa la rang gi chos nyid ji ltar rtogs pa ngo bo nyid dang / dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad zil gyis gnon pas mchog nyid dang / chos thams cad la skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan mar mi 'dzin pas mngon par 'du bya ba med pa nyid dang /üîΩde lta bu'i lam gyis 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas la sogs pa'i chos mtha' dag mi dmigs pa nyid du rnal 'byor ba'i rgyud la skyed cing gtod pa dang / mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa nyid kyi 'bras bur byed pas don chen po nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la rang gi chos nyid ji ltar rtogs pa ngo bo nyid dang / dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad zil gyis gnon pas mchog nyid dang / chos thams cad la skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan mar mi 'dzin pas mngon par 'du bya ba med pa nyid dang / de lta bu'i lam gyis 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas la sogs pa'i chos mtha' dag mi dmigs pa nyid du rnal 'byor ba'i rgyud la skyed cing gtod pa dang / mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa nyid kyi 'bras bur byed pas don chen po nyid do //
translated: The path of seeing is the supreme object of attainment because it is the cause of the attainment of the result of nirvana, it is the cause of the attainment of the qualities of the ƒÅryas, it is the cause of the attainment of the qualities of the buddhas and it is the cause of the attainment of the qualities of the pratyekabuddhas and ≈õrƒÅvakas.üîΩThe path of seeing is the supreme object of attainment because it is the cause of the attainment of the result of nirvana, it is the cause of the attainment of the qualities of the ƒÅryas, it is the cause of the attainment of the qualities of the buddhas and it is the cause of the attainment of the qualities of the pratyekabuddhas and ≈õrƒÅvakas.üîΩThe path of seeing is the supreme object of attainment because it is the cause of the attainment of the result of nirvana, it is the cause of the attainment of the qualities of the ƒÅryas, it is the cause of the attainment of the qualities of the buddhas and it is the cause of the attainment of the qualities of the pratyekabuddhas and ≈õrƒÅvakas.

original: sgrub pa dang ldan pa la rnam par dag pa'i lam bsgom pa 'byung bas de bshad pa'i phyir gang zhig yongs su gzung ba dang dor bas 'di skye ba dang mi skye ba'i rgyu sngon du gsungs pa /
analyzed: sgrub pa dang ldan pa la rnam par dag pa'i lam bsgom pa 'byung bas de bshad pa'i phyir gang zhig yongs su gzung ba dang dor bas 'di skye ba dang mi skye ba'i rgyu sngon du gsungs pa /
translated: The path of seeing is the supreme object of attainment because it is the cause of the attainment of the result of nirvana, it is the cause of the attainment of the qualities of the ƒÅryas, it is the cause of the attainment of the qualities of the buddhas and it is the cause of the attainment of the qualities of the pratyekabuddhas and ≈õrƒÅvakas.üîΩThe path of seeing is the supreme object of attainment because it is the cause of the attainment of the result of nirvana, it is the cause of the attainment of the qualities of the ƒÅryas, it is the cause of the attainment of the qualities of the buddhas and it is the cause of the attainment of the qualities of the pratyekabuddhas and ≈õrƒÅvakas.üîΩThe path of seeing is the supreme object of attainment because it is the cause of the attainment of the result of nirvana, it is the cause of the attainment of the qualities of the ƒÅryas, it is the cause of the attainment of the qualities of the buddhas and it is the cause of the attainment of the qualities of the pratyekabuddhas and ≈õrƒÅvakas.

original: sangs rgyas bsten dang sbyin sogs dang // thabs la mkhas pa gang yin pa //üîΩ'di la mos pa'i rgyu dag yin //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bsten dang sbyin sogs dang // thabs la mkhas pa gang yin pa // 'di la mos pa'i rgyu dag yin //
translated: and skill in means.

original: chos kyis phongs pa'i rgyu dag ni //
analyzed: chos kyis phongs pa'i rgyu dag ni //
translated: The causes of the loss of the Dharma areüîΩbeing overcome by the darkness of Mara,üîΩlack of faith in the profound Dharma,üîΩover-concern with the aggregates, etc.,

original: bdud kyi thibs kyis non pa dang // zab mo'i chos la ma mos dang // phung po la sogs mngon zhen dang // sdig pa'i grogs pos yongs zin pa'o //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdud kyi thibs kyis non pa dang // zab mo'i chos la ma mos dang // phung po la sogs mngon zhen dang // sdig pa'i grogs pos yongs zin pa'o // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and being dominated by evil companions.

original: sangs rgyas @32b bsten pa la sogs pa yun ring por bsnyen bkur zhing dri ba byas pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrub cing theg pa chen po'i tshul bsrung ba dang / 'di la mnyam par 'jog pa nyid kyi thabs la mkhas pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par dag pa'i lam 'di la mos shing skye bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas @32b bsten pa la sogs pa yun ring por bsnyen bkur zhing dri ba byas pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgrub cing theg pa chen po'i tshul bsrung ba dang / 'di la mnyam par 'jog pa nyid kyi thabs la mkhas pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par dag pa'i lam 'di la mos shing skye bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The causes of faith in this pure path are reliance on the Buddha for a long time, service, and questioning; the practice of the six perfections and the protection of the way of the universal vehicle; and skill in means in meditative equipoise on this.

original: sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bsags pas bdud kyi byin gyis brlabs pa dang / theg pa chen po'i rigs ma sbyangs pas chos zab mo la ma mos pa dang / bdag med pa nyid kyi don la legs par goms pa med pas phung po la sogs par mngon par zhen pa dang /
analyzed: sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bsags pas bdud kyi byin gyis brlabs pa dang / theg pa chen po'i rigs ma sbyangs pas chos zab mo la ma mos pa dang / bdag med pa nyid kyi don la legs par goms pa med pas phung po la sogs par mngon par zhen pa dang /
translated: Because they have not previously accumulated roots of virtue, they are empowered by Mara; because they have not purified the lineage of the Mahayana, they have no interest in the profound Dharma; because they have not properly cultivated the meaning of selflessness, they cling to the aggregates and so on;

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la 'dris par ma byas pas sdig pa'i grogs pos zin pa dag ni 'di mi skye zhing chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la 'dris par ma byas pas sdig pa'i grogs pos zin pa dag ni 'di mi skye zhing chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: and because they have not associated with spiritual guides, they are seized by evil companions. These are the causes of not producing this and of being deprived of the Dharma.

original: de'i rjes la skabs su bab pa'i rnam par dag pa spyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i rjes la skabs su bab pa'i rnam par dag pa spyir gsungs pa /
translated: After that, in some contexts, general purity is stated:

original: 'bras bu dag la gzugs la sogs //
analyzed: 'bras bu dag la gzugs la sogs //
translated: In the result, form and so on

original: dag pa nyid de gang gi phyir //
analyzed: dag pa nyid de gang gi phyir //
translated: are pure because

original: de gnyis tha dad ma yin zhing //üîΩgcad du med pas dag par brjod //
analyzed: de gnyis tha dad ma yin zhing // gcad du med pas dag par brjod //
translated: those two are not different

original: ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o //
translated: and cannot be cut, so they are called pure.

original: 'di ltar 'phags pa'i gang zag rnams kyi 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad dang bral ba nyid kyis rnam par dag pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'phags pa'i gang zag rnams kyi 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad dang bral ba nyid kyis rnam par dag pa yin la /
translated: Thus, the result of noble persons is pure, since it is free from all adverse classes.

original: de nyid gzugs la sogs pa rnam par dag pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid gzugs la sogs pa rnam par dag pa yin te /
translated: That itself is the purity of form, etc.

original: 'bras bu dang gzugs la sogs pa rnam par dag pa ni de la bdag tu mngon par zhen pa la sogs pa dang bral bas rab tu phye ba nyid kyis gang gi phyir de dag gi rnam par dag pa rang dang spyi'i mtshan kyis  tha mi dadüîΩcing gcad du med pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang gzugs la sogs pa rnam par dag pa ni de la bdag tu mngon par zhen pa la sogs pa dang bral bas rab tu phye ba nyid kyis gang gi phyir de dag gi rnam par dag pa rang dang spyi'i mtshan kyis  tha mi dad cing gcad du med pa nyid de /
translated: The purity of the result and the purity of form, etc. are not differentiated by specific and general characteristics, since they are distinguished by freedom from clinging to a self, etc.

original: de'i phyir de ltar rnam par dag par brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar rnam par dag par brjod do //
translated: Therefore, they are said to be pure in that way.

original: de'i rjes la rnam par dag pa bye brag tu gsungs pa /üîΩnyon mongs shes bya lam gsum gyi //
analyzed: de'i rjes la rnam par dag pa bye brag tu gsungs pa / nyon mongs shes bya lam gsum gyi //
translated: After that, purity is specifically taught:üîΩThe purity of learners, rhinoceroses, and bodhisattvas

original: nyams phyir slob ma bse ru dang // rgyal sras rnams kyi dag pa ste //üîΩsangs rgyas rnam kun shin tu ba //
analyzed: nyams phyir slob ma bse ru dang // rgyal sras rnams kyi dag pa ste // sangs rgyas rnam kun shin tu ba //
translated: is due to the destruction of the three: afflictions, objects of knowledge, and paths.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The purity of buddhas is in all aspects.

original: gang zag tu lta ba dang 'brel ba'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa ni nyan thos rnams kyi dag pa dang / gzung bar lta ba dang 'brel ba shes bya'i sgrib pa'i phyogs gcig spangs pa ni rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi dag pa dang /üîΩgang zag dang chos su lta ba dang 'brel pa theg pa gsum gyi lam gyi sgrib pa gsum @33a * //
analyzed: gang zag tu lta ba dang 'brel ba'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa ni nyan thos rnams kyi dag pa dang / gzung bar lta ba dang 'brel ba shes bya'i sgrib pa'i phyogs gcig spangs pa ni rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi dag pa dang / gang zag dang chos su lta ba dang 'brel pa theg pa gsum gyi lam gyi sgrib pa gsum @33a * //
translated: The purity of the pratyekabuddhas is the abandonment of one part of the obscurations to omniscience that are related to the view of the apprehended.

original: spangs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dag pa yin no //
analyzed: spangs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dag pa yin no //
translated: The purity of the bodhisattvas is the abandonment of the three obscurations to the paths of the three vehicles that are related to the views of the person and phenomena.

original: lta ba thams cad dang 'brel ba nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa rnam pa thams cad du spangs pa ni shin tu rnam par dag pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi yin par blta'o //
analyzed: lta ba thams cad dang 'brel ba nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa rnam pa thams cad du spangs pa ni shin tu rnam par dag pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi yin par blta'o //
translated: The purity of the extremely pure, perfect buddhas is the complete abandonment of all views, of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience, together with their traces.

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' dang sangs rgyas kyi dag pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa yin par brtag ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' dang sangs rgyas kyi dag pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa yin par brtag ce na /
translated: How should one view the purification of the obscurations of the bodhisattva and the Buddha?

original: gnyen po dgus spang bar bya bar rnam par bsal ba'i tshul gsungs pa /
analyzed: gnyen po dgus spang bar bya bar rnam par bsal ba'i tshul gsungs pa /
translated: The method of eliminating the discards by means of the nine remedies is stated:

original: sa dgu la ni chen po yi //
analyzed: sa dgu la ni chen po yi //
translated: On the nine levels, the great,

original: chen po la sogs dri ma yi //
analyzed: chen po la sogs dri ma yi //
translated: the great, etc.,üîΩare the discards.

original: gnyen po chung ngu'i chung ngu la //
analyzed: gnyen po chung ngu'i chung ngu la //
translated: The small, small, etc.,

original: sogs pa'i lam ni dag pa yin //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i lam ni dag pa yin // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: are the path of purification.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan bzhi dang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dag ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan bzhi dang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dag ste /
translated: The nine levels are the desire realm, the four absorptions, and the four formless realm meditative attainments.

original: sa dgu la lam chung ngu'i chung ngu la sogs pa rnam pa dgu nyid kyis go rims ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs chen po'i chen po la sogs pa rnam pa dgu'i dri ma sel bar byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sa dgu la lam chung ngu'i chung ngu la sogs pa rnam pa dgu nyid kyis go rims ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs chen po'i chen po la sogs pa rnam pa dgu'i dri ma sel bar byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: The nine types of path, the small, small, etc., eliminate the nine types of discards, the great, great, etc., in that order.

original: gos la dri ma phra mo bsal ba la btso blag mkhan chen thang du 'bad pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gos la dri ma phra mo bsal ba la btso blag mkhan chen thang du 'bad pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: This is like a washerman who makes a great effort to remove a small stain from a fine cloth.

original: ci'i phyir yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi rnam par dag pa shin tu rab tu brjod ce na /üîΩde'i phyir ma lus pa'i gnyen po phul du gyur pa rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci'i phyir yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi rnam par dag pa shin tu rab tu brjod ce na / de'i phyir ma lus pa'i gnyen po phul du gyur pa rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa /
translated: Why is the purity of the perfect buddhas said to be utterly supreme?

original: de la klan ka spangs pa yis //üîΩlam ni 'jal dang gzhal bya dag / mnyam pa nyid kyis khams gsum gyi //
analyzed: de la klan ka spangs pa yis // lam ni 'jal dang gzhal bya dag / mnyam pa nyid kyis khams gsum gyi //
translated: Therefore, the perfection of the antidote that is without remainder is stated to be the characteristic of completion.üîΩThe path is asserted to be the antidote of the three realms

original: gnyen po nyid du 'dod pa yin //
analyzed: gnyen po nyid du 'dod pa yin //
translated: through the equality of the measure and the measured.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The objection is refuted.

original: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid la spang bar bya ba dang gnyen po mi 'thad do zhes pa dang / de bzhin du dor ba dang blang bar bya ba dang / thob pa dang mngon par rtogs pa mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i klan ka dag bden pa gnyis la brten pa'i lam gyis rnam par bsal te /
analyzed: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid la spang bar bya ba dang gnyen po mi 'thad do zhes pa dang / de bzhin du dor ba dang blang bar bya ba dang / thob pa dang mngon par rtogs pa mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i klan ka dag bden pa gnyis la brten pa'i lam gyis rnam par bsal te /
translated: The objection is refuted by the path that is based on the two truths.

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi ni mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa khams gsum pa'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa dang shes par bya ba dag mi dmigs pa nyid kyis dri mar gyur pa mtha' dag gi gnyen po yongs su rdzogs pa mthar phyin pa'i rnam par dagüîΩpa shin tu ba yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi ni mnyam pa nyid gang yin pa khams gsum pa'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa dang shes par bya ba dag mi dmigs pa nyid kyis dri mar gyur pa mtha' dag gi gnyen po yongs su rdzogs pa mthar phyin pa'i rnam par dag pa shin tu ba yin par 'dod do //
translated: Therefore, the equality of the Buddha is the complete, ultimate, and utterly pure antidote to all stains, by not objectifying consciousness and objects that have the aspect of the three realms.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos mngon par rtogs pa'i @33b rgyan gyi 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma'i phreng ba zhes bya ba las skabs gnyis pa'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos mngon par rtogs pa'i @33b rgyan gyi 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma'i phreng ba zhes bya ba las skabs gnyis pa'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: This concludes the commentary on the second chapter, having 24 verses, called ‚Äúthe perfection of wisdom.‚Äù

original: // / lam thams cad legs par yongs su shes pa nyid kyang gzhi thams cad shes pa la rag las pas dang por yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi gzhi thams cad shes pa gsungs pa /üîΩtshu rol pha rol mtha' la min //
analyzed: // / lam thams cad legs par yongs su shes pa nyid kyang gzhi thams cad shes pa la rag las pas dang por yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi gzhi thams cad shes pa gsungs pa / tshu rol pha rol mtha' la min //
translated: The thorough knowledge of all paths also depends on the thorough knowledge of all bases, so first the thorough knowledge of all bases that has the nature of correct reality is taught.üîΩNot this shore, not the other shore,

original: de dag par na mi gnas pas //
analyzed: de dag par na mi gnas pas //
translated: not in between,

original: dus rnams mnyam pa nyid shes phyir //üîΩshes rab pha rol phyin par 'dod //
analyzed: dus rnams mnyam pa nyid shes phyir // shes rab pha rol phyin par 'dod //
translated: Because of knowing the equality of the three times,

original: ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o //
translated: it is asserted as the perfection of wisdom.

original: dus gsum pa'i chos thams cad gdod ma nas skye ba med pa'i bdag nyid du mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pas shes rab dang snying rje yang dag pa nyid kyis tshul rol dang pha rol gyi mtha' 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa rtag pa dang chad
analyzed: dus gsum pa'i chos thams cad gdod ma nas skye ba med pa'i bdag nyid du mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pas shes rab dang snying rje yang dag pa nyid kyis tshul rol dang pha rol gyi mtha' 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa rtag pa dang chad
translated: Because of realizing that all phenomena of the three times are equal in the nature of primordially not arising, wisdom and compassion are the correct method. The extremes of this side, samsara, and the other side, nirvana, have the characteristics of permanence and annihilation,

original: pa'i mtshan nyid dang / de dag gi bar na yang mi gnas pa'i phyir yang dag pa nyid kyi gzhi thams cad shes pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par 'dod do //
analyzed: pa'i mtshan nyid dang / de dag gi bar na yang mi gnas pa'i phyir yang dag pa nyid kyi gzhi thams cad shes pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par 'dod do //
translated: and they do not abide in between those two. Therefore, it is asserted as the perfection of wisdom that knows the basis of reality.

original: 'dis ni nyan thos la sogs pa la dus rnam pa gsum mnyam pa nyid shes pa med pa'i phyir rang gi rtogs pa tsam gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par zad pas shes rab dang snying rje dang bral te /
analyzed: 'dis ni nyan thos la sogs pa la dus rnam pa gsum mnyam pa nyid shes pa med pa'i phyir rang gi rtogs pa tsam gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par zad pas shes rab dang snying rje dang bral te /
translated: This is because the hearers and so on do not know the equality of the three times. Therefore, they have only the perfection of wisdom of their own realization and are devoid of wisdom and compassion.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med par dmigs pa nyid kyis srid pa dang zhi ba'i mtha' la gnas par bstan to //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med par dmigs pa nyid kyis srid pa dang zhi ba'i mtha' la gnas par bstan to //
translated: By observing things and non-things, one is shown to abide in the extremes of existence and peace.

original: gang gis mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de la ring ba dang nye bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de la ring ba dang nye bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: By what is the perfection of wisdom, which has the characteristic of non-abiding, far or near?

original: de rang gi rgyu mtshan gsungs pa /üîΩde ni mtshan mar dmigs sgo nas //üîΩthabs ma yin pas ring ba ste //
analyzed: de rang gi rgyu mtshan gsungs pa / de ni mtshan mar dmigs sgo nas // thabs ma yin pas ring ba ste //
translated: Its own reason is stated:üîΩBy observing signs,üîΩit is far through lack of skill in means.

original: de ni thabs la mkhas pa yis //üîΩyang dag nye ba nyid du bshad //
analyzed: de ni thabs la mkhas pa yis // yang dag nye ba nyid du bshad //
translated: By skill in means,

original: ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o //
translated: it is explained as being truly near.

original: skye bo phal po che'i tshogs kyis sgyu ma'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i de kho na nyid ma shes pas yul so so la mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba bzhin du /
analyzed: skye bo phal po che'i tshogs kyis sgyu ma'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i de kho na nyid ma shes pas yul so so la mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as a multitude of ordinary people, not knowing the suchness of the illusion-like dependent origination, become attached to individual objects,

original: nyan thos la sogs pa ni yang dag pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pa thabs la mkhas pa dang bral bas dngos po rnams la ming dang don gyi mtshan mar dmigs pa'i sgo nas mtshan ma med pa'i yum 'di las ring bar gyur la /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa ni yang dag pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pa thabs la mkhas pa dang bral bas dngos po rnams la ming dang don gyi mtshan mar dmigs pa'i sgo nas mtshan ma med pa'i yum 'di las ring bar gyur la /
translated: The ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on are far removed from this mother of the absence of attributes because they lack the skill in means of a true spiritual friend and so on. They are far removed because they observe things through the attributes of names and referents.

original: sgyu ma'i mkhan po rang nyid brdzun pa'i don can gyis yid rmongs par ma gyur pas rab tu ma zhen pa bzhin du /üîΩbyang chub sems @34a * //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i mkhan po rang nyid brdzun pa'i don can gyis yid rmongs par ma gyur pas rab tu ma zhen pa bzhin du / byang chub sems @34a * //
translated: Just as a magician himself is not deluded by the meaning of his illusions, he is not attached to them.

original: dpa' dus yun ring mo zhi gnas de kho na nyid la mkhas pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen yang dag par mgu bar byas pa la sogs pa thabs mkhas pa'i mtshan nyid can thos pa la sogs pa'i blo gros zab mos dngos por rnam par 'khrul pa'i mtshan ma
analyzed: dpa' dus yun ring mo zhi gnas de kho na nyid la mkhas pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen yang dag par mgu bar byas pa la sogs pa thabs mkhas pa'i mtshan nyid can thos pa la sogs pa'i blo gros zab mos dngos por rnam par 'khrul pa'i mtshan ma
translated: In the same way, bodhisattvas, who have been spiritual friends skilled in means, such as delighting the suchness of ≈õamatha for a long time, and so on, with their profound intelligence of listening and so on, do not observe the attributes of confusion about entities.

original: bsal ba rnams ni don ji lta bar nye bar gnas pa dang mthun pa nyid kyis rgyal ba'i yum 'di la yang dag par nye bar gyur pa bshad do //
analyzed: bsal ba rnams ni don ji lta bar nye bar gnas pa dang mthun pa nyid kyis rgyal ba'i yum 'di la yang dag par nye bar gyur pa bshad do //
translated: The elucidations are explained to be in accord with the Mother of Victors, since they are well-established in accordance with the meaning.

original: gang gis ring bar gyur pa'i mtshan mar dmigs pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis ring bar gyur pa'i mtshan mar dmigs pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the observation of a sign that is far away?

original: de ltar 'du shes pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar 'du shes pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs gsungs pa /
translated: The discordant class of that perception is stated:üîΩThe discordant class of the perception of practiceüîΩIs the emptiness of the aggregates of form and so on,üîΩThe phenomena included in the three times,

original: gzugs sogs phung po stong nyid dang // dus gsum gtogs pa'i chos rnams dang // sbyin sogs byang chub phyogs rnams la //üîΩspyod pa'i 'du shes mi mthun phyogs //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs sogs phung po stong nyid dang // dus gsum gtogs pa'i chos rnams dang // sbyin sogs byang chub phyogs rnams la // spyod pa'i 'du shes mi mthun phyogs // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: And the factors of enlightenment such as generosity.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po gzhan gyis kun brtags pa'i bdag la sogs pas stong pa nyid du 'du shes pa dang / 'das pa la sogs pa dus gsum du gtogs pa'i chos la zag pa dang bcas pa dang / cig shos la der 'du shes pa dang /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po gzhan gyis kun brtags pa'i bdag la sogs pas stong pa nyid du 'du shes pa dang / 'das pa la sogs pa dus gsum du gtogs pa'i chos la zag pa dang bcas pa dang / cig shos la der 'du shes pa dang /
translated: The discordant class of the perception of practice is the perception of the emptiness of the aggregates of form and so on, the perception of the phenomena included in the three times, the past and so on, as being with or without contamination, and the perception of the factors of enlightenment such as generosity and so on as being with or without remainder.

original: sbyin pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa la sogs pa la spyod bar 'du shes pa ni //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa la sogs pa la spyod bar 'du shes pa ni //
translated: The idea that one practices generosity, the establishments of mindfulness, the dhyanas, the immeasurables, etc.

original: gnyen po yin na yang yul la mtshan mar 'dzin pa nyid kyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: gnyen po yin na yang yul la mtshan mar 'dzin pa nyid kyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
translated: is an adversary because it is a counteragent, but it is an opposing factor because it grasps the sign of an object.

original: yang gang gis nye bar gyur pa'i mi dmigs pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang gang gis nye bar gyur pa'i mi dmigs pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the non-apprehension of the one who has become intimate with it?

original: de ltar 'du shes pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar 'du shes pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs gsungs pa /
translated: The author declares the counteragent to that idea:

original: sbyin la sogs la dar 'dzin med//
analyzed: sbyin la sogs la dar 'dzin med//
translated: 10. In generosity, etc., there is no apprehension of an object;

original: gzhan dag de la sbyor byed gang //
analyzed: gzhan dag de la sbyor byed gang //
translated: but the one who is engaged in that for the sake of others

original: de ni chags pa'i mtha' 'gog pa //
analyzed: de ni chags pa'i mtha' 'gog pa //
translated: is stopped by the extreme of attachment;

original: rgyal la sogs la chags pa phra //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyal la sogs la chags pa phra // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: attachment to the Conqueror, etc. is subtle.

original: 'khor gsum rnam par dag pa nyid kyis sbyin pa la sogs pa gsum la bdag dang bdag gir bya ba med par rtogs pa la bdag nyid gnas shing gzhan dag kyang tshul de 'dra ba kho na la yang dag par sbyor ba la mngon par chags pa'i tshogs
analyzed: 'khor gsum rnam par dag pa nyid kyis sbyin pa la sogs pa gsum la bdag dang bdag gir bya ba med par rtogs pa la bdag nyid gnas shing gzhan dag kyang tshul de 'dra ba kho na la yang dag par sbyor ba la mngon par chags pa'i tshogs
translated: The three spheres are pure in the three kinds of generosity, etc. The bodhisattva himself is established in the realization that there is no self and no possession, and he perfectly engages others in just that way. The collection of the three kinds of generosity, etc. is the counteragent to the extreme of attachment.

original: kyi mtha' thams cad 'gog pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: kyi mtha' thams cad 'gog pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du gnyen po yin no //
translated: because it is the antidote to all the extremes of conceptual thought.

original: sbyin pa la sogs par 'du shes pa mtha' dag spang bar bya ba brjod pa na /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs par 'du shes pa mtha' dag spang bar bya ba brjod pa na /
translated: When it is said that all discriminations of giving, etc., are to be abandoned,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa yid @34b la byed pa yang bsod nams kyi rgyur gyur pa nyid kyi gnyen po yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa yid @34b la byed pa yang bsod nams kyi rgyur gyur pa nyid kyi gnyen po yin mod kyi /
translated: the attention to the Tathagata, etc., is also an antidote because it is the cause of merit.

original: der 'du shes pa nyid kyis chags pa phra mo'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: der 'du shes pa nyid kyis chags pa phra mo'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that it is not an adverse element because it is the subtle attachment in the nature of the discrimination of that.

original: de ci'i phyir chags pa phra mo mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir chags pa phra mo mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin zhe na /
translated: Why is subtle attachment an adverse element?

original: yul gyi chos nyid phra mo las nye bar 'das pa'i rgyu mtshan gsungs pa /üîΩchos kyi lam ni rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: yul gyi chos nyid phra mo las nye bar 'das pa'i rgyu mtshan gsungs pa / chos kyi lam ni rang bzhin gyis //
translated: The reason is stated in the subtle reality of the object:üîΩThe Dharma path is profound

original: dben pa'i phyir na de zab nyid //üîΩces bya ba'o //
analyzed: dben pa'i phyir na de zab nyid // ces bya ba'o //
translated: because it is naturally isolated.

original: gang gi chos thams cad kyi rigs ni nam mkha' ltar ngo bo nyid kho nas stod pa zab pa nyid de /
analyzed: gang gi chos thams cad kyi rigs ni nam mkha' ltar ngo bo nyid kho nas stod pa zab pa nyid de /
translated: The Dharma path is profound because the nature of all dharmas is emptiness, like space.

original: de la ni shin tu phra ba'i chags pa yang nye bar gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la ni shin tu phra ba'i chags pa yang nye bar gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: And in that, even the most subtle attachment does not abide.

original: de'i phyir de dag spong bar byed pa'i gnyen po gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag spong bar byed pa'i gnyen po gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, the antidote that eliminates those is taught:

original: chos rnams rang bzhin gcig par ni //üîΩshes pas chags pa spong ba yin //
analyzed: chos rnams rang bzhin gcig par ni // shes pas chags pa spong ba yin //
translated: By knowing the single nature of phenomena,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: attachment is eliminated.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa kho nas gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad rang bzhin gcig pa nyid de /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa kho nas gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad rang bzhin gcig pa nyid de /
translated: By the very lack of intrinsic nature, all phenomena such as form have a single nature.

original: 'di ltar rang bzhin med pa'i zhes bya bas ma skyes pa nyid du mnyam par yongs su shes pas ni chags pa spong ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rang bzhin med pa'i zhes bya bas ma skyes pa nyid du mnyam par yongs su shes pas ni chags pa spong ba yin no //
translated: Thus, by fully knowing the equality of the lack of intrinsic nature, that is, the non-arisen, attachment is eliminated.

original: yang dben pas zab pa zhes bya ba 'di nyid ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang dben pas zab pa zhes bya ba 'di nyid ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: Again, how is this very profundity of emptiness explained by seclusion?

original: de'i rang gi mtshan nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i rang gi mtshan nyid gsungs pa /
translated: Its intrinsic characteristic is taught:

original: mthong ba la sogs bkag pa yis //üîΩde ni rtogs par dka' bar bshad //
analyzed: mthong ba la sogs bkag pa yis // de ni rtogs par dka' bar bshad //
translated: By the negation of seeing and so forth,

original: ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o //
translated: it is explained as difficult to realize.

original: 'di ltar gang zhig nye bar dmigs par byar yod pa ni gzhan du 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zhig nye bar dmigs par byar yod pa ni gzhan du 'gyur na /
translated: Thus, that which is to be observed as existent is transformed into something else.

original: chos thams cad ni rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi dmigs pa'i don gsal bas de'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni rab tu rtogs par dga' bar bshad de /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi dmigs pa'i don gsal bas de'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni rab tu rtogs par dga' bar bshad de /
translated: The nature of all phenomena is that they are the objects of all consciousnesses, because they are the clear manifestations of all consciousnesses.

original: de'i phyir zab ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zab ces bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called ‚Äúprofound.‚Äù

original: rtogs par dka' ba nyid ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rtogs par dka' ba nyid ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it difficult to realize?

original: de'i yang rgyu gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i yang rgyu gsungs pa /
translated: The reason for that is stated:

original: gzugs la sogs pa mi shes phyir //üîΩde ni bsam mi khyab par 'dod //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa mi shes phyir // de ni bsam mi khyab par 'dod //
translated: Because form and so on are not known,

original: ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o //
translated: it is asserted to be inconceivable.

original: gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar gyi rang bzhin ni gang du yang yongs su shes par mi nus pas bsam par bya ba las 'das par 'dod de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa nas sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i bar gyi rang bzhin ni gang du yang yongs su shes par mi nus pas bsam par bya ba las 'das par 'dod de /
translated: Because the nature of form and so on up to the unshared qualities of a buddha cannot be known anywhere, it is asserted to be beyond conception.

original: de'i phyir rtogs par dka'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtogs par dka'o zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called ‚Äúdifficult to realize.‚Äù

original: de ltar phyogs gnyis rnam par nges pa'i mjug bsdu ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar phyogs gnyis rnam par nges pa'i mjug bsdu ba gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, the conclusion is stated with regard to the two aspects:

original: de ltar kun shes nyid lugs la //
analyzed: de ltar kun shes nyid lugs la //
translated: Thus, in the system of complete understanding,üîΩthe entire classification

original: mi mthun gnyen po'i phyogs dag gi / rnam par dbye ba ma lus pa /
analyzed: mi mthun gnyen po'i phyogs dag gi / rnam par dbye ba ma lus pa /
translated: of the discordant classes and their antidotesüîΩis explained.

original: ji skad bshad pa 'di @35a * //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa 'di @35a * //
translated: This is to be known

original: shes bya // zhes bya ba'o //üîΩji skad bshad pa thams cad shes pa nyid kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul lugs la nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'i rgyud kyi bye brag gis mi ma thun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i phyogs kyi rab tu dbye ba'i ring
analyzed: shes bya // zhes bya ba'o // ji skad bshad pa thams cad shes pa nyid kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul lugs la nyan thos dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'i rgyud kyi bye brag gis mi ma thun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i phyogs kyi rab tu dbye ba'i ring
translated: as it has been explained.üîΩAll that has been explained is to be known as the perfection of wisdom, the method of the perfection of wisdom, by way of the distinctions of the continua of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, bodhisattvas, and so on.

original: ba dang nye ba'i mtshan nyid dang bcas pa 'di dag de ltar shes par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ba dang nye ba'i mtshan nyid dang bcas pa 'di dag de ltar shes par bya ba yin no //
translated: The distinctions of the side of the antidotes and the side of the objects of abandonment, along with their characteristics of distance and nearness, are to be known in that way.

original: mtshan nyid shes pas don rnam par bsgom dgos pa de'i 'og tu bsgom pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sbyor ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: mtshan nyid shes pas don rnam par bsgom dgos pa de'i 'og tu bsgom pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sbyor ba gsungs pa /
translated: Having understood the characteristics, one must cultivate the objects. After that, the application of the characteristics of cultivation is stated:üîΩThe impermanence, etc. of form, etc.,üîΩits incompleteness and completion,

original: gzugs sogs de mi rtag sogs dang // de ma rdzogs dang rab rdzogs dang // de la chags pa med nyid la //
analyzed: gzugs sogs de mi rtag sogs dang // de ma rdzogs dang rab rdzogs dang // de la chags pa med nyid la //
translated: and the lack of attachment to it,

original: spyod pa bkag pa'i sbyor ba dang // mi 'gyur byed po min pa dang // bya dka' rnam gsum sbyor ba dang // skal ba ji bzhin 'bras thob pas //
analyzed: spyod pa bkag pa'i sbyor ba dang // mi 'gyur byed po min pa dang // bya dka' rnam gsum sbyor ba dang // skal ba ji bzhin 'bras thob pas //
translated: The three kinds of difficult practices,üîΩand the attainment of the result in accordance with one's fortune.

original: 'bras yod 'dod pa de dang ni //üîΩgzhan la rag las med gang dang // snang ba rnam bdun shes byed do //
analyzed: 'bras yod 'dod pa de dang ni // gzhan la rag las med gang dang // snang ba rnam bdun shes byed do //
translated: And the assertion that the result exists,üîΩand that which is not dependent on another,

original: zhes bya ba'o //

translated: and the seven kinds of appearance are to be understood.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad kyi ngo bo la bden par spyod pa bkag pa dang / de dag gi khyad par mi rtag pa dang / stong ba nyid la sogs pa la spyod pa bkag pa dang / de dag gi ma rdzogs pa dang rdzogs pa kun brtags pa dang /

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi bdag nyid ched du bya ba dang sbyor ba dang rtogs par bya ba rnam pa gsum de kho nar bya dka' ba nyid la spyod pa dang / 'di nyid theg pa rnam pa gsum gyi rigs can gyis bsgoms nas rang rang gi skal ba ji lta ba bzhin 'bras bu thob pas de'i 'bras bu la nye bar 'dod pa'i spyod pa dang /üîΩrnam pa thams cad du lam sgrub pa dang bsrung bar bya ba gzhan la ma ltos pa nyid dang / brdzun pa'i snang ba rnam pa bdun shes par byed pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi bdag nyid ched du bya ba dang sbyor ba dang rtogs par bya ba rnam pa gsum de kho nar bya dka' ba nyid la spyod pa dang / 'di nyid theg pa rnam pa gsum gyi rigs can gyis bsgoms nas rang rang gi skal ba ji lta ba bzhin 'bras bu thob pas de'i 'bras bu la nye bar 'dod pa'i spyod pa dang /üîΩrnam pa thams cad du lam sgrub pa dang bsrung bar bya ba gzhan la ma ltos pa nyid dang / brdzun pa'i snang ba rnam pa bdun shes par byed pa ste /
translated: The practice of the result is the practice of the result of the three kinds of omniscience, which is the attainment of one's own fortune by meditating on the three kinds of omniscience by those who have the lineage of the three kinds of vehicles.üîΩThe

original: 'di ltar bag chags kyis yid yongs su 'gyur ba rmi lam dang / sngags la sogs pa mnyam du tshogs pas snang bar sgyu ma dang / rgyu med par snang ba nyid @35b don dang 'gal ba smig rgyu dang / sgra dang gnas gyi  rkyen la brten pa brag ca dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar bag chags kyis yid yongs su 'gyur ba rmi lam dang / sngags la sogs pa mnyam du tshogs pas snang bar sgyu ma dang / rgyu med par snang ba nyid @35b don dang 'gal ba smig rgyu dang / sgra dang gnas gyi  rkyen la brten pa brag ca dang /
translated: Thus, the mind is completely transformed by habitual tendencies, like in a dream; it appears through the coming together of mantras, etc., like an illusion; it appears without a cause, like a mirage that contradicts its object; it is based on the conditions of sound and location, like an echo;

original: rnam pa stong bar byed pa ma 'phos par shar ba gzugs brnyan dang / gnas par bya ba'i rten med dri za'i grong khyer dang / lus dang ngag gi byed pa po med pa sprul pa lta bu rnams /
analyzed: rnam pa stong bar byed pa ma 'phos par shar ba gzugs brnyan dang / gnas par bya ba'i rten med dri za'i grong khyer dang / lus dang ngag gi byed pa po med pa sprul pa lta bu rnams /
translated: it is empty of aspects, like a reflection that arises without moving; it lacks a basis for abiding, like a city of gandharvas; and it lacks a body or speech agent, like a magical creation.

original: snang pa la spyod pa bkag pa'i sgo nas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis nye bar sbyor ba rnam pa bcu'o //
analyzed: snang pa la spyod pa bkag pa'i sgo nas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis nye bar sbyor ba rnam pa bcu'o //
translated: These are the ten modes of application by way of non-observation that refute the engagement with appearances.

original: 'dis kyang shugs kyis nyan thos la sogs pa'i sbyor ba phyogs gcig gis bzlog par bsgom pa 'phangs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis kyang shugs kyis nyan thos la sogs pa'i sbyor ba phyogs gcig gis bzlog par bsgom pa 'phangs pa yin no //
translated: This also implies the cultivation of the refutation of the one-sided engagement of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, etc.
