original: gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo la dngos por rlom pa nyid dang / sngon po la sogs pa'i khyad par la mtshan mar rlom pa nyid dang / rnam pa rab tu dbye ba la sogs pa la spros par rlom pa nyid dang / bdag gis 'di lta bur rig gi zhes rtogs pa por rlom pa nyid rnam par dmigs par bya ba la sogs pa nye bar zhi ba'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis mnyam pa nyid du sbyor ba ni mnyam pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo la dngos por rlom pa nyid dang / sngon po la sogs pa'i khyad par la mtshan mar rlom pa nyid dang / rnam pa rab tu dbye ba la sogs pa la spros par rlom pa nyid dang / bdag gis 'di lta bur rig gi zhes rtogs pa por rlom pa nyid rnam par dmigs par bya ba la sogs pa nye bar zhi ba'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis mnyam pa nyid du sbyor ba ni mnyam pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The sameness of those four is the object of the perfection of sameness.üîΩThe sameness of those four is the

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi sbyor ba yongs su rdzogs par bsgoms pa las mthong ba'i lam skye ba'i phyir de'i skad cig ma'i rnam par dbye ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyi sbyor ba yongs su rdzogs par bsgoms pa las mthong ba'i lam skye ba'i phyir de'i skad cig ma'i rnam par dbye ba gsungs pa /
translated: The path of seeing arises from the complete cultivation of the application of sameness. Therefore, the momentariness of that is explained.

original: sdug bsngal la sogs bden pa la //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs bden pa la //
translated: With regard to the truths of suffering and so on,üîΩthere is Dharma knowledge, subsequent knowledge,

original: chos shes rjes su shes pa dang // bzod shes skad cig bdag nyid 'di //üîΩkun shes tshul la mthong ba'i lam //
analyzed: chos shes rjes su shes pa dang // bzod shes skad cig bdag nyid 'di // kun shes tshul la mthong ba'i lam //
translated: the nature of the moments of acceptance and knowledge.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the path of seeing in the system of complete knowledge.

original: sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam gyi bden pa rnams la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / chos shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / rjes su shes pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam gyi bden pa rnams la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / chos shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / rjes su shes pa ste /
translated: With regard to the truths of suffering, origin, cessation, and path, there is the acceptance of Dharma knowledge, Dharma knowledge, the acceptance of subsequent knowledge, and subsequent knowledge.

original: de ltar bzod pa dang shes pa'i skad cig ma rab tu dbye ba bcu drug gi bdag nyid 'di ni / thams cad shes pa nyid kyi tshul lugs la mthong ba'i lam yin no //
analyzed: de ltar bzod pa dang shes pa'i skad cig ma rab tu dbye ba bcu drug gi bdag nyid 'di ni / thams cad shes pa nyid kyi tshul lugs la mthong ba'i lam yin no //
translated: Thus this path of seeing has the nature of the moments of the divisions of the sixteen aspects of acceptance and knowledge.

original: ji ltar na skad cig ma rnam pa bcu drug yin par brtag ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na skad cig ma rnam pa bcu drug yin par brtag ce na /
translated: How are they posited as the sixteen moments?

original: de'i phyir bden pa'i rnam pa rnams gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir bden pa'i rnam pa rnams gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, the aspects of the truths are taught.

original: gzugs rtag ma @36a * //
analyzed: gzugs rtag ma @36a * //
translated: Form is not permanent,

original: yin mi rtag yin //
analyzed: yin mi rtag yin //
translated: it is not impermanent.üîΩBeyond extremes, pure,

original: mtha' las 'das dang rnam dag dang // ma skyes ba ma 'gags la sogs pa //
analyzed: mtha' las 'das dang rnam dag dang // ma skyes ba ma 'gags la sogs pa //
translated: unproduced, unceasing, and so on,üîΩlike space, free from attachment,üîΩliberated from grasping,üîΩinexpressible by nature,

original: mkha' 'dra chags pa spangs pa dang // yongs su 'dzin las grol ba dang // ngo bo nyid kyis brjod med dang // gang gis 'di don brjod pa yis //
analyzed: mkha' 'dra chags pa spangs pa dang // yongs su 'dzin las grol ba dang // ngo bo nyid kyis brjod med dang // gang gis 'di don brjod pa yis //
translated: and by whom this meaning is expressed,üîΩcannot be given to others,üîΩmakes the object non-existent,

original: gzhan la sbyin du med pa dang // dmigs pa med par byed pa dang // shin tu rnam dag nad mi 'byung //
analyzed: gzhan la sbyin du med pa dang // dmigs pa med par byed pa dang // shin tu rnam dag nad mi 'byung //
translated: and is utterly pure, without arising of faults.

original: ngan song chad dang 'bras bu ni //
analyzed: ngan song chad dang 'bras bu ni //
translated: Cessation of lower rebirths, and the result,

original: mngon du bya la mi rtog nyid //üîΩmtshan ma dag dang ma 'brel dang // dngos dang ming dang gnyis po la //
analyzed: mngon du bya la mi rtog nyid // mtshan ma dag dang ma 'brel dang // dngos dang ming dang gnyis po la //
translated: is non-conceptuality itself.üîΩUnconnected with signs,üîΩin the non-arising of consciousness

original: shes pa skye ba med pa ni ;
analyzed: shes pa skye ba med pa ni ;
translated: of things, names, and both,

original: / kun shes nyid kyi skad cig ma //
analyzed: / kun shes nyid kyi skad cig ma //
translated: is the moment of complete understanding.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: 'di lta bu'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa la rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dang bral pas rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin pa dang / sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal ba ma yin pa dang bral ba nyid kyis rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' dang bral ba dang /
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa la rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dang bral pas rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin pa dang / sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal ba ma yin pa dang bral ba nyid kyis rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' dang bral ba dang /
translated: Because of this kind of intrinsic realitylessness, form and so on are neither permanent nor impermanent, because they are free from permanence and impermanence.üîΩBecause they are free from suffering and non-suffering, they are free from the extremes of eternalism and nihilism.

original: stong pa dang mi stong pa dang bral ba nyid kyis rnam par dag pa dang / bdag dang bdag med pa'i ngo bo dang bral ba nyid kyis ma skyes shing ma 'gags la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bden pa dang po'i rnam pa dag yin no //
analyzed: stong pa dang mi stong pa dang bral ba nyid kyis rnam par dag pa dang / bdag dang bdag med pa'i ngo bo dang bral ba nyid kyis ma skyes shing ma 'gags la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bden pa dang po'i rnam pa dag yin no //
translated: Because they are free from emptiness and non-emptiness, they are pure. Because they are free from the nature of self and non-self, they are unborn, unceasing, and neither afflicted nor purified. These are the aspects of the first truth.

original: de bzhin du rgyu dang rgyu ma yin pa nyid kyis dben pa'i phyir nam mkha' dang 'dra ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang kun 'byung ba med pa dang / mi ldan pas nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa dang ;
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyu dang rgyu ma yin pa nyid kyis dben pa'i phyir nam mkha' dang 'dra ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang kun 'byung ba med pa dang / mi ldan pas nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa dang ;
translated: it is the abandonment of all afflictions and branch afflictions because it is not a source and does not arise,üîΩit is free from grasping because it does not arise, does not arise, and is not related,üîΩand it is inexpressible by nature because it is free from conditions and nonconditions.

original: rab tu skye ba dang ma skyes pa dang ma 'brel bas yongs su 'dzin pa las grol ba dang / rkyen dang rkyen ma yin pa las rnam par grol ba'i phyir rang gi ngo bo brjod du med pa zhes bya ba ni bden pa gnyis pa'i rnam pa dag yin no //
analyzed: rab tu skye ba dang ma skyes pa dang ma 'brel bas yongs su 'dzin pa las grol ba dang / rkyen dang rkyen ma yin pa las rnam par grol ba'i phyir rang gi ngo bo brjod du med pa zhes bya ba ni bden pa gnyis pa'i rnam pa dag yin no //
translated: These are the aspects of the second truth.

original: de bzhin du 'gog pa dang 'gog pa med pa dang bral bas de'i don tshig tu brjod pas rgyud de gzhan la sbyin du med pa dang / zhi ba dang ma zhi ba med pas dmigs pa med par byed pa dang / gya nom pa dang gya nom pa ma yin pa dang bral bas mtha' gnyis las 'das shing shin tu rnam par dag pa @36b dang ;
analyzed: de bzhin du 'gog pa dang 'gog pa med pa dang bral bas de'i don tshig tu brjod pas rgyud de gzhan la sbyin du med pa dang / zhi ba dang ma zhi ba med pas dmigs pa med par byed pa dang / gya nom pa dang gya nom pa ma yin pa dang bral bas mtha' gnyis las 'das shing shin tu rnam par dag pa @36b dang ;
translated: Since it is free from the sublime and the non-sublime, it transcends the two extremes and is utterly pure.üîΩSince it is free from deliverance and non-deliverance, it is isolated and free from all stains.

original: nges par 'byung ba dang nges par 'byung ba med pas dben pas dri ma'i nad thams cad mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni bden pa gsum pa'i rnam pa dag yin no //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba dang nges par 'byung ba med pas dben pas dri ma'i nad thams cad mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni bden pa gsum pa'i rnam pa dag yin no //
translated: These are the aspects of the third truth.

original: lam dang lam ma yin pa dang bral ba'i phyir ngan song chad pa dang / rigs pa dang rigs pa ma yin pa dang ma 'dres pas 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i thabs la mi rtog pa dang / sgrub pa dang sgrub pa ma yin pa las rnam par grol ba nyid kyi chos thams cad kyi mtshan ma dag dang ma 'brel ba dang /
analyzed: lam dang lam ma yin pa dang bral ba'i phyir ngan song chad pa dang / rigs pa dang rigs pa ma yin pa dang ma 'dres pas 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i thabs la mi rtog pa dang / sgrub pa dang sgrub pa ma yin pa las rnam par grol ba nyid kyi chos thams cad kyi mtshan ma dag dang ma 'brel ba dang /
translated: Since it is free from the path and not the path, it is the elimination of lower rebirths. Since it is unmixed with logic and illogical, it is the non-conceptualization of the means of actualizing the result. Since it is free from both practice and non-practice, it is unassociated with the signs of all phenomena.

original: nges par 'byin pa dang nges par 'byin pa ma yin pa med pas na brjod par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid shes bya dang / sgra gnyis la shes pa skye ba med pa zhes bya ba bden pa bzhi pa'i rnam pa dag yin te /
analyzed: nges par 'byin pa dang nges par 'byin pa ma yin pa med pas na brjod par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid shes bya dang / sgra gnyis la shes pa skye ba med pa zhes bya ba bden pa bzhi pa'i rnam pa dag yin te /
translated: Since there is no definite deliverance and no non-definite deliverance, it is the non-arising of cognition in relation to the two terms, the object of expression and the nature of the object of expression. These are the aspects of the fourth truth, called the non-arising of cognition in relation to the two terms.

original: de dag ni kun shes pa nyid kyi mthong ba'i lam skad cig ma bcu drug byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang du byas pa ste rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni kun shes pa nyid kyi mthong ba'i lam skad cig ma bcu drug byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang du byas pa ste rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: These are the sixteen moments of the path of seeing of the state of complete knowledge, which are posited from the perspective of bodhisattvas.

original: 'dis kyang nyan thos la sogs pas ni de dag las phyogs gcig gis bzlog pa'i rnam pa can du don gyis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis kyang nyan thos la sogs pas ni de dag las phyogs gcig gis bzlog pa'i rnam pa can du don gyis bstan pa yin no //
translated: This also shows that the Listeners and so forth are taught implicitly to have the aspect of reversing only a part of those.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis shes par bya ba yin gyi mngon du bya ba ni ma yin pas 'dir bsgom pa'i lam ni logs shig tu ma bstan to //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis shes par bya ba yin gyi mngon du bya ba ni ma yin pas 'dir bsgom pa'i lam ni logs shig tu ma bstan to //
translated: The path of the Listeners and so forth is to be understood by the Bodhisattvas, but it is not to be actualized. Therefore, the path of cultivation is not taught separately here.

original: de ltar na thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi mtshan nyid so sor gtan la phab nas //
analyzed: de ltar na thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi mtshan nyid so sor gtan la phab nas //
translated: Thus, having determined the characteristics of the three knowledges individually,

original: skabs gsum gyi mjug bsdu ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: skabs gsum gyi mjug bsdu ba gsungs pa /
translated: he states the conclusion of the three chapters:

original: de ltar 'di dang yang 'di dang // yang 'di yin te rnam gsum po //
analyzed: de ltar 'di dang yang 'di dang // yang 'di yin te rnam gsum po //
translated: Thus, this, and also this, and also this, are the three.

original: 'dis ni gnas skabs gsum po dag / rdzogs par yongs su bstan pa yin //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni gnas skabs gsum po dag / rdzogs par yongs su bstan pa yin //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
translated: By this, the three situations are taught completely.

original: de bas na gang zhig rtogs par bya ba nyid kyi bdag nyid dag bkag pa gzhi thams cad shes pa nyid 'di dang / chos thams cad la nye bar gnas pa med pa'i mtshan nyid can lam thams cad shes pa nyid 'di dang / 'ga' yang byed pa med pas don thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dag ste /
analyzed: de bas na gang zhig rtogs par bya ba nyid kyi bdag nyid dag bkag pa gzhi thams cad shes pa nyid 'di dang / chos thams cad la nye bar gnas pa med pa'i mtshan nyid can lam thams cad shes pa nyid 'di dang / 'ga' yang byed pa med pas don thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dag ste /
translated: Therefore, this knowledge of all bases, which is the very nature of what is to be realized, this knowledge of all paths, which is the characteristic of not abiding in any phenomena, and this knowledge of all aspects, which is the very nature of the complete fulfillment of all goals because nothing is done‚Äî

original: de ltar na dngos po rnam pa gsum bshad pas gzhung le'u gsum gyi skabs gsum rdzogs par bstan pa yin no //üîΩshes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos @37a * //
analyzed: de ltar na dngos po rnam pa gsum bshad pas gzhung le'u gsum gyi skabs gsum rdzogs par bstan pa yin no // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos @37a * //
translated: thus, by explaining these three things, the three chapters of the treatise are taught to be complete.

original: mngon par rtogs pa rgyan gyi 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma'i phreng ba zhes bya ba las skabs gsum pa'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa rgyan gyi 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma'i phreng ba zhes bya ba las skabs gsum pa'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: This concludes the commentary on the third chapter, called ‚ÄúThe Ornaments,‚Äù from Ornament of the Mahayana Sutras: A Commentary Called ‚ÄúIlluminating the Meaning.‚Äù

original: // / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi 'bras bu ji lta ba bzhin mngon sum du rtogs pa rim pa rnams nyams su blangs pa kho na la rag las pas da ni de dag dbang du bya ba nyid kyi phyir gzhi dang lam dang rnam pa ma lus
analyzed: // / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi 'bras bu ji lta ba bzhin mngon sum du rtogs pa rim pa rnams nyams su blangs pa kho na la rag las pas da ni de dag dbang du bya ba nyid kyi phyir gzhi dang lam dang rnam pa ma lus
translated: The realization of the result of the three omnisciences depends solely on the practice of the stages. Now, in order to bring them under control, the complete and perfect realization of the simultaneous meditation of all the bases, paths, and aspects is explained.

original: pa bsdu ba'i sgo nas cig car rnam par bsgom pa gang yin pa rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa bshad par bzhed nas thog mar de'i rnam pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: pa bsdu ba'i sgo nas cig car rnam par bsgom pa gang yin pa rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa bshad par bzhed nas thog mar de'i rnam pa gsungs pa /
translated: First, the aspects of that are stated:

original: gzhi shes pa yi bye brag rnams //
analyzed: gzhi shes pa yi bye brag rnams //
translated: The different aspects of the knowledge of the basis

original: rnam pa zhes bya mtshan nyid de //
analyzed: rnam pa zhes bya mtshan nyid de //
translated: Are called ‚Äúaspects‚Äù and are characteristics.

original: kun mkhyen nyid ni rnam gsum phyir //üîΩde ni rnam pa gsum du 'dod //
analyzed: kun mkhyen nyid ni rnam gsum phyir // de ni rnam pa gsum du 'dod //
translated: Because of the three omnisciences,

original: ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o //
translated: They are asserted to be threefold.

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa'i khyad par gyis mi rtag pa la sogs pa dang de la dmigs pa nyid kyi bye brag rnam pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa'i khyad par gyis mi rtag pa la sogs pa dang de la dmigs pa nyid kyi bye brag rnam pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The different aspects of impermanence and so on, which are distinguished by the specific truths of suffering and so on, are posited as the aspects that focus on them.

original: de ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi bye brag gis rnam pa gsum du 'dod de /
analyzed: de ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi bye brag gis rnam pa gsum du 'dod de /
translated: That is asserted to be threefold by the specific distinctions of the three omnisciences.

original: de la thams cad shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa rab tu dbye ba gsungs pa /üîΩmed pa'i rnam pa nas bzung ste //
analyzed: de la thams cad shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa rab tu dbye ba gsungs pa / med pa'i rnam pa nas bzung ste //
translated: The classification of the aspects of the knowledge of all aspects is stated:üîΩFrom the aspect of nonexistence

original: mi g-yo ba yi rnam pa'i bar //üîΩbden pa so so la bzhi dang // lam la de ni bco lngar bshad //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba yi rnam pa'i bar // bden pa so so la bzhi dang // lam la de ni bco lngar bshad //
translated: up to the aspect of immovability,üîΩin each truth there are four,

original: ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o //
translated: and in the path there are said to be fifteen.

original: ther zug tu med pa'i mtshan nyid mi rtag pa dang / de kho nar mi skye ba'i mtshan nyid sdug bsngal ba dang / don gzhan gyis dben pa'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / phung po'i skyon gyis mi brdzi ba'i mtshan nyid bdag med pa ste /
analyzed: ther zug tu med pa'i mtshan nyid mi rtag pa dang / de kho nar mi skye ba'i mtshan nyid sdug bsngal ba dang / don gzhan gyis dben pa'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / phung po'i skyon gyis mi brdzi ba'i mtshan nyid bdag med pa ste /
translated: Impermanence, which is characterized by noneternality, suffering, which is characterized by nonarising in reality, emptiness, which is characterized by being devoid of other objects, and selflessness, which is characterized by not being crushed by the faults of the aggregates.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i rnam pa bzhi dang / gzhi'i gnas med pa'i mtshan nyid rgyu'i rnam pa dang / byed pas dben pa nam mkha'i mtshan nyid kun 'byung ba dang / rtag pa la sogs pas brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid rab tu skye ba dang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i rnam pa bzhi dang / gzhi'i gnas med pa'i mtshan nyid rgyu'i rnam pa dang / byed pas dben pa nam mkha'i mtshan nyid kun 'byung ba dang / rtag pa la sogs pas brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid rab tu skye ba dang /
translated: the aspect of origination, characterized by the absence of an agent, like space;

original: tshor ba la sogs pa'i ming med pa'i mtshan nyid rkyen gyi rnam pa ste /
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa'i ming med pa'i mtshan nyid rkyen gyi rnam pa ste /
translated: the aspect of condition, characterized by the absence of the names of feelings and so forth.üîΩThe four aspects of the truth of origin are:üîΩthe aspect of cessation, characterized by the absence of going because of the non-establishment of an entity;üîΩthe aspect of peace, characterized by the invincibility of the abandonment of suffering;

original: kun 'byung ba'i rnam pa bzhi dang / ngo bo nyid ma grub pas 'gro ba med pa'i mtshan nyid 'gog pa dang / sdug bsngal pa spangs pa las mi 'phrogs @37b pa'i bdag nyid zhi ba dang / dman pa'i nyes pa dang bral bas mi zad pa'i mtshan nyid gya nom pa dang /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i rnam pa bzhi dang / ngo bo nyid ma grub pas 'gro ba med pa'i mtshan nyid 'gog pa dang / sdug bsngal pa spangs pa las mi 'phrogs @37b pa'i bdag nyid zhi ba dang / dman pa'i nyes pa dang bral bas mi zad pa'i mtshan nyid gya nom pa dang /
translated: the aspect of excellence, characterized by inexhaustibility because of being free from the faults of the inferior;üîΩthe aspect of definite emergence, characterized by non-arising because of having reached the state of benefit.

original: phan pa'i gnas su phyin pas skye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid nges par 'byung ba ste 'gog pa'i rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: phan pa'i gnas su phyin pas skye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid nges par 'byung ba ste 'gog pa'i rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: The four aspects of the truth of cessation are:

original: de ltar na bden pa rnam pa gsum so so la rab tu dbye bas bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: de ltar na bden pa rnam pa gsum so so la rab tu dbye bas bcu gnyis so //
translated: Thus, the truths are divided into twelve by the individual divisions of the three truths.

original: lam gyi bden pa la ni khyad par gyi rab tu dbye ba bco lnga ste /
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa la ni khyad par gyi rab tu dbye ba bco lnga ste /
translated: The truth of the path has fifteen specific divisions:

original: bdag gis byed pa po med pa'i mtshan nyid lam dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi shes pa po med pa'i mtshan nyid rigs pa dang / phyin ci ma log pas 'pho ba med pa'i mtshan nyid bsgrub pa dang / rtag pa'i go 'phang 'du 'bral med pa'i mtshan nyid nges par 'byin pa ste rnam pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: bdag gis byed pa po med pa'i mtshan nyid lam dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi shes pa po med pa'i mtshan nyid rigs pa dang / phyin ci ma log pas 'pho ba med pa'i mtshan nyid bsgrub pa dang / rtag pa'i go 'phang 'du 'bral med pa'i mtshan nyid nges par 'byin pa ste rnam pa bzhi dang /
translated: the path that is characterized by the absence of an agent, the principle that is characterized by the absence of a defiled cognizer, the accomplishment that is characterized by the absence of a reversal due to error and the definite emergence that is characterized by the state of permanence that is not separate from the assembly of the factors of enlightenment.

original: rmi lam ltar rang gi ngo bo nyid med pa dang / sgra brnyan ltar rgyu las ma skyes pa dang / mig yor ltar rkyen gyis ma 'gags pa dang / smig rgyu ltar dus gzod ma nas zhi ba dang / sgyu ma ltar bdag nyid rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das par rtogs pa'i rnam pa lnga dang /
analyzed: rmi lam ltar rang gi ngo bo nyid med pa dang / sgra brnyan ltar rgyu las ma skyes pa dang / mig yor ltar rkyen gyis ma 'gags pa dang / smig rgyu ltar dus gzod ma nas zhi ba dang / sgyu ma ltar bdag nyid rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das par rtogs pa'i rnam pa lnga dang /
translated: The five aspects are the realization that the path is like a dream, without any essence of its own, like an echo, not produced from a cause, like an optical illusion, not ceased due to conditions, like a mirage, primordially peaceful and like an illusion, naturally nirvana.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i bdag nyid dor ba dang blang bar bya ba'i gnyen po de dag med pa gnyis dang / nyon mongs pa'i bag chags dang gzugs la sogs pa'i dbye ba bdag dang chos su 'dzin pa'i gnyen po gos pa med pa dang /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i bdag nyid dor ba dang blang bar bya ba'i gnyen po de dag med pa gnyis dang / nyon mongs pa'i bag chags dang gzugs la sogs pa'i dbye ba bdag dang chos su 'dzin pa'i gnyen po gos pa med pa dang /
translated: The two remedies for the absence of the antidotes to the apprehension of self and phenomena are the remedies for the absence of the antidotes to the latent propensities of the afflictions and the absence of the antidotes to the differentiation of form and so on.üîΩThe two remedies for the absence of the antidotes to the enjoyment of one's own attainment and the absence of the antidotes to the realization of degeneration in others are the remedies for the absence of the antidotes to the pride of the door of the result and the absence of the antidotes to the aspect of nonfluctuation.

original: spros pa med pa gnyis dang / rang gi rtogs pa thob pa la ro myang ba dang / gzhan las nyams par rtogs pa'i gnyen po 'bras bu'i sgo can gyi yongs su 'dzin pa'i gnyen po'i rlom pa med pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i rnam pa gnyis te rtogs pa'i khyad par drug go //
analyzed: spros pa med pa gnyis dang / rang gi rtogs pa thob pa la ro myang ba dang / gzhan las nyams par rtogs pa'i gnyen po 'bras bu'i sgo can gyi yongs su 'dzin pa'i gnyen po'i rlom pa med pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i rnam pa gnyis te rtogs pa'i khyad par drug go //
translated: These are the six specific realizations.

original: de la dang po bzhi ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: de la dang po bzhi ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po yin no //
translated: Among them, the first four are the remedies for the afflictive obstructions.

original: de'i 'og tu bcu gcig ni shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bcu gcig ni shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnyen po ste /
translated: The eleven after that are the remedies for the obstructions to omniscience.

original: grangs bzhin du bsgom pa dang mthong ba'i lam gyi bdag nyid zag pa dang bcas pa dang cig shos kyi mtshan nyid lnga dang drug yin te /
analyzed: grangs bzhin du bsgom pa dang mthong ba'i lam gyi bdag nyid zag pa dang bcas pa dang cig shos kyi mtshan nyid lnga dang drug yin te /
translated: The path of cultivation has five characteristics, and the path of seeing has six characteristics, as they are cultivated and seen in order.

original: spyir na thams cad shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bdun no //
analyzed: spyir na thams cad shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bdun no //
translated: In general, there are twenty-seven aspects of the knowledge of all things.

original: de'i 'og tu lam shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa'i rab tu dbye ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu lam shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa'i rab tu dbye ba gsungs pa /
translated: Next, the classification of the aspects of the knowledge of the path is stated:üîΩCause, path, suffering,üîΩand cessation,

original: rgyu dang lam dang sdug bsngal dang // 'gog pa @38a * //üîΩla ni go rims bzhin //
analyzed: rgyu dang lam dang sdug bsngal dang // 'gog pa @38a * // la ni go rims bzhin //
translated: in that order,üîΩare proclaimed to be

original: de dag brgyad dang bdun dang ni //
analyzed: de dag brgyad dang bdun dang ni //
translated: eight, seven,

original: lnga dang bcu drug ces bsgrags so //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lnga dang bcu drug ces bsgrags so // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: five, and sixteen.

original: spyir sdug bsngal bskyed pa'i rgyu gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: spyir sdug bsngal bskyed pa'i rgyu gang yin pa ste /
translated: In general, whatever is the cause that produces suffering

original: yul la 'dun pa dang / 'dod chags dar /
analyzed: yul la 'dun pa dang / 'dod chags dar /
translated: is the craving that is the desire for objects, the craving that is the desire for existence, and the craving that is the desire to end existence.üîΩThe antidotes to those are the three aspects of freedom from attachment, nonabiding, and peace.üîΩWhatever is the origin of all suffering

original: yul la dga' bas mngon par sred pa'i gnyen po 'dod chags dang bral ba dang mi gnas pa dang / zhi ba'i rnam pa gsum dang / sdug bsngal ma lus pa kun 'byung ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: yul la dga' bas mngon par sred pa'i gnyen po 'dod chags dang bral ba dang mi gnas pa dang / zhi ba'i rnam pa gsum dang / sdug bsngal ma lus pa kun 'byung ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: is the four conditions, the four errors, and the four inverted perceptions.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi gnyen po de dag med pa gsum dang / sdug bsngal drag po rab tu skye ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi gnyen po de dag med pa gsum dang / sdug bsngal drag po rab tu skye ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: The three that are the absence of the antidotes to desire, anger, and ignorance, and that which is the arising of intense suffering.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa'i gnyen po nyon mongs pa med pa nyid gcig dang / sdug bsngal brgyud mar 'byung ba'i rkyen gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa'i gnyen po nyon mongs pa med pa nyid gcig dang / sdug bsngal brgyud mar 'byung ba'i rkyen gang yin pa ste /
translated: The one that is the absence of afflictions, which is the antidote to false imagination, and that which is the condition for the occurrence of suffering in succession.

original: sems can du mngon par zhen pa'i gnyen po sems can med pa'i rnam pa nyid gcig ste /
analyzed: sems can du mngon par zhen pa'i gnyen po sems can med pa'i rnam pa nyid gcig ste /
translated: The one that is the absence of sentient beings, which is the antidote to the conception of sentient beings.

original: de ltar rnam pa brgyad ni rgyur gyur pa'i bden pa kun 'byung ba'i rnam par bsgrags so //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa brgyad ni rgyur gyur pa'i bden pa kun 'byung ba'i rnam par bsgrags so //
translated: Thus, these eight aspects are proclaimed as the aspects of the truth of origin that is the cause.

original: sems can thams cad go skabs 'byed pa'i lam tshad med pa dang / ji ltar go skabs 'byed pa'i lam mtha' gnyis dang ma 'brel ba dang / rigs pa gang yin pa tha mi dad pa dang / ji ltar rigs pa mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa dang /
analyzed: sems can thams cad go skabs 'byed pa'i lam tshad med pa dang / ji ltar go skabs 'byed pa'i lam mtha' gnyis dang ma 'brel ba dang / rigs pa gang yin pa tha mi dad pa dang / ji ltar rigs pa mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa dang /
translated: The immeasurable path that opens up opportunities for all sentient beings, the path that opens up opportunities in a way that is not connected to the two extremes, the non-differentiation of whatever is reasonable, and the non-grasping at whatever is reasonable as supreme.

original: sgrub pa gang yin pa mtshan mar mi rtog pa dang / ji ltar sgrub pa tshad mas gzhal du med par 'dzin pa gang yin pa chags pa med pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa gang yin pa mtshan mar mi rtog pa dang / ji ltar sgrub pa tshad mas gzhal du med par 'dzin pa gang yin pa chags pa med pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: The practice is the non-conceptualization of signs. The way of practicing is the apprehension of the immeasurable by means of valid cognition. This is the aspect of non-attachment.

original: de ltar rnam pa bdun ni lam gyi bden pa'i rnam par bsgrags so //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa bdun ni lam gyi bden pa'i rnam par bsgrags so //
translated: Thus, these seven aspects are proclaimed to be the aspects of the truth of the path.

original: rab tu 'jig pa nyid kyis mi rtag pa dang / nye bar gnod pa nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba dang / gzhan du gyur pa'i byed pa po med pa nyid kyis stong pa dang / rang nyid de'i ngo bo ma yin pa nyid kyis bdag med pa dang /
analyzed: rab tu 'jig pa nyid kyis mi rtag pa dang / nye bar gnod pa nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba dang / gzhan du gyur pa'i byed pa po med pa nyid kyis stong pa dang / rang nyid de'i ngo bo ma yin pa nyid kyis bdag med pa dang /
translated: Impermanence due to complete destruction, suffering due to harm, emptiness due to the absence of a creator that transforms, selflessness due to not being the nature of that [self],

original: spyir 'ga' yang yongs su gnas pa med pa nyid kyis mtshan nyid med pa'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: spyir 'ga' yang yongs su gnas pa med pa nyid kyis mtshan nyid med pa'i ngo bo ste /
translated: and the nature of signlessness due to the absence of any general abiding whatsoever.

original: de ltar rnam pa lnga ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i rnam par bsgrags so //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa lnga ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i rnam par bsgrags so //
translated: Thus, these five aspects are proclaimed to be the aspects of the truth of suffering.

original: 'gog pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: That which is cessation

original: de ni rang bzhin dang glo bur ba'i dri ma las grol ba nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo nang dang phyi dang @38b gnyis ka'i dngos po dang bral bas nang dang phyi dang gnyis ka stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa gsum dang / zhi ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin dang glo bur ba'i dri ma las grol ba nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo nang dang phyi dang @38b gnyis ka'i dngos po dang bral bas nang dang phyi dang gnyis ka stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa gsum dang / zhi ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: Since it is free from both natural and adventitious stains, its essence is free from inner, outer, and both kinds of entities. Therefore, it has three aspects: emptiness of the inner, emptiness of the outer, and emptiness of both the inner and the outer.üîΩIt is peace,

original: de ni rtag pa'i bdag tu lta ba nye bar spangs pa nyid kyis bdag gis stong pa dang / snod kyi 'jig rten dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam dang / rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba dang / rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: de ni rtag pa'i bdag tu lta ba nye bar spangs pa nyid kyis bdag gis stong pa dang / snod kyi 'jig rten dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam dang / rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba dang / rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba ma yin pa dang /
translated: which is to say, it is empty of a self because it has abandoned the view of a permanent self. It is empty of the world of the environment, the path of nirvana, that which arises from causes and conditions, and that which does not arise from causes and conditions.

original: rtag pa dang chad pa dang / 'khor ba'i sngon dang phyi ma dang / rtog pa'i chos ma spangs pa la mngon par zhen pa dgag pas ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / chen po dang / don dam pa dang / 'dus byas dang /
analyzed: rtag pa dang chad pa dang / 'khor ba'i sngon dang phyi ma dang / rtog pa'i chos ma spangs pa la mngon par zhen pa dgag pas ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / chen po dang / don dam pa dang / 'dus byas dang /
translated: It is empty of permanence and annihilation, the past and future of samsara, and the essence of phenomena that are not abandoned due to clinging. Therefore, it is emptiness of essence, emptiness of the great, emptiness of the ultimate, emptiness of the conditioned,üîΩand emptiness of the unconditioned.

original: 'dus ma byas dang / mtha' las 'das pa dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa ste brgyad dang / gya nom pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas dang / mtha' las 'das pa dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa ste brgyad dang / gya nom pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The aspect of the emptiness of the unconditioned, the aspect of the emptiness of what is beyond extremes, the aspect of the emptiness of the beginningless and endless, and the aspect of the emptiness of what is not to be discarded.

original: de ni rtogs pa gzhan las phul du gyur pa nyid kyis kun tu brtags pa'i byed pa po dgag pas rang gi rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa gcig nyid dang / nges par 'byung ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de ni rtogs pa gzhan las phul du gyur pa nyid kyis kun tu brtags pa'i byed pa po dgag pas rang gi rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa gcig nyid dang / nges par 'byung ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: The aspect of the sublime, which is the emptiness of the nature of the self, is the one aspect that refutes the imagined creator.üîΩThe aspect of the transcendence of suffering, which is the emptiness of all phenomena, is the aspect that refutes the imagined objects, characteristics, and times of the perfection that does not abide in any extreme.

original: de ni thams cad du mi gnas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyi brtags pa tsam gyi yul dang mtshan nyid dang dus su 'khrul pa'i rnam pa rnams dgag pas chos thams cad dang / gzugs su rung ba la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid dang /
analyzed: de ni thams cad du mi gnas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyi brtags pa tsam gyi yul dang mtshan nyid dang dus su 'khrul pa'i rnam pa rnams dgag pas chos thams cad dang / gzugs su rung ba la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid dang /
translated: The aspect of the emptiness of the defining characteristics, which is the emptiness of the defining characteristics of all phenomena, is the aspect that refutes the imagined defining characteristics of all phenomena, such as the defining characteristic of form being to be suitable to be form, and so on.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa ste /
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa ste /
translated: The aspect of the emptiness of the non-apprehension of the past, which is the emptiness of the past, and so on, is the aspect that refutes the imagined past, future, and present.

original: ji ltar nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa gsum dang / gang du nges par 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid dgag pas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa gcig ste /
analyzed: ji ltar nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa gsum dang / gang du nges par 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid dgag pas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa gcig ste /
translated: The three aspects of definite emergence and the one aspect of the emptiness of the non-existence of things, by the negation of the nature of the emergence in any way,

original: de ltar rnam pa bcu drug ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'i rnam par bsgrags pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa bcu drug ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'i rnam par bsgrags pa'o //
translated: thus, the sixteen aspects are proclaimed as the aspects of the Truth of Cessation.

original: de'i phyir lam shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa sum cu rtsa drug go //
analyzed: de'i phyir lam shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa sum cu rtsa drug go //
translated: Therefore, there are thirty-six aspects of the knowledge of the path.

original: de'i 'og tu rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam pa'i rab tu dbye ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam pa'i rab tu dbye ba gsungs pa /
translated: After that, the classification of the aspects of the knowledge of all aspects is stated:

original: dran pa nyer gzhag nas bzung ste //
analyzed: dran pa nyer gzhag nas bzung ste //
translated: From the foundations of mindfulness up to

original: sangs rgyas rnam pa'i mthar thug rnams //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnam pa'i mthar thug rnams //
translated: the Buddha-aspects,

original: lam gyi bden pa'i rjes mthun par //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa'i rjes mthun par //
translated: in accordance with the Truth of the Path,

original: kun mkhyen gsum du phye bas na //
analyzed: kun mkhyen gsum du phye bas na //
translated: divided into three omnisciences,üîΩfor the disciples, the Bodhisattvas,

original: slob ma byang chub sems dpa' dang // sangs rgyas rnams la rim bzhin te //
analyzed: slob ma byang chub sems dpa' dang // sangs rgyas rnams la rim bzhin te //
translated: and the Buddhas, respectively,

original: sum cu bdun dang sum cu bzhi //
analyzed: sum cu bdun dang sum cu bzhi //
translated: they are accepted as thirty-seven, thirty-four,

original: sum cu rtsa dgu dag tu bzhed //üîΩces bya ba'o //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa dgu dag tu bzhed // ces bya ba'o //
translated: and thirty-nine.üîΩThe aspects of the knowledge of all aspects are stated in the S≈´tra on the Ten Stages as follows:üîΩThe aspects of the knowledge of the path are stated in the S≈´tra on the Ten Stages as follows:

original: rnam @39a * //
analyzed: rnam @39a * //
translated: The aspects of the knowledge of all aspects are stated in the S≈´tra on the Ten Stages as follows:

original: pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mngon par byang chub pa'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nas bzung ste sangs rgyas kyi rnam pa'i mthar thug pa rnams ni de nyid mngon par sgrub pa'i lam yin pa'i sgo nas
analyzed: pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mngon par byang chub pa'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nas bzung ste sangs rgyas kyi rnam pa'i mthar thug pa rnams ni de nyid mngon par sgrub pa'i lam yin pa'i sgo nas
translated: Omniscience is the path of accomplishing that, from the close placement of mindfulness up to the end of the aspects of buddhahood, because it is the manifest enlightenment to all aspects of all phenomena.üîΩIn this regard, it is asserted that omniscience is classified into three types:üîΩthe thirty seven aspects of omniscience for sravakas and so on,üîΩthe thirty four aspects of omniscience for bodhisattvas and

original: de'i dbang du byas te thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam pa gsum gyi rab tu dbye ba nyan thos la sogs pa la rnam pa sum cu rtsa bdun dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams la sum cu rtsa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas rnams la sum cu rtsa dgur bzhed do //
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas te thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam pa gsum gyi rab tu dbye ba nyan thos la sogs pa la rnam pa sum cu rtsa bdun dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams la sum cu rtsa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas rnams la sum cu rtsa dgur bzhed do //
translated: the thirty nine aspects of omniscience for buddhas.

original: de la gzhi thams cad shes pa'i rnam pa rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la gzhi thams cad shes pa'i rnam pa rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the aspects of omniscience that are the basis?

original: dang por dngos po yongs su rtogs pa'i lam la lus kyi rang bzhin shes pas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la 'jug pa lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / tshor ba dang sems dang chos kyi rang bzhin shes pas kun 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: dang por dngos po yongs su rtogs pa'i lam la lus kyi rang bzhin shes pas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la 'jug pa lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / tshor ba dang sems dang chos kyi rang bzhin shes pas kun 'byung ba dang /
translated: First, on the path of thorough understanding of things, one enters the truth of suffering by knowing the nature of the body, which is close placement of mindfulness of the body. One enters the truths of origin,üîΩcessation and path by knowing the nature of feelings, mind and phenomena.

original: 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden pa la 'jug par 'gyur ba mnyam par gzhag pa dang / cig shos kyis spyi dang rang gi mtshan nyid yongs su brtags pas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i rnam pa bzhi'o //üîΩde ltar zhugs pa las brtson 'grus 'byung bas rtsol ba'i lam la mi dge ba skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dag yang dag par sel cing slar mi bskyed pa dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa dang skyes pa dag bskyed pa dang / mngon par 'phel bar byed pa'i brtson 'grus te /
analyzed: 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden pa la 'jug par 'gyur ba mnyam par gzhag pa dang / cig shos kyis spyi dang rang gi mtshan nyid yongs su brtags pas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i rnam pa bzhi'o // de ltar zhugs pa las brtson 'grus 'byung bas rtsol ba'i lam la mi dge ba skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dag yang dag par sel cing slar mi bskyed pa dang / dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa dang skyes pa dag bskyed pa dang / mngon par 'phel bar byed pa'i brtson 'grus te /
translated: The other is the four aspects of close placement of mindfulness, which thoroughly investigate general and specific characteristics.

original: yang dag par spong ba rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: Since effort arises from such engagement, on the path of effort one has the four correct abandonments: one correctly eliminates and does not generate again nonvirtue that has arisen and that which has not arisen and one generates and increases virtue that has not arisen and that which has arisen.

original: brtson 'grus dang ldan pas sems las su rung ba nyid du byed pas ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyong ba'i lam la gus par sbyor ba nyid kyi rgyur gyur pa can 'dun pa dang rtag par sbyor ba nyid kyi rgyur gyur pa can brtson 'grus dang /
analyzed: brtson 'grus dang ldan pas sems las su rung ba nyid du byed pas ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyong ba'i lam la gus par sbyor ba nyid kyi rgyur gyur pa can 'dun pa dang rtag par sbyor ba nyid kyi rgyur gyur pa can brtson 'grus dang /
translated: Since one who possesses effort makes the mind serviceable, it is the cause of the path of thorough training in concentration.

original: sngon gyi ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyur gyur pa can sems dang / de kho na nyid rab tu 'byed pa'i rgyur gyur pa can dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: sngon gyi ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyur gyur pa can sems dang / de kho na nyid rab tu 'byed pa'i rgyur gyur pa can dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: It is the cause of constant application. It is the cause of the mind that is the cause of previous concentration and it is the cause of the analysis that is the cause of the discernment of thatness.

original: gnas la sogs pa brgyad kyis le lo la sogs pa'i nyes pa rnam pa lnga spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: gnas la sogs pa brgyad kyis le lo la sogs pa'i nyes pa rnam pa lnga spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: The four bases of supernormal powers possess the motivating factors that abandon the five faults such as laziness through the eight such as desire and so on.

original: yongs su sbyangs pa la dro ba la sogs pa bzhi 'byung bas mngon par rtogs pa la sbyor ba'i lam la bden @39b pa'i chos nyid rnams la yid ches pa dad pa dang / de nyid mngon par rtogs par rab tu spro ba brtson 'grus dang /
analyzed: yongs su sbyangs pa la dro ba la sogs pa bzhi 'byung bas mngon par rtogs pa la sbyor ba'i lam la bden @39b pa'i chos nyid rnams la yid ches pa dad pa dang / de nyid mngon par rtogs par rab tu spro ba brtson 'grus dang /
translated: Faith is confidence in the nature of the four truths, effort is enthusiasm for realizing that nature,

original: rnam pa de yid yongs su mi brjed pa dran pa dang / shin tu rtse gcig pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / bden pa'i de kho na nyid rnam par 'byed pa shes rab kyi dbang po ste /
analyzed: rnam pa de yid yongs su mi brjed pa dran pa dang / shin tu rtse gcig pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / bden pa'i de kho na nyid rnam par 'byed pa shes rab kyi dbang po ste /
translated: mindfulness is not forgetting that aspect, samadhi is complete one pointedness and the faculty of wisdom is the discernment of the thatness of the four truths.üîΩSince one knows the nonexistence of the apprehended of affliction and its opposite, one approaches the vision of thatness.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang cig shos kyi gzung ba med pa nyid shes pas de kho na nyid mthong ba la nye bar gyur pa dro ba dang rtse mor gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid dbang po'i rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang cig shos kyi gzung ba med pa nyid shes pas de kho na nyid mthong ba la nye bar gyur pa dro ba dang rtse mor gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid dbang po'i rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: The five faculties are the nature of heat and peak.

original: dro ba la sogs pa thob pa la bzod pa la sogs pa 'byung bas mngon par rtogs pa dang 'brel pa'i lam la dad pa la sogs pa de dag nyid cher mthu dang ldan par gyur pas rdzas dang btags pa'i 'dzin pa med pa nyid shes pas zab
analyzed: dro ba la sogs pa thob pa la bzod pa la sogs pa 'byung bas mngon par rtogs pa dang 'brel pa'i lam la dad pa la sogs pa de dag nyid cher mthu dang ldan par gyur pas rdzas dang btags pa'i 'dzin pa med pa nyid shes pas zab
translated: Since perseverance for the summit of existence and so on arise from obtaining heat and so forth, those such as faith that are related to the path of realization become powerful and one obtains the five types of power that are the nature of acceptance and the supreme mundane state.

original: mo'i spyod yul du gyur pa bzod pa dang / chos kyi mchog tu gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid stobs kyi rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: mo'i spyod yul du gyur pa bzod pa dang / chos kyi mchog tu gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid stobs kyi rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: They are profound since they are objects of wisdom that do not apprehend substantial or imputed entities.

original: nges par 'byed pa la sbyor ba rnam pa bzhi rtogs pas ni bden pa'i de kho na nyid mthong bar 'gyur bas mngon par rtogs pa'i lam la mngon par rtogs pa snga ma ma brjed par dran pa dang / de kho na mngon du gyur pa'i chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa la sbyor ba rnam pa bzhi rtogs pas ni bden pa'i de kho na nyid mthong bar 'gyur bas mngon par rtogs pa'i lam la mngon par rtogs pa snga ma ma brjed par dran pa dang / de kho na mngon du gyur pa'i chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang /
translated: One sees the reality tattva of the four truths through realizing the four aspects of preparation for the factors conducive to penetrative insight.

original: gong mar gyur pa'i chos la mngon par spro ba brtson 'grus dang / chos dang sems can la dmigs nas zag pa med pa'i bden pas tshim pa dga' ba dang / lus dang sems las su rung ba nyid shin tu sbyangs pa dang / rtse gcig pas mnyam par gnas pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang /
analyzed: gong mar gyur pa'i chos la mngon par spro ba brtson 'grus dang / chos dang sems can la dmigs nas zag pa med pa'i bden pas tshim pa dga' ba dang / lus dang sems las su rung ba nyid shin tu sbyangs pa dang / rtse gcig pas mnyam par gnas pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang /
translated: Concentration is the one pointed abiding of the mind.

original: dgos pa byas pa'i phyir rtsol ba dang bral ba btang snyoms yang dag pa ste /
analyzed: dgos pa byas pa'i phyir rtsol ba dang bral ba btang snyoms yang dag pa ste /
translated: Correct equanimity is the absence of effort because the purpose has been achieved.

original: grangs bzhin du gnas pa dang / rang bzhin dang / nges par 'byung ba dang / phan yon dang / gzhi dang / nyon mongs pa med pa'i gnas dang / ngo bo nyid kyi yan lag yin pa'i phyir byang chub kyi yan lag gi rnam pa bdun no //
analyzed: grangs bzhin du gnas pa dang / rang bzhin dang / nges par 'byung ba dang / phan yon dang / gzhi dang / nyon mongs pa med pa'i gnas dang / ngo bo nyid kyi yan lag yin pa'i phyir byang chub kyi yan lag gi rnam pa bdun no //
translated: These are the seven aspects of the factors of enlightenment, because they are the branches of abiding, nature, definite emergence, benefit, basis, the state of being without defilement and essence.

original: bden pa mthong ba las bsgom pa'i lam 'byung bas rnam par dag par nges par 'dzin pa'i lam la mthong ba'i lam gyi rtogs pa la yang dag par gcod pa yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / log par rtog pa brgyad spangs pa'i mtshan nyid rtogs pa dang /üîΩdam @40a * //
analyzed: bden pa mthong ba las bsgom pa'i lam 'byung bas rnam par dag par nges par 'dzin pa'i lam la mthong ba'i lam gyi rtogs pa la yang dag par gcod pa yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / log par rtog pa brgyad spangs pa'i mtshan nyid rtogs pa dang / dam @40a * //
translated: Since the path of meditation arises from seeing the truth, the path of definite purity is the correct view that ascertains the realizations of the path of seeing, the realization that abandons the eight misconceptions,üîΩthe correct speech that teaches the Dharma to others,

original: pa'i chos bsnyad pa dang 'brel pa'i gtam gyis bden zhing snyan par smra ba dag dang / lus dang ngag dang yid kyis 'phags pa'i bya ba ma yin pa mi byed pa las kyi mtha' dang / tshul 'chos la sogs pa log par 'tsho ba lnga spangs pa 'tsho ba dang /
analyzed: pa'i chos bsnyad pa dang 'brel pa'i gtam gyis bden zhing snyan par smra ba dag dang / lus dang ngag dang yid kyis 'phags pa'i bya ba ma yin pa mi byed pa las kyi mtha' dang / tshul 'chos la sogs pa log par 'tsho ba lnga spangs pa 'tsho ba dang /
translated: the correct action that does not engage in non-arable actions of body, speech, and mind, the correct livelihood that abandons the five wrong livelihoods such as hypocrisy,

original: gnyen por gyur pa nyid kyi chos la mngon par brtson pa dang / gnyen po dmigs pa ma brjed pa dran pa dang / dmigs pa la rtse gcig par nye bar gnas pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: gnyen por gyur pa nyid kyi chos la mngon par brtson pa dang / gnyen po dmigs pa ma brjed pa dran pa dang / dmigs pa la rtse gcig par nye bar gnas pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: the correct effort that is the application to the dharmas that are the antidotes, the correct mindfulness that does not forget the focal object of the antidotes, and the correct samadhi that abides single-pointedly on the focal object.

original: go rims ltar yongs su gcod par byed pa'i yan lag dang / gzhan la go bar byed pa dang / lta ba la yid ches pa dang / tshul khrims dang ldan pa la yid ches pa dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa la yid ches pa'i yan lag dang /
analyzed: go rims ltar yongs su gcod par byed pa'i yan lag dang / gzhan la go bar byed pa dang / lta ba la yid ches pa dang / tshul khrims dang ldan pa la yid ches pa dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa la yid ches pa'i yan lag dang /
translated: The eight aspects of the ƒÅrya‚Äôs eightfold path are the branches of discernment, understanding others, confidence in view, confidence in ethical conduct, confidence in austerity,

original: nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa spang ba dang / ting nge 'dzin la dbang du ma gyur pa'i gnyen po'i yan lag yin pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i rnam pa brgyad de /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa spang ba dang / ting nge 'dzin la dbang du ma gyur pa'i gnyen po'i yan lag yin pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i rnam pa brgyad de /
translated: the branch of the antidote that abandons afflictions, the branch of the antidote that abandons branch afflictions, and the branch of the antidote that masters concentration.

original: de'i phyir slob ma rnams kyi kun shes pa nyid kyi lam gyi rten can rnam pa sum cu rtsa bdun du bzhed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir slob ma rnams kyi kun shes pa nyid kyi lam gyi rten can rnam pa sum cu rtsa bdun du bzhed do //
translated: Therefore they assert that the path of complete knowledge of students has thirty-seven aspects.

original: lam thams cad shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: lam thams cad shes pa nyid kyi rnam pa rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the aspects of the path of complete knowledge of all aspects?

original: re zhig gnyen po'i lam la bdag nyid dang bdag gir lta ba'i gnyen po gzhan dang ngo bor gyur pas stong pa dang bdag med pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam par thar pa'i sgo dang po'i rnam pa dang / de'i rgyu mtshan mtshan mar dmigs pa nyid kyi gnyen po 'gog pa dang /
analyzed: re zhig gnyen po'i lam la bdag nyid dang bdag gir lta ba'i gnyen po gzhan dang ngo bor gyur pas stong pa dang bdag med pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam par thar pa'i sgo dang po'i rnam pa dang / de'i rgyu mtshan mtshan mar dmigs pa nyid kyi gnyen po 'gog pa dang /
translated: First, the antidote to the view of the self and entities connected to the self is the aspect of the first door of liberation, the nature of emptiness and selflessness, which is of the same nature as the path of the antidote.üîΩThe antidote to the observation of the reason for that, the sign, is cessation,üîΩwhich is the aspect of the second door of liberation, the nature of the truth of the path.

original: lam gyi bden pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam par thar pa'i sgo gnyis pa'i rnam pa dang / khams gsum mam 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la dor ba dang blang bar bya bar smon pa'i gnyen por mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba gnyis dang /
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam par thar pa'i sgo gnyis pa'i rnam pa dang / khams gsum mam 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la dor ba dang blang bar bya bar smon pa'i gnyen por mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba gnyis dang /
translated: The antidote to the aspiration to adopt the three realms or samsara and to reject nirvana is the aspect of the two, impermanence and suffering.

original: rgyu dang rkyen kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen gyi rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen gyi rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four conditions: causal condition, objective condition, immediately preceding condition and dominant condition.

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The aspect of the third door of liberation is the nature of suffering and origin.

original: sprul pa'i lam la nang rang gi lus skra dang kha spu la sogs pa'i bar du gzugs kyi 'du shes rnam par bshig pas 'du shes nas phyi rol gyi gzugs la rnam @40b par lta ba ste /
analyzed: sprul pa'i lam la nang rang gi lus skra dang kha spu la sogs pa'i bar du gzugs kyi 'du shes rnam par bshig pas 'du shes nas phyi rol gyi gzugs la rnam @40b par lta ba ste /
translated: On the path of emanation, one meditates on the form of the body, from head to toe, and on the form of the hair and beard, and so on, and one meditates on the form of external objects,üîΩcontemplating that they are greater or smaller than they are, and so on.

original: chen po dang chung ngu la sogs pa la de bas ches chen po dang chung ngu la sogs par mos shing sgom par byed pa dang / nang gzugs kyi 'du shes pa rnam par bshig pas nam mkha'i 'du shes su byas nas bsam gtan gyi sems mngon du byas pa nyid kyis phyi rol gyi gzugs la snga ma ltar bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: chen po dang chung ngu la sogs pa la de bas ches chen po dang chung ngu la sogs par mos shing sgom par byed pa dang / nang gzugs kyi 'du shes pa rnam par bshig pas nam mkha'i 'du shes su byas nas bsam gtan gyi sems mngon du byas pa nyid kyis phyi rol gyi gzugs la snga ma ltar bsgom pa ste /
translated: One meditates on external forms as before, having eliminated the perception of internal form and having contemplated the perception of space.

original: sprul pa la rang dbang bar bsgyur mi nus pa'i gnyen por rnam par thar pa gnyis dang / gzugs sdug pa dang mi sdug pa la sprul pa mngon par brtson par 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa 'bad pa dang mi 'bad pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo lus kyi mngon sum du byas nas rdzogs par byas te
analyzed: sprul pa la rang dbang bar bsgyur mi nus pa'i gnyen por rnam par thar pa gnyis dang / gzugs sdug pa dang mi sdug pa la sprul pa mngon par brtson par 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa 'bad pa dang mi 'bad pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo lus kyi mngon sum du byas nas rdzogs par byas te
translated: The liberation of the beautiful is the antidote to the afflictions of the desire and non-desire to strive to emanate beautiful and ugly forms and to strive and not strive for them.

original: gnas so zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gnas so zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The sutra states:üîΩOne abides having manifested and completed the liberation of the beautiful.

original: phan tshun ltos pa dang / rjes su zhugs pa dang / ro gcig pa'i 'du shes bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: phan tshun ltos pa dang / rjes su zhugs pa dang / ro gcig pa'i 'du shes bsgom pa ste /
translated: This is the cultivation of the perception of mutual dependence, engagement and single taste.

original: sprul pa la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por rnam par thar pa gcig go //
analyzed: sprul pa la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por rnam par thar pa gcig go //
translated: One liberation is the antidote to the afflictions of emanations.

original: mthong ba'i chos can la bde bar gnas pa'i lam la 'di ltar thar pa dang mthun par gnas pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin nam mkha' mtha' yas pa la sogs pa gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnam pa bzhi dang / zhi bar gnas pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i rnam pa gcig go //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos can la bde bar gnas pa'i lam la 'di ltar thar pa dang mthun par gnas pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin nam mkha' mtha' yas pa la sogs pa gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnam pa bzhi dang / zhi bar gnas pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i rnam pa gcig go //
translated: The path of abiding in comfort in this life is the four formless meditative attainments of infinite space and so on, which are the nature of the path that accords with liberation and the single aspect of the meditative attainment of the aspect of the cessation of discernment and feeling, which is the nature of the path of abiding in peace.

original: de ltar rnam par thar pa brgyad kyi rnam pa ni sprul pa dang bde bar gnas pa'i lam gnyis kyis bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par thar pa brgyad kyi rnam pa ni sprul pa dang bde bar gnas pa'i lam gnyis kyis bsdus pa yin no //
translated: Thus the eight aspects of liberation are subsumed by the two paths of emanation and abiding in comfort.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam la mthong ba dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyi rten gyi ngo bo nyid kyis bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa bzhi dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyi rten nyid kyis nam mkha' mtha' yas la sogs pa gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam la mthong ba dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyi rten gyi ngo bo nyid kyis bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa bzhi dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyi rten nyid kyis nam mkha' mtha' yas la sogs pa gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang /
translated: The transcendent path is subsumed by the four absorptions such as the first absorption and so on, which are the support of the path of seeing and the support of the path of meditation and the four formless meditative attainments of infinite space and so on, which are the support of the path of meditation alone.

original: 'das pa'i sems nyid kyis 'jug cing langs nas mngon du byed pa nyid kyis mngon par bsgrubs pa'i 'bras bu 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dag ste /
analyzed: 'das pa'i sems nyid kyis 'jug cing langs nas mngon du byed pa nyid kyis mngon par bsgrubs pa'i 'bras bu 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dag ste /
translated: The result of the meditative development of the meditative attainment of cessation is the actual meditative attainment of cessation which is entered into and arisen from by means of the mind of the past.

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnam pa dgu'o //üîΩspong ba'i lam la nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa yongs su sgrib pa bzhi rnam par sel ba nyid kyis bar chad med pa'i lam gyi rnam par @41a * //
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnam pa dgu'o // spong ba'i lam la nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa yongs su sgrib pa bzhi rnam par sel ba nyid kyis bar chad med pa'i lam gyi rnam par @41a * //
translated: These are the nine meditative attainments of abiding in progressive order.üîΩThe path of application is the path of application of the bodhisattva which is not common to the ≈õrƒÅvaka etc. It is the path of application of the bodhisattva which is not common to the ≈õrƒÅvaka etc. because it is the counteragent to the four obscurations.

original: 'gyur ba bden pa bzhi'i chos shes pa nyid kyi bzod pas rab tu bsdus pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba bden pa bzhi'i chos shes pa nyid kyi bzod pas rab tu bsdus pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: It is the path of application of the bodhisattva which is not common to the ≈õrƒÅvaka etc. because it is the counteragent to the four obscurations.

original: sangs rgyas nyid kyi lam la gzhan la ma 'dres pa nyid kyis sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nyid rnam pa bcu ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid kyi lam la gzhan la ma 'dres pa nyid kyis sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nyid rnam pa bcu ste /
translated: The path of the Buddha is the ten perfections beginning with generosity, because they are not common to others.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam shes pa nyid kyi lam gyi rten can gyi rnam pa sum cu rtsa bzhir bzhed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam shes pa nyid kyi lam gyi rten can gyi rnam pa sum cu rtsa bzhir bzhed do //
translated: Therefore, the path of the knowledge of the path of the bodhisattvas is considered to have thirty-four aspects, based on the path.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam pa rnams gang zhe na /üîΩphan pa dang bde ba nyid kyi gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa dang / nyes pa dang legs par spyad pa'i 'bras bu las kyi rnam par smin pa mkhyen pa dang / lam dang 'bras bu so so la mos pa sna tshogs pa mkhyen pa dang /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam pa rnams gang zhe na / phan pa dang bde ba nyid kyi gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa dang / nyes pa dang legs par spyad pa'i 'bras bu las kyi rnam par smin pa mkhyen pa dang / lam dang 'bras bu so so la mos pa sna tshogs pa mkhyen pa dang /
translated: What are the aspects of the knowledge of all aspects?üîΩThey are the knowledge of the possible and impossible, the knowledge of the results of the evolution of actions, the knowledge of the various higher and lower faculties of beings, the knowledge of the various aspirations of beings,

analyzed: zhing yongs su dag pa dang ma dag pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams du ma mkhyen pa dang / theg pa chen po dang chen po ma yin pa la yid ches pa'i dbang po mchog dang / mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa dang / nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa dang yin pa'i 'bras bu thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa dang /
translated: the knowledge of the various dhƒÅtus of beings, the knowledge of the path that leads everywhere, the knowledge of the recollection of former existences, the knowledge of the divine eye, and the knowledge of the destruction of the impurities.

original: da ni chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'o zhes ye shes zhal gyis 'ches pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa zag pa ji snyed pa thams cad rab tu zad do zhes spangs pa nyid dang / gzhan la 'dod chags la sogs pa 'di dag gis theg pa gsum gyi bar du gcod pa'o zhes gegs lung 'bogs pa nyid dang /
analyzed: da ni chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'o zhes ye shes zhal gyis 'ches pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa zag pa ji snyed pa thams cad rab tu zad do zhes spangs pa nyid dang / gzhan la 'dod chags la sogs pa 'di dag gis theg pa gsum gyi bar du gcod pa'o zhes gegs lung 'bogs pa nyid dang /
translated: Now, he claims to have the gnosis of perfect buddhahood, saying, I have fully awakened to all phenomena, he claims to have eliminated, saying, I have completely eliminated all defilements such as attachment and he claims to have blocked the path, saying, These attachments and so on block the three vehicles.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi lam 'khor ba dang theg pa dman pa las nges par 'byung ba rjes su @41b ston par mdzad pa la lha dang bdud la sogs pa'i rgol ba pos bag tsha ba med pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi lam 'khor ba dang theg pa dman pa las nges par 'byung ba rjes su @41b ston par mdzad pa la lha dang bdud la sogs pa'i rgol ba pos bag tsha ba med pa ste /
translated: He teaches the path of the three omnisciences that definitely delivers one from samsara and the lower vehicles and he is fearless in the face of any opponent, such as gods and demons.

original: gzhan mu stegs la sogs pas brdzi bar mi nus pa'i phyir mi 'jigs pa'i rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: gzhan mu stegs la sogs pas brdzi bar mi nus pa'i phyir mi 'jigs pa'i rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: He has four kinds of fearlessness because he cannot be crushed by others, such as tirthikas.

original: gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi chos rnams la rnam grangs so so yang dag par rig pa dang / de dag gi spyi dang rang gi mtshan nyid la don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / lha dang klu la sogs pa'i skad la nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa dang /üîΩchos rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba'i yul la spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi chos rnams la rnam grangs so so yang dag par rig pa dang / de dag gi spyi dang rang gi mtshan nyid la don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / lha dang klu la sogs pa'i skad la nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa dang / chos rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba'i yul la spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa ste /
translated: These four kinds of perfect knowledge are the perfect knowledge of the categories of all phenomena from form to omniscience, the perfect knowledge of their general and specific characteristics, the perfect knowledge of the etymological definitions of the languages of gods, nagas and so on and the perfect knowledge of eloquence with regard to the classification of phenomena.

translated: He is never indifferent without examining whether or not those to be tamed are suitable vessels.

original: grangs ji lta bar drug tshan re res spyod pa dang thob pa dang / phrin las shin tu phul du gyur pa gzhan las thun mong ma yin pa brnyes pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnam pa bco brgyad dang / dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas thams cad kyis bshad cing 'gyur ba med pa'i de bzhin nyid dang /
analyzed: grangs ji lta bar drug tshan re res spyod pa dang thob pa dang / phrin las shin tu phul du gyur pa gzhan las thun mong ma yin pa brnyes pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnam pa bco brgyad dang / dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas thams cad kyis bshad cing 'gyur ba med pa'i de bzhin nyid dang /
translated: The nature of the Buddha is the suchness of all things, which is explained by all buddhas of the three times and is unchanging.

original: chos thams cad la dbang bsgyur ba rang 'byung ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub pa'i mtshan nyid sangs rgyas nyid kyi rnam pa ste /üîΩ@42a * // rnam pa thams cad bla na med pa'i rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: chos thams cad la dbang bsgyur ba rang 'byung ba dang / rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub pa'i mtshan nyid sangs rgyas nyid kyi rnam pa ste / @42a * // rnam pa thams cad bla na med pa'i rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: It is the mastery over all phenomena, self-arisen and characterized by the complete and perfect enlightenment of all aspects.

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam gyi rten can gyi rnam pa ni sum cu rtsa dgur bzhed de /
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam gyi rten can gyi rnam pa ni sum cu rtsa dgur bzhed de /
translated: Thus the aspects of the knowledge of all aspects of the buddhas are asserted to be thirty-nine, based on the path.

original: mdor bsdu na rnam pa brgya bdun cu rtsa gsum yin no //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na rnam pa brgya bdun cu rtsa gsum yin no //
translated: In brief, there are seventy-three aspects.

original: de la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi rnam pa rnams ni go rims ltar nyan thos la sogs pa nyon mongs pa med pas zhi ba kho na'i don du zhugs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' nyon mongs pa shin tu spangs pa ma yin pas sems can gyi don tshol ba dang /
analyzed: de la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi rnam pa rnams ni go rims ltar nyan thos la sogs pa nyon mongs pa med pas zhi ba kho na'i don du zhugs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' nyon mongs pa shin tu spangs pa ma yin pas sems can gyi don tshol ba dang /
translated: The three types of omniscience should be understood as follows: the aspects of the three types of omniscience are respectively engaged for the sake of the mere peace of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on, who are free of afflictions, the bodhisattvas, who have not completely abandoned the afflictions, seek the welfare of sentient beings,

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dri ma ma lus pa spangs pas mdzad pa lhun gyis grub par spyod pa'i phyir zag pa med pa dang / yod pa dang med pa gnyis ka dang / shin tu zag pa med pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dri ma ma lus pa spangs pas mdzad pa lhun gyis grub par spyod pa'i phyir zag pa med pa dang / yod pa dang med pa gnyis ka dang / shin tu zag pa med pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: and the perfect buddhas, who have abandoned all stains, engage in deeds that are spontaneously present.

original: de'i rjes la rnam pa de dag sgom par byed pa'i sbyor ba bstan pa'i phyir sngon du sbyor ba po'i snod gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i rjes la rnam pa de dag sgom par byed pa'i sbyor ba bstan pa'i phyir sngon du sbyor ba po'i snod gsungs pa /
translated: After that, in order to teach the training in meditating on those aspects, the vessel of the one who trains is first taught.

translated: They have served the buddhas

analyzed: de las dge ba'i rtsa ba bskrun //
translated: and planted roots of virtue with them.

original: dge ba'i bshes kyi mgon bcas pa //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes kyi mgon bcas pa //
translated: They have been protected by the spiritual friend.
