analyzed: snod du dam pa rnams bzhed do // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: received, hold, and so on.

original: sngon dang da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas rnams la bsnyen bkur byas pa dang / de dag la sems bskyed pa la sogs pas dge ba'i rtsa ba bskrun cing sbyangs pa dang / gnas skabs thams cad du dge ba'i bshes gnyen dag gis rjes su bzung ba rnams ni rnam pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi yum 'di'i gzhung mnyan pa'i snod du rung ba yin no //
analyzed: sngon dang da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas rnams la bsnyen bkur byas pa dang / de dag la sems bskyed pa la sogs pas dge ba'i rtsa ba bskrun cing sbyangs pa dang / gnas skabs thams cad du dge ba'i bshes gnyen dag gis rjes su bzung ba rnams ni rnam pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi yum 'di'i gzhung mnyan pa'i snod du rung ba yin no //
translated: Those who have served the Buddhas of the past and present, who have planted and cultivated the roots of virtue by arousing the thought of enlightenment, and so on, and who have been assisted by spiritual benefactors at all times are fit vessels for listening to the text of this Perfection of Wisdom which has the nature of the aspects.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la lus la sogs pa'i zhabs 'bring gis mnyes par byas pa dang / the tshom gyi gnas thams cad legs par dris pa dang / sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa bcu rab tu sgrub pa dag go rims ltar 'di'i tshig 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la lus la sogs pa'i zhabs 'bring gis mnyes par byas pa dang / the tshom gyi gnas thams cad legs par dris pa dang / sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa bcu rab tu sgrub pa dag go rims ltar 'di'i tshig 'dzin pa dang /
translated: They are pleasing the tathagatas by serving them with one's body and so on, asking them well about all the points one is doubtful about and accomplishing the ten paramitas such as generosity and ethics.üîΩ

original: don mi brjed pa dang / mtshan nyid tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa'i snod du rung ba nyid yin par sangs rgyas la sogs pa bzhed do //
analyzed: don mi brjed pa dang / mtshan nyid tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa'i snod du rung ba nyid yin par sangs rgyas la sogs pa bzhed do //
translated: The Tathagatas accept that the retention of its words, the nonforgetting of its meaning, and the suitability of proper mental attention to its characteristics are respectively due to the service of body, speech, and mind to the Tathagatas, the proper questioning of all doubtful points, and the practice of the ten perfections such as generosity and morality.

original: de'i 'og tu sbyor ba dngos gsungs @42b pa ;
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sbyor ba dngos gsungs @42b pa ;
translated: Then, after that, he states the actual application.

original: gzugs la sogs la mi gnas phyir //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs la mi gnas phyir //
translated: Because one does not dwell in form, etc.,

original: de la spyod pa bkag pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de la spyod pa bkag pa'i phyir //
translated: because one stops the practice of those,

original: de yi de bzhin nyid zab phyir //
analyzed: de yi de bzhin nyid zab phyir //
translated: because the suchness of those is profound,

original: de rnams gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de rnams gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir //
translated: because those are difficult to fathom,

original: de dag tshad ni med phyir dang // tshegs chen yun ring rtogs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de dag tshad ni med phyir dang // tshegs chen yun ring rtogs pa'i phyir //
translated: because those are immeasurable, and because one realizes them after a long time with great difficulty,

original: lung bstan phyir mi ldog nyid dang // nges 'byung bar chad med bcas dang // byang chub nye dang myur ba dang // gzhan don 'phel med 'grib med phyir //
analyzed: lung bstan phyir mi ldog nyid dang // nges 'byung bar chad med bcas dang // byang chub nye dang myur ba dang // gzhan don 'phel med 'grib med phyir //
translated: and because of no increase or decrease in the benefit of others.

original: chos dang chos min sogs mi mthong //
analyzed: chos dang chos min sogs mi mthong //
translated: One does not see virtue and nonvirtue,üîΩand so on.

original: gzugs sogs bsam mi khyab mi mthong //
analyzed: gzugs sogs bsam mi khyab mi mthong //
translated: One does not see the inconceivability of form and so on.üîΩOne does not conceptualize the signs of form and so on,

original: gzugs sogs de yi mtshan ma dang // de yi ngo bor rnam mi rtog /'bras bu rin chen spyin byed dang // de ni dag pa mtshams dang bcas //
analyzed: gzugs sogs de yi mtshan ma dang // de yi ngo bor rnam mi rtog /'bras bu rin chen spyin byed dang // de ni dag pa mtshams dang bcas //
translated: nor their nature. The precious fruit is given,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and it is pure, together with its limits.

original: gzugs la sogs pa la ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyi mi gnas pa dang / de dag la mi sbyor ba nyid kyang mi dmigs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa de dag de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis zab pa dang / rtogs par dka' ba nyid kyis gting dpag dka' ba dang /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyi mi gnas pa dang / de dag la mi sbyor ba nyid kyang mi dmigs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa de dag de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis zab pa dang / rtogs par dka' ba nyid kyis gting dpag dka' ba dang /
translated: The nonabiding of form and so on in their reality, and the nonapplication to them, are also the profound. The profundity of form and so on by their reality of suchness, and their difficulty to fathom by their difficulty to realize, are the difficult to fathom.

original: de dag gi mtha' mi rnyed pa nyid kyis tshad med pa zhes bya bar rang bzhin gyi dbye ba rnam pa lnga dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la skrag pa'i phyir rab tu tshegs chen pos yun ring mo zhig na 'tshang rgya ba dang /
analyzed: de dag gi mtha' mi rnyed pa nyid kyis tshad med pa zhes bya bar rang bzhin gyi dbye ba rnam pa lnga dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la skrag pa'i phyir rab tu tshegs chen pos yun ring mo zhig na 'tshang rgya ba dang /
translated: Because they are afraid of the perfection of wisdom, they attain enlightenment after a long time with great difficulty.üîΩBecause they do not proclaim it, they are close to being predicted as irreversible.üîΩBecause they correctly uphold the practices of the perfection of wisdom, they are irreversible.

original: mi bsgrag pa'i phyir phyir mi ldog par lung bstan par nye ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa de'i chos spyod pa yang dag par 'dzin pa'i phyir phyir mi ldog pa dang / theg pa dman pa yid la byed pa'i bar chad kyi chos spong ba'i phyir nges par 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: mi bsgrag pa'i phyir phyir mi ldog par lung bstan par nye ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa de'i chos spyod pa yang dag par 'dzin pa'i phyir phyir mi ldog pa dang / theg pa dman pa yid la byed pa'i bar chad kyi chos spong ba'i phyir nges par 'byung ba dang /
translated: Because they abandon the phenomena that are obstacles to attending to the Hƒ´nayƒÅna, they are certain to be liberated.

original: rtag tu de kho na nyid kyi chos bsgom pa'i phyir bar chad med pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i chos gsar gyi rten du gyur pa'i phyir byang chub dang nye ba dang / 'bras bu chos kyi sku mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir byang chub myur ba dang /üîΩchos kyi 'khor lo rnam pa du mar rab tu skor bar byed pa'i phyir gzhan gyi don dang / chos kyi de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bos skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i phyir 'phel ba dang 'grib pa med pa dang / 'dod pa'i khams su nye bar mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos dang chos ma yin pa la sogs pa mi mthong ba dang /
analyzed: rtag tu de kho na nyid kyi chos bsgom pa'i phyir bar chad med pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i chos gsar gyi rten du gyur pa'i phyir byang chub dang nye ba dang / 'bras bu chos kyi sku mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir byang chub myur ba dang / chos kyi 'khor lo rnam pa du mar rab tu skor bar byed pa'i phyir gzhan gyi don dang / chos kyi de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bos skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i phyir 'phel ba dang 'grib pa med pa dang / 'dod pa'i khams su nye bar mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos dang chos ma yin pa la sogs pa mi mthong ba dang /
translated: It is endowed with uninterrupted meditation on suchness, it is close to enlightenment because it is the support for the new uncontaminated qualities and it is swift enlightenment because it is the actualization of the result, the dharmakaya.üîΩIt is for the benefit of others because it turns the wheel of Dharma in many ways, it is without increase and decrease because it is unborn and unceasing by nature, suchness, it is the non seeing of Dharma and non Dharma and so on because it does not observe the desire realm and it is the non seeing of the form and formless realms because it does not observe the form and formless realms.

original: kun rdzob kyi ngo bo nyid kyis gzugs la @43a * //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi ngo bo nyid kyis gzugs la @43a * //
translated: It is the non seeing of the three realms because it does not observe the three realms.

original: sogs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i don dam par de ltar rlom pa med pa'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rnam pa 'gog pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa dang de'i mtshan ma dang de'i ngo bo nyid gsum du rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir de'i ngo bor rnam par mi rtog pa dang /
analyzed: sogs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i don dam par de ltar rlom pa med pa'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rnam pa 'gog pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa dang de'i mtshan ma dang de'i ngo bo nyid gsum du rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir de'i ngo bor rnam par mi rtog pa dang /
translated: The aspect of nonconceptuality is the nonconceptuality of the essence of form and so on, because there is no concept of form and so on, their characteristics and their nature.üîΩThe aspect of the precious result is the bestowal of the precious result, because it causes the first result and so on to be manifestly seen.üîΩThe aspect of purity is purity, because it meditates on the pure reality of form and so on, which has two aspects.

original: 'bras bu dang po la sogs pa mngon par mthong ba nyid du byed pa'i phyir 'bras bu rin po che sbyin pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i chos nyid dag pa rnam pa gnyis bsgom pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa dang / lo dang zla ba la sogs pa khyad par gyi dus bzung bas mngon par brtson pa'i phyir sa mtshams dang bcas te /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang po la sogs pa mngon par mthong ba nyid du byed pa'i phyir 'bras bu rin po che sbyin pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i chos nyid dag pa rnam pa gnyis bsgom pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa dang / lo dang zla ba la sogs pa khyad par gyi dus bzung bas mngon par brtson pa'i phyir sa mtshams dang bcas te /
translated: The aspect of the boundary is the boundary, because it is applied with a special time such as a month or a year.

original: sbyor ba zhes pa gnas skabs kyi dbye ba bco lnga ste sbyor ba ni rnam pa nyi shu'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba zhes pa gnas skabs kyi dbye ba bco lnga ste sbyor ba ni rnam pa nyi shu'o //
translated: These are the fifteen divisions of the occasion.

original: de nas sbyor ba de dag rnam par sgom pa'i phan yon gsungs pa /üîΩbdud kyi mthu bcom la sogs pa //
analyzed: de nas sbyor ba de dag rnam par sgom pa'i phan yon gsungs pa / bdud kyi mthu bcom la sogs pa //
translated: The benefits of cultivating the applications areüîΩthe fourteen qualities such as overcoming the power of Mara.üîΩThe benefits of cultivating the applications are the fourteen qualities such as overcoming the power of Mara.üîΩThe benefits of cultivating the applications are the fourteen qualities such as overcoming the power of Mara.

original: yon tan rnam pa bcu bzhi'o //üîΩzhes bya ba'o// de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs pas bdud kyi mthu bcom pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad yongs su mnyes pas dgongs shing mkhyen pa dang / gces spras su byed pas mngon sum du mdzad pa dang / rgyu yongs su 'dzin pas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang nye bar gyur pa dang /
analyzed: yon tan rnam pa bcu bzhi'o //üîΩzhes bya ba'o// de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs pas bdud kyi mthu bcom pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad yongs su mnyes pas dgongs shing mkhyen pa dang / gces spras su byed pas mngon sum du mdzad pa dang / rgyu yongs su 'dzin pas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang nye bar gyur pa dang /
translated: The benefits of cultivating the applications are the fourteen qualities such as overcoming the power of Mara.üîΩThe benefits of cultivating the applications are the fourteen qualities original: nam yang ngan song du mi ltung zhing sangs rgyas dang mi 'bral bas don chen po nyid la sogs pa dang / lho phyogs brta ni nas byang phyogs su rgyas par 'gyur ba la sogs pas bya ba byed pa dang / sangs rgyas mang po la rab tu zhus pas zag pa med pa'i yon tan rdzogs pa dang /
analyzed: nam yang ngan song du mi ltung zhing sangs rgyas dang mi 'bral bas don chen po nyid la sogs pa dang / lho phyogs brta ni nas byang phyogs su rgyas par 'gyur ba la sogs pas bya ba byed pa dang / sangs rgyas mang po la rab tu zhus pas zag pa med pa'i yon tan rdzogs pa dang /
translated: It is the source of inexhaustible qualities, since it is requested from many buddhas.üîΩIt is the source of the qualities of the teacher, since the teacher teaches the subject of omniscience.üîΩIt is the source of the qualities of the person who is not to be turned back by Mara, since Mara cannot turn one away from enlightenment.

original: bdag la ston pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi gtam mdzad pas smra ba'i skyes bur 'gyur ba dang / bdud kyis byang chub las zlog par mi nus pas mi byed pa dang / bdag nyid theg pa chen po'i sbyor ba rnams la dga' ba cher 'phel zhing gzhan de nyid la 'god par 'gyur bas dge ba'i rtsa ba thun mong ma yin pa sbyin pa dang /
analyzed: bdag la ston pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi gtam mdzad pas smra ba'i skyes bur 'gyur ba dang / bdud kyis byang chub las zlog par mi nus pas mi byed pa dang / bdag nyid theg pa chen po'i sbyor ba rnams la dga' ba cher 'phel zhing gzhan de nyid la 'god par 'gyur bas dge ba'i rtsa ba thun mong ma yin pa sbyin pa dang /
translated: It is the source of the qualities of the person who is not to be turned back by others, since one's own joy in the practices of the Great Vehicle increases and one establishes others in those practices.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi rjes su yi rang ba mdzad pas dam bca' ba ji lta ba bzhin bsgrub pa dang / chos rgya chen po la mos shing spyod pa rlabs po che yang dag par spyad pas 'bras bu rgya chen po yongs su @43b 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi rjes su yi rang ba mdzad pas dam bca' ba ji lta ba bzhin bsgrub pa dang / chos rgya chen po la mos shing spyod pa rlabs po che yang dag par spyad pas 'bras bu rgya chen po yongs su @43b 'dzin pa dang /
translated: By rejoicing in the Buddhas, one accomplishes the vow just as it is; by having a vast aspiration for the Dharma and by practicing the great waves of conduct, one embraces the vast result.

original: de nas rlabs chen po'i spyod pas gzhan gyi dgos pa rjes su sgrub pas sems can gyi don sgrub pa dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi don du brtson pa mi gtong bas 'di tshol ba na 'di dang gzhan pa'i mdo sde 'di lta bu yang rnyed par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de nas rlabs chen po'i spyod pas gzhan gyi dgos pa rjes su sgrub pas sems can gyi don sgrub pa dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi don du brtson pa mi gtong bas 'di tshol ba na 'di dang gzhan pa'i mdo sde 'di lta bu yang rnyed par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Then, by the great waves of conduct, one accomplishes the purpose of others, thus accomplishing the benefit of sentient beings; by not abandoning striving for one's own and others' benefit, one finds this and other such sutras when seeking them.

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i sbyor ba la mngon par dga' bas 'thob pa yon tan rnam pa bcu bzhi'o //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i sbyor ba la mngon par dga' bas 'thob pa yon tan rnam pa bcu bzhi'o //
translated: Thus, by delighting in unmistaken practice, there are fourteen qualities to be attained.

original: de nas sbyor ba de dag phun sum tshogs par bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir skyon shes dgos pas bar chad du 'gyur ba'i gnas rnams gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nas sbyor ba de dag phun sum tshogs par bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir skyon shes dgos pas bar chad du 'gyur ba'i gnas rnams gsungs pa /
translated: Then, in order to accomplish those perfect practices, one must know the faults, so the obstacles are explained:

original: skyon ni bcu tshan bzhir bcas pa //üîΩdrug tu nges par rtogs par bya //
analyzed: skyon ni bcu tshan bzhir bcas pa // drug tu nges par rtogs par bya //
translated: The faults are four sets of ten.

original: zhes bya ba'o //üîΩskyo zhing bar chad du 'gyur ba'i rgyu spobs pa ha cang thogs pa dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rtogs pa myur du skye bas rlom pa'i rgyu ha cang myur ba ste spobs pa dang 'brel pa gnyis dang / glal ba dang steg pa la sogs pa lus kyi gnas ngan len dang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o // skyo zhing bar chad du 'gyur ba'i rgyu spobs pa ha cang thogs pa dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rtogs pa myur du skye bas rlom pa'i rgyu ha cang myur ba ste spobs pa dang 'brel pa gnyis dang / glal ba dang steg pa la sogs pa lus kyi gnas ngan len dang /
translated: They should be understood as definitely six.üîΩThe two related to eloquence are: (1) being too slow in eloquence, which is the cause of discouragement and an obstacle, and (2) being too quick in eloquence, which is the cause of conceit due to the rapid arising of incorrect understanding.

original: g-yeng ba dang 'dod chags la sogs pa sems kyi gnas ngan len dang / glal ba la sogs pa rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa'i kha ton byed pa la sogs pa ngag gi gnas ngan len te gnas ngan len dang 'brel pa gsum dang /
analyzed: g-yeng ba dang 'dod chags la sogs pa sems kyi gnas ngan len dang / glal ba la sogs pa rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa'i kha ton byed pa la sogs pa ngag gi gnas ngan len te gnas ngan len dang 'brel pa gsum dang /
translated: The three related to corruption are: (1) physical corruption, such as yawning and arrogance, (2) mental corruption, such as distraction and attachment, and (3) verbal corruption, such as reciting mantras and so on that are generated by improper means, such as yawning.

original: lung ma bstan pa dang 'di'i gting mi rnyed pas phyir phyogs pa'i rgyu mtshan 'dzin pa dang / nyan thos kyi sde snod tshol bas rgyu la mngon par zhen pas nyams pa dang / dman pa'i ro la chags pa gya nom pa'i ro myang bas nyams pa dang /
analyzed: lung ma bstan pa dang 'di'i gting mi rnyed pas phyir phyogs pa'i rgyu mtshan 'dzin pa dang / nyan thos kyi sde snod tshol bas rgyu la mngon par zhen pas nyams pa dang / dman pa'i ro la chags pa gya nom pa'i ro myang bas nyams pa dang /
translated: The degeneration of the cause of turning away from the Great Vehicle is due to not understanding the profound and vast aspects of the Great Vehicle and not finding the depths of the Great Vehicle, so that one holds the reasons for turning away from it. The degeneration of the cause of attachment to the result is due to attachment to the result of the sravakas vehicle, which is the result of mere peace, and to attachment to the result of the pratyekabuddhas vehicle, which is the result of mere liberation.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i sde snod la mchog tu 'dzin pas theg pa'i mchog kun tu 'dzin pa las nyams pa dang / ched du bya ba rin po che'i 'byung gnas ma yin pa la yin par 'dzin pas rtag tu ched du bya ba nyams pa zhes bya ba dag go //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i sde snod la mchog tu 'dzin pas theg pa'i mchog kun tu 'dzin pa las nyams pa dang / ched du bya ba rin po che'i 'byung gnas ma yin pa la yin par 'dzin pas rtag tu ched du bya ba nyams pa zhes bya ba dag go //
translated: The degeneration of the cause of the supreme vehicle is due to holding the sravaka and pratyekabuddha vehicles to be supreme. The degeneration of the cause of the object is due to holding the object of practice to be the supreme vehicle, when it is not.üîΩThe degeneration of the cause of the result is due to the degeneration of the result of the supreme vehicle, which is the attainment of omniscience.üîΩThe degeneration of the cause of the result of the supreme vehicle is due to the degeneration of the result of the supreme vehicle, which is the attainment of omniscience.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'dod pas theg pa dman pa la slob pa rgyu dang 'bras bu 'brel pa nyams pa dang / dman pa'i yon tan gyi gzhir gyur pa'i sde snod lan pa gong na med pa las nyams pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'dod pas theg pa dman pa la slob pa rgyu dang 'bras bu 'brel pa nyams pa dang / dman pa'i yon tan gyi gzhir gyur pa'i sde snod lan pa gong na med pa las nyams pa ste /
translated: The degeneration of the cause of the result of the supreme vehicle is due to the degeneration of the result of the supreme vehicle, which is the attainment of omniscience.

original: theg pa chen po las nyams pa'i rgyu dang 'brel pa dang / mdo sde gzhan la spyod pa'i yid la byed pa 'byung bas yul mang po la rnam @44a * //üîΩpar rtog pa'i spobs pa 'gyur ba dang / yi ge shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par 'du shes pas yi ge 'dri ba la mngon par zhen pa dang / med pa'i mtshan mar dmigs pa dngos po med pa la mngon par zhen pa dang /
analyzed: theg pa chen po las nyams pa'i rgyu dang 'brel pa dang / mdo sde gzhan la spyod pa'i yid la byed pa 'byung bas yul mang po la rnam @44a * // par rtog pa'i spobs pa 'gyur ba dang / yi ge shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par 'du shes pas yi ge 'dri ba la mngon par zhen pa dang / med pa'i mtshan mar dmigs pa dngos po med pa la mngon par zhen pa dang /
translated: It is related to the cause of degeneration from the Great Vehicle, and it is the occurrence of attention to practice in other s≈´tras.üîΩIt is the change of eloquence that is discursive thought about many objects, and it is the adherence to the writing of letters through the perception that letters are the perfection of wisdom.üîΩIt is the adherence to the non-existent object of observation, the non-existent, and it is the adherence to the letters through the perception that the text of the written letters is the mother.

original: yi ger 'dri ba'i gzhung yum du 'du shes pa yi ge la mngon par zhen pa dang / yi ge ma yin pa yum du 'du shes pa yi ge med pas mngon par zhen pa dang / sna tshogs pa'i 'du shes kyis g-yeng ba dang yul dang grong khyer la sogs pa yid la byed pa dang /
analyzed: yi ger 'dri ba'i gzhung yum du 'du shes pa yi ge la mngon par zhen pa dang / yi ge ma yin pa yum du 'du shes pa yi ge med pas mngon par zhen pa dang / sna tshogs pa'i 'du shes kyis g-yeng ba dang yul dang grong khyer la sogs pa yid la byed pa dang /
translated: It is the adherence to the non-letters through the perception that the non-letters are the mother, and it is the distraction of the various perceptions and the attention to objects, cities, and so on.

original: 'jig rten gyi dga' ba nyams su len pa rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang tshigs su bcad pa'i ro myang ba dang / bdud kyi bstan pa'i sde snod las thabs la mkhas pa tshol ba lam ma yin pas lam tshol ba zhes bya ba dag ste rnam par g-yeng ba'i rgyu dang 'brel pa brgyad do /üîΩde'i sbyor ba la mngon par brtson pa dang mi brtson pa dang 'dun pa dang snyom las kyis nyams pa dang / 'dir gnas pa dang gzhan du 'gro bar 'dod pas 'dun pa'i yul tha dad pas nyams pa dang / chos dang zang zing lhur len pa dang 'dod chen chung ba dang chung ba ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi dga' ba nyams su len pa rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang tshigs su bcad pa'i ro myang ba dang / bdud kyi bstan pa'i sde snod las thabs la mkhas pa tshol ba lam ma yin pas lam tshol ba zhes bya ba dag ste rnam par g-yeng ba'i rgyu dang 'brel pa brgyad do /üîΩde'i sbyor ba la mngon par brtson pa dang mi brtson pa dang 'dun pa dang snyom las kyis nyams pa dang / 'dir gnas pa dang gzhan du 'gro bar 'dod pas 'dun pa'i yul tha dad pas nyams pa dang / chos dang zang zing lhur len pa dang 'dod chen chung ba dang chung ba ma yin pa dang /
translated: 8. the distraction of the mundane path, which is the enjoyment of the taste of the bliss of meditative concentration.üîΩ8. the distraction of

original: dgon pa la sogs pa sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa dang mi ldan pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyams pa la dad pa dang / de ma yin pa la sogs pa dge ba dang mi dge ba ma yin pa'i chos nyid dang /
analyzed: dgon pa la sogs pa sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa dang mi ldan pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyams pa la dad pa dang / de ma yin pa la sogs pa dge ba dang mi dge ba ma yin pa'i chos nyid dang /
translated: Those who are endowed with the qualities of training, such as monks, and those who are not so endowed, those who have faith in the perfection of wisdom and those who do not, and the nature of virtuous and nonvirtuous dharmas that are neither of those.

original: rang gi dang gi byed pas gtong ba dang ser sna can du 'gyur ba dang / rang gi gnas skabs kyi byed pas sbyin pa dang mi len pa dang / dbang po'i khyad par gyis mgo smos pa dang rnam par spros pas go ba dang /
analyzed: rang gi dang gi byed pas gtong ba dang ser sna can du 'gyur ba dang / rang gi gnas skabs kyi byed pas sbyin pa dang mi len pa dang / dbang po'i khyad par gyis mgo smos pa dang rnam par spros pas go ba dang /
translated: Those who give and those who are miserly due to their own activity, those who give and those who do not receive due to their own circumstances, and those who understand through brief explanations and those who understand through detailed explanations due to the difference in their faculties.

original: rgya chen po dang cig shos kyi dbang gis mdo la sogs pa'i chos mngon par shes pa dang mi shes pa dang / spyod pa dang dang tshul gyi sgo nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan pa dang mi ldan pa zhes bya ba dag go //
analyzed: rgya chen po dang cig shos kyi dbang gis mdo la sogs pa'i chos mngon par shes pa dang mi shes pa dang / spyod pa dang dang tshul gyi sgo nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan pa dang mi ldan pa zhes bya ba dag go //
translated: Those who understand and those who do not understand the Dharma of the sutras and so on due to the difference of their vast and narrow minds, and those who are endowed and those who are not endowed with the six perfections due to their conduct and way of life.

original: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi thabs dang ma yin pa la mkhas pa dang / tshig la sogs pa'i gzungs thob pa dang ma thob pa dang / glegs bam du bya ba'i phyir yi ge 'dri bar 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi thabs dang ma yin pa la mkhas pa dang / tshig la sogs pa'i gzungs thob pa dang ma thob pa dang / glegs bam du bya ba'i phyir yi ge 'dri bar 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa dang /
translated: Similarly, there are fourteen related to the listener and the expounder, such as being skilled or not skilled in the means of omniscience, having or not having attained retention of words and so on, wishing or not wishing to write the words for the sake of books, being or not being free from desire and so on.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dun pa la sogs pa dang bral ba dang ma bral ba nyid ces bya ba nyan @44b ba bo dang 'chad pa po gang yang rung ba dang 'brel ba bcu bzhi dang / ngan 'gro'i bsngags pa ma yin pa brjod pas ngan song gi don las phyir phyogs pa dang /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dun pa la sogs pa dang bral ba dang ma bral ba nyid ces bya ba nyan @44b ba bo dang 'chad pa po gang yang rung ba dang 'brel ba bcu bzhi dang / ngan 'gro'i bsngags pa ma yin pa brjod pas ngan song gi don las phyir phyogs pa dang /
translated: There are two related to oneself, such as turning away from the lower realms by expressing the faults of the lower realms and not being liberated by expressing the qualities of the higher realms, since one is delighted by the higher realms.

original: mtho ris kyi yon tan brjod pas nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa bde 'gro 'gro bas yid be de ba zhes bya ba rang dang 'brel pa gnyis dang / dang tshul dang gnas skabs kyis gcig pu dang 'khor dang mngon par dga' ba dang /
analyzed: mtho ris kyi yon tan brjod pas nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa bde 'gro 'gro bas yid be de ba zhes bya ba rang dang 'brel pa gnyis dang / dang tshul dang gnas skabs kyis gcig pu dang 'khor dang mngon par dga' ba dang /
translated: There are two related to oneself, such as being alone due to one's conduct and circumstances, delighting in one's retinue and delighting in solitude.

original: 'chad par khas mi len pa'am /
analyzed: 'chad par khas mi len pa'am /
translated: or one does not accept to explain;

original: blangs kyang go skabs mi 'byed cing nyan pa po la sogs par rjes su 'brel par 'dod pa dang / mngon par chags pa'i sgo nas zang zing cung zad sbyin par 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa dang / rkyen gyi bye brag gis srog gi bar chad du 'gyur ba dang mi 'gyur ba'i phyogs su 'gro ba zhes bya ba dag go //
analyzed: blangs kyang go skabs mi 'byed cing nyan pa po la sogs par rjes su 'brel par 'dod pa dang / mngon par chags pa'i sgo nas zang zing cung zad sbyin par 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa dang / rkyen gyi bye brag gis srog gi bar chad du 'gyur ba dang mi 'gyur ba'i phyogs su 'gro ba zhes bya ba dag go //
translated: or, although one has accepted, one does not find the opportunity to explain, or one does not wish to be connected with the listener, etc., or one wishes to give a little gift out of attachment, or one does not wish to give, or one goes to a place where there is an obstacle to life, or one does not go.

original: de bzhin du mu ge byung ba'i phyogs dang chom rkun la sogs pas dkrugs pa'i phyogs su 'gro ba dang mi 'gro ba zhes bya ba gnyis te /
analyzed: de bzhin du mu ge byung ba'i phyogs dang chom rkun la sogs pas dkrugs pa'i phyogs su 'gro ba dang mi 'gro ba zhes bya ba gnyis te /
translated: Similarly, one goes or does not go to a place where there is famine, or a place disturbed by thieves, etc.

original: gnyis ka dang 'brel pa drug ste /
analyzed: gnyis ka dang 'brel pa drug ste /
translated: There are six that are connected with both.

original: slob dpon nyid dang 'brel pa rnyed pa la chags pa la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis byams par byed pa'i khyim blta bas yid mi bde ba zhes bya ba gcig dang / bdud kyis 'di yin gyi de ni ma yin no zhes brjod pas bzlog pa nyid kyis 'byed pa'i sbyor ba dang /
analyzed: slob dpon nyid dang 'brel pa rnyed pa la chags pa la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis byams par byed pa'i khyim blta bas yid mi bde ba zhes bya ba gcig dang / bdud kyis 'di yin gyi de ni ma yin no zhes brjod pas bzlog pa nyid kyis 'byed pa'i sbyor ba dang /
translated: One is the application of division, which is the reversal of the path by the statement of Mara, This is it, but that is not.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan bstan pas bral bar byed pa bcos ma nye bar sgrub pa dang / bcos ma'i 'tshang rgya ba dang byang chub sems dpa' sprul te /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan bstan pas bral bar byed pa bcos ma nye bar sgrub pa dang / bcos ma'i 'tshang rgya ba dang byang chub sems dpa' sprul te /
translated: One is the establishment of a counterfeit, which is the creation of a counterfeit by teaching a counterfeit of generosity and so on.

original: yul ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa la dga' ba bskyed pa zhes bya ba log par 'khrid pa nyid kyi rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: yul ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa la dga' ba bskyed pa zhes bya ba log par 'khrid pa nyid kyi rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: One is the guidance of error, which is the generation of delight in an object that is not as it seems.

original: de ltar bzhi bcu rtsa drug go //
analyzed: de ltar bzhi bcu rtsa drug go //
translated: Thus there are forty six.

original: de ltar yon tan dang skyon blang ba dang dor bas sbyor ba rnams bsgom par bya ba yang mtshan nyid shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pas de'i 'og tu mtshon pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yon tan dang skyon blang ba dang dor bas sbyor ba rnams bsgom par bya ba yang mtshan nyid shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pas de'i 'og tu mtshon pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, the characteristics of the illustrations are stated immediately after that:

original: gang gis mtshon te mtshan nyid du //
analyzed: gang gis mtshon te mtshan nyid du //
translated: The illustration is the characteristic.

original: shes bya de yang rnam pa gsum //
analyzed: shes bya de yang rnam pa gsum //
translated: The object of knowledge is also threefold.

original: shes pa khyad par byed pa ste //
analyzed: shes pa khyad par byed pa ste //
translated: It is the characteristic of the agent of distinction of consciousness.

original: ngo bo nyid gang mtshon bya yang //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gang mtshon bya yang // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The essence is also the object of illustration.

original: 'dis sbyor ba rnams de bzhi gshegs pa nyid skyed par mtshon par byed pas shes pa dang / khyad par dang / byed pa'i @45a * //
analyzed: 'dis sbyor ba rnams de bzhi gshegs pa nyid skyed par mtshon par byed pas shes pa dang / khyad par dang / byed pa'i @45a * //
translated: This illustrates the production of the TathƒÅgata through the applications. Therefore, the characteristics are the object of knowledge, distinction, and action.

original: mtshan nyid de byed pa sgrub pa rnam pa gsum dang / 'di dag mtshon par bya ba yin pas ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid las su sgrub pa'i rnam pa gcig ste mtshan nyid ni gzhir shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid de byed pa sgrub pa rnam pa gsum dang / 'di dag mtshon par bya ba yin pas ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid las su sgrub pa'i rnam pa gcig ste mtshan nyid ni gzhir shes par bya'o //
translated: The three types of establishment of action are the characteristics of the agent. Since these are the objects of illustration, the single type of establishment of the object of the characteristic of essence is the characteristic of the object. The characteristic should be understood as the basis.

original: de la shes pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi dbye bas tha dad pa las re zhig thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sgo nas de'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de la shes pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi dbye bas tha dad pa las re zhig thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sgo nas de'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa /
translated: The characteristics of omniscience are stated in the Ornament of Clear Realization:üîΩThe appearance of the tathagatas,üîΩthe nature of the world not being destroyed,üîΩthe conduct of the minds of sentient beings,üîΩtheir inclusion, their turning away,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba dang // 'jig rten 'jig med bdag nyid dang // sems can sems kyi spyod pa dang // de bsdus pa dang phyir bltas dang // mi zad pa yi rnam pa dang ; / chags bcas sogs dang rgya chen dang //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba dang // 'jig rten 'jig med bdag nyid dang // sems can sems kyi spyod pa dang // de bsdus pa dang phyir bltas dang // mi zad pa yi rnam pa dang ; / chags bcas sogs dang rgya chen dang //
translated: their aspects of inexhaustibility,üîΩtheir being with attachment and so on, their vastness,üîΩtheir being of great extent, their immeasurability,üîΩtheir being taught as consciousness,

original: chen por gyur dang tshad med dang // rnam shes bstan du med pa dang // sems bltar med dang shes pa de //
analyzed: chen por gyur dang tshad med dang // rnam shes bstan du med pa dang // sems bltar med dang shes pa de //
translated: their being taught as the mind,üîΩtheir being taught as knowledge,

original: g-yo ba la sogs shes bya dang // de las gzhan yang de dag ni //üîΩde bzhin nyid kyi rnam par shes //
analyzed: g-yo ba la sogs shes bya dang // de las gzhan yang de dag ni // de bzhin nyid kyi rnam par shes //
translated: their being taught as movement and so on,üîΩand their being taught as suchness.

original: thub pas de bzhin nyid rtogs te //üîΩgzhan la bstan pa zhes bya 'di //
analyzed: thub pas de bzhin nyid rtogs te // gzhan la bstan pa zhes bya 'di //
translated: The Sage realizes suchnessüîΩand teaches it to others.

original: thams cad shes pa nyid skabs kyi //
analyzed: thams cad shes pa nyid skabs kyi //
translated: This is the section on the knowledge of all aspects.

original: shes pa'i mchan nyid bsdus pa yin //
analyzed: shes pa'i mchan nyid bsdus pa yin //
translated: The characteristics of consciousness are collected.üîΩ

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and the essence of consciousness is collected.

original: ma 'dres pa'i chos la sogs pas spyir de bzhin gshegs pa skyed pa nyid dang / 'jig rten de kho nar 'jig pa med par mkhyen pa dang / kun rdzob tu sems can grangs med pa'i sems can gyi spyod pa dang / de bzhi nyid la mnyam par bzhag pa sems bsdus pa dang /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa'i chos la sogs pas spyir de bzhin gshegs pa skyed pa nyid dang / 'jig rten de kho nar 'jig pa med par mkhyen pa dang / kun rdzob tu sems can grangs med pa'i sems can gyi spyod pa dang / de bzhi nyid la mnyam par bzhag pa sems bsdus pa dang /
translated: By means of the unshared qualities and so forth, the generation of the Tathagata in general is known, the world is known to be imperishable in reality, the conduct of sentient beings is known conventionally, and the mind is collected in equipoise on those four.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pas sems rnam par g-yengs pa phyir bltas pa dang / yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sems mi zad pa'i rnam pa dang / skye bo rnams kyi sems kun nas nyon mongs pa 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang / sogs pa zhes bya bas bsdus pa 'phags pa rnams kyi rnam par byad pa'i sems 'dod chags dang bral ba dang /
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pas sems rnam par g-yengs pa phyir bltas pa dang / yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi sems mi zad pa'i rnam pa dang / skye bo rnams kyi sems kun nas nyon mongs pa 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang / sogs pa zhes bya bas bsdus pa 'phags pa rnams kyi rnam par byad pa'i sems 'dod chags dang bral ba dang /
translated: The distracted mind of one not in equipoise is turned back, the aspect of the imperishable mind of reality is known, the afflicted mind of beings is known to be associated with attachment, and the dispassionate mind of the noble ones is known to be free from attachment.

original: skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa med pa'i sems rgya chen po dang / bdag med pa nyid dang / yon tan thob pa mnyam pa nyid sems chen por gyur pa dang / so so nges par mi nus pas sems tshad med pa dang /
analyzed: skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa med pa'i sems rgya chen po dang / bdag med pa nyid dang / yon tan thob pa mnyam pa nyid sems chen por gyur pa dang / so so nges par mi nus pas sems tshad med pa dang /
translated: The mind is vast, without arising, abiding, or cessation; it is the sameness of the attainment of the qualities of selflessness; it is a great mind; it is immeasurable, since it cannot be ascertained individually;

original: 'gags pa la sogs pas dus gsum gyi sems bstan du med pa dang / ngo @45b bo nyid thams cad dang bral bas sems bltar med pa dang / rnam par 'phro bas sems g-yo ba la sogs pa dang / de las gzhan yang g-yo ba la sogs pa de bzhin nyid dang ma nor ba dang /
analyzed: 'gags pa la sogs pas dus gsum gyi sems bstan du med pa dang / ngo @45b bo nyid thams cad dang bral bas sems bltar med pa dang / rnam par 'phro bas sems g-yo ba la sogs pa dang / de las gzhan yang g-yo ba la sogs pa de bzhin nyid dang ma nor ba dang /
translated: it is a mind that cannot be seen, since it is free from all natures; it is a moving mind, since it is dispersed; and it is the suchness of movement and so on, since it is not otherwise.

original: thub pa mchog gis de bzhin nyid ji lta bar rtogs nas de'i don gzhan la bstan pa zhes bya ba shes pa'i rnam pa'i bye brag bcu drug gis thams cad shes pa nyid kyi sbyor ba rnams ji ltar de'i bdag nyid kyis mkhyen pa skyed par mtshon pas
analyzed: thub pa mchog gis de bzhin nyid ji lta bar rtogs nas de'i don gzhan la bstan pa zhes bya ba shes pa'i rnam pa'i bye brag bcu drug gis thams cad shes pa nyid kyi sbyor ba rnams ji ltar de'i bdag nyid kyis mkhyen pa skyed par mtshon pas
translated: The sixteen aspects of knowledge, such as the knowledge that the supreme sage has realized the suchness of all phenomena just as it is and has taught that meaning to others, illustrate the application of the knowledge of all aspects, since they illustrate the knowledge that arises through the identity of that knowledge.

original: shes pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad shes pa nyid kyis bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: shes pa'i mtshan nyid thams cad shes pa nyid kyis bsdus pa yin no //
translated: All the characteristics of consciousness are included in the knowledge of all things.

original: de nas lam shes pa nyid kyi sgo nas shes pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nas lam shes pa nyid kyi sgo nas shes pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa /
translated: Then, from the point of view of the knowledge of the path, the characteristics of knowledge are stated:üîΩEmptiness, signlessness,üîΩthe abandonment of wishes,üîΩnon-production, non-cessation, and so forth,üîΩthe immutability of reality,

original: stong nyid mtshan ma med bcas dang // smon pa rnam par spangs pa dang // skye med 'gag pa med sogs dang // chos nyid rnam par 'khrug med dang // 'du mi byed dang rnam mi rtog / rab dbye mtshan nyid med nyid la //
analyzed: stong nyid mtshan ma med bcas dang // smon pa rnam par spangs pa dang // skye med 'gag pa med sogs dang // chos nyid rnam par 'khrug med dang // 'du mi byed dang rnam mi rtog / rab dbye mtshan nyid med nyid la //
translated: non-compounding, non-conceptuality,üîΩand the absence of differentiation and characteristics

original: lam shes nyid kyi skabs kyis ni //üîΩshes pa'i mtshan nyid yin par bzhed //
analyzed: lam shes nyid kyi skabs kyis ni // shes pa'i mtshan nyid yin par bzhed //
translated: are the characteristics of the knowledge of the path.üîΩBy the section on the knowledge of the path,

original: ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o //
translated: it is accepted as the characteristic of knowledge.üîΩThe characteristics of the knowledge of the path are stated:üîΩThe essence of emptiness,üîΩthe causal function of signlessness,üîΩthe fruition nature of wishlessness,üîΩthe non-production of forward-moving dependent origination,

original: rang gi ngo bo stong pa nyid dang / rgyu'i byed pa mtshan ma med pa dang / 'bras bu'i bdag nyid smon pa med pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba lugs su 'byung ba'i skye ba med pa dang / lugs las bzlog pa'i 'gag pa med pa dang /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo stong pa nyid dang / rgyu'i byed pa mtshan ma med pa dang / 'bras bu'i bdag nyid smon pa med pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba lugs su 'byung ba'i skye ba med pa dang / lugs las bzlog pa'i 'gag pa med pa dang /
translated: the non-cessation of reverse-moving dependent origination,

original: sogs pa zhes bya bas bsdus pa dri ma'i bdag nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / dri ma dang bral ba rnam par byang ba med pa dang / spangs ba dang / blang ba'i dngo spo med pa dang rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa dang /
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya bas bsdus pa dri ma'i bdag nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / dri ma dang bral ba rnam par byang ba med pa dang / spangs ba dang / blang ba'i dngo spo med pa dang rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa dang /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes the following: the absence of the afflictions, which are by nature stains; the absence of purification, which is free from stains; the absence of a basis for abandoning and adopting; the absence of an essence that is natural nirvana;

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo rten med pa dang / sgrib g-yogs kyi dbang gis yongs su 'gyur ba med pas nam mkha'i mtshan nyid drug dang / sus kyang gzhan du bya bar mi nus pas chos nyid rnam par 'khrug pa med pa dang / rgyu dang rkyen las ma skyes pas mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo rten med pa dang / sgrib g-yogs kyi dbang gis yongs su 'gyur ba med pas nam mkha'i mtshan nyid drug dang / sus kyang gzhan du bya bar mi nus pas chos nyid rnam par 'khrug pa med pa dang / rgyu dang rkyen las ma skyes pas mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang /
translated: the absence of a basis for the dharmadhatu; the absence of change due to the influence of obscurations; the six characteristics of space; the absence of disturbance in reality, which cannot be changed by anyone; the absence of manifest activity, since it is not produced from causes and conditions;

original: mtshan nyid 'gar yang gdags par bya ba ma yin pas rnam par mi rtog pa nyid dang / kun rdzob rnam par bzhag pas chos rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba dang / don dam par shin tu dben pas mtshan nyid med par shes pa dang zhes bya ba shes pa'i @46a * //
analyzed: mtshan nyid 'gar yang gdags par bya ba ma yin pas rnam par mi rtog pa nyid dang / kun rdzob rnam par bzhag pas chos rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba dang / don dam par shin tu dben pas mtshan nyid med par shes pa dang zhes bya ba shes pa'i @46a * //
translated: Since it is utterly isolated in the ultimate, it is the knowledge of the absence of characteristics.

original: rnam pa'i bye brag bcu drug gis lam shes pa nyid kyi sbyor ba rnams ji lta bar de'i bdag nyid kyi mkhyen pa bskyed par mtshon pas shes pa'i mtshan nyid lam shes pa nyid kyis bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa'i bye brag bcu drug gis lam shes pa nyid kyi sbyor ba rnams ji lta bar de'i bdag nyid kyi mkhyen pa bskyed par mtshon pas shes pa'i mtshan nyid lam shes pa nyid kyis bsdus pa yin no //
translated: These sixteen aspects of knowledge illustrate the generation of the knowledge of the path that is the application to the knowledge of the path by means of the knowledge of the path that is included in the knowledge of phenomena.

original: de nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sgo nas shes pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa //
analyzed: de nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sgo nas shes pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa //
translated: Then, from the perspective of the knowledge of all aspects, the defining characteristics of knowledge are taught.

original: de ni nyid kyi chos brten nas //
analyzed: de ni nyid kyi chos brten nas //
translated: It is based on one's own dharma.

original: gnas dang gus par bya ba dang // bla ma nyid dang mnyes pa dang // de la mchod dang byed med dang // kun tu 'jug mkhyen gang yin dang // ma mthong ston par mdzad pa dang // 'jig rten stong nyid rnam pa dang / brjod dang shes mdzad mngon sum mdzad //
analyzed: gnas dang gus par bya ba dang // bla ma nyid dang mnyes pa dang // de la mchod dang byed med dang // kun tu 'jug mkhyen gang yin dang // ma mthong ston par mdzad pa dang // 'jig rten stong nyid rnam pa dang / brjod dang shes mdzad mngon sum mdzad //
translated: The place, the respect, the guru, the pleasing, the worship of that, the absence of action, the knowledge of engagement, the teaching of the unseen, the emptiness of the world, the manifestation of expression and knowledge,

original: bsam mi khyab dang zhi nyid ston //
analyzed: bsam mi khyab dang zhi nyid ston //
translated: the teaching of the inconceivable and peace,

original: 'jig rten 'du shes 'gog pa la //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'du shes 'gog pa la //
translated: the cessation of the world‚Äôs ideation,

original: rnam pa kun mkhyen tshul la ni //üîΩshes pa'i mtshan nyid ces bshad do //
analyzed: rnam pa kun mkhyen tshul la ni // shes pa'i mtshan nyid ces bshad do //
translated: the knowledge of all aspects,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: is explained as the characteristic of knowledge.

original: thub pa de ni nyid kyi chos rnam pa thams cad ji lta bar mkhyen pa'i yul 'di la brten nas bde bar gnas pa mchog gis gnas pa mkhyen pa dang / 'di'i don ston par mdzad pa nas nyid kyi khri bsham pa la sogs pa mdzad pa gus par bya ba dang /
analyzed: thub pa de ni nyid kyi chos rnam pa thams cad ji lta bar mkhyen pa'i yul 'di la brten nas bde bar gnas pa mchog gis gnas pa mkhyen pa dang / 'di'i don ston par mdzad pa nas nyid kyi khri bsham pa la sogs pa mdzad pa gus par bya ba dang /
translated: The Sage, based on this object, the knowledge of all aspects of his own Dharma, abides in supreme bliss, and he knows the knowledge of abiding, and he teaches its meaning, and he respectfully sets up his seat, and so on.

original: bka' bsgrub par bya ba nyid du bkur bas bla mar bya ba dang / yon tan brjod pa la sogs pas mnyes par byed pa dang / rin po che'i me tog gtor ba la sogs pas mchod pa dang / de kho nar skye ba dang 'jig pa dang rang gi ngo bos stong pas de ltar byed pa nyid med pa dang /
analyzed: bka' bsgrub par bya ba nyid du bkur bas bla mar bya ba dang / yon tan brjod pa la sogs pas mnyes par byed pa dang / rin po che'i me tog gtor ba la sogs pas mchod pa dang / de kho nar skye ba dang 'jig pa dang rang gi ngo bos stong pas de ltar byed pa nyid med pa dang /
translated: They are to be revered as gurus because they are to be respected as those who accomplish the Buddha's words, to be pleased by praising their good qualities and so on, to be worshipped by scattering precious flowers and so on, to be known as not existing because they are empty of origination and destruction in reality and by their own nature,

original: chos thams cad la thogs pa med pa'i ye shes kun tu 'jug pa mkhyen pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dis sangs rgyas la chos 'ga' yang mthong bar byar med pa'i don ston pa dang / phung po lha'i 'jig rten stong pa nyid du mkhyen pa dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad la thogs pa med pa'i ye shes kun tu 'jug pa mkhyen pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dis sangs rgyas la chos 'ga' yang mthong bar byar med pa'i don ston pa dang / phung po lha'i 'jig rten stong pa nyid du mkhyen pa dang /
translated: to be known as the all pervasive wisdom that is unobstructed with regard to all phenomena, to be known as the wisdom that teaches the meaning that by this perfection of wisdom the Buddha has nothing to see in phenomena, to be known as the wisdom that knows the aggregates and the world of gods to be emptiness,üîΩand to be known as the wisdom that knows the world of humans to be emptiness.

original: thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab bskyed par bya ba nyid kyis 'jig rten stong pa nyid du brjod par mdzad pa dang / bsams pa las byung ba bskyed par bya ba nyid kyis 'jig rten stong pa nyid du shes par bya ba dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba bskyed par bya ba nyid kyis 'jig rten stong pa nyid du mngon sum du mthong bar mdzad pa dang /
analyzed: thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab bskyed par bya ba nyid kyis 'jig rten stong pa nyid du brjod par mdzad pa dang / bsams pa las byung ba bskyed par bya ba nyid kyis 'jig rten stong pa nyid du shes par bya ba dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba bskyed par bya ba nyid kyis 'jig rten stong pa nyid du mngon sum du mthong bar mdzad pa dang /
translated: He taught the world to be empty by generating the wisdom arisen from listening, he caused the world to understand that it is empty by generating the wisdom arisen from reflection, and he caused the world to directly see that it is empty by generating the wisdom arisen from meditation.

original: phung po rnam pa lnga'i @46b de kho na nyid spyod yul las 'das pas bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang // de'i chos nyid spros pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba nyid du ston pa dang / phung po la mngon par zhen pa'i 'jig rten 'gog pa dang /
analyzed: phung po rnam pa lnga'i @46b de kho na nyid spyod yul las 'das pas bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang // de'i chos nyid spros pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba nyid du ston pa dang / phung po la mngon par zhen pa'i 'jig rten 'gog pa dang /
translated: He taught the world to be inconceivable since the reality of the five aggregates is beyond the domain of thought, he taught the reality of the aggregates to be the pacification of all elaborations, he refuted the world that clings to the aggregates and he taught the world to be empty of essence.

original: de la blos mtshan mar 'dzin pa nyid kyi 'du shes 'gog pa zhes bya ba shes pa'i rnam pa'i bye brag bcu drug gis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sbyor ba rnams ji lta bar de'i bdag nyid kyi mkhyen pa bskyed par mtshon pas shes pa'i
analyzed: de la blos mtshan mar 'dzin pa nyid kyi 'du shes 'gog pa zhes bya ba shes pa'i rnam pa'i bye brag bcu drug gis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sbyor ba rnams ji lta bar de'i bdag nyid kyi mkhyen pa bskyed par mtshon pas shes pa'i
translated: The knowledge that is indicated by the sixteen aspects of the knowledge of the sixteen aspects of the four noble truths, such as impermanence, is the knowledge that stops the discriminations that apprehend signs with the mind.

original: mtshan nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis bsdus pa yin no //
translated: It is included in the knowledge of all aspects, which is the defining characteristic of knowledge.

original: de ltar shes pa'i mtshan nyid spyi'i mtshan nyid du brjod nas ;
analyzed: de ltar shes pa'i mtshan nyid spyi'i mtshan nyid du brjod nas ;
translated: Having thus described the defining characteristic of knowledge in general,

original: shes pa'i rnam pas yongs su bcad pa khyad par gyi mtshan nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: shes pa'i rnam pas yongs su bcad pa khyad par gyi mtshan nyid gsungs pa /
translated: the defining characteristic of knowledge that is distinguished by its aspects is stated:üîΩThe defining characteristic of distinction

original: bsam mi khyab sogs khyad par gyis //
analyzed: bsam mi khyab sogs khyad par gyis //
translated: is distinguished by the distinctions of the inconceivable, etc.,

original: khyad zhugs bden pa'i spyod yul can //üîΩskad cig ma ni bcu drug gis //üîΩkhyad par mtshan nyid bshad pa yin //
analyzed: khyad zhugs bden pa'i spyod yul can // skad cig ma ni bcu drug gis // khyad par mtshan nyid bshad pa yin //
translated: and has the reality of distinction as its domain.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is explained that the defining characteristic of distinctionüîΩis distinguished by the sixteen aspectsüîΩin sixteen moments.

original: gang gi phyir khyad par gyi chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mi mnyam pa la sogs pas khyad par du gyur pa sdug bsngal la sogs pa bden pa'i yul can chos dang rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang shes pa'i mtshan nyid skad cig ma bcu drug gis lam shes pa nyid la sogs pa'i sbyor ba dag mtshon parüîΩbyed pa'i phyir khyad par gyi mtshan nyid du bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir khyad par gyi chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mi mnyam pa la sogs pas khyad par du gyur pa sdug bsngal la sogs pa bden pa'i yul can chos dang rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang shes pa'i mtshan nyid skad cig ma bcu drug gis lam shes pa nyid la sogs pa'i sbyor ba dag mtshon par byed pa'i phyir khyad par gyi mtshan nyid du bshad pa yin no //
translated: Because the sixteen moments of perseverance and knowledge that are the subjects of the truths of suffering and so on, which are distinguished by the inconceivable, the unequaled and so on, are explained to be the defining characteristics of the path of preparation, such as the knowledge of the path, because they are the defining characteristics of the path of preparation.

original: de la bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sogs pa'i khyad par de dag gsungs pa //
analyzed: de la bsam gyis mi khyab pa la sogs pa'i khyad par de dag gsungs pa //
translated: The distinctive features of the path of preparation are taught to be inconceivable and so on.üîΩThe inconceivable, the unequaled,

original: bsam mi khyab dang mi mnyam dang // gzhal dang bgrang las yang dag 'das //
analyzed: bsam mi khyab dang mi mnyam dang // gzhal dang bgrang las yang dag 'das //
translated: the immeasurable and the incalculableüîΩare the distinctive features of the path of preparation.

original: 'phags pa kun bsdus mkhas pa yis //
analyzed: 'phags pa kun bsdus mkhas pa yis //
translated: The wise who are skilled in summarizing the ƒÅryas

original: rig bya thun mong med shes dang // shes myur bri dang gang med dang / sgrub dang yang dag 'grub pa dang // dmigs pa rten dang bcas pa dang / mtha' dag pa dang yongs 'dzin dang // ro myang med dang khyad par ni //
analyzed: rig bya thun mong med shes dang // shes myur bri dang gang med dang / sgrub dang yang dag 'grub pa dang // dmigs pa rten dang bcas pa dang / mtha' dag pa dang yongs 'dzin dang // ro myang med dang khyad par ni //
translated: it is complete, it is complete retention,üîΩit is without relishing, and it is distinctive.

original: bcu drug bdag nyid shes bya ste //üîΩgang gis lam 'di gzhan dag las //
analyzed: bcu drug bdag nyid shes bya ste // gang gis lam 'di gzhan dag las //
translated: It is to be known as having sixteen aspects.üîΩBecause this path is superior to other paths,

original: khyad du 'phags pas khyad par lam //
analyzed: khyad du 'phags pas khyad par lam //
translated: it is the special path.

original: zhes bya ba'o //üîΩrtog ge'i spyod yul las 'das pas bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid dang / dpe zlar rung bas mtshungs pa med pas mi mnyam pa dang / tshang ma rnams @47a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o // rtog ge'i spyod yul las 'das pas bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid dang / dpe zlar rung bas mtshungs pa med pas mi mnyam pa dang / tshang ma rnams @47a * //
translated: Thus it is.

original: kyis rtogs par bya ba ma yin pas gzhal ba las yang dag par 'das pa dang / sgras brjod pa la sogs pas tshad gzung bar mi rung bas bgrang ba las yang dag par 'das pa dag ni /
analyzed: kyis rtogs par bya ba ma yin pas gzhal ba las yang dag par 'das pa dang / sgras brjod pa la sogs pas tshad gzung bar mi rung bas bgrang ba las yang dag par 'das pa dag ni /
translated: It is inconceivable because it transcends the domain of speculation, it is unequalled because it is without compare, it is beyond evaluation because it is not to be realized by those with incomplete realization, it is beyond enumeration because it is not suitable to be measured by words and so on.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i skad cig ma'i khyad par yin no //üîΩnyon thos nas rang sangs rgyas kyi bar du 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad sdud pa dang / phra ba la sogs pa'i don skyes bu mkhas pas rig par bya ba nyid dang / nyan thos la sogs pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i dngos po yongs su shes pa dang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i skad cig ma'i khyad par yin no // nyon thos nas rang sangs rgyas kyi bar du 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad sdud pa dang / phra ba la sogs pa'i don skyes bu mkhas pas rig par bya ba nyid dang / nyan thos la sogs pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i dngos po yongs su shes pa dang /
translated: They are the special moments of the truth of the origin of suffering.üîΩThey are the special moments of the truth of the path.üîΩThey are the special moments of the truth of cessation.üîΩThey are the special moments of the truth of suffering.üîΩThey are the special moments of the truth of the origin of suffering.üîΩThey are the special moments of the truth of the path.

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid shin tu myur bar rtogs pa dag ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'i skad cig ma'i khyad par yin no //üîΩchos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo kho nas chos thams cad bri ba dang gang ba med pa dang / chos smra ba bsten cing 'khor gsum rnam par dag pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug tu rab tu sgrub pa dang /
