original: dus ring mo nyid nas sangs rgyas la bsnyen bkur ba la sogs pa'i rgyus bsod nams dang ye shes yang dag par 'grub pa dang / shes rab dang thabs kyis yang dag par zin pas chos thams cad ma tshangs ba med pa la dmigs pa dag ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'i skad cig ma'i khyad par yin no //üîΩthabs mkhas pa nyid kyis legs par bsgrubs pa'i rigs kyi rten dang bcas pa dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i rgyu mtha' dag 'tshog pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bstan pa'i thabs dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: dus ring mo nyid nas sangs rgyas la bsnyen bkur ba la sogs pa'i rgyus bsod nams dang ye shes yang dag par 'grub pa dang / shes rab dang thabs kyis yang dag par zin pas chos thams cad ma tshangs ba med pa la dmigs pa dag ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'i skad cig ma'i khyad par yin no // thabs mkhas pa nyid kyis legs par bsgrubs pa'i rigs kyi rten dang bcas pa dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i rgyu mtha' dag 'tshog pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bstan pa'i thabs dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su 'dzin pa dang /
translated: The special moments of the truth of cessation are the perfect accomplishment of merit and knowledge through causes such as serving the Buddhas for a long time, and the non-deficiency of all dharmas by being taken hold of by wisdom and method.üîΩThe special moments of the truth of the path are the basis of the lineage that is well-established by skill in means, the collection of all the causes for completing the perfections such as generosity, and the possession of the perfection of wisdom and method taught by the spiritual friend.

original: dngos po dang mya ngan las 'das pa la chags pa'i ro myang ba med pa dag ni lam gyi bden pa'i skad cig ma'i khyad par yin te /
analyzed: dngos po dang mya ngan las 'das pa la chags pa'i ro myang ba med pa dag ni lam gyi bden pa'i skad cig ma'i khyad par yin te /
translated: And the absence of relishing the taste of attachment to things and nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: gang gi byang chub sems dpa'i lam nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam rnams las khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos bshad ma thag pa'i khyad par skad cig ma bcu drug dang ldan pa 'di dag ni khyad par gyi lam yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi byang chub sems dpa'i lam nyan thos la sogs pa'i lam rnams las khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos bshad ma thag pa'i khyad par skad cig ma bcu drug dang ldan pa 'di dag ni khyad par gyi lam yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva path, which has been just explained as superior to the paths of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on, should be known as the special path, endowed with the sixteen moments of the special qualities.

original: de'i rjes la de dag gi byed pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i rjes la de dag gi byed pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa /
translated: After that, the characteristics of its activity are stated:üîΩBeneficial, happy, protective,üîΩa refuge for humans,

original: phan dang bde dang skyob pa dang // mi rnams kyi ni skyabs dag dang / gnas dang dpung @47b gnyen gling dang ni //üîΩyongs 'dren pa zhes bya ba dang // lhun gyis grub dang theg gsum gyi //
analyzed: phan dang bde dang skyob pa dang // mi rnams kyi ni skyabs dag dang / gnas dang dpung @47b gnyen gling dang ni // yongs 'dren pa zhes bya ba dang // lhun gyis grub dang theg gsum gyi //
translated: a support, a friend, an island,üîΩa light, a boat, a bridge,üîΩspontaneous, not actualizingüîΩthe result of the three vehicles,

original: 'bras bu mngon sum mi byed dag / tha ma rten gyi mdzad pa ste //üîΩ'di ni byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin //
analyzed: 'bras bu mngon sum mi byed dag / tha ma rten gyi mdzad pa ste // 'di ni byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin //
translated: the last is the activity of support;

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: this is the characteristic of activity.

original: nges par legs pa nyid kyi phan pa thar pa dang // sems can la mngon par mtho ba nyid kyi bde ba lus dang sems mngon par tshim pa dang / bla na med pa nyid kyi skyob pa lam legs par ston pa ste /üîΩspyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi byed pa gsum dang / yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus la sogs pas rim gyis mi gnas pa'i /
analyzed: nges par legs pa nyid kyi phan pa thar pa dang // sems can la mngon par mtho ba nyid kyi bde ba lus dang sems mngon par tshim pa dang / bla na med pa nyid kyi skyob pa lam legs par ston pa ste / spyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi byed pa gsum dang / yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus la sogs pas rim gyis mi gnas pa'i /
translated: The benefit of definite excellence is liberation, the bliss of higher states for sentient beings is the satisfaction of body and mind, and the unsurpassed refuge is the teaching of the excellent path.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la sbyor ba skyabs dang / chos thams cad 'dre ba med pa la sogs par bstan pas ma rig pa dang bag chags kyi sa la sogs pa spong ba'i gnas dang / srid pa dang zhi ba mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pas de las gzhan pa rnams kyi dpung gnyen dang /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la sbyor ba skyabs dang / chos thams cad 'dre ba med pa la sogs par bstan pas ma rig pa dang bag chags kyi sa la sogs pa spong ba'i gnas dang / srid pa dang zhi ba mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pas de las gzhan pa rnams kyi dpung gnyen dang /
translated: In general, these are the three activities of omniscience, and in particular, they are the refuge that connects one to nirvana, which is not attained gradually through a mental body and so on, the basis for abandoning ignorance, the traces of ignorance and so on, through teaching that all phenomena are unmixed and so on, and the ally of those other than that, through realizing the equality of existence and peace.

original: blang / ba dang dor ba'i sred pa yongs su chad cing rang dang gzhan gyi don rtogs pa'i rten du gyur pa'i gling dang / skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i chos bstan te gzhan gyi don bsgrub pas yongs su 'dren pa dang / chos thams cad nam mkha' dang 'dra bar ston cing rtsol ba med par 'jug pas sems can gyi don lhun gyis grub pa dang /
analyzed: blang / ba dang dor ba'i sred pa yongs su chad cing rang dang gzhan gyi don rtogs pa'i rten du gyur pa'i gling dang / skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i chos bstan te gzhan gyi don bsgrub pas yongs su 'dren pa dang / chos thams cad nam mkha' dang 'dra bar ston cing rtsol ba med par 'jug pas sems can gyi don lhun gyis grub pa dang /
translated: It is the spontaneous accomplishment of the welfare of sentient beings, since it teaches that all phenomena are like space and engages in them effortlessly.

original: rlom sems dang bral ba'i chos ston cing mngon du bya ba dang bral bar rtogs pas theg pa gsum gyis nges par 'byung ba'i 'bras bu mngon du mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: rlom sems dang bral ba'i chos ston cing mngon du bya ba dang bral bar rtogs pas theg pa gsum gyis nges par 'byung ba'i 'bras bu mngon du mi byed pa ste /
translated: It is the nonactualization of the result of definite emergence through the three vehicles, since it teaches the Dharma free from conceit and is realized as free from actualization.

original: bye brag tu lam shes pa nyid kyi bden pa bdun dang / chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs pa nyid kyis chos bstan te de'i rten sangs rgyas la 'god pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang yin pa rten gyi mdzad pa ni gcig go //
analyzed: bye brag tu lam shes pa nyid kyi bden pa bdun dang / chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs pa nyid kyis chos bstan te de'i rten sangs rgyas la 'god pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang yin pa rten gyi mdzad pa ni gcig go //
translated: In particular, the seven topics of the knowledge of paths are taught, and all phenomena are taught by the knowledge of all aspects. Thus, the knowledge of all aspects is the activity of the support, which is the one activity.

original: 'dir thun mong ma yin pa'i sbyor ba gtsor bstan pa nyid kyi byed pa rnam par bstan pa yin pas thams cad shes pa nyid la brten pa'i byed pa ni logs shig tu brtsi bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir thun mong ma yin pa'i sbyor ba gtsor bstan pa nyid kyi byed pa rnam par bstan pa yin pas thams cad shes pa nyid la brten pa'i byed pa ni logs shig tu brtsi bar mi bya'o //
translated: Here, the teaching of the principal uncommon application itself is the teaching of the activity. Therefore, the activity that is based on the knowledge of all aspects should not be counted separately.

original: de ltar byed pa'i rnam pa bcu gcig gis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi sbyor ba dag ji lta bar mtshon par byed pas byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar byed pa'i rnam pa bcu gcig gis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi sbyor ba dag ji lta bar mtshon par byed pas byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, the knowledge of all aspects is characterized by activity because it is characterized by the eleven types of activity that are applied to the three exalted knowers just as they are.

original: mtshan nyid de dag gis shes par byas pa'i ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan nyid de dag gis shes par byas pa'i ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the nature that is known by those characteristics?

original: ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid gsungs @48a * //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid gsungs @48a * //
translated: The nature of the three exalted knowers is taught.

original: pa ; / nyon mongs rtags dang mtshan ma dang // mi mthun phyogs dang gnyen po dag //
analyzed: pa ; / nyon mongs rtags dang mtshan ma dang // mi mthun phyogs dang gnyen po dag //
translated: the discordant classes and antidotes,üîΩSolitude, difficulty, certainty,üîΩthe object of intent, non-observation,üîΩthe prevention of attachment,üîΩand the object, which is called

original: dben dang dka' dang nges pa dang // ched du bya dang mi dmigs dang // mngon par zhen pa bkag pa dang // dmigs pa zhes bya ba gang yin dang / mi mthun thogs pa med dang de //
analyzed: dben dang dka' dang nges pa dang // ched du bya dang mi dmigs dang // mngon par zhen pa bkag pa dang // dmigs pa zhes bya ba gang yin dang / mi mthun thogs pa med dang de //
translated: the discordant class, the unobstructed,üîΩthe groundless, the non-going, the non-arising,üîΩand the non-observation of suchness,

original: gzhi med 'gro med skye med dang / de bzhin nyid ni mi dmigs dang // ngo bo nyid bcu drug bdag nyid //
analyzed: gzhi med 'gro med skye med dang / de bzhin nyid ni mi dmigs dang // ngo bo nyid bcu drug bdag nyid //
translated: are the sixteen natures.

original: mtshon bya lta bur mtshon pas na //üîΩmtshan nyid bzhi par bzhed pa yin //
analyzed: mtshon bya lta bur mtshon pas na // mtshan nyid bzhi par bzhed pa yin //
translated: Since they are indicated by the example of the indicated,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: they are accepted as the four characteristics.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pas dben pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / des kun nas bslang bas de'i rtags lus dang ngag gi gnas ngan len gyis dben pa dang / de dag gi rgyu tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa la sogs pa de'i mtshan mas dben pa dang /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pas dben pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / des kun nas bslang bas de'i rtags lus dang ngag gi gnas ngan len gyis dben pa dang / de dag gi rgyu tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa la sogs pa de'i mtshan mas dben pa dang /
translated: The nature of solitude from the afflictions such as attachment, the solitude from the physical and verbal misdeeds that are the signs of those afflictions, which are motivated by them, and the solitude from their causes, such as incorrect attention, which are the characteristics of those afflictions.

original: stong pa nyid kyis 'dod chags dang 'dod chags med pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po dag gis dben pa zhes bya ba thams cad shes pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid bzhi'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis 'dod chags dang 'dod chags med pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po dag gis dben pa zhes bya ba thams cad shes pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid bzhi'o //
translated: The four natures of the knowledge of all things are: the emptiness of the duality of apprehended and apprehender, the emptiness of the subject that is consciousness, the emptiness of the object that is form, and the emptiness of the non-separation of apprehended and apprehender.

original: don dam par med pa'i sems can mya ngan las 'da' bar dka' bas de'i go cha chos thams cad dang ma 'brel ba dang / theg pa gzhan du mi ltung ba'i mtshan nyid mtha' gcig tu nges pa dang / yun ring po nas sems can thams cad kyi don bsgrub par bya ba'i mtshan nyid kyi ched du bya ba dang /
analyzed: don dam par med pa'i sems can mya ngan las 'da' bar dka' bas de'i go cha chos thams cad dang ma 'brel ba dang / theg pa gzhan du mi ltung ba'i mtshan nyid mtha' gcig tu nges pa dang / yun ring po nas sems can thams cad kyi don bsgrub par bya ba'i mtshan nyid kyi ched du bya ba dang /
translated: The four natures of the knowledge of paths are: the armor-like armoring in the Great Vehicle, the entry into the certainty of the one way of the non-descent into other vehicles, the objective support of the accomplishment of the aims of all sentient beings, and the accomplishment of the aims of all sentient beings.

original: rang bzhin gyis bsgom par bya ba la sogs pa 'khor gsum du mi dmigs pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi lam thams cad mngon par zhen pa mtha' dag bkag pa zhes bya ba lam zhes pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid lnga'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis bsgom par bya ba la sogs pa 'khor gsum du mi dmigs pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi lam thams cad mngon par zhen pa mtha' dag bkag pa zhes bya ba lam zhes pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid lnga'o //
translated: The five aspects of the path are: the non-apprehension of the three spheres in the cultivation of the perfection of giving and so forth, the non-apprehension of the three spheres in the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom and so forth, the non-apprehension of the three spheres in the cultivation of the path from the perfection of wisdom up to omniscience, the non-apprehension of the three spheres in the cultivation of the path from the perfection of wisdom up to omniscience, and the non-apprehension of the three spheres in the cultivation of the path from the perfection of wisdom up to omniscience.üîΩThe five aspects of the result are: the non-apprehension of the three spheres in the cultivation of the perfection of giving and so forth, the non-apprehension of the three spheres in the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom and so forth, the non-apprehension of the three spheres in the cultivation of the path from the perfection of wisdom up to omniscience, the non-apprehension of the three spheres in the cultivation of the path from the perfection of wisdom up to omniscience, and the non-apprehension of the three spheres in the cultivation of the path from the perfection of wisdom up to omniscience.üîΩThe five aspects of the path are: the non-apprehension of the three spheres in the cultivation of the perfection of giving and so forth, the non-apprehension of the three spheres in the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom and so forth, the non-apprehension of the three spheres in the cultivation of the path from the perfection of wisdom up to omniscience, the non-apprehension of the three spheres in the cultivation of the path from the perfection of wisdom up to omniscience, and the non-apprehension of the three spheres in the cultivation of the path from the perfection of wisdom up to omniscience.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sbyor ba'i tshul gyis ma byas shing rtogs par bya ba ma yin pa'i de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa dang ; 'jig rten pa la sogs pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan mar spyod pa las zlog ste bltas pas mi mthun pa dang /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sbyor ba'i tshul gyis ma byas shing rtogs par bya ba ma yin pa'i de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa dang ; 'jig rten pa la sogs pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan mar spyod pa las zlog ste bltas pas mi mthun pa dang /
translated: The five aspects of the result are: the non-apprehension of the three spheres in the cultivation of the perfection of giving and so forth, the non-apprehension of the three spheres in the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom and so forth, the non-apprehension of the three spheres in the cultivation of the path from the perfection of wisdom up to omniscience, the non-apprehension of the three spheres in the cultivation of the path from the perfection of wisdom up to omniscience, and the non-apprehension of the three spheres in the cultivation of the path from the perfection of wisdom up to omniscience.üîΩThe five aspects of

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad thogs pa med par shes pa dang / shes par bya ba dang shes par byed pa mi dmigs pa gzhi med pa @48b dang ; de bzhin nyid kyis 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa dang de bzhin nyid dang de las gzhan pa'i rjes su ma yin pas skye ba med pa dang /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad thogs pa med par shes pa dang / shes par bya ba dang shes par byed pa mi dmigs pa gzhi med pa @48b dang ; de bzhin nyid kyis 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa dang de bzhin nyid dang de las gzhan pa'i rjes su ma yin pas skye ba med pa dang /
translated: It is to know all phenomena such as form without impediment, to not apprehend the knower, the known and the act of knowing, to have no basis, to neither come nor go through suchness, to not arise from suchness or from anything other than suchness,

original: de bzhin nyid zab pas gzugs dang de bzhin nyid la sogs pa gsum gyi ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pa zhes rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid bdun no /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid zab pas gzugs dang de bzhin nyid la sogs pa gsum gyi ngo bo nyid mi dmigs pa zhes rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid bdun no /
translated: and to not apprehend the entity of the three such as form and suchness because suchness is profound.

original: de ltar na ngo bo nyid bcu drug gis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam pa gsum gyi sbyor ba rnams ji lta ba'i mtshan nyid dag gis mtshon par bya ba yin pas bzhi pa ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid du 'dod do //
analyzed: de ltar na ngo bo nyid bcu drug gis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam pa gsum gyi sbyor ba rnams ji lta ba'i mtshan nyid dag gis mtshon par bya ba yin pas bzhi pa ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid du 'dod do //
translated: Thus, since the three kinds of omniscience are illustrated by the sixteen kinds of essence in terms of the characteristics of the applications to the three kinds of omniscience, the fourth is asserted to be the characteristic of the essence.

original: de ltar bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa bco brgyad kyis byed pa dang bya ba'i bdag nyid can gyi mtshan nyid dgu bcu rtsa gcig bstan par mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa bco brgyad kyis byed pa dang bya ba'i bdag nyid can gyi mtshan nyid dgu bcu rtsa gcig bstan par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the eighteen verses in the middle teach the ninety-one characteristics of the nature of action and agent.

original: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang ldan pa la ji skad bshad pa'i sbyor ba yongs su bsgom pa 'byung ba dang / sbyor ba'i dbang gis 'thob par 'gyur ba nyid kyang yin pas de'i 'og tu thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa gsungs pa //üîΩmtshan med rab tu sbyin la sogs //
analyzed: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang ldan pa la ji skad bshad pa'i sbyor ba yongs su bsgom pa 'byung ba dang / sbyor ba'i dbang gis 'thob par 'gyur ba nyid kyang yin pas de'i 'og tu thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa gsungs pa // mtshan med rab tu sbyin la sogs //
translated: The roots of virtue that are conducive to liberation arise from the complete cultivation of the above mentioned preparations, and they are also attained by the power of preparation. Therefore, the text explains the roots of virtue that are conducive to liberation after that.üîΩThe skill in the correct achievement of the signless

original: yang dag sgrub la mkhas pa ni //
analyzed: yang dag sgrub la mkhas pa ni //
translated: generosity and so on

original: rnam pa thams cad rtogs 'di la /üîΩthar pa'i cha dang mthun par 'dod //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad rtogs 'di la / thar pa'i cha dang mthun par 'dod //
translated: is the realization of all aspects

original: ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o //
translated: and is asserted to be conducive to liberation.

original: rang bzhin gyis rnam pa thams cad du thams cad la mtshan ma med par dmigs pa'i shes pa'i rnam pas sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mthar thug pa rnams kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i mtshan
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rnam pa thams cad du thams cad la mtshan ma med par dmigs pa'i shes pa'i rnam pas sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mthar thug pa rnams kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i mtshan
translated: The perfection of generosity and so on up to the final perfection of omniscience are all characterized by the aspect of the consciousness that perceives them as signless in every respect and by nature.üîΩ

original: nyid kyis rgyud la yang dag par bskyed pa la mkhas pa gang yin pa de ni rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa'i sbyor ba 'di la thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa bar 'dod do //
analyzed: nyid kyis rgyud la yang dag par bskyed pa la mkhas pa gang yin pa de ni rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa'i sbyor ba 'di la thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa bar 'dod do //
translated: The skill in the generation of the perfections from generosity to the final perfection of the knowledge of all aspects in the mindstream by means of the aspect of the consciousness that observes the absence of all signs in every respect by nature is asserted as the root of the virtue that is conducive to liberation in this application of the realization of all aspects.

original: de la thabs mkhas pa de dag gang yin pa zhe na gsungs pa //
analyzed: de la thabs mkhas pa de dag gang yin pa zhe na gsungs pa //
translated: What are those skillful means?üîΩFaith that observes the Buddha and so on,üîΩeffort that is the domain of generosity and so on,üîΩmindfulness that is complete in intention,

translated: concentration that is nonconceptual,üîΩand the wisdom that fully discerns all aspects of phenomenaüîΩare the six perfections.

translated: Thus, those of sharp faculty who have greatly trained in the factors conducive to penetrations realize perfect complete enlightenment easily, and those of dull faculty who have not greatly trained in the factors conducive to penetrations realize it with difficulty.

translated: The knowledge of the truth that is based on oneself and others

original: chos mchog de bzhin sems can rnams //
analyzed: chos mchog de bzhin sems can rnams //
translated: is the supreme doctrine, and likewise the maturation of sentient beings.

original: smin byed sogs kyis shes par bya //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: smin byed sogs kyis shes par bya // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: One should know these and so forth.

original: chos kyi rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa 'di la chung du ni sems mnyam pa dang / byams pa dang / 'bring du na phan pa dang / khong khro ba med pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba med pa'i sems te /
analyzed: chos kyi rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa 'di la chung du ni sems mnyam pa dang / byams pa dang / 'bring du na phan pa dang / khong khro ba med pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba med pa'i sems te /
translated: The realization of all aspects of the doctrine is small when one has an attitude of equality, love, and so forth. It is middling when one has an attitude of benefit, non-aversion, and non-violence.

original: spyir legs par sems pa rnam pa lnga dang // chen po pha dang ma'i sems dang / spun dang sring mi'i sems dang / bu dang bu mo'i sems dang / bshes dang grogs kyi sems dang / gnyen dang snag gi gnyen mtshams kyi sems te /
analyzed: spyir legs par sems pa rnam pa lnga dang // chen po pha dang ma'i sems dang / spun dang sring mi'i sems dang / bu dang bu mo'i sems dang / bshes dang grogs kyi sems dang / gnyen dang snag gi gnyen mtshams kyi sems te /
translated: It is great when one has the five kinds of good attitudes: the attitude of a father, mother, brother, sister, child, and grandchild.

original: gzhan yang de la yang dag par 'god pa dang ; bstan pa'i phyir zhugs pa la bsngags pa brjod pa dang / 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir mthun pas dga' bar byed pa zhes pa dang / 'bring du na bdag nyid sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas shing //
analyzed: gzhan yang de la yang dag par 'god pa dang ; bstan pa'i phyir zhugs pa la bsngags pa brjod pa dang / 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir mthun pas dga' bar byed pa zhes pa dang / 'bring du na bdag nyid sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas shing //
translated: and for the sake of increasing [virtue], one delights in what is compatible. In the medium [state], one abides in the six perfections such as generosity,üîΩand for the sake of increasing [virtue], one delights in what is compatible. In the great [state], one abides in the six

original: gzhan yang snga ma ltar rjes su sgrub pa nyid dang // chen po ni sogs pa zhes bya bas bsdus te bdag nyid rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba lugs su 'byung ba dang lugs las bzlog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / gzhan dag kyang snga ma bzhin du nye bar spyod pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas sems can thams cad la dmigs pa'i rtse mor gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang snga ma ltar rjes su sgrub pa nyid dang // chen po ni sogs pa zhes bya bas bsdus te bdag nyid rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba lugs su 'byung ba dang lugs las bzlog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / gzhan dag kyang snga ma bzhin du nye bar spyod pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas sems can thams cad la dmigs pa'i rtse mor gyur pa yin no //
translated: It is the culmination of the meditative development of the immeasurables since it is the basis for the meditative development of the immeasurables in the manner previously described.

original: de bzhin du chung du na sdug bsngal yongs su shes par bya ba la sogs pa snga ma lta bu'i rnam pas lam la sbyor ba nyid dang / 'bring du na rang byang chub kyi 'bras bu la gzhan dag sbyor ba dang / chen por bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la bdag nyid gnas shing gzhan dag nye bar sbyor ba la sogs pa'i rnam pas sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa sems can thams cad la dmigs pa ni bzod pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du chung du na sdug bsngal yongs su shes par bya ba la sogs pa snga ma lta bu'i rnam pas lam la sbyor ba nyid dang / 'bring du na rang byang chub kyi 'bras bu la gzhan dag sbyor ba dang / chen por bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la bdag nyid gnas shing gzhan dag nye bar sbyor ba la sogs pa'i rnam pas sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa sems can thams cad la dmigs pa ni bzod pa yin no //
translated: The truth of suffering and so on that focuses on all sentient beings in these ways is patience.

original: snga ma bzhin du chud du na theg pa gsum gyis smin par byed pa dang / sogs zhes bya bas bsdus pa 'bring du na byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa bskyed pa dang / chen po ni bag chags kyis mtshams sbyor ba thams cad spong par byed pa la sogs pa la bdag nyid gnas shing zhan dag 'god pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas sems can thams cad la dmigs pa ni chos kyi mchog tu gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du chud du na theg pa gsum gyis smin par byed pa dang / sogs zhes bya bas bsdus pa 'bring du na byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa bskyed pa dang / chen po ni bag chags kyis mtshams sbyor ba thams cad spong par byed pa la sogs pa la bdag nyid gnas shing zhan dag 'god pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas sems can thams cad la dmigs pa ni chos kyi mchog tu gyur pa yin no //
translated: If one is not like the former, one is engaged in ripening beings by means of the three vehicles. If one is not like the middling, one generates the superknowledges of a bodhisattva. If one is not like the great, one abides in the elimination of all residual impression connections and so on, and by the aspects of establishing others in those and so on, one focuses on all sentient beings.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa thob pas phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpar 'gyur bas slob pa phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa //
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa thob pas phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpar 'gyur bas slob pa phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa //
translated: The characteristic of the irreversible learner is stated because one becomes an irreversible bodhisattva by attaining the factors conducive to penetration.

original: nges 'byed yan lag nas bzung ste //
analyzed: nges 'byed yan lag nas bzung ste //
translated: From the factors conducive to penetraüîΩtion

original: mthong dang bsgom pa'i lam dag la //
analyzed: mthong dang bsgom pa'i lam dag la //
translated: on the paths of seeing and cultivation

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang dag @50a * //üîΩgnas // de 'dir phyir mi ldog pa'i tshogs //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang dag @50a * // gnas // de 'dir phyir mi ldog pa'i tshogs //
translated: the bodhisattvasüîΩabide.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the assembly of the irreversible here.

original: 'di ltar nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa bzhi dang mthong ba'i lam dang bsgom pa'i lam dag la yang dag par rtogs pa thob pas gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gang yin pa de dag ni rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs pa rtogs pa'i skabs 'dir
analyzed: 'di ltar nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa bzhi dang mthong ba'i lam dang bsgom pa'i lam dag la yang dag par rtogs pa thob pas gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gang yin pa de dag ni rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs pa rtogs pa'i skabs 'dir
translated: Thus, those bodhisattvas who attain realization on the four aspects that conform with penetrative insight, on the path of seeing, and on the path of meditation are abiding bodhisattvas.

original: slob pa phyir mi ldog pa'i tshogs kyi dge 'dun yin no //
analyzed: slob pa phyir mi ldog pa'i tshogs kyi dge 'dun yin no //
translated: They are the assembly of irreversible learners.

original: de la bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun par gnas pa rnams kyi phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags gsungs pa //
analyzed: de la bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun par gnas pa rnams kyi phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags gsungs pa //
translated: One verse in the middle on the signs of irreversibility of those abiding in the factors conducive to penetrative insight.

original: gzugs la sogs las ldog sogs rtags //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs las ldog sogs rtags //
translated: The signs of turning away from form and so on,

original: rnam pa nyi shur brjod pa yis //üîΩnges 'byed yan lag la gnas pa'i //üîΩphyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid 'di //
analyzed: rnam pa nyi shur brjod pa yis // nges 'byed yan lag la gnas pa'i // phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid 'di //
translated: are said to have twenty aspects.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: These are the characteristics of irreversibilityüîΩof those abiding in the factors conducive to penetrative insight.

original: gzugs la sogs pa las ldog pa dang / the tshom med pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa nyi shur brjod pa'i 'di dag gis nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag la gnas pa rnams kyi phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid shes par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa las ldog pa dang / the tshom med pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa nyi shur brjod pa'i 'di dag gis nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag la gnas pa rnams kyi phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid shes par bya ba yin no //
translated: These twenty aspects, such as turning away from form, etc., and being free from doubt, etc., are to be known as the characteristics of irreversibility for those who are established in the factors conducive to penetration.

original: rnam pa nyi shu po gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa nyi shu po gang zhe na /
translated: What are the twenty aspects?

original: bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa drug gis gsungs pa //
analyzed: bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa drug gis gsungs pa //
translated: Six intermediate verses are spoken:

original: gzugs la sogs las ldog pa dang / the tshom mi dal zad pa dang // bdag nyid dge ba la gnas shing //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs las ldog pa dang / the tshom mi dal zad pa dang // bdag nyid dge ba la gnas shing //
translated: Turning away from form, etc., being free from doubt, being free from laziness,

original: gzhan dag de la 'god pa dang / gzhan gyi rten can spyin sogs dang / zab mo'i don la som nyi med //üîΩbyams lus sogs dang sgrib pa ni //
analyzed: gzhan dag de la 'god pa dang / gzhan gyi rten can spyin sogs dang / zab mo'i don la som nyi med // byams lus sogs dang sgrib pa ni //
translated: establishing others in that, giving, etc. based on others, being free from doubt about the profound meaning,üîΩbeing free from the five aspects of attachment, being free from obscurations,üîΩdestroying all latent tendencies, mindfulness, introspection,

original: rnam pa lnga dang mi 'grogs dang / bag la nyal kun 'joms pa dang // dran pa dang ni shes bzhin dang // gos la sogs pa gtsang ba dang / lus la srin bu rnams mi 'byung //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga dang mi 'grogs dang / bag la nyal kun 'joms pa dang // dran pa dang ni shes bzhin dang // gos la sogs pa gtsang ba dang / lus la srin bu rnams mi 'byung //
translated: cleanliness of robes, etc., and the absence of parasites in the body,

original: gya gyu med sems sbyangs pa ni //
analyzed: gya gyu med sems sbyangs pa ni //
translated: The training of the mind without deceit,üîΩThe taking of the vow, the absence of stinginess, and so on,üîΩThe going forth endowed with the Dharma,üîΩThe search for the hells for the sake of sentient beings,

original: len dang ser sna med sogs dang // chos nyid ldan par 'gro nyid dang // sems can don du dmyal tshol dang // gzhan gyis ba kri bar mi btub dang // lam gzhan nye bar ston bdud la //
analyzed: len dang ser sna med sogs dang // chos nyid ldan par 'gro nyid dang // sems can don du dmyal tshol dang // gzhan gyis ba kri bar mi btub dang // lam gzhan nye bar ston bdud la //
translated: The inability to be led astray by others,üîΩThe realization that the demon who teaches other pathsüîΩIs called Mara,

original: bdung ces bya bar rtogs pa dang // sangs rgyas dgyes pa'i spyod pa ste //
analyzed: bdung ces bya bar rtogs pa dang // sangs rgyas dgyes pa'i spyod pa ste //
translated: And the conduct pleasing to the Buddhas‚Äî

original: rtags ni nyi shu de dag gis //
analyzed: rtags ni nyi shu de dag gis //
translated: These are the twenty signs.üîΩThe one who abides in heat, peak, patience,

original: drod dang rtse mo bzod bcas dang // chos mchog rnams la gnas pa ni /
analyzed: drod dang rtse mo bzod bcas dang // chos mchog rnams la gnas pa ni /
translated: And the highest worldly dharmas

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub @50b las mi ldog / ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub @50b las mi ldog / ces bya ba'o //
translated: Does not turn away from complete enlightenment.üîΩThe great reversal of clinging to form and so on through the absence of intrinsic nature,üîΩThe unshakable faith in the refuge through knowing the qualities of the Buddha and so on,

original: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa las mngon par zhen pa cher ldog pa dang / sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i yon tan shes nas skyabs su dad pa the tshom mi za ba dang / spyod lam grub pas dmyal ba dang /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa las mngon par zhen pa cher ldog pa dang / sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i yon tan shes nas skyabs su dad pa the tshom mi za ba dang / spyod lam grub pas dmyal ba dang /
translated: The search for the hells through the perfection of conduct,

original: yi dgas dang / dud 'gro dang / sangs rgyas kyis stong pa dang / yul mtha' 'khob dang / lha tshe ring po dang / log par lta ba can dang / lkugs pa zhes bya ba mi khom pa brgyad du skye ba zad pa dang /
analyzed: yi dgas dang / dud 'gro dang / sangs rgyas kyis stong pa dang / yul mtha' 'khob dang / lha tshe ring po dang / log par lta ba can dang / lkugs pa zhes bya ba mi khom pa brgyad du skye ba zad pa dang /
translated: The eight unfavorable states are: birth in the hells, as a hungry ghost, as an animal, in a place devoid of Buddha, in a remote land, as a long-lived god, as one with wrong views, or as a mute.

original: lta ba dang snying rje bsgoms pa nyid kyis bdag nyid dge ba bcu la gnas shing gzhan dag kyang de la sbyor ba dang / bdag dang gzhan du brje ba nyid kyis sbyin pa la sogs pa thams cad sems dan gzhan gyi yul la yongs su bsngo ba dang /
analyzed: lta ba dang snying rje bsgoms pa nyid kyis bdag nyid dge ba bcu la gnas shing gzhan dag kyang de la sbyor ba dang / bdag dang gzhan du brje ba nyid kyis sbyin pa la sogs pa thams cad sems dan gzhan gyi yul la yongs su bsngo ba dang /
translated: By means of the cultivation of the view and compassion, one abides in the ten virtues oneself and introduces others to them, and by means of the exchange of oneself for others, one dedicates all the gifts and so forth to the objects of other sentient beings.

original: chos yang dag par rtogs par zab mo'i don la yang som nyi med pa dang / gzhan la phan pa nyid du zhugs pas byams pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las dang / sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pas 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang /
analyzed: chos yang dag par rtogs par zab mo'i don la yang som nyi med pa dang / gzhan la phan pa nyid du zhugs pas byams pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las dang / sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pas 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang /
translated: One has no doubts about the profound meaning by means of the perfect realization of the Dharma, and one has a body, speech, and mind of love and has an aspiration for the gifts and so forth by means of engaging in the benefit of others.

original: gnod sems dang / gnyid dang rmugs pa dang / rgod pa dang 'gyod pa dang / the tshom ste sgrib pa lnga po dag dang mi 'grogs pa dang / gnyen po rnam par bsgoms pa nyid kyis ma rig pa dang / lta bas bsdus pa'i bag la nyal thams cad 'joms pa dang /
analyzed: gnod sems dang / gnyid dang rmugs pa dang / rgod pa dang 'gyod pa dang / the tshom ste sgrib pa lnga po dag dang mi 'grogs pa dang / gnyen po rnam par bsgoms pa nyid kyis ma rig pa dang / lta bas bsdus pa'i bag la nyal thams cad 'joms pa dang /
translated: It is the destruction of all latent states of ignorance and views by means of the cultivation of their antidotes.üîΩIt is endowed with mindfulness and vigilance by means of constant meditative equipoise.üîΩIt is completely pure with regard to clothing and so forth by means of the practice of pure conduct.

original: rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa nyid kyis dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang ldan pa dang / gtsang sbra kun tu spyod pa nyid kyis gos la sogs pa yongs su gtsang ba zhes bya ba'i rnam pa bcu gcig ni dro bar gyur pa la gnas pa phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags yin no //
analyzed: rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa nyid kyis dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang ldan pa dang / gtsang sbra kun tu spyod pa nyid kyis gos la sogs pa yongs su gtsang ba zhes bya ba'i rnam pa bcu gcig ni dro bar gyur pa la gnas pa phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags yin no //
translated: These eleven aspects are the signs of irreversibility for one abiding in the state of heat.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'jig rten dang rab tu ma 'dres pa nyid kyis lus la srin bu'i rigs brgyad khri mi 'byung ba dang / yid la byed pa rnam par dag pas kya gyu'i sems med pa dang / rnyed pa dang bkur sti la sogs pa la mi lta ba nyid kyis phyag dar khrod pa dang /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'jig rten dang rab tu ma 'dres pa nyid kyis lus la srin bu'i rigs brgyad khri mi 'byung ba dang / yid la byed pa rnam par dag pas kya gyu'i sems med pa dang / rnyed pa dang bkur sti la sogs pa la mi lta ba nyid kyis phyag dar khrod pa dang /
translated: Because their roots of virtue are not mixed with the mundane, they do not have the eighty four thousand types of worms in their bodies. Because their attention is pure, they do not have the kƒ´·π≠a mind. Because they do not look for gain, honor, and so forth, they are ragpickers.

original: chos gos gsum pa dang / phying pa dang / bsod snyoms pa dang / stan gcig pa dang / phyis mi len pa dang / dgon pa dang / cog pu pa dang / gzhi ji bzhin pa dang / dur @51a * //
analyzed: chos gos gsum pa dang / phying pa dang / bsod snyoms pa dang / stan gcig pa dang / phyis mi len pa dang / dgon pa dang / cog pu pa dang / gzhi ji bzhin pa dang / dur @51a * //
translated: Since their roots of virtue are not mixed with the mundane, they do not have the eighty four thousand types of worms in their bodies. Since their mental activity is pure, they do not have the mind of a pig. Since they do not look for gain, honor, and so forth, they are rag robe wearers, wearers of the three Dharma robes, wearers of felt, practitioners of alms begging, practitioners of one sitting, non acceptors of food after rising from one's seat, forest dwellers, practitioners of sitting on bare ground, practitioners of whatever is available, charnel ground dwellers, tree dwellers, and open air dwellers.

original: khrod pa dang / shing drung ba dang / bla gab med pa pa zhes bya ba sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis yang dag par len pa dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa'i khyad par sgrub pas de dag dang 'gal ba ser sna la sogs pa med pa dang /
analyzed: khrod pa dang / shing drung ba dang / bla gab med pa pa zhes bya ba sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis yang dag par len pa dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa'i khyad par sgrub pas de dag dang 'gal ba ser sna la sogs pa med pa dang /
translated: They correctly take up the twelve ascetic practices and since they accomplish the special practices of generosity and so forth, they are free of the discordant classes such as miserliness.

original: chos thams cad yang dag par sdud pa nyid kyis chos nyid dang mi 'gal ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan par 'gro ba dang / 'gro ba bdag gir bya ba nyid kyis gzhan gyi don du dmyal bar yang 'jug pa zhes bya ba rnam pa drug ni rtse mor gyur pa la gnas pa'i phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad yang dag par sdud pa nyid kyis chos nyid dang mi 'gal ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan par 'gro ba dang / 'gro ba bdag gir bya ba nyid kyis gzhan gyi don du dmyal bar yang 'jug pa zhes bya ba rnam pa drug ni rtse mor gyur pa la gnas pa'i phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags yin no //
translated: The six beginning with ‚Äúgoing‚Äù are the signs of non-regression of one who is situated in the summit, because they are the signs of the summit. ‚Äú Going‚Äù means going to the perfection of wisdom, which is endowed with the perfection of wisdom, because it is the very collection of all dharmas and is not in conflict with the dharmata. ‚Äú Entering‚Äù means entering into the hells for the sake of others, because one has taken on the responsibility for all beings.

original: rtogs pa la yid ches pa'i chos nyid gzhan gyis gzhan du bkrir mi btub pa dang / sangs rgyas nyid kyi thabs shes pa la mkhas pa nyid kyis lam ltar bcos pa nye bar ston pa'i bdud la bdud nyid du rtogs pa zhes bya ba rnam pa gnyis ni bzod par gyur pa la gnas pa'i phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa la yid ches pa'i chos nyid gzhan gyis gzhan du bkrir mi btub pa dang / sangs rgyas nyid kyi thabs shes pa la mkhas pa nyid kyis lam ltar bcos pa nye bar ston pa'i bdud la bdud nyid du rtogs pa zhes bya ba rnam pa gnyis ni bzod par gyur pa la gnas pa'i phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags yin no //
translated: The two beginning with ‚Äúrealization‚Äù are the signs of non-regression of one who is situated in receptivity, because they are the signs of receptivity. ‚Äú Realization‚Äù means realization of the reality of conviction in realization, because one cannot be led away from it by others. ‚Äú Skill‚Äù means skill in the means of buddhahood, because one demonstrates a counterfeit path to Mara.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yid la byed pa dang ma bral bas spyod pa las sangs rgyas mngon par dgyes pa zhes bya ba rnam pa gcig ni chos kyi mchog tu gyur pa la gnas pa'i phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yid la byed pa dang ma bral bas spyod pa las sangs rgyas mngon par dgyes pa zhes bya ba rnam pa gcig ni chos kyi mchog tu gyur pa la gnas pa'i phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags te /
translated: The sign of irreversibility is one aspect, called ‚Äúdelighting the buddhas,‚Äù because of abiding in the supreme mundane state.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' dro ba la sogs pa nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag la gnas pa rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags ni rnam pa nyi shu po 'di dag tu shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' dro ba la sogs pa nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag la gnas pa rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags ni rnam pa nyi shu po 'di dag tu shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the signs of irreversibility of the bodhisattva who abides in the factors conducive to penetration such as heat should be known as these twenty aspects.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa phyir mi ldog pa thob pa las mthong ba'i lam gyi phyir mi ldog par 'byung bas de'i rtags bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis gsungs pa /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa phyir mi ldog pa thob pa las mthong ba'i lam gyi phyir mi ldog par 'byung bas de'i rtags bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis gsungs pa /
translated: The sign of irreversibility on the path of seeing is stated in one verse in the middle.üîΩThe sixteen moments of acceptance and knowledge

original: mthong ba'i lam la bzod pa dang // shes pa'i skad cig bcu drug ni //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la bzod pa dang // shes pa'i skad cig bcu drug ni //
translated: on the path of seeingüîΩare the irreversible

original: byang chub sems dpa' mi ldog pa'i //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mi ldog pa'i //
translated: of the bodhisattva.

original: mtshan nyid yin par shes par bya //
analyzed: mtshan nyid yin par shes par bya //
translated: One should understand that this is the definition.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the definition.

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa bzhi la chos dang rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang shes pa'i skad cig ma bcu drug ni byang chub sems dpa' mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa rnams kyi phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa bzhi la chos dang rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang shes pa'i skad cig ma bcu drug ni byang chub sems dpa' mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa rnams kyi phyir mi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: The sixteen moments of the receptivities and cognitions with regard to the four truths, such as the truth of suffering, are the definition of the bodhisattva's abiding in the path of seeing as the state of nonreturn.

original: skad cig ma'i rnam pa bcu drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: skad cig ma'i rnam pa bcu drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the sixteen moments?

original: bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad @51b pa lngas gsungs pa /üîΩgzugs sogs 'du shes ldog pa dang // sems brtan theg pa dman dag las //
analyzed: bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad @51b pa lngas gsungs pa / gzugs sogs 'du shes ldog pa dang // sems brtan theg pa dman dag las //
translated: Five verses in the middle state it:

original: rnam log bsam gtan la sogs pa'i //
analyzed: rnam log bsam gtan la sogs pa'i //
translated: The reversal of the ideation of form, etc., the stability of mind, the reversal from the lower vehicle,

original: yan lag yongs su zad pa dang // lus sems yang ba nyid dang ni //
analyzed: yan lag yongs su zad pa dang // lus sems yang ba nyid dang ni //
translated: The complete exhaustion of the branches of concentration, etc., the lightness of body and mind,

original: 'dod pa spyod la mkhas pa dang // rtag tu tshangs par spyod nyid dang // 'tsho ba rnam par dag nyid dang / phung sogs bar chad byed rnams dang // tshogs dang dbang sogs bcas pa yi //
analyzed: 'dod pa spyod la mkhas pa dang // rtag tu tshangs par spyod nyid dang // 'tsho ba rnam par dag nyid dang / phung sogs bar chad byed rnams dang // tshogs dang dbang sogs bcas pa yi //
translated: and the obstacles to the aggregates and so on,

original: g-yul 'gyed ser sna la sogs la //
analyzed: g-yul 'gyed ser sna la sogs la //
translated: and the battle with stinginess and so on,

original: sbyor dang rjes su sbyor ba yi //
analyzed: sbyor dang rjes su sbyor ba yi //
translated: and the application and subsequent applicationüîΩof the individual cessations,

original: gnas pa so sor bkag pa dang // chos ni rdul tsam mi dmigs nyid //
analyzed: gnas pa so sor bkag pa dang // chos ni rdul tsam mi dmigs nyid //
translated: and the non-apprehension of even an atom of phenomena,

original: rang gi sa la nges pa nyid //
analyzed: rang gi sa la nges pa nyid //
translated: and being certain about one's own level,üîΩand abiding in the three levels,

original: sa gsum la ni gnas pa dang // chos kyi don du srog gtong ba //
analyzed: sa gsum la ni gnas pa dang // chos kyi don du srog gtong ba //
translated: and giving up one's life for the sake of the Dharma,

original: de 'dra'i skad cig bcu drug ni //
analyzed: de 'dra'i skad cig bcu drug ni //
translated: such are the sixteen moments

original: blo ldan mthong ba'i lam gnas kyi //
analyzed: blo ldan mthong ba'i lam gnas kyi //
translated: of the wise abiding in the path of seeing.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags dag yin //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags dag yin //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
translated: These are the signs of irreversibility.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa la mtshan mar yongs su 'dzin pa phra mo yang ldog pa dang / sangs rgyas la sogs pas byin gyis brlabs pas bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sems brtan pa nyid dang / theg pa chen po'i chos khyad par can bsgrubs pas nyan thos la sogs pa'i theg pa dman pa las sems rnam par ldog pa dang /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa la mtshan mar yongs su 'dzin pa phra mo yang ldog pa dang / sangs rgyas la sogs pas byin gyis brlabs pas bla na med pa'i byang chub tu sems brtan pa nyid dang / theg pa chen po'i chos khyad par can bsgrubs pas nyan thos la sogs pa'i theg pa dman pa las sems rnam par ldog pa dang /
translated: The subtle apprehension of signs of form and so on is stopped by the emptiness of defining characteristics, the mind is stabilized in unsurpassable enlightenment by the blessings of the buddhas and so on, the mind turns away from the lower vehicles of the sravakas and so on by accomplishing the special qualities of the Mahayana and the limbs of birth in the absorptions, the formless realm and so on are exhausted by the power of fully discriminating phenomena.

original: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i mthus bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs par skye ba'i yan lag yongs su zad pa zhes bya ba bzhi ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i mthus bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs par skye ba'i yan lag yongs su zad pa zhes bya ba bzhi ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i rnam pa yin no //
translated: These four are the aspects of the truth of suffering.

original: mi dge ba dang bral ba nyid kyis lus dang sems yang ba dang / sems can gdul ba'i thabs la mkhas pa'i mthus mngon par zhen pa med par 'dod pa la nye bar spyod pa dang / yul gyi nyes dmigs mthong bas rtag tu tshangs par spyod pa nyid dang /
analyzed: mi dge ba dang bral ba nyid kyis lus dang sems yang ba dang / sems can gdul ba'i thabs la mkhas pa'i mthus mngon par zhen pa med par 'dod pa la nye bar spyod pa dang / yul gyi nyes dmigs mthong bas rtag tu tshangs par spyod pa nyid dang /
translated: It is light in body and mind due to being free from nonvirtue. It is the enjoyment of sense objects without attachment due to the power of skill in the means of training sentient beings. It is always celibacy due to seeing the faults of objects.üîΩIt is pure in livelihood since it does not engage in the activities of bad people, such as predicting the future.

original: skyes bu dam pa'i chos nyid kyis dman pa'i dngos po lung ston pa la sogs pa mi byed pas 'tsho ba'i yo byad rnam par dag pa nyid ces bya ba bzhin ni kun 'byung ba'i rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa'i chos nyid kyis dman pa'i dngos po lung ston pa la sogs pa mi byed pas 'tsho ba'i yo byad rnam par dag pa nyid ces bya ba bzhin ni kun 'byung ba'i rnam pa yin no //
translated: It is the aspect of origin because it is the cause of the arising of the four truths.üîΩIt is the aspect of cessation because it is the cause of the arising of the four truths.

original: stong pa nyid la gnas pa nyid kyis phung po dang skye mched dang khams rnams la sbyor ba dang rjes su sbyor ba'i @52a * //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la gnas pa nyid kyis phung po dang skye mched dang khams rnams la sbyor ba dang rjes su sbyor ba'i @52a * //
translated: It is the aspect of the path because it is the cause of the arising of the four truths.

original: gnas pa so sor bkag pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs bsal ba nyid kyis rtogs pa'i bar chad byed pa'i chos rnams la snga ma ltar sbyor ba la sogs pa so sor bkag pa dang / rnam par rtog pa'i skyon yongs su shes pa nyid kyis byang chub kyi tshogs sbyin pa la sogs pa la sbyor ba la sogs pa'i gtam la gnas pa so sor bkag pa dang /
analyzed: gnas pa so sor bkag pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs bsal ba nyid kyis rtogs pa'i bar chad byed pa'i chos rnams la snga ma ltar sbyor ba la sogs pa so sor bkag pa dang / rnam par rtog pa'i skyon yongs su shes pa nyid kyis byang chub kyi tshogs sbyin pa la sogs pa la sbyor ba la sogs pa'i gtam la gnas pa so sor bkag pa dang /
translated: cessation of application and so on to the accumulations of enlightenment such as generosity, since one abides in the teachings on application and so on and one fully understands the faults of conceptualization,

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag spang bar bya ba nyid kyis dbang po dang rten dang yul dang bdag gir sbyor ba la sogs pa'i gnas pa so sor bkag pa zhes bya ba bzhi ni /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag spang bar bya ba nyid kyis dbang po dang rten dang yul dang bdag gir sbyor ba la sogs pa'i gnas pa so sor bkag pa zhes bya ba bzhi ni /
translated: cessation of application and so on to the sense faculties, their supports, objects and the appropriating agent, since one abandons apprehended objects and apprehending subjects.

original: 'gog pa'i rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i rnam pa yin no //
translated: These four are the aspects of cessation.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i khyad par rtogs pas ser sna la sogs pa la sbyor ba dang rjes su sbyor ba'i gnas pa so sor bkag pa dang / chos thams cad rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyi ngo bo nyid yin pas rtogs pa'i chos rdul tsam yang mi dmigs pa dang ;
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i khyad par rtogs pas ser sna la sogs pa la sbyor ba dang rjes su sbyor ba'i gnas pa so sor bkag pa dang / chos thams cad rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum gyi ngo bo nyid yin pas rtogs pa'i chos rdul tsam yang mi dmigs pa dang ;
translated: The four aspects of the path are the special realization of generosity and so on, the individual cessation of the application and subsequent application of stinginess and so on, the nonapprehension of even a particle of the Dharma to be realized since all phenomena are by nature the three doors of perfect liberation and

original: mngon par yid ches pa thob pas mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi rang nyid kyi bar chad med pa la sogs pa gsum la nges pa nyid kyis gnas pa dang / gcig tu gzhol ba nyid kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi chos kyi don du lus dang srog gtong ba zhes bya ba bzhi ni lam gyi rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon par yid ches pa thob pas mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi rang nyid kyi bar chad med pa la sogs pa gsum la nges pa nyid kyis gnas pa dang / gcig tu gzhol ba nyid kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi chos kyi don du lus dang srog gtong ba zhes bya ba bzhi ni lam gyi rnam pa yin no //
translated: the state of certainty in the three uninterrupted paths and so on of the three exalted knowers through obtaining full conviction and the giving up of body and life for the sake of the Dharma of omniscience through single pointed devotion.

original: de ltar na bzod pa dang shes pa rnams kyi skad cig ma rnam pa bcu drug gis rab tu dbye bas mnyam par gzhag pa rang dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu dag pa 'jig rten pa'i yul can gzugs la sogs pa'i 'du shes las ldog pa la sogs pa
analyzed: de ltar na bzod pa dang shes pa rnams kyi skad cig ma rnam pa bcu drug gis rab tu dbye bas mnyam par gzhag pa rang dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu dag pa 'jig rten pa'i yul can gzugs la sogs pa'i 'du shes las ldog pa la sogs pa
translated: The path of meditation is the uninterrupted path that is the antidote to the afflictive obstructions and the uninterrupted path that is the antidote to the obstructions to omniscience.üîΩThe path of meditation is the uninterrupted path that is the antidote to the afflictive obstructions and the uninterrupted path that is the antidote to the obstructions to omniscience.üîΩThe path of meditation is the uninterrupted path that is the antidote to the afflictive obstructions and the uninterrupted path that is the antidote to the obstructions to omniscience.üîΩThe path of meditation is the uninterrupted path that is the antidote to the afflictive obstructions and the uninterrupted path that is the antidote to the obstructions to omniscience.

original: bskyed pa'i mngon par ma zhen pa'i rnam pa can rjes kyi sems kyis bsdus pa gang yin pa 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags yin no //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i mngon par ma zhen pa'i rnam pa can rjes kyi sems kyis bsdus pa gang yin pa 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags yin no //
translated: The path of meditation is the uninterrupted path that is the antidote to the afflictive obstructions and the uninterrupted path that is the antidote to the obstructions to omniscience.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi phyir mi ldog pa thob pa las bsgom pa'i lam gyi phyir mi ldog pa 'byung bas de'i mtshan nyid bshad par bzhed nas /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi phyir mi ldog pa thob pa las bsgom pa'i lam gyi phyir mi ldog pa 'byung bas de'i mtshan nyid bshad par bzhed nas /
translated: The path of meditation is the uninterrupted path that is the antidote to the afflictive obstructions and the uninterrupted path that is the antidote to the obstructions to omniscience.

original: khyad par ma bzung bar khyad par can gyi blo mi skye ba'i phyir re zhig bsgom pa'i lam gyi khyad par gsungs pa /
analyzed: khyad par ma bzung bar khyad par can gyi blo mi skye ba'i phyir re zhig bsgom pa'i lam gyi khyad par gsungs pa /
translated: The path of meditation is the uninterrupted path that is the antidote to the afflictive obstructions and the uninterrupted path that is the antidote to the obstructions to omniscience.üîΩThe path of meditation is the uninterrupted path that is the antidote to the afflictive obstructions and the uninterrupted path that is the antidote to the obstructions to omniscience.üîΩThe path of meditation is the uninterrupted path that is the antidote to the afflictive obstructions and the uninterrupted path that is the antidote to the obstructions to omniscience.üîΩThe path of meditation is the uninterrupted path that is the antidote to the afflictive obstructions and the uninterrupted path that is the antidote to the obstructions to omniscience.üîΩThe path of meditation is the uninterrupted path that is the antidote to the afflictive obstructions and the uninterrupted path that is the antidote to the obstructions to omniscience.

original: bsgom pa'i lam ni zab pa ste //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam ni zab pa ste //
translated: The path of meditation is the uninterrupted path that is the antidote to the aff

original: zab mo stong pa nyid la sogs //
analyzed: zab mo stong pa nyid la sogs //
translated: The profound is emptiness, etc.

original: zab pa de ni sgro 'dogs dang // skur @52b pa'i mtha' las grol ba nyid //üîΩces bya ba'o //
analyzed: zab pa de ni sgro 'dogs dang // skur @52b pa'i mtha' las grol ba nyid // ces bya ba'o //
translated: That profundity is freedom from the extremes of superimposition and denial.üîΩBecause form, etc. do not exist in emptiness, nor does emptiness exist in form, etc.

original: gang gi phyir stong pa nyid la yang gzugs la sogs pa med la stong pa nyid las gzhan na yang gzugs la sogs pa med pas go rims bzhin du stong pa nyid dang gzugs la sogs pa la sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa'i mtha' las grol ba nyid
analyzed: gang gi phyir stong pa nyid la yang gzugs la sogs pa med la stong pa nyid las gzhan na yang gzugs la sogs pa med pas go rims bzhin du stong pa nyid dang gzugs la sogs pa la sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa'i mtha' las grol ba nyid
translated: Thus, emptiness and form, etc. are free from the extremes of superimposition and denial, respectively.

original: gang yin pa de ni zab mo ste /
analyzed: gang yin pa de ni zab mo ste /
translated: That is the profound.

original: de nyid ni stong pa nyid la sogs pas de'i phyir zab mo nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir bsgom pa'i lam zab pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ni stong pa nyid la sogs pas de'i phyir zab mo nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir bsgom pa'i lam zab pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the path of meditative development is profound because it is endowed with profundity.

original: de'i 'og tu khyad par gyi gzhi bsgom pa'i lam dngos gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu khyad par gyi gzhi bsgom pa'i lam dngos gsungs pa /
translated: After that, he states the basis of the distinction, the actual path of meditative development:üîΩThe path of meditative development is the repeated

original: nges 'byed yan lag dang mthong ba'i //üîΩlam dang bsgom pa'i lam nyid la //
analyzed: nges 'byed yan lag dang mthong ba'i // lam dang bsgom pa'i lam nyid la //
translated: contemplation, evaluation, and ascertainmentüîΩof the factors conducive to penetration,

original: yang dang yang du sems pa dang // 'jal dang nges rtog bsgom pa'i lam //
analyzed: yang dang yang du sems pa dang // 'jal dang nges rtog bsgom pa'i lam //
translated: the path of insight, and the path of meditative development.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus it is.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi sbyor ba dang / dngos dang / rjes las byung ba'i shes rab kyis go rims bzhin du nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag dang / mthong ba'i lam dang / bsgom pa'i lam nyid kyi don la yang dang yang du sems pa dang /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi sbyor ba dang / dngos dang / rjes las byung ba'i shes rab kyis go rims bzhin du nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag dang / mthong ba'i lam dang / bsgom pa'i lam nyid kyi don la yang dang yang du sems pa dang /
translated: Wisdom that arises from the application, actual practice, and conclusion of meditative concentration, respectively, is the repeated reflection on the meaning of the factors conducive to insight, the path of seeing, and the path of cultivation.

original: tshul ji lta ba bzhin du 'jal ba dang / yang dag par nges par rtog pa ni bsgom pa'i lam rgyun chags pa yin no //
analyzed: tshul ji lta ba bzhin du 'jal ba dang / yang dag par nges par rtog pa ni bsgom pa'i lam rgyun chags pa yin no //
translated: The correct evaluation and correct ascertainment of the meaning of the path of cultivation is the continuous path of cultivation.

original: de la rnam pa du zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la rnam pa du zhig yin zhe na /
translated: How many aspects does it have?

original: de'i rab tu dbye ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i rab tu dbye ba gsungs pa /
translated: Its divisions are stated:

original: de ni rgyun chags yin pa'i phyir //üîΩchung dang 'bring dang chen po rnams //
analyzed: de ni rgyun chags yin pa'i phyir // chung dang 'bring dang chen po rnams //
translated: It is continuous,üîΩsmall, medium, and great,

original: chung ngu'i chung sogs dbye ba yi //üîΩrnam pas rnam pa dgur bzhed do //
analyzed: chung ngu'i chung sogs dbye ba yi // rnam pas rnam pa dgur bzhed do //
translated: divided into small of the small, and so on,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: it is accepted as having nine aspects.

original: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyon mongs pa ni rnam par rtog pa'o zhes 'byung bas rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen po bsgom pa'i lam de ni don dam pa stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi rnam par dbye ba dgu rgyun chags su 'byung ba'i
analyzed: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyon mongs pa ni rnam par rtog pa'o zhes 'byung bas rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen po bsgom pa'i lam de ni don dam pa stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi rnam par dbye ba dgu rgyun chags su 'byung ba'i
translated: Because it is said that afflictions are conceptual thoughts, the path of meditation that is the antidote to conceptual thoughts is the ninefold classification that has the nature of ultimate emptiness.

original: phyir te / 'di ltar 'dod pa'i khams dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi ste sa dgu dag tu go rims ltar rnam par rtog pa chen po dang 'bring dang chung ngu rnam pa re re zhing chen po dang 'bring dang chung ngu'i bye brag gis tha dad pa rnam pa dgu yin pa'i phyir
analyzed: phyir te / 'di ltar 'dod pa'i khams dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi ste sa dgu dag tu go rims ltar rnam par rtog pa chen po dang 'bring dang chung ngu rnam pa re re zhing chen po dang 'bring dang chung ngu'i bye brag gis tha dad pa rnam pa dgu yin pa'i phyir
translated: Because there are nine levels, the desire realm, the four absorptions and the four formless states, there are nine types of conceptual thought, since each level has great, medium and small conceptual thoughts and each of those is differentiated by great, medium and small.

original: de dag gi gnyen po ni mun pa shin tu chen po snang ba chung ngus sel ba dang / chung ngu ni chen pos sel to zhes bya ba'i bye brag chung ngu dang / 'bring dang chen po rnams kyang re re zhing @53a * //
analyzed: de dag gi gnyen po ni mun pa shin tu chen po snang ba chung ngus sel ba dang / chung ngu ni chen pos sel to zhes bya ba'i bye brag chung ngu dang / 'bring dang chen po rnams kyang re re zhing @53a * //
translated: Their antidotes are the small, medium, and great, since a small light dispels a very great darkness, and a great one dispels a small one.üîΩSince each of those is differentiated as small, medium, and great, there are nine types.

original: chung ngu dang / 'bring dang chen po'i bye brag gis tha dad pa dgu yin pa de'i phyir bsgom pa'i lam rab tu dbye bas rnam pa dgu yin par bzhed do //
analyzed: chung ngu dang / 'bring dang chen po'i bye brag gis tha dad pa dgu yin pa de'i phyir bsgom pa'i lam rab tu dbye bas rnam pa dgu yin par bzhed do //
translated: Therefore, the path of meditation is asserted to be differentiated into nine types.

original: gal te stong pa nyid kyi spyod yul can la bsod nams la sogs pa'i khyad par ji ltar rung zhes dogs pa bsu ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: gal te stong pa nyid kyi spyod yul can la bsod nams la sogs pa'i khyad par ji ltar rung zhes dogs pa bsu ba gsungs pa /
translated: If one wonders, ‚ÄúHow can the distinction of merit and so on be suitable for those who have the domain of emptiness?‚ÄùüîΩThe response is stated:

original: grangs med la sogs bstan pa rnams //üîΩdam pa'i don du bzod ma yin //
analyzed: grangs med la sogs bstan pa rnams // dam pa'i don du bzod ma yin //
translated: The teachings on countless and so on

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: are not accepted in the ultimate sense.

original: rgyal ba'i yum de dang de las bsgom pa'i lam rnam pa re re'i dbang du mdzad de /
analyzed: rgyal ba'i yum de dang de las bsgom pa'i lam rnam pa re re'i dbang du mdzad de /
translated: In this way, in the Mother of the Victor, the path of meditation is taught from the perspective of each of the aspects.

original: bsod nams grangs med pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / tshad med pa skye bar gsungs pa don dam pa'i mtshan nyid don dang yi ge dang tha snyad du bya ba med pa la ji ltar de dag rnam par gzhag pa bzod pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: bsod nams grangs med pa dang / gzhal du med pa dang / tshad med pa skye bar gsungs pa don dam pa'i mtshan nyid don dang yi ge dang tha snyad du bya ba med pa la ji ltar de dag rnam par gzhag pa bzod pa yin zhe na /
translated: How can one accept the presentation of the production of merit as immeasurable, incalculable, and limitless, in the ultimate which has no characteristic, no meaning, no letter, and no verbal expression?

original: de'i lan gsungs pa /üîΩkun rdzob tu ni thugs brtse ba'i //
analyzed: de'i lan gsungs pa / kun rdzob tu ni thugs brtse ba'i //
translated: The answer to that is stated:

original: rgyu mthun bstan par thub pa bzhed //
analyzed: rgyu mthun bstan par thub pa bzhed //
translated: The Muni accepts the teaching of the concordant cause

original: ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o //
translated: in the conventional.

original: bden te / ji skad bstan pa de dag ni don dam pa nyid kyi dbang du byas pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bden te / ji skad bstan pa de dag ni don dam pa nyid kyi dbang du byas pa ma yin gyi /
translated: That is correct, but those teachings are not from the point of view of the ultimate.

original: kun rdzob tu dmigs pa med pa'i thugs rje chen po'i rang bzhin chos kyi dbyings kyi rgyu mthun pa'i dbang gis byis pa'i skye bo rnams la 'bras bu chen po rab tu skye bar bstan par de bzhin gshegs pa bzhed pa yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu dmigs pa med pa'i thugs rje chen po'i rang bzhin chos kyi dbyings kyi rgyu mthun pa'i dbang gis byis pa'i skye bo rnams la 'bras bu chen po rab tu skye bar bstan par de bzhin gshegs pa bzhed pa yin no //
translated: The Tathagata accepts the teaching of the great result that is produced in childish beings by the power of the concordant cause of the Dharma Sphere, which has the nature of great compassion that is not an object in the conventional.

original: yang stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyis goms pa phul du byar ci yod ces dogs pa bsu ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyis goms pa phul du byar ci yod ces dogs pa bsu ba gsungs pa /
translated: Again, it is said that the qualm, ‚ÄúWhat is the point of cultivating the emptiness of emptiness to the point of excess?‚ÄùüîΩis anticipated:

original: dngos po brjod du med pa la //
analyzed: dngos po brjod du med pa la //
translated: In the inexpressible reality

original: nyams pa dang mi 'phel mi rung //
analyzed: nyams pa dang mi 'phel mi rung //
translated: there is no loss and no increase.

original: bsgom zhes bya ba'i lam gyis ni //
analyzed: bsgom zhes bya ba'i lam gyis ni //
translated: By the path called ‚Äúcultivation‚Äù

original: ci zhig nyams shing ci zhig 'thob //üîΩces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci zhig nyams shing ci zhig 'thob // ces bya ba'o //
translated: what is lost and what is gained?

original: gang gi phyir chos nyid kyi lam gyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis yang dag par na de nyid dang gzhan nyid dang gnyis ka dang gnyis ka ma yin pa nyid du brjod du med pa la ni mi mthun pa dang gnyen po'i phyogs dang bral ba
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos nyid kyi lam gyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis yang dag par na de nyid dang gzhan nyid dang gnyis ka dang gnyis ka ma yin pa nyid du brjod du med pa la ni mi mthun pa dang gnyen po'i phyogs dang bral ba
translated: Because the reality of the path is essenceless, it is in reality inexpressible as sameness, difference, both, or neither.

original: dang skye bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: dang skye bar mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not tenable that it is lost or gained.

original: de'i phyir brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid can bsgom pa zhes bya ba'i lam gyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi ngo bo ni ci zhig 'dor la rnam par byang ba'i ngo bo ci zhig 'thob ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir brjod du med pa'i mtshan nyid can bsgom pa zhes bya ba'i lam gyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi ngo bo ni ci zhig 'dor la rnam par byang ba'i ngo bo ci zhig 'thob ste /
translated: Therefore, by the path called ‚Äúcultivation‚Äù which has the character of being inexpressible, what is lost is the reality of the side of the afflictions and what is gained is the reality of purification.

original: cung zad kyang mi byed pa kho nas bsgom pa phul du phyin pa byar med do zhe na /
analyzed: cung zad kyang mi byed pa kho nas bsgom pa phul du phyin pa byar med do zhe na /
translated: If you say that there is no meditation at all, then there is nothing to be done to perfect meditation.

original: de'i lan gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i lan gsungs pa /
translated: The reply to that is stated:

original: byang chub ji lta de bzhin du //
analyzed: byang chub ji lta de bzhin du //
translated: Just as enlightenment,

original: @53b 'di ni 'dod pa'i don sgrub byed //
analyzed: @53b 'di ni 'dod pa'i don sgrub byed //
translated: this is what accomplishes the desired aim.

original: byang chub de bzhin nyid mtshan nyid //üîΩde yang de yi mtshan nyid bzhed //
analyzed: byang chub de bzhin nyid mtshan nyid // de yang de yi mtshan nyid bzhed //
translated: Enlightenment is characterized by suchness.

original: ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o //
translated: That is also asserted to be its characteristic.

original: ji ltar de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid can bla na med pa'i byang chub gang gis kyang khyad par du byar med pa ni sngon don khyad par can snang ba'i sems bskyed pa'i sgo nas chos kyi sku la sogs pa'i bdag po tsam gyis gdul bar bya ba
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid can bla na med pa'i byang chub gang gis kyang khyad par du byar med pa ni sngon don khyad par can snang ba'i sems bskyed pa'i sgo nas chos kyi sku la sogs pa'i bdag po tsam gyis gdul bar bya ba
translated: Just as enlightenment, which is characterized by suchness, cannot be distinguished by anything at all, previously, through generating the mind that appears as the special object, the dharmakƒÅya and so on are to be tamed by being mere lords.

original: rnams kyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi rjes su mthun par mngon par 'dod pa'i don sgrub par byed pa de bzhin du de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyis lam 'di yang bsgoms pas glo bur gyi dri ma dang bral ba'i sgo nas kun rdzob tu mi mthun
analyzed: rnams kyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi rjes su mthun par mngon par 'dod pa'i don sgrub par byed pa de bzhin du de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyis lam 'di yang bsgoms pas glo bur gyi dri ma dang bral ba'i sgo nas kun rdzob tu mi mthun
translated: Just as the wish-fulfilling jewel grants the desired objects in accordance with the merit and wisdom of beings, in the same way, this path, which is characterized by suchness, grants the desired objects by removing the temporary stains through meditation.üîΩ

original: pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po nyams pa dang 'phel ba'i don du sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po nyams pa dang 'phel ba'i don du sgrub par byed de /
translated: Just as the moon, in accordance with the merit and wisdom of all beings, accomplishes the desired aims, in the same way, this path, through the characteristic of thusness, through meditation, accomplishes the elimination of the discordant side and the increase of the antidote, in terms of the elimination of the temporary defilements, conventionally.

original: don dam par ni nyams pa dang 'phel ba dgag pa nyid du bzhed do //
analyzed: don dam par ni nyams pa dang 'phel ba dgag pa nyid du bzhed do //
translated: Ultimately, it is asserted that the elimination and increase of the defilements and the antidotes are negated.

original: byang chub nyid la rgyu'i don sgrub pa mi 'thad par dogs pa bsu ba /
analyzed: byang chub nyid la rgyu'i don sgrub pa mi 'thad par dogs pa bsu ba /
translated: The objection that it is untenable to establish the meaning of cause in enlightenment itselfüîΩis anticipated:

original: sems ni snga mas byang chub par //
analyzed: sems ni snga mas byang chub par //
translated: Enlightenment is not due to a previous mind,

original: rigs min phyi mas kyang ma yin //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rigs min phyi mas kyang ma yin // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: nor is it due to a later one.üîΩWhat is meant is that it is not due to any mind.

original: ci sems khyad par can bskyed pa'i sgo nas mngon par byang chub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba sems bskyed pa snga mas ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ci sems khyad par can bskyed pa'i sgo nas mngon par byang chub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba sems bskyed pa snga mas ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Is it the case that one becomes fully enlightened through the generation of a special mind? It is not due to a previous mind that generates enlightenment,

original: de 'dra'i 'bras bur byed pa yongs su rdzogs pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'dra'i 'bras bur byed pa yongs su rdzogs pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable that the effect is fully completed by the action.

original: phyi mas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: phyi mas kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the latter,

original: de'i mthu thams cad ni snga ma'i mthar thug pas de med na mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i mthu thams cad ni snga ma'i mthar thug pas de med na mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all its power is exhausted in the former, and it is impossible without it.

original: de bzhin du snga phyir gyur ba mang po nyid kyang de byung ma thag tu 'jig pa rjes su 'gro ba med pa nyid kyis phan tshun 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du snga phyir gyur ba mang po nyid kyang de byung ma thag tu 'jig pa rjes su 'gro ba med pa nyid kyis phan tshun 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ma yin no zhe na /
translated: In the same way, the many earlier and later moments are not related to each other because the one that has just arisen is destroyed and does not continue.

original: de'i lan gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i lan gsungs pa /
translated: The answer to that is stated:

original: mar me'i dpe yi tshul gyis ni ;
analyzed: mar me'i dpe yi tshul gyis ni ;
translated: By the method of the example of the lamp,

original: / zab mo'i chos nyid rnam pa brgyad //üîΩces bya ba'o //üîΩji ltar mar me'i me lce 'bar ba ni skad cig ma gnyis pa la ma ltos pa dang pos snying po sreg par mi nus la /
analyzed: / zab mo'i chos nyid rnam pa brgyad // ces bya ba'o // ji ltar mar me'i me lce 'bar ba ni skad cig ma gnyis pa la ma ltos pa dang pos snying po sreg par mi nus la /
translated: The profound reality is eightfold.üîΩJust as the flame of a blazing lamp cannot burn the wick without depending on the second moment,

original: dang po nyid la ma ltos par gnyis pas kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: dang po nyid la ma ltos par gnyis pas kyang ma yin no //
translated: and the second moment cannot do so without depending on the first moment.

original: de bzhin du 'brel pa med pa'i snga ma dang phyi ma mang po nyid kyis kyang bsreg bar bya ba sreg par byed pa yong ba ma yin mod /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'brel pa med pa'i snga ma dang phyi ma mang po nyid kyis kyang bsreg bar bya ba sreg par byed pa yong ba ma yin mod /
