translated: So too, many prior and subsequent moments that are not related to each other do not cause the burning of what is to be burned.üîΩHowever, by the mere conditionality of dependent origination, the first moment and so on generate a special cause that burns the second moment and so on.üîΩIn that way, just as the essence of the fire causes the burning of the essence of the fuel, the first moment and so on generate a special cause that burns the second moment and so on.

original: 'on kyang rkyen nyid 'di pa tsam gyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos nyid kyis skad cig ma dang po la sogs pas gnyis pa la sogs pa sreg par byed pa la sogs pa'i rgyu'i ngo bos khyad par yongs su skyed pa'i sgo nas @54a * //üîΩsnying po tshig par byed pa bzhin du don khyad par can du snang ba'i mtshan nyid kyis sems bskyed pa yang snga ma dang phyi ma'i skad cig so so ba dang / du ma mngon par 'brel pa las ni ma yin mod /
analyzed: 'on kyang rkyen nyid 'di pa tsam gyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos nyid kyis skad cig ma dang po la sogs pas gnyis pa la sogs pa sreg par byed pa la sogs pa'i rgyu'i ngo bos khyad par yongs su skyed pa'i sgo nas @54a * //üîΩsnying po tshig par byed pa bzhin du don khyad par can du snang ba'i mtshan nyid kyis sems bskyed pa yang snga ma dang phyi ma'i skad cig so so ba dang / du ma mngon par 'brel pa las ni ma yin mod /
translated: In that way, just as the essence of the fire causes the burning of the essence of the fuel, the first moment and so on generate a special cause that burns the second moment and so on.üîΩIn that way, just as the essence of the fire causes the burning of the essence of the fuel, the first moment and so on generate a special cause that burns the second moment and so on.üîΩIn that way, just as the essence of the fire causes the burning of the essence of the fuel, the first moment and so on generate a special cause that burns the second moment and so on.üîΩIn that way, just as the essence of the fire causes the burning of the essence of the fuel, the first moment and so on generate a special cause that burns the second moment and so on.üîΩIn that way, just as the essence of the fire causes the burning of the essence of the fuel, the first moment and so on generate a special cause that burns the second moment and so on.

original: 'on kyang rgyun 'brel pa nyid kyi bdag nyid mthu phul du phyin par 'gyur bas spang bar bya ba dang cig shos kyi chos gsal ba dang yongs su rdzogs pa'i sgo nas byang chub par 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rgyun 'brel pa nyid kyi bdag nyid mthu phul du phyin par 'gyur bas spang bar bya ba dang cig shos kyi chos gsal ba dang yongs su rdzogs pa'i sgo nas byang chub par 'thad pa yin no //
translated: However, since the nature of the continuum is the most powerful, it is tenable that the object of elimination is eliminated and the other phenomenon is purified by way of being clarified and perfected.

original: don bsdu ba ni de'i phyir rnam par brtags na skyed par byed pa la sogs pa mi dmigs pa yang ma dpyad par nyams dga' ba nyid kyi ngor skye ba la sogs pa rung ba zab mo'i chos nyid rnam pa brgyad yin no //
analyzed: don bsdu ba ni de'i phyir rnam par brtags na skyed par byed pa la sogs pa mi dmigs pa yang ma dpyad par nyams dga' ba nyid kyi ngor skye ba la sogs pa rung ba zab mo'i chos nyid rnam pa brgyad yin no //
translated: The summary is this: Therefore, when analyzed, production and so forth are not observed in the creator and so forth. However, when not analyzed, production and so forth are suitable in the perspective of what is delightful for the world. The eight aspects of the profound nature of phenomena are as follows.

original: zab mo rnam pa brgyad gang dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: zab mo rnam pa brgyad gang dag yin zhe na /
translated: What are the eight aspects of the profound?

original: skye ba la sogs pa yul brgyad la zab pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa yul brgyad la zab pa gsungs pa /
translated: The eight objects of production and so forth are said to be profound.üîΩProduction and cessation,üîΩsuchness, the knower,üîΩknowing, conduct, nonduality,

original: skye ba dang ni 'gag pa dang // de bzhin nyid dang shes bya dang // shes dang spyod dang gnyis med dang // thabs mkhas pa la zab pa nyid //üîΩces bya ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang ni 'gag pa dang // de bzhin nyid dang shes bya dang // shes dang spyod dang gnyis med dang // thabs mkhas pa la zab pa nyid //üîΩces bya ba'o //
translated: and skill in means are profound.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i tshul gyis skad cig ma snga ma dang phyi ma dag gis kyang ma yin zhing //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i tshul gyis skad cig ma snga ma dang phyi ma dag gis kyang ma yin zhing //
translated: As just explained, it is not by the former and latter moments,

original: ngo bo nyid med pas kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pas kyang ma yin la /
translated: and it is not by the absence of intrinsic reality.üîΩHowever, it generates the special object of realization that is cultivated.

original: 'on kyang bsgoms pas rtogs pa'i don khyad par du 'phags pa skyed do zhes rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i skye ba zab pa dang / dngos po thams cad byung ba nyid nas rang bzhin gyis ngo bo nyid med la 'gag go zhes bya ba 'gag pa zab pa dang /
analyzed: 'on kyang bsgoms pas rtogs pa'i don khyad par du 'phags pa skyed do zhes rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i skye ba zab pa dang / dngos po thams cad byung ba nyid nas rang bzhin gyis ngo bo nyid med la 'gag go zhes bya ba 'gag pa zab pa dang /
translated: Thus, the profound dependent origination of arising, the profound cessation of all things, which are essentially natureless from the very moment they occur,üîΩthe profound suchness that is not actualized even though it is cultivated in all situations,

original: gnas skabs thams cad du goms kyang mngon du mi byed do zhes bya ba de bzhin nyid zab pa dang / de kho na'i rang bzhin shes par bya ba'i chos thams cad sbyin pa la sogs pa rnam pa du ma rjes su sgrub po zhes bya ba shes bya zab pa dang /
analyzed: gnas skabs thams cad du goms kyang mngon du mi byed do zhes bya ba de bzhin nyid zab pa dang / de kho na'i rang bzhin shes par bya ba'i chos thams cad sbyin pa la sogs pa rnam pa du ma rjes su sgrub po zhes bya ba shes bya zab pa dang /
translated: and the profound object of knowledge, which is the accomplishment of the many aspects of generosity and so on, the phenomena that are to be known as the nature of thatness.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis mthong ba med pa nyid mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis mthong ba med pa nyid mthong ba yin no //
translated: Seeing the nonseeing of suchness is seeing.

original: zhes bya ba shes pa zab pa dang / don dam par spyod pa med pa nyid spyod pa yin no zhes bya ba spyod pa zab pa dang / chos thams cad gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo nyid du sgrub po zhes bya ba gnyis su med pa zab pa dang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba shes pa zab pa dang / don dam par spyod pa med pa nyid spyod pa yin no zhes bya ba spyod pa zab pa dang / chos thams cad gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo nyid du sgrub po zhes bya ba gnyis su med pa zab pa dang /
translated: The profound knowledge is the knowledge of the three times. The profound practice is ultimately, there is no practice, but it is practice. The profound nonduality is all phenomena are established as the nondual nature.

original: rnam par thar pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin mi spong bas sems can yongs su smin par byed cing tshogs thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa de'i 'bras bu sangs @54b rgyas nyid 'thob par byar med pa zhes bya ba thabs la mkhas pa zab pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin mi spong bas sems can yongs su smin par byed cing tshogs thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa de'i 'bras bu sangs @54b rgyas nyid 'thob par byar med pa zhes bya ba thabs la mkhas pa zab pa ste /
translated: The profound skill in means is without abandoning the concentrations of liberation and so on, one ripens sentient beings and attains the result of buddhahood, the perfection of all accumulations.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rnam par thar pa thob pa'i sgo nas phan tshun 'gal ba'i don bsgrub pa lta bur rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir zab pa rnam pa brgyad yin no //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rnam par thar pa thob pa'i sgo nas phan tshun 'gal ba'i don bsgrub pa lta bur rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir zab pa rnam pa brgyad yin no //
translated: Because it is difficult to realize that the profound is like the accomplishment of mutually contradictory objects through attaining inconceivable liberation, there are eight profundities.

original: slob pa phyir mi ldog pa'i chos thob pas 'bras bu sangs rgyas nyid thob par bya dgos pas de'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: slob pa phyir mi ldog pa'i chos thob pas 'bras bu sangs rgyas nyid thob par bya dgos pas de'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mnyam pa nyid gsungs pa /
translated: Since one who is a learner has attained the Dharma of irreversibility, one must attain the result, buddhahood itself. Therefore, the uncommon cause is the equality of samsara and nirvana.

original: chos rnams rmi lam 'dra ba'i phyir //
analyzed: chos rnams rmi lam 'dra ba'i phyir //
translated: Since phenomena are like dreams,

original: srid dang zhi bar mi rtog pa //üîΩlas med la sogs klan ka yi //üîΩlan ni ji skad bshad par zad //
analyzed: srid dang zhi bar mi rtog pa // las med la sogs klan ka yi // lan ni ji skad bshad par zad //
translated: samsara and nirvana are not imagined.üîΩThe response to the objection

original: ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o //
translated: that there is no karma and so on has already been explained.

original: mi mthun pa dang gnyen po'i chos thams cad snang brnyan tsam du bsgoms pa'i phyir 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa ni rmi lam dang 'dra ba nyid du rtogs te /
analyzed: mi mthun pa dang gnyen po'i chos thams cad snang brnyan tsam du bsgoms pa'i phyir 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa ni rmi lam dang 'dra ba nyid du rtogs te /
translated: Since all phenomena, whether discordant or antidotal, are meditated on as mere reflections, samsara and nirvana are realized to be like a dream.

original: de'i phyir de gnyis tha dad pa nyid du rnam par mi rtog pas mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de gnyis tha dad pa nyid du rnam par mi rtog pas mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, since they are not imagined to be different, they are equality.

original: gal te rmi lam dang 'dra ba nyid yin na gnyid ma log pa'i gnas skabs na yang mi dge ba dang sbyin pa la sogs pa'i las med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa klan ka rnams kyi lan ni ji ltar phyi rol gyi don du
analyzed: gal te rmi lam dang 'dra ba nyid yin na gnyid ma log pa'i gnas skabs na yang mi dge ba dang sbyin pa la sogs pa'i las med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa klan ka rnams kyi lan ni ji ltar phyi rol gyi don du
translated: If it is just like a dream, then even when one is not asleep, there would be no nonvirtue or virtue such as generosity.üîΩThe response to such objections is as follows.üîΩIn the system of those who propound external objects, although ultimately there is no killing and so on, the continuum of life is interrupted and things that are discordant with life are generated.

original: smra ba'i lugs la don dam par gang gis gang bsad pa la sogs pa med kyang srog gi rgyun 'jug pa dang 'gal ba'i dngos po bskyed pa la gsod pa la sogs par rtogs pa'i sgo nas srog gcod pa la sogs par rnam par 'jog pa de bzhin
analyzed: smra ba'i lugs la don dam par gang gis gang bsad pa la sogs pa med kyang srog gi rgyun 'jug pa dang 'gal ba'i dngos po bskyed pa la gsod pa la sogs par rtogs pa'i sgo nas srog gcod pa la sogs par rnam par 'jog pa de bzhin
translated: In this way, killing and so on are posited from the perspective of the cognition that conceives of killing and so on.

original: du / dngos po rmi lam dang 'dra ba la yang phyi ci log gi 'ching ba mtha' dag ma nyams pa rnams la de dang mthun pa'i don gyi dngos po la sogs par rtog pa'i mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / gzhan yang rmi lam na dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rnam pa spyad pa nyid kyang rjes su gnas skabs kyi sems kyis mngon par zhen pa'i gsos btab na don ci 'dra ba nyid kyi 'bras bur yang 'gyur bas dpe ma grub pa yin no zhes mdo sde
analyzed: du / dngos po rmi lam dang 'dra ba la yang phyi ci log gi 'ching ba mtha' dag ma nyams pa rnams la de dang mthun pa'i don gyi dngos po la sogs par rtog pa'i mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / gzhan yang rmi lam na dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rnam pa spyad pa nyid kyang rjes su gnas skabs kyi sems kyis mngon par zhen pa'i gsos btab na don ci 'dra ba nyid kyi 'bras bur yang 'gyur bas dpe ma grub pa yin no zhes mdo sde
translated: Also, when the aspects of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions in dreams are nourished by the mind of the subsequent period, they become the results of actions that are just like their objects. Therefore, the example is not established.

original: dang de'i phyogs las ji skad bshad par zad do //
analyzed: dang de'i phyogs las ji skad bshad par zad do //
translated: This is explained in the sutras and in the treatises of the same name.

original: de ltar mnyam pa nyid rnam par bsgoms pa ni rang gi zhing du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur bas sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar mnyam pa nyid rnam par bsgoms pa ni rang gi zhing du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur bas sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, since one who has meditated on equality will attain manifest, perfect buddhahood in one‚Äôs own buddha realm, the complete purity of the buddha realm is taught.

original: sems can 'jig rten de bzhin du //
analyzed: sems can 'jig rten de bzhin du //
translated: Sentient beings and the world are like that.

original: snod @55a * //
analyzed: snod @55a * //
translated: The vessel is like that.

original: kyi 'jig rten ma dag pa //
analyzed: kyi 'jig rten ma dag pa //
translated: The world of sentient beings and the world of their habitat are impure.

original: de la dag par bsgrubs pa yis //
analyzed: de la dag par bsgrubs pa yis //
translated: By purifying them,

original: sangs rgyas zhing ni dag pa nyid //üîΩces bya ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhing ni dag pa nyid // ces bya ba'o //
translated: the Buddha-land is purified.üîΩThe Buddha-land is twofold, as habitat and as inhabitants, in accordance with the distinction between the world of sentient beings and the world of their habitat.

original: sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten gyi bye brag gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing rten pa dang rten rnam pa gnyis la go rims bzhin du bkres pa dang skom pa la sogs pa nyid kyis ma dag pa'i gnyen por bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa gya
analyzed: sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten gyi bye brag gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing rten pa dang rten rnam pa gnyis la go rims bzhin du bkres pa dang skom pa la sogs pa nyid kyis ma dag pa'i gnyen por bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa gya
translated: In order, one should give food and drink, etc. as the antidote to the impurity of hunger and thirst, etc. of the inhabitants, the sentient beings.üîΩOne should give palaces, etc. as the antidote to the impurity of ravines, precipices, etc. of the habitat, the world.

original: nom pa byin te lha'i nye bar spyad pa la sogs pa smon lam gyis rjes su sgrub pa dang / ngam grog dang g-yang sa la sogs pas ma dag pa'i gnyen por khang bzangs la sogs pa byin pas gser gyi sa phyogs la sogs par mngon par sgrub par smon lam gyis rjes su mthun par byed pa ste /
analyzed: nom pa byin te lha'i nye bar spyad pa la sogs pa smon lam gyis rjes su sgrub pa dang / ngam grog dang g-yang sa la sogs pas ma dag pa'i gnyen por khang bzangs la sogs pa byin pas gser gyi sa phyogs la sogs par mngon par sgrub par smon lam gyis rjes su mthun par byed pa ste /
translated: One should make a vow to accomplish the Buddha-land, the golden ground, etc.

original: de ltar sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag pa yongs su sbyong ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag pa yongs su sbyong ba'o //
translated: Thus, the purification of the Buddha-land is perfected.

original: rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par ni skal ba ji lta ba bzhin sangs rgyas kyi phrin las rjes su bsgrub par bya dgos pas de'i rgyur thabs la mkhas pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par ni skal ba ji lta ba bzhin sangs rgyas kyi phrin las rjes su bsgrub par bya dgos pas de'i rgyur thabs la mkhas pa gsungs pa /
translated: The ten kinds of skill in means are taught as the causes for that.

original: yul dang sbyor ba can 'di ni //
analyzed: yul dang sbyor ba can 'di ni //
translated: This is the one who is endowed with the application to the object,üîΩwho has gone beyond the enemies,

original: dgra rnams las ni 'das pa dang // mi gnas ji bzhin shugs dang ni //
analyzed: dgra rnams las ni 'das pa dang // mi gnas ji bzhin shugs dang ni //
translated: who does not abide, who is just so, who has power,üîΩwho has the uncommon characteristics,üîΩwho is without attachment, who is non-apprehending,üîΩwho has exhausted signs and vows,

original: thun mong ma yin mtshan nyid dang // ma chags pa dang mi dmigs dang// mtshan ma smon lam zad pa dang // de yi rtags dang mtshan med dang // thabs la mkhas pa rnam pa bcu //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin mtshan nyid dang // ma chags pa dang mi dmigs dang// mtshan ma smon lam zad pa dang // de yi rtags dang mtshan med dang // thabs la mkhas pa rnam pa bcu //
translated: who has the signs of that, who is signless,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and who is skilled in means.üîΩThe one who is endowed with the application to the object is the one who has trained well in the cause for completely transcending the phenomena of obstacles.

original: bar chad kyi chos las yang dag par 'da' ba'i rgyu la legs par sbyangs pas lha la sogs pa'i bdud las 'das pa dang / chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid rnam par bsgoms pas stong pa nyid rtogs kyang mngon sum du mi byed pas mi gnas pa dang /
analyzed: bar chad kyi chos las yang dag par 'da' ba'i rgyu la legs par sbyangs pas lha la sogs pa'i bdud las 'das pa dang / chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid rnam par bsgoms pas stong pa nyid rtogs kyang mngon sum du mi byed pas mi gnas pa dang /
translated: The one who has gone beyond the demons of gods and so forth, who has meditated on the sameness of all phenomena, who realizes emptiness but does not actualize it, is the one who does not abide.

original: smon lam grub pa nyid kyis gzhan gyi don thams cad sngon gyi shugs kyis 'phangs pa byed pa dang / dka' ba spyad pa thams cad shin tu goms pa nyid kyis rnam par thar pa la sogs pa sgom pa thun mong ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: smon lam grub pa nyid kyis gzhan gyi don thams cad sngon gyi shugs kyis 'phangs pa byed pa dang / dka' ba spyad pa thams cad shin tu goms pa nyid kyis rnam par thar pa la sogs pa sgom pa thun mong ma yin pa dang /
translated: All benefit for others is accomplished by the power of previous aspirations and all hardships are endured by being extremely familiar with the practice.

original: chos dkar po rnam par dag pas rnam par thar pa la sogs pa la 'jug kyang mya ngan las 'das pa la ma chags pa dang / sems can rnams kyi dmigs pa'i 'du shes spang ba'i don du rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid kyis mi @55b dmigs pa dang /
analyzed: chos dkar po rnam par dag pas rnam par thar pa la sogs pa la 'jug kyang mya ngan las 'das pa la ma chags pa dang / sems can rnams kyi dmigs pa'i 'du shes spang ba'i don du rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid kyis mi @55b dmigs pa dang /
translated: They enter into the doors of liberation such as emptiness without attachment to nirvana and without the perception of apprehending sentient beings as objects.

original: sems can rnams kyi mtshan ma'i 'du shes spang ba'i don du rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pa nyid kyis mtshan ma med pa dang / sems can rnams kyi smon pa'i 'du shes spang ba'i don du rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pa nyid kyis smon pa med pa dang /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi mtshan ma'i 'du shes spang ba'i don du rnam par thar pa'i sgo mtshan ma med pa nyid kyis mtshan ma med pa dang / sems can rnams kyi smon pa'i 'du shes spang ba'i don du rnam par thar pa'i sgo smon pa med pa nyid kyis smon pa med pa dang /
translated: The absence of wishes is due to the absence of wishes through the door of liberation of wishlessness for the sake of eliminating the conception of wishes of sentient beings.üîΩThe signs of irreversibility are due to the expression of the irreversible Dharma by way of the questions.

original: dri ba sngon du btang bas phyir mi ldog pa'i chos yang dag par brjod pa nyid kyis phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags dang / yul tshad med pa thams cad shes pa nyid kyis tshad med pa ste /
analyzed: dri ba sngon du btang bas phyir mi ldog pa'i chos yang dag par brjod pa nyid kyis phyir mi ldog pa'i rtags dang / yul tshad med pa thams cad shes pa nyid kyis tshad med pa ste /
translated: The immeasurables are due to the knowledge of all the immeasurable objects.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yul can bcu mngon sum du bya ba la dus dang dus ma yin pa shes pa'i sbyor ba ni thabs la mkhas pa rnam pa bcu yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i yul can bcu mngon sum du bya ba la dus dang dus ma yin pa shes pa'i sbyor ba ni thabs la mkhas pa rnam pa bcu yin no //
translated: The ten skillful means are the application of knowing the right and wrong time for the direct realization of the ten subjects of the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma'i phreng ba zhes bya ba las skabs bzhi pa'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma'i phreng ba zhes bya ba las skabs bzhi pa'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the fourth chapter, the ‚Äúperfection of wisdom,‚Äù from Illuminating the Intent: A Commentary on the Ornament for the Clear Realizations.

original: // / da ni rnam pa thams cad mngon par rtogs pa de nyid rab tu mthar phyin pa'i rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa bshad par bzhed de /
analyzed: // / da ni rnam pa thams cad mngon par rtogs pa de nyid rab tu mthar phyin pa'i rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa bshad par bzhed de /
translated: Now, wishing to explain the peak clear realization that is the culmination of that very clear realization of all aspects,

original: dang por re zhig nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang po dro bar gyur pa'i rtse mo gsungs pa /
analyzed: dang por re zhig nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang po dro bar gyur pa'i rtse mo gsungs pa /
translated: first he teaches the peak of the heat stage of the path of preparation.

original: rmi lam na yang chos rnams kun //
analyzed: rmi lam na yang chos rnams kun //
translated: Even in dreams all phenomena

original: rmi lam lta bur lta la sogs //
analyzed: rmi lam lta bur lta la sogs //
translated: are seen as dreamlike and so forth.üîΩThese are the signs of the peak

original: rtse mor phyin pa'i sbyor ba'i rtags //üîΩrnam pa bcu gnyis dag tu bzhed //
analyzed: rtse mor phyin pa'i sbyor ba'i rtags // rnam pa bcu gnyis dag tu bzhed //
translated: of the stage of joining.

original: ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o //
translated: They are asserted to be of twelve types.

original: shin tu goms pa'i phyir rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na yang chos thams cad rmi lam dang 'dra ba la sogs par lta ba dang / srid pa nyid dang nyan thos la sogs pa la mngon par dga' ba'i sems mi bskyed pa dang / bdag nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam par 'phrul pa dmigs pa dang /
analyzed: shin tu goms pa'i phyir rmi lam gyi gnas skabs na yang chos thams cad rmi lam dang 'dra ba la sogs par lta ba dang / srid pa nyid dang nyan thos la sogs pa la mngon par dga' ba'i sems mi bskyed pa dang / bdag nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam par 'phrul pa dmigs pa dang /
translated: Because of their great familiarity, even in the dream state, they see all phenomena as being like dreams and so on, they do not give rise to a mind that delights in existence itself or in the sravaka and so on and they observe the Tathagata's miraculous emanations.

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas la sogs pa chos ston pa nye bar mthong ba dang / yang ba la sogs pa rnam pa mang po 'byung bas mi skrag cing sad na chos thams cad rmi lam ltar mos pa dang / dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sems can mthong ba sngon du 'gro bas rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing du ngan song spong ba rjes su dran pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas la sogs pa chos ston pa nye bar mthong ba dang / yang ba la sogs pa rnam pa mang po 'byung bas mi skrag cing sad na chos thams cad rmi lam ltar mos pa dang / dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sems can mthong ba sngon du 'gro bas rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing du ngan song spong ba rjes su dran pa dang /
translated: They do not fear the many things that occur such as seeing the buddhas teaching the dharma and so on and when they awaken they have conviction that all phenomena are like a dream and they recall that they will eliminate the lower rebirths in their own buddha realm, preceded by seeing the beings of the hells and so on.

original: rmi lam mam rmi lam ma yin par grong khyer la sogs pa tshig pa rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i bden pa'i byin gyi rlabs 'grub pa dang / 'byung po la sogs pa mi ma yin pas zin pa la @56a * //
analyzed: rmi lam mam rmi lam ma yin par grong khyer la sogs pa tshig pa rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i bden pa'i byin gyi rlabs 'grub pa dang / 'byung po la sogs pa mi ma yin pas zin pa la @56a * //
translated: The power to pacify the burning of cities and so on, whether in dreams or in reality, through the blessings of truth,üîΩthe power to accomplish the words of truth that liberate from being seized by nonhuman spirits and so on,üîΩthe power to rely on spiritual masters who are superior to oneself through one's own superknowledge, which is different from dreams, and

original: med par byed pa'i bden pa'i tshig rab tu 'grub pa dang / rmi lam las gzhan du rang gi mngon par shes pas pha rol gnon pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'dod pas rnam pa thams cad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa dang /
analyzed: med par byed pa'i bden pa'i tshig rab tu 'grub pa dang / rmi lam las gzhan du rang gi mngon par shes pas pha rol gnon pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'dod pas rnam pa thams cad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob pa dang /
translated: the power to train in the perfection of wisdom in all aspects, wishing to perfect all roots of virtue.

original: shes rab chags pa med pa nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad bden par lta ba dang / gzugs la sogs pa la mi spyod pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la nye bar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab chags pa med pa nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad bden par lta ba dang / gzugs la sogs pa la mi spyod pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la nye bar gyur pa ste /
translated: By means of the very absence of attachment to wisdom, one practices the perfection of wisdom by not engaging in the view of the reality of all phenomena that are afflicted and purified, and by not engaging in form, etc. Thus, one approaches the enlightenment of the buddhas.

original: rnam pa bcu gnyis ni dro bar gyur pa nyid kyi rtse mo mngon par rtogs pa thob pa'i mtshan nyid rtags kyi khyad par yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu gnyis ni dro bar gyur pa nyid kyi rtse mo mngon par rtogs pa thob pa'i mtshan nyid rtags kyi khyad par yin no //
translated: These twelve aspects are the distinctive signs of the attainment of the realization of the peak of the state of heat.üîΩThe increase that arises from the attainment of those signs is called the increase that is the nature of the peak.üîΩThe increase of the peak is taught in the following:üîΩThe increase of the peak is taught in the following:üîΩThe increase of the peak is taught in the following:

original: rtags de dag thob pa las rnam par 'phel ba byung bas rtse mor gyur pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par 'phel ba gsungs pa /üîΩ'dzam bu'i gling gi skye bo snyed //üîΩsangs rgyas mchod pa'i dge la sogs //üîΩdper mdzad nas ni rnam mang du //
analyzed: rtags de dag thob pa las rnam par 'phel ba byung bas rtse mor gyur pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par 'phel ba gsungs pa / 'dzam bu'i gling gi skye bo snyed // sangs rgyas mchod pa'i dge la sogs // dper mdzad nas ni rnam mang du //
translated: The increase of the peak is taught in the following:üîΩThe increase of the peak is taught in the following:

original: rgyal ba'i yum dag las 'dzam bu'i gling la sogs pa stong gsum gyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can ji snyed kyis de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa bas ches lhag pa dang / de bas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid yid la byed pas brtson pa dang /
analyzed: rgyal ba'i yum dag las 'dzam bu'i gling la sogs pa stong gsum gyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can ji snyed kyis de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa bas ches lhag pa dang / de bas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid yid la byed pas brtson pa dang /
translated: In the Mother Perfection of Wisdom sutras, it says that compared to all the sentient beings of the three-thousandfold world systems, such as the Rose Apple Land, who make offerings to the Tathagata, it is far greater to bring to mind this perfection of wisdom itself.

original: chos thams cad 'phel ba dang 'grib pa med pas mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa dang / mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba dang / byed pa'i chos mi dmigs pa dang / de nyid dang ldan pas dge ba bcu la sogs pa spyod pa dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad 'phel ba dang 'grib pa med pas mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa dang / mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba dang / byed pa'i chos mi dmigs pa dang / de nyid dang ldan pas dge ba bcu la sogs pa spyod pa dang /
translated: And it says that by this very perfection of wisdom, one attains the acceptance that phenomena are unborn, because all phenomena are neither increased nor decreased, and one attains manifest, complete enlightenment, because one does not observe phenomena that are to be acted upon or agents that act upon them.

original: de ltar spyod pa la lha'i ris thams cad 'khor du 'ong zhing nye bar bsrung ba dang / bdud thams cad mya ngan gyi zug rngus non par byed pa dang / skye bo rnams la ston pa dang mtshungs par gnas pa zhes bya ba rnam par 'phel ba brgyad dang /
analyzed: de ltar spyod pa la lha'i ris thams cad 'khor du 'ong zhing nye bar bsrung ba dang / bdud thams cad mya ngan gyi zug rngus non par byed pa dang / skye bo rnams la ston pa dang mtshungs par gnas pa zhes bya ba rnam par 'phel ba brgyad dang /
translated: Thus, in this way, there are eight increases: all the classes of gods come to be in the retinue and guard closely, all demons are afflicted with the pain of sorrow, and one abides as if one were a teacher for beings.

original: yang rnam pa thams cad du thabs la mkhas pas bslab pa yongs su dag pa dang / sangs rgyas kho na'i rigs can du nges par 'gyur ba nyid dang / 'bras bu sangs rgyas nyid yang dag par 'thob @56b pa'i rgyu mtshan dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnam pa drug gis mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi sems mi skye ba dang /
analyzed: yang rnam pa thams cad du thabs la mkhas pas bslab pa yongs su dag pa dang / sangs rgyas kho na'i rigs can du nges par 'gyur ba nyid dang / 'bras bu sangs rgyas nyid yang dag par 'thob @56b pa'i rgyu mtshan dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnam pa drug gis mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi sems mi skye ba dang /
translated: Moreover, there are four special qualities: the training becomes completely pure through skill in means in all aspects, one definitely becomes a being of the lineage of only a buddha, the cause for perfectly attaining the result of buddhahood, and the mind that is discordant with the six perfections does not arise.

original: gzugs la sogs pa dang ldan par rtogs pa'i sems mi skye ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa kun bsdus pa rab tu shes pa dang / theg pa thams cad phun sum tshogs pa thob pa dang / phun sum tshogs pa nyid dang yul dang byed pa la sogs pa mi dmigs par spyod pa zhes bya ba rnam par 'phel ba gzhan rnam pa brgyad de /üîΩthog mar sems can dpag tu med pas me tog la sogs pas sangs rgyas rnams mchod pa'i dge ba la sogs pa rnam pa rab tu mang po dper mdzad nas gong nas gong du bsod nams khyad par du 'phags pa gnas skabs bcu drug gis mtshon pa'i ngo
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dang ldan par rtogs pa'i sems mi skye ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa kun bsdus pa rab tu shes pa dang / theg pa thams cad phun sum tshogs pa thob pa dang / phun sum tshogs pa nyid dang yul dang byed pa la sogs pa mi dmigs par spyod pa zhes bya ba rnam par 'phel ba gzhan rnam pa brgyad de / thog mar sems can dpag tu med pas me tog la sogs pas sangs rgyas rnams mchod pa'i dge ba la sogs pa rnam pa rab tu mang po dper mdzad nas gong nas gong du bsod nams khyad par du 'phags pa gnas skabs bcu drug gis mtshon pa'i ngo
translated: There are eight other kinds of increase: the non-arising of the mind that conceives of the possession of form and so on, the full knowledge of the inclusion of all the perfections, the attainment of the perfection of all vehicles, and the practice of the perfection of the non-apprehension of perfection, object, action, and so on.

original: bo nyid ni rtse mor gyur pa nyid kyi rtse mo mngon par rtogs pas thob pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par 'phel ba'i khyad par yin no //
analyzed: bo nyid ni rtse mor gyur pa nyid kyi rtse mo mngon par rtogs pas thob pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par 'phel ba'i khyad par yin no //
translated: The essence of the increase of the supreme training is the attainment of the peak through the realization of the peak.

original: rnam par 'phel ba thob pa las nges par brtan pa 'byung bas bzod par gyur pa'i mtshan nyid nges par brtan pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: rnam par 'phel ba thob pa las nges par brtan pa 'byung bas bzod par gyur pa'i mtshan nyid nges par brtan pa gsungs pa /
translated: Since stability definitely occurs from obtaining the increase of the perfection of patience, the definition of the stage of patience is stated as stability.

original: kun mkhyen nyid gsum chos rnams kyi //
analyzed: kun mkhyen nyid gsum chos rnams kyi //
translated: The three knowledges are the complete,

original: yongs su rdzogs pa bla med pa //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa bla med pa //
translated: unsurpassable qualities,

original: sems can don yongs mi gtong ba //
analyzed: sems can don yongs mi gtong ba //
translated: and never abandoning the welfare of sentient beings

original: brtan pa zhes ni mngon par brjod //üîΩces bya ba'o //
analyzed: brtan pa zhes ni mngon par brjod // ces bya ba'o //
translated: is expressed as stability.üîΩBy the power of being skilled in the correct method, all phenomena of the three knowledges, as they have been explained, are completely perfected by the three general characteristics.

original: yang dag pa'i thabs la mkhas pa'i stobs kyis ji skad bshad pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi chos spyi'i mtshan nyid gsum gyis yongs su rdzogs pa'i mos pa bla na med pa nyid dang / de ltar rnam par mi rtog pa'i rtogs pa'i gnas skabs na snying rje chen po mngon du byed pa'i ngo bos ci nas kyang sems can gyi don yongs su mi gtong bar sgrub pa ni bzod par gyur pa nyid kyi rtse mo mngon par rtogs pa thob pa'i
analyzed: yang dag pa'i thabs la mkhas pa'i stobs kyis ji skad bshad pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum gyi chos spyi'i mtshan nyid gsum gyis yongs su rdzogs pa'i mos pa bla na med pa nyid dang / de ltar rnam par mi rtog pa'i rtogs pa'i gnas skabs na snying rje chen po mngon du byed pa'i ngo bos ci nas kyang sems can gyi don yongs su mi gtong bar sgrub pa ni bzod par gyur pa nyid kyi rtse mo mngon par rtogs pa thob pa'i
translated: The unsurpassable is the attainment of the peak, the attainment of clear realization, of the stage of patience, which is the accomplishment of never abandoning the welfare of sentient beings by the essence of actualizing great compassion in the state of the realization of nonconceptuality.

original: mtshan nyid nges par brtan pa'i khyad par yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid nges par brtan pa'i khyad par yin no //
translated: It is the distinctive feature of the stability of ascertainment.

original: nges par brtan pa las sems kun tu gnas par 'gyur bas chos kyi mchog tu gyur pa'i mtshan nyid sems kun tu gnas pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: nges par brtan pa las sems kun tu gnas par 'gyur bas chos kyi mchog tu gyur pa'i mtshan nyid sems kun tu gnas pa gsungs pa /
translated: Since the mind is completely stabilized due to stability, the defining characteristic of the supreme mundane state, complete stabilization of the mind is stated:üîΩTaking as examples the four continents, the chiliocosm,

original: gling bzhi pa dang stong dag dang // stong gnyis gsum dag dper mdzad nas //
analyzed: gling bzhi pa dang stong dag dang // stong gnyis gsum dag dper mdzad nas //
translated: the dichiliocosm, and the trichiliocosm,

original: bsod nams mang po nyid kyis ni //üîΩting 'dzin yongs su bsgrags pa yin //
analyzed: bsod nams mang po nyid kyis ni // ting 'dzin yongs su bsgrags pa yin //
translated: through the abundance of merit,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the samadhi is proclaimed.

original: gling bzhi pa dang / stong dang / stong gnyis pa dang / stong gsum gyi 'jig rten @57a * //
analyzed: gling bzhi pa dang / stong dang / stong gnyis pa dang / stong gsum gyi 'jig rten @57a * //
translated: The four continents, the chiliocosm, the dichiliocosm, and the trichiliocosm are taken as examples.

original: gyi khams rnams kyi ri rab dang rgya mtsho la sogs pa ni srang la gzhal ba dang / skra'i rtse mo'i thigs pa la sogs pas tshad gzung du rung gi zhes so sor dper mdzad nas de las khyad par du 'phags shing tshad las 'das pa'i bsod nams mang po nyid kyis ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan nyid brjod pa ni chos kyi mchog tu gyur pa
analyzed: gyi khams rnams kyi ri rab dang rgya mtsho la sogs pa ni srang la gzhal ba dang / skra'i rtse mo'i thigs pa la sogs pas tshad gzung du rung gi zhes so sor dper mdzad nas de las khyad par du 'phags shing tshad las 'das pa'i bsod nams mang po nyid kyis ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan nyid brjod pa ni chos kyi mchog tu gyur pa
translated: The characteristics of concentration are described by the many kinds of immeasurable merit.

original: nyid kyi rtse mo mngon par rtogs pa thob pa'i mtshan nyid sems kun tu gnas pa'i khyad par yin no //
analyzed: nyid kyi rtse mo mngon par rtogs pa thob pa'i mtshan nyid sems kun tu gnas pa'i khyad par yin no //
translated: The distinctive state of mind that obtains the peak of realization is the supreme of all phenomena.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i rtse mo thob pas mthong ba'i lam gyi rtse mo 'byung bas de la mi mthun pa'i phyogs dngos su bstan pas gnyen po dang bcas pa rnam pa bzhi 'chad par mdzad pa na /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i rtse mo thob pas mthong ba'i lam gyi rtse mo 'byung bas de la mi mthun pa'i phyogs dngos su bstan pas gnyen po dang bcas pa rnam pa bzhi 'chad par mdzad pa na /
translated: The peak of the path of seeing arises from obtaining the peak of the factors conducive to penetrative insight.

original: re zhig mi mthun pa'i phyogs gzung bar rnam par rtog pa gnyis po mdor gsungs pa /üîΩ'jug pa dang ni ldog pa la //
analyzed: re zhig mi mthun pa'i phyogs gzung bar rnam par rtog pa gnyis po mdor gsungs pa / 'jug pa dang ni ldog pa la //
translated: It should be known that the object of the nine kindsüîΩis not the nature of reality.üîΩThe conceptualization of the apprehended is each of those.üîΩThe conceptualization of the apprehended is each of those.üîΩThe conceptualization of the apprehended is each of those.

original: gzung ba'i rnam rtog so sor de //üîΩdgu yi bdag nyid ji bzhin yul //
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam rtog so sor de // dgu yi bdag nyid ji bzhin yul //
translated: The conceptualization of the apprehended is each of those.üîΩThe conceptualization of the apprehended is each of those.

original: 'jug pa'i rten can mi dmigs pa'i bdag nyid byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos blang ba dang / ldog pa'i rten can dmigs pa'i bdag nyid nyan thos la sogs pa'i chos 'dor ba'i sgo nas bzung ba'o zhes rnam par rtog pa ngo bo nyid dang dman pa la sogs pa yul gyi dbye bas so sor rnam pa dgu'i bdag nyid de /üîΩdon ji lta ba bzhin dang ma 'brel bar 'jug pa nyid kyis phyin ci log tu snang ba'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par rtog pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rten can mi dmigs pa'i bdag nyid byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi chos blang ba dang / ldog pa'i rten can dmigs pa'i bdag nyid nyan thos la sogs pa'i chos 'dor ba'i sgo nas bzung ba'o zhes rnam par rtog pa ngo bo nyid dang dman pa la sogs pa yul gyi dbye bas so sor rnam pa dgu'i bdag nyid de /üîΩdon ji lta ba bzhin dang ma 'brel bar 'jug pa nyid kyis phyin ci log tu snang ba'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par rtog pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: The conceptualization of the apprehended is each of those

original: de'i 'og tu 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis mdor gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis mdor gsungs pa /
translated: The next two verses in brief teach the two kinds of grasping conceptualization.

original: so so'i skye bo 'phangs dbye bas //üîΩsems can rdzas dang btags yod par //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo 'phangs dbye bas // sems can rdzas dang btags yod par //
translated: Ordinary beings are divided into those who areüîΩimpelled and those who are not.üîΩThey are considered to be the grasping conceptualizations

original: rnam rtog 'dzin pa dag tu 'dod //
analyzed: rnam rtog 'dzin pa dag tu 'dod //
translated: of sentient beings as substantially and imputedly existent.

original: de dag so sor dgu bdag nyid //
analyzed: de dag so sor dgu bdag nyid //
translated: Each of them has nine aspects.

original: gal te gzung don de bzhin med //
analyzed: gal te gzung don de bzhin med //
translated: If the object of grasping does not exist in that way,

original: de dag gang gis 'dzin par 'dod //
analyzed: de dag gang gis 'dzin par 'dod //
translated: by what means is it grasped?

original: de ltar de dag 'dzin pa yi //
analyzed: de ltar de dag 'dzin pa yi //
translated: Thus, they are characterized by

original: ngo bos stong pa'i mtshan nyid do //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //üîΩso so skye bo'i dbang du byas nas gang zag rdzas su yod pa dang / 'phags pa rnams kyi dbang du byas nas skyes bu btags par yod pa'i rten can gyi sgo nas 'dzin pa'o zhes rnam par rtog pa 'dzin cing 'dor ba dang nges par 'byung @57b ba mchog ma yin pa la sogs pa'i yul gyi dbye bas so sor rnam pa
analyzed: ngo bos stong pa'i mtshan nyid do // zhes bya ba'o // so so skye bo'i dbang du byas nas gang zag rdzas su yod pa dang / 'phags pa rnams kyi dbang du byas nas skyes bu btags par yod pa'i rten can gyi sgo nas 'dzin pa'o zhes rnam par rtog pa 'dzin cing 'dor ba dang nges par 'byung @57b ba mchog ma yin pa la sogs pa'i yul gyi dbye bas so sor rnam pa
translated: the emptiness of the entity of grasping.üîΩFrom the perspective of ordinary beings, there is the grasping of the person as substantially existent and from the perspective of ƒÅryas, there is the grasping of the person as imputedly existent.

original: dgu'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: dgu'i bdag nyid de /
translated: Grasping is conceptualization that is divided into nine aspects due to the different objects of non-supreme renunciation and so on.

original: de dag kyang don ji lta ba bzhin 'jug pa ma yin pa'i phyir gang gi tshe de dag gi yul gyi dngos po dag de bzhin du gzung ba'i ngo bor yod pa ma yin pas de'i tshe blo de dag gis 'dzin par 'dod par byed /
analyzed: de dag kyang don ji lta ba bzhin 'jug pa ma yin pa'i phyir gang gi tshe de dag gi yul gyi dngos po dag de bzhin du gzung ba'i ngo bor yod pa ma yin pas de'i tshe blo de dag gis 'dzin par 'dod par byed /
translated: Because they do not engage their objects as they are, when the things that are their objects do not exist in the nature that is grasped by them, then at that time, those cognitions are said to grasp them.

original: de bas na mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par rtog pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par rtog pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should understand that the counteragents are conceptual thoughts.

original: de'i phyir de dag 'dzin pa'i ngo bos dben pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag 'dzin pa'i ngo bos dben pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: Therefore, they have the characteristic of being devoid of the nature of grasping.

original: 'di ni snga ma'i skabs su yang nye bar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni snga ma'i skabs su yang nye bar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied in the previous context as well.üîΩAfter that, in nine intermediate verses, he elaborates on just those conceptual thoughts of the apprehended and the apprehender. First, he elaborates on the conceptual thought of the apprehended.

original: de'i 'og tu bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa dgus gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa de dag nyid rgyas par ston pa las re zhig gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po 'jug pa'i phyogs kyi rten can dgu gang zhe na /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa dgus gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa de dag nyid rgyas par ston pa las re zhig gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po 'jug pa'i phyogs kyi rten can dgu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the nine that are the basis of engagement?

original: ngo bo nyid dang rigs dang ni //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang rigs dang ni //
translated: They are: nature, type,

original: lam ni yang dag 'grub pa dang // shes pa'i dmigs pa ma 'khrul dang // gnyen po'i mi mthun phyogs dag dang // rang gis rtogs dang byed pa dang // de'i las byed pa'i 'bras bu la //üîΩ'jug pa'i phyogs kyi rten can gyi //
analyzed: lam ni yang dag 'grub pa dang // shes pa'i dmigs pa ma 'khrul dang // gnyen po'i mi mthun phyogs dag dang // rang gis rtogs dang byed pa dang // de'i las byed pa'i 'bras bu la // 'jug pa'i phyogs kyi rten can gyi //
translated: and the result of the activity.üîΩIt is said that the conception

original: rnam rtog de ni rnam dgur 'dod //
analyzed: rnam rtog de ni rnam dgur 'dod //
translated: of the side of engagement has nine aspects.

original: ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o //
translated: Thus it is.

original: lam dang 'bras bus dben pas dben par mi rtog pas ngo bo nyid dang / 'bras bu mchog dang dman pa la ring ba dang / nye ba'i rgyu nyid kyis theg pa chen po'i rigs dang / de la brten nas sgyu ma lta bur rtogs pas mthong ba la sogs pa lam yang dag par 'grub pa dang /
analyzed: lam dang 'bras bus dben pas dben par mi rtog pas ngo bo nyid dang / 'bras bu mchog dang dman pa la ring ba dang / nye ba'i rgyu nyid kyis theg pa chen po'i rigs dang / de la brten nas sgyu ma lta bur rtogs pas mthong ba la sogs pa lam yang dag par 'grub pa dang /
translated: The essence is the non-conception of emptiness due to the absence of path and result, the MahƒÅyƒÅna lineage due to being the cause of the superior and inferior results, far and near, and the correct achievement of the path, such as seeing and so on, due to the realization of illusion-like [emptiness] based on that [lineage].

original: snang brnyan tsam du zad pas shes pa'i dmigs pa ma 'khrul ba dang / yon tan dang skyon mthong ba sngon du 'gro bas blang ba dang dor bar bya ba nyid kyis gnyen po dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / dri ma thams cad dang bral ba nyid kyis rang gis rtogs pa dang /
analyzed: snang brnyan tsam du zad pas shes pa'i dmigs pa ma 'khrul ba dang / yon tan dang skyon mthong ba sngon du 'gro bas blang ba dang dor bar bya ba nyid kyis gnyen po dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / dri ma thams cad dang bral ba nyid kyis rang gis rtogs pa dang /
translated: Since it is free from all adverse factors and stains, it is self-realized.

original: smon lam yongs su rdzogs pa nyid kyis gzugs kyi sku dag gis /üîΩgzhan gyi don byed pa dang / phrin las lhun gyis grub pa nyid kyis cho 'phrul gsum la bdag gir bya ba'i las dang / yang dag pa'i thabs la mkhas pa'i stobs kyis theg pa gsum gyi byang chub la 'god par bya ba'i 'bras bur skyon med pa nyid kyis gzung bar bya ba nyid du 'jug par bya'o zhes rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa'i phyogs kyi rten @58a * //
analyzed: smon lam yongs su rdzogs pa nyid kyis gzugs kyi sku dag gis / gzhan gyi don byed pa dang / phrin las lhun gyis grub pa nyid kyis cho 'phrul gsum la bdag gir bya ba'i las dang / yang dag pa'i thabs la mkhas pa'i stobs kyis theg pa gsum gyi byang chub la 'god par bya ba'i 'bras bur skyon med pa nyid kyis gzung bar bya ba nyid du 'jug par bya'o zhes rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa'i phyogs kyi rten @58a * //
translated: Since it is the fulfillment of aspirations, it is the activity of benefiting others through the two form bodies.üîΩSince it is spontaneous activity, it is the activity of taking ownership of the three types of spiritual miracles.üîΩSince it is the faultless result of establishing beings in the enlightenment of the three vehicles through the power of perfect skillful means, it is to be taken up.

original: can rnam pa dgur bzhed de /
analyzed: can rnam pa dgur bzhed de /
translated: Thus it is asserted that the nine aspects of the bodhisattva's engagement in conceptualization are the basis for engagement.

original: de dag ni mthong ba'i lam gyi sbyor ba'i gnas skabs kyis spang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni mthong ba'i lam gyi sbyor ba'i gnas skabs kyis spang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: These are to be abandoned by the path of vision, in the stage of preparation.

original: gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa ldog pa'i phyogs kyi rten can dgu po gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa ldog pa'i phyogs kyi rten can dgu po gang zhe na /
translated: What are the nine conceptualizations of the apprehended that are the basis of the reversal of the second?

original: srid dang zhi bar ltung ba'i phyir //
analyzed: srid dang zhi bar ltung ba'i phyir //
translated: Falling into existence and peace,

original: rtogs pa dman pa nyid dang ni //
analyzed: rtogs pa dman pa nyid dang ni //
translated: Inferior realization,üîΩLack of complete acceptance,üîΩLack of complete aspects of the path,üîΩGoing by the conditions of others,üîΩReversal of the object of propagation,

original: yongs su 'dzin pa med pa dang // lam gyi rnam pa ma tshang dang // gzhan gyi rkyen gyis 'gro ba dang // mched du bya ba log pa dang // nyi tshe ba dang sna tshogs nyid //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa med pa dang // lam gyi rnam pa ma tshang dang // gzhan gyi rkyen gyis 'gro ba dang // mched du bya ba log pa dang // nyi tshe ba dang sna tshogs nyid //
translated: Limited scope, and variety,üîΩConfusion about the basis and engagement,

original: gnas dang 'jug la rmongs pa dang // rjes la 'gro zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: gnas dang 'jug la rmongs pa dang // rjes la 'gro zhes bya ba la //
translated: And following after.

original: rnam rtog dgu yi bdag nyid 'di //
analyzed: rnam rtog dgu yi bdag nyid 'di //
translated: These are the nine conceptualizations.

original: ldog pa'i phyogs kyi rten can te //üîΩnyan thos la sogs yid la byung //
analyzed: ldog pa'i phyogs kyi rten can te // nyan thos la sogs yid la byung //
translated: They are the basis of the reversal of the second.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: They arise in the minds of ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on.

original: shes rab dang snying rje dang bral bas 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gang yang rung ba zhig tu ltung ba nyid kyis rtogs pa dman pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pa dang bral ba nyid kyis yongs su 'dzin pa med pa dang /
analyzed: shes rab dang snying rje dang bral bas 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gang yang rung ba zhig tu ltung ba nyid kyis rtogs pa dman pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pa dang bral ba nyid kyis yongs su 'dzin pa med pa dang /
translated: It is without support because it is devoid of spiritual masters and so forth.üîΩIt is incomplete in terms of the path because it is not the antidote to all the obscurations to omniscience.üîΩIt is a path that goes by the conditions of others because it depends on the instructions of the Buddha and so forth.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa mtha' dag gi gnyen po ma yin pa nyid kyis lam gyi rnam pa ma tshang ba dang / sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i gdams ngag la ltos pa nyid kyis gzhan gyi rkyen gyis 'gro ba dang / ji skad bshad pa'i sems chen po nyid la sogs pa la mi 'jug pa nyid kyis ched du bya ba log pa dang /
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa mtha' dag gi gnyen po ma yin pa nyid kyis lam gyi rnam pa ma tshang ba dang / sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i gdams ngag la ltos pa nyid kyis gzhan gyi rkyen gyis 'gro ba dang / ji skad bshad pa'i sems chen po nyid la sogs pa la mi 'jug pa nyid kyis ched du bya ba log pa dang /
translated: It is a perverted object because it does not engage the great mind and so forth as they have been explained.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa kho na'i gnyen por zad pa nyid kyis nyi tshe ba dang / chos thams cad ro gcig par ma rtogs pa nyid kyis 'bras bu bzhi la sogs pa rtogs pa tha dad pa du ma dang / 'khor gsum kun nas mi rtog pa nyid la rmongs pa 'am ma rig pa'i bag la nyal thams cad ma spangs pa nyid kyis gnas pa dang 'gro ba mi shes pa dang /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa kho na'i gnyen por zad pa nyid kyis nyi tshe ba dang / chos thams cad ro gcig par ma rtogs pa nyid kyis 'bras bu bzhi la sogs pa rtogs pa tha dad pa du ma dang / 'khor gsum kun nas mi rtog pa nyid la rmongs pa 'am ma rig pa'i bag la nyal thams cad ma spangs pa nyid kyis gnas pa dang 'gro ba mi shes pa dang /
translated: It is limited because it is merely the antidote to the afflictive obscurations, it has many different realizations such as the four results because it does not realize the single taste of all phenomena, it does not know where it is going or where it has been because it does not abandon all the latent propensities of ignorance or confusion about the complete nonconceptuality of the three spheres,

original: theg pa chen po thams cad sdud par byed pa nyid kyis //üîΩrnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mya ngan las 'das pa thams cad kyi mjug tu 'gro ba rnams nyes pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis ldog par bya ba rnams la de ltar gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa ldog pa'i phyogs kyi rten can nyan thos dang rang
analyzed: theg pa chen po thams cad sdud par byed pa nyid kyis // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mya ngan las 'das pa thams cad kyi mjug tu 'gro ba rnams nyes pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis ldog par bya ba rnams la de ltar gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa ldog pa'i phyogs kyi rten can nyan thos dang rang
translated: it is reversible because it is not the final nirvana since it does not include all Mahayana paths,üîΩit is reversible because it is not the final nirvana since it is not the knowledge of all aspects that goes to the end of all nirvana and it is reversible because it is not the knowledge of all aspects that goes to the end of all nirvana since it is not the knowledge of all aspects that goes to the end of all nirvana.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rgyud la 'byung ba rnam pa dgu ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rgyud la 'byung ba rnam pa dgu ste /
translated: These are the nine types of conceptual thoughts that occur in the mindstreams of sravakas and pratyekabuddhas who are to be turned away from holding such views.

original: de dag ni mthong ba'i lam gyi sems @58b dang sems las byung ba 'jug pa'i gnas skabs kyis spang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni mthong ba'i lam gyi sems @58b dang sems las byung ba 'jug pa'i gnas skabs kyis spang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: These are to be abandoned by the path of vision, by the state of the mind and mental activities.

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang po gang zag rdzas su yod pa'i rten can dgu po gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang po gang zag rdzas su yod pa'i rten can dgu po gang zhe na /
translated: What are the nine kinds of discrimination of grasping that have as their support the substantial person?

original: 'dzin pa dang ni 'dor ba dang // yid la byed dang khams rnams ni //
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang ni 'dor ba dang // yid la byed dang khams rnams ni //
translated: Grasping, rejecting, mental attention, the three realms,üîΩassociation, abode, manifest attachment,üîΩthe imputation of the reality of things,üîΩattachment, and the counteragent,

original: gsum po dag dang nye 'brel dang ; / gnas dang mngon par zhen pa dang // chos kyi dngos po btags pa dang // chags pa dang ni gnyen po dang // ji ltar 'dod bzhin 'gro nyams la //üîΩ'dzin pa dang por shes par bya //
analyzed: gsum po dag dang nye 'brel dang ; / gnas dang mngon par zhen pa dang // chos kyi dngos po btags pa dang // chags pa dang ni gnyen po dang // ji ltar 'dod bzhin 'gro nyams la // 'dzin pa dang por shes par bya //
translated: going as one wishes, and regression

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: are to be known as the first grasping.

original: don rnams la blang ba dang dor ba'i bdag nyid kyis byed pa por dmigs pas 'dzin pa dang 'dor ba dang / dngos po rnams la bden par 'dzin pa nyid kyis yid la byed pa dang / rgyur mngon par zhen pa dang bcas pa'i 'bras bu khams gsum dang 'brel pa dang /
analyzed: don rnams la blang ba dang dor ba'i bdag nyid kyis byed pa por dmigs pas 'dzin pa dang 'dor ba dang / dngos po rnams la bden par 'dzin pa nyid kyis yid la byed pa dang / rgyur mngon par zhen pa dang bcas pa'i 'bras bu khams gsum dang 'brel pa dang /
translated: Since it observes the agent in the aspect of adopting and rejecting objects, it is grasping and rejecting. Since it apprehends things as truly existent, it is mental activity. Since it is associated with the three realms, it is the result of manifest clinging.

original: gzugs la sogs pa ma dmigs pa'i tshul gyis yid la byed pas de dag la gnas pa dang / don gyi rnam pa phyi rol du yongs su 'dzin pa nyid kyis mngon par zhen pa dang / de'i don la tha snyad kyi brdar nye bar sbyor ba nyid kyis chos kyi dngos po btags pa dang /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ma dmigs pa'i tshul gyis yid la byed pas de dag la gnas pa dang / don gyi rnam pa phyi rol du yongs su 'dzin pa nyid kyis mngon par zhen pa dang / de'i don la tha snyad kyi brdar nye bar sbyor ba nyid kyis chos kyi dngos po btags pa dang /
translated: Since it is mental activity in the aspect of not observing form and so on, it is their basis. Since it is the external grasping of the aspect of an object, it is clinging. Since it is the designation of the entity of phenomena through the application of conventional symbols to its object, it is designation.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi yul rnams la mtshan mar byed pas yongs su chags pa dang / mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa la lam du lta ba nyid kyis gnyen por zhen pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par ma shes pas ji ltar 'dod pa ltar byang chub mchog tu 'gro bar mi nus pa rnams la don dam pa'i dngos por mngon par zhen pa nyid kyis 'dzin par rnam par rtog pa gang zag rdzas su
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi yul rnams la mtshan mar byed pas yongs su chags pa dang / mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa la lam du lta ba nyid kyis gnyen por zhen pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par ma shes pas ji ltar 'dod pa ltar byang chub mchog tu 'gro bar mi nus pa rnams la don dam pa'i dngos por mngon par zhen pa nyid kyis 'dzin par rnam par rtog pa gang zag rdzas su
translated: Since they conceive of objects that are discordant factors as signs, they are attached to them. Since they view impermanence, suffering and so on as the path itself, they are attached to antidotes. Since they do not perfectly understand the perfection of wisdom, they are unable to proceed to supreme enlightenment as they wish.

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam dgu ste /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam dgu ste /
translated: These nine are the conceptions of apprehending the person asüîΩsubstantial.üîΩThey are to be abandoned by the path of seeing through the state of

original: de dag ni mthong ba'i lam gyi sbyor ba gnas skabs kyis spang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni mthong ba'i lam gyi sbyor ba gnas skabs kyis spang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: preparation.üîΩWhat are the nine that are based on the imputed existence of the person

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pas skyes bu btags par yod pa'i rten can dgu gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pas skyes bu btags par yod pa'i rten can dgu gang zhe na /
translated: and are the conceptions of apprehending?

original: ched bzhin nges par mi 'byung ba dang // lam la lam min nges 'dzin dang // 'gog dang bcas pa'i skye ba dang // dngos po ldan dang mi ldan dang // gnas dang rigs ni 'jig pa dang // don du gnyer dang rgyu med dang //
analyzed: ched bzhin nges par mi 'byung ba dang // lam la lam min nges 'dzin dang // 'gog dang bcas pa'i skye ba dang // dngos po ldan dang mi ldan dang // gnas dang rigs ni 'jig pa dang // don du gnyer dang rgyu med dang //
translated: the apprehension of the destruction of abodes and lineages,üîΩthe apprehension of the aimless and the causeless,

original: phyir rgol ba ni dmigs pa la //
analyzed: phyir rgol ba ni dmigs pa la //
translated: and the apprehension of the object of the opponent.üîΩThese are the other discriminations.üîΩThe other discriminations are:

original: 'dzin pa'i rnam rtog gzhan yin no //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i rnam rtog gzhan yin no // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The non-occurrence of the definite occurrence of the purpose,üîΩthe definite apprehension of the path as not being the path,üîΩthe apprehension of birth as having cessation,üîΩthe apprehension of things as being possessed or not possessed,

original: nyan thos la sogs @59a * //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs @59a * //
translated: the apprehension of the destruction of abodes and lineages,üîΩthe apprehension of the aimless and the causeless,üîΩand the apprehension of the object of the opponent.üîΩThe non-occurrence of the definite occurrence of the purpose is the non-occurrence of the definite occurrence of the purpose of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, etc. by way of the definite occurrence of the result.üîΩThe definite apprehension of the path as not being the path is the definite apprehension of another path as not being the path due to the non-existence of the path that is the aim of oneself.

original: pa'i 'bras bu nges par 'byung ba nyid kyis ched du bya ba ji lta ba bzhin nges par mi 'byung ba dang / rang gi don mngon par 'dod pa'i lam med pas lam gzhan la lam ma yin par nges par 'dzin pa dang / dngos po thams cad yang dag par bkag pa nyid kyis skye ba dang bcas par 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: pa'i 'bras bu nges par 'byung ba nyid kyis ched du bya ba ji lta ba bzhin nges par mi 'byung ba dang / rang gi don mngon par 'dod pa'i lam med pas lam gzhan la lam ma yin par nges par 'dzin pa dang / dngos po thams cad yang dag par bkag pa nyid kyis skye ba dang bcas par 'dzin pa dang /
translated: The apprehension of birth as having cessation is the apprehension of birth as having cessation due to the complete cessation of all things.

original: bar chad med pa dang cig shos su snang ba nyid kyis dngos po mtha' dag ldan pa dang / mi ldan pa dang / nam mkhar gnas pa'i bya la sogs pa dang 'dra ba nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa la gnas pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yang dag par spyad pa nyid kyis nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs 'jig pa dang /
analyzed: bar chad med pa dang cig shos su snang ba nyid kyis dngos po mtha' dag ldan pa dang / mi ldan pa dang / nam mkhar gnas pa'i bya la sogs pa dang 'dra ba nyid kyis gzugs la sogs pa la gnas pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yang dag par spyad pa nyid kyis nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs 'jig pa dang /
translated: lineage of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on.üîΩSince there is no dharma that is superior to suchness, it is not seekingüîΩthe essence of enlightenment, and so on. Since it is the cause that accomplishes all qualities based on the characteristics of the ultimate, it is

original: de bzhin nyid las khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos med pa'i phyir snying po byang chub la sogs pa don du gnyer ba med pa dang / don dam pa'i mtshan nyid la brten nas yon tan thams cad 'grub par byed pa'i rgyu med pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid las khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos med pa'i phyir snying po byang chub la sogs pa don du gnyer ba med pa dang / don dam pa'i mtshan nyid la brten nas yon tan thams cad 'grub par byed pa'i rgyu med pa dang /
translated: without cause.

original: shes rab yongs su nyam chung ba nyid kyis bdud la sogs pa'i phyir rgol ba dang dmigs pa rnams la btags pa'i dngos por mngon par zhen pa nyid kyis 'dzin par rnam par rtog pa skyes bu btags par yod pa'i rten can gyi rnam pa dgu ste /
analyzed: shes rab yongs su nyam chung ba nyid kyis bdud la sogs pa'i phyir rgol ba dang dmigs pa rnams la btags pa'i dngos por mngon par zhen pa nyid kyis 'dzin par rnam par rtog pa skyes bu btags par yod pa'i rten can gyi rnam pa dgu ste /
translated: The nine aspects of the conception of the apprehended are based on the conception of the person as something imagined, due to the extreme weakness of wisdom and due to the adherence to the imagined reality of the objects of the senses, such as the demons and adversaries.

original: de dag ni mthong ba'i lam gyi sems dang sems las byung ba 'jug pa'i gnas skabs kyis spangs bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni mthong ba'i lam gyi sems dang sems las byung ba 'jug pa'i gnas skabs kyis spangs bar bya ba yin no //
translated: These are to be eliminated by the mind and mental factors of the path of seeing.

original: de ltar na mthong ba'i lam gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni dgu phrag rnam pa bzhi yin pas de dag nyid kyi gnyen po yang dgu phrag rnam pa bzhir rab tu dbye ba khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na mthong ba'i lam gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni dgu phrag rnam pa bzhi yin pas de dag nyid kyi gnyen po yang dgu phrag rnam pa bzhir rab tu dbye ba khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Thus, since the adverse factors of the path of seeing are four times nine, one should understand that their antidotes are also classified as four times nine.

original: de'i 'og tu mthong ba'i lam de nyid rgyu gang dang bcas pas byang chub chen por sgrub par byed pa bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mthong ba'i lam de nyid rgyu gang dang bcas pas byang chub chen por sgrub par byed pa bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa gsungs pa /
translated: The following verse is a supplementary verse, which states the cause by which the path of seeing is established as great enlightenment.

original: byang chub la gzhan stong pa dang // de yi rgyu ni yongs gtod nyid //üîΩde 'thob bar chad med pa'i rgyu //
analyzed: byang chub la gzhan stong pa dang // de yi rgyu ni yongs gtod nyid // de 'thob bar chad med pa'i rgyu //
translated: Enlightenment is the emptiness of others, and its cause is thorough dedication.

original: bsod nams mang po'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: bsod nams mang po'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The cause of attaining it is the characteristic of great merit.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus it is.

original: bdag nyid mthong ba'i lam la gnas nas gzhan dag la de dag la sogs pa bstan pas rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'god pa dang / byang chub kyi rgyu kho nar gdul bya la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzhung mi nyams shing 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir so sor gtod pa dang /
analyzed: bdag nyid mthong ba'i lam la gnas nas gzhan dag la de dag la sogs pa bstan pas rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'god pa dang / byang chub kyi rgyu kho nar gdul bya la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzhung mi nyams shing 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir so sor gtod pa dang /
translated: Having oneself stood on the path of insight, one establishes others in perfect enlightenment by teaching them that and so on. One thoroughly dedicates to disciples the very cause of enlightenment, so that the scriptural transmission of the perfection of wisdom may not decline but increase.

original: @59b byang chub 'thob pa la bar chad med pa'i rgyu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rang gi bsgom pa la sogs pa bsod nams chen po'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: @59b byang chub 'thob pa la bar chad med pa'i rgyu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rang gi bsgom pa la sogs pa bsod nams chen po'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The cause of attaining enlightenment is the characteristic of great merit, such as one's own cultivation of the perfection of wisdom, which is the cause of attaining enlightenment without obstacles.

original: de'i rgyu tshigs ni rnam pa gsum yin no //
analyzed: de'i rgyu tshigs ni rnam pa gsum yin no //
translated: The causes are of three kinds.

original: rgyu de lta bu las thob pa'i byang chub de nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu de lta bu las thob pa'i byang chub de nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is that enlightenment which is attained from such causes?

original: bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pas 'bras bu'i bdag nyid byang chub chen po gsungs pa /
analyzed: bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pas 'bras bu'i bdag nyid byang chub chen po gsungs pa /
translated: The intermediate verses state the result, the nature of enlightenment.

original: dri ma zad dang mi skye ba'i //
analyzed: dri ma zad dang mi skye ba'i //
translated: The knowledge of the extinction of defilements and of their non-arising

original: ye shes byang chub ces brjod de //
analyzed: ye shes byang chub ces brjod de //
translated: is called enlightenment.

original: zad med skye med phyir de dag / go rims bzhin du shes par bya //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //üîΩgang gi phyir chos thams cad ni chos kyi dbyings las ma gtogs pa gang yang med pas nam mkha' ltar 'gag pa dang skye ba med pa'i phyir dang / dri ma gang yin pa rnams ni gcig dang du ma'i ngo bo nyid dang / rang dang gzhan la sogs pa'i rgyu dang /
analyzed: zad med skye med phyir de dag / go rims bzhin du shes par bya // zhes bya ba'o // gang gi phyir chos thams cad ni chos kyi dbyings las ma gtogs pa gang yang med pas nam mkha' ltar 'gag pa dang skye ba med pa'i phyir dang / dri ma gang yin pa rnams ni gcig dang du ma'i ngo bo nyid dang / rang dang gzhan la sogs pa'i rgyu dang /
translated: They should be understood respectively as the extinction and non-arising.üîΩBecause there is nothing apart from the dharmadhatu, all phenomena are like space, without cessation or origination.üîΩAnd because the reasonings that defilements are empty of a singular or plural nature, of a cause such as self or other,

original: yod pa dang med pa las skye ba'i 'bras bus stong pa la sogs pa'i 'thad pa nyid kyis nam mkha'i pad ma bzhin du 'gag pa dang skye ba med de /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa las skye ba'i 'bras bus stong pa la sogs pa'i 'thad pa nyid kyis nam mkha'i pad ma bzhin du 'gag pa dang skye ba med de /
translated: of an existent or non-existent result, and so forth, are valid, they are like a sky-lotus, without cessation or origination.

original: de'i phyir sngar yod pa rnams zad pa dang gsar du mi skye bar byas pa ma grub pas go rims ltar gdod ma nas zad pa dang mi skye ba gang yin pa de ji lta ba bzhin rab tu rtogs pa'i ye shes chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid ni
analyzed: de'i phyir sngar yod pa rnams zad pa dang gsar du mi skye bar byas pa ma grub pas go rims ltar gdod ma nas zad pa dang mi skye ba gang yin pa de ji lta ba bzhin rab tu rtogs pa'i ye shes chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid ni
translated: Therefore, since the exhaustion of what previously existed and the prevention of new arising are not established, the pristine wisdom that fully understands just what is‚Äîthe exhaustion from the beginning and the nonarising‚Äîis

original: byang chub chen por shes par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub chen por shes par bya'o //
translated: to be known as great enlightenment.

original: de las gzhan du zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa mi rung bar gsungs pa /
analyzed: de las gzhan du zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa mi rung bar gsungs pa /
translated: It is said that it is not tenable to know exhaustion and nonarising in any other way:

original: 'gog pa med pa'i rang bzhin la //
analyzed: 'gog pa med pa'i rang bzhin la //
translated: In the nature that is not cessation,üîΩwhat kind of cessation is there

original: mthong zhes bya ba'i lam gyis ni //üîΩrnam par rtog rigs ci zhig zad //
analyzed: mthong zhes bya ba'i lam gyis ni // rnam par rtog rigs ci zhig zad //
translated: in the path called ‚Äúseeing‚Äù?

original: skye med rnam pa ci zhig 'thob //üîΩces bya ba'o //
analyzed: skye med rnam pa ci zhig 'thob // ces bya ba'o //
translated: What kind of nonarising is obtained?

original: gang dang dngos po 'jig pa dang phyis mi skye ba la zad pa dang mi skye ba'o zhes 'du shes la de ltar zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa ni byang chub yin no zhes rtog pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang dang dngos po 'jig pa dang phyis mi skye ba la zad pa dang mi skye ba'o zhes 'du shes la de ltar zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa ni byang chub yin no zhes rtog pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is illogical to think that the knowledge of exhaustion and nonarising is enlightenment, since exhaustion is the destruction of a thing and nonarising is its not arising again later.

original: gang gi phyir 'gog pa ni de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo gdod ma nas med pa'i rang bzhin yin no //üîΩskyes pa dang ma skyes pa dag go rims bzhin du zad pa dang skye ba'i gegs byed pa'i mtshan nyid can la khyed kyi mthong ba'i lam gyi stobs kyis spangs bar bya ba rnam par rtog pa'i rigs sngar skyes pa ni ci zhig zad la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'gog pa ni de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo gdod ma nas med pa'i rang bzhin yin no // skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dag go rims bzhin du zad pa dang skye ba'i gegs byed pa'i mtshan nyid can la khyed kyi mthong ba'i lam gyi stobs kyis spangs bar bya ba rnam par rtog pa'i rigs sngar skyes pa ni ci zhig zad la /
translated: Because cessation is the nature of thusness, which is primordially the nature of nonexistence.

original: bsgrub par bya ba mi skye ba'i chos can ma skyes pa ni ci zhig skyes te cung zad kyang med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba mi skye ba'i chos can ma skyes pa ni ci zhig skyes te cung zad kyang med pa kho na'o //
translated: What previously arisen conceptual thoughts that are to be abandoned by the power of the path of seeing are exhausted, and what unarisen phenomena that are to be established and are not yet arisen are produced? Nothing at all!

original: yang mthong ba'i lam ni @60a * //
analyzed: yang mthong ba'i lam ni @60a * //
translated: Moreover, the path of seeing

original: de'i stobs kyis zad pa dang mi skye bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i stobs kyis zad pa dang mi skye bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: does not cause the exhaustion and nonarising of those conceptual thoughts by its power,

original: med pa'i bdag nyid can gyi 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes kyang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: med pa'i bdag nyid can gyi 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes kyang brjod par bya'o //
translated: because it observes cessation, which is the nature of nonexistence.üîΩAlso, it should be said that in his system, the presentation of the path of seeing

original: gang yang de'i lugs la rnam par gzhag pa 'gal bar gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang yang de'i lugs la rnam par gzhag pa 'gal bar gsungs pa /
translated: is contradictory, as stated in the following:
