analyzed: gzhan gyi chos rnams kyang yod la //
translated: Other‚Äôs phenomena exist,

original: shes bya la yang ston pa yi //üîΩsgrib pa zad par brjod pa dang // de la kho bos mtshar du brtsis //
analyzed: shes bya la yang ston pa yi // sgrib pa zad par brjod pa dang // de la kho bos mtshar du brtsis //
translated: And the knowledge of the knowable,üîΩThe exhaustion of the obscurations with regard to them,

original: zhes bya ba'o //üîΩ'di ltar shes pa dang shes bya'i mtshan nyid skad cig ma chos can gyi ngo bo don dam pa nyid du yod par gyur na spang ba dang bskyed du med pa'i rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pa nyid kyis nam mkha' bzhin du gnyen po bsgom pas de dag
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o // 'di ltar shes pa dang shes bya'i mtshan nyid skad cig ma chos can gyi ngo bo don dam pa nyid du yod par gyur na spang ba dang bskyed du med pa'i rang gi ngo bo 'dzin pa nyid kyis nam mkha' bzhin du gnyen po bsgom pas de dag
translated: I consider that to be amazing.

original: la cung zad kyang mi byed do //
analyzed: la cung zad kyang mi byed do //
translated: Thus, if the nature of the object of knowledge and the knower, which are characterized by momentariness, were to exist in reality, then, because they would possess an essence that cannot be eliminated or produced, like space, the cultivation of the antidote would not do anything to them at all.

original: de bas na dngos por mngon par zhen pa de dag gis chos rnams ni yang dag pa nyid du yod par khas 'che la /
analyzed: de bas na dngos por mngon par zhen pa de dag gis chos rnams ni yang dag pa nyid du yod par khas 'che la /
translated: Therefore, those who are attached to things claim that phenomena exist in reality,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas ni shes par bya ba de dag la sgrib pa'i rnam pa thams cad zad par 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni phan tshun cher 'gal ba smra ba yin pas de la kho bos ya mtshan du mthong ngo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas ni shes par bya ba de dag la sgrib pa'i rnam pa thams cad zad par 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni phan tshun cher 'gal ba smra ba yin pas de la kho bos ya mtshan du mthong ngo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and the TathƒÅgata is said to have exhausted all the aspects of the obscurations with regard to those objects of knowledge. Since this is a claim that is mutually contradictory, I consider that to be amazing.

original: 'o na don 'di ji ltar rnam par brtag par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na don 'di ji ltar rnam par brtag par bya zhe na /
translated: Well then, how should this matter be investigated?

original: bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pas ngo bo nyid med pa'i tshul lugs bstan pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pas ngo bo nyid med pa'i tshul lugs bstan pa gsungs pa /
translated: In an intermediate verse, he teaches the system of realitylessness:

original: 'di las bsal bya ci yang med //
analyzed: 'di las bsal bya ci yang med //
translated: There is nothing at all to be removed from this,

original: gzhag par bya ba cung zad med //
analyzed: gzhag par bya ba cung zad med //
translated: Nor the slightest thing to be added.

original: yang dag nyid la yang dag lta //
analyzed: yang dag nyid la yang dag lta //
translated: The real is to be seen as real;

original: yang dag mthong na rnam par grol //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag mthong na rnam par grol // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: When the real is seen, one is liberated.

original: mthong ba'i lam la sogs pas bsdus pa'i bdag nyid kyi chos 'di dag la gdod ma nas de kho na nyid kyi ngo bos sngar yod pa bsal bar bya ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam pa ci yang med la /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la sogs pas bsdus pa'i bdag nyid kyi chos 'di dag la gdod ma nas de kho na nyid kyi ngo bos sngar yod pa bsal bar bya ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam pa ci yang med la /
translated: In these phenomena, which are included in the path of insight, etc., there is nothing at all, in the aspect of an opposing class, that is to be removed as something previously existent by the reality nature.

original: gsar du gzhag par bya ba'i gnyen po'i phyogs cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gsar du gzhag par bya ba'i gnyen po'i phyogs cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Nor is there the slightest thing that is to be newly added as something not existent, in the aspect of an antidote.

original: 'on kyang mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa de bzhin du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid yang dag pa'i mtha' dgag pa dang sgrub pa 'ga' yang ma grub pa'i don nyid la phyin ci ma log pa can gyi blo gros don ji lta ba yang dag pa nyid du
analyzed: 'on kyang mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa de bzhin du ro gcig pa'i mtshan nyid yang dag pa'i mtha' dgag pa dang sgrub pa 'ga' yang ma grub pa'i don nyid la phyin ci ma log pa can gyi blo gros don ji lta ba yang dag pa nyid du
translated: However, just as on the path of seeing and so forth, the characteristic of one taste is also the non-erroneous mind that sees the meaning of the non-establishment of any negation or affirmation of the perfect limit.

original: lta ba zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: lta ba zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: It is called ‚Äúthe view of the perfect reality just as it is.‚Äù

original: de bas na sgyu ma'i rgyal po sgyu ma'i rgyal po gzhan gyis pham par byas pa ltar phyin ci log rnam par ldog pas mthar yang dag pa'i mtha' yang ma mthong ba'i tshul gyis mthong ba na yongs @60b su 'dzin pa mtha' dag las rnam par grol bar
analyzed: de bas na sgyu ma'i rgyal po sgyu ma'i rgyal po gzhan gyis pham par byas pa ltar phyin ci log rnam par ldog pas mthar yang dag pa'i mtha' yang ma mthong ba'i tshul gyis mthong ba na yongs @60b su 'dzin pa mtha' dag las rnam par grol bar
translated: Therefore, just as an illusory king is defeated by another illusory king, in the end, when the perfect limit is seen by the reversal of error in a manner of not seeing, one is completely liberated from all clinging.

original: 'gyur ro // de ltar skye ba dang 'jig pas stong pa nyid kyis bdag med pa dang / phyi rol gyi don mngon par ma grub pa nyid kyis sems tsam du rnam par rig pa dang / gzung ba med na 'dzin pa med pa nyid kyis gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang ;
analyzed: 'gyur ro // de ltar skye ba dang 'jig pas stong pa nyid kyis bdag med pa dang / phyi rol gyi don mngon par ma grub pa nyid kyis sems tsam du rnam par rig pa dang / gzung ba med na 'dzin pa med pa nyid kyis gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang ;
translated: Thus, through the emptiness of arising and destruction, one practices yoga in selflessness; through the nonestablishment of external objects, one practices yoga in consciousness only; through the nonexistence of an apprehender when there is no apprehended, one practices yoga in the nature of nonduality;

original: de kho nar 'ga' yang dmigs pa med pa nyid kyis mtshan ma med pa la rnal 'byor du byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de kho nar 'ga' yang dmigs pa med pa nyid kyis mtshan ma med pa la rnal 'byor du byed par 'gyur te /
translated: and through the nonexistence of any observation of reality, one practices yoga in the absence of signs.

original: de'i stobs kyis nam mkha' lta bur chos thams cad rnam par mi rtog pa'i mtshan nyid so so rang gis rig par bya ba ji ltar mngon du byas pas gdod ma nas skyes pa dang ma skyes pa med pa zad pa dang mi skye ba'i bdag nyid rtogs
analyzed: de'i stobs kyis nam mkha' lta bur chos thams cad rnam par mi rtog pa'i mtshan nyid so so rang gis rig par bya ba ji ltar mngon du byas pas gdod ma nas skyes pa dang ma skyes pa med pa zad pa dang mi skye ba'i bdag nyid rtogs
translated: By the power of that, one will attain the fruit of realization, the nonconceptual characteristic of all phenomena like space, to be understood by individual self-cognition, just as it is actualized, with the nature of cessation and nonarising, without any originally arisen or nonarisen exhaustion.

original: pa'i 'bras bu 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di rig par bya'o //
analyzed: pa'i 'bras bu 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood.

original: de'i 'og tu mthong ba'i lam gyi ngo bo dngos gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mthong ba'i lam gyi ngo bo dngos gsungs pa /
translated: After that, he taught the essence of the path of seeing:

original: sbyin pa la sogs re rer ni //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs re rer ni //
translated: Each of the perfections such as giving

original: de dag phan tshun bsdus pa gang //üîΩskad cig gcig pa'i bzod pa yis //
analyzed: de dag phan tshun bsdus pa gang // skad cig gcig pa'i bzod pa yis //
translated: is included in each other perfection.

original: bsdus pa de 'dir mthong ba'i lam //
analyzed: bsdus pa de 'dir mthong ba'i lam //
translated: The path of seeing is here the perfection

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: of the instantaneous acceptance of the Dharma.üîΩThe path of seeing is the generation of the six perfections such as giving, which are divided into thirtysix aspects, by the act of seeing.

original: gang zhig mthong ba'i byed pas sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug la rab tu dbye bas rnam pa sum cu rtsa drug can skyed par byed pa ni so sor sbyin pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo re rer phan tshun bsdus pa sgrub parüîΩbyed pa gang yin pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang zhig mthong ba'i byed pas sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug la rab tu dbye bas rnam pa sum cu rtsa drug can skyed par byed pa ni so sor sbyin pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo re rer phan tshun bsdus pa sgrub par byed pa gang yin pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The perfection of the instantaneous acceptance of the Dharma is the path of seeing in this context of the realization of the peak.

original: skad cig ma gcig pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid sdug bsngal la sogs pa chos shes pa'i bzod pas bsdus pa ni rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa'i skabs 'dir mthong ba'i lam yin no //
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid sdug bsngal la sogs pa chos shes pa'i bzod pas bsdus pa ni rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa'i skabs 'dir mthong ba'i lam yin no //
translated: The perfection of the instantaneous acceptance of the Dharma is the perfection of the instantaneous acceptance of the Dharma that is included in the acceptance of the knowledge of the Dharma of suffering, etc., which has the nature of the knowledge of the single instant.

original: de skyes na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi po so sor dgu'i bdag nyid 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi dbye bas rnam par rtog pa brgya rtsa brgyad spangs pas de dag gis bsdus pa'i sa bon gyi nyon
analyzed: de skyes na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi po so sor dgu'i bdag nyid 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi dbye bas rnam par rtog pa brgya rtsa brgyad spangs pas de dag gis bsdus pa'i sa bon gyi nyon
translated: When that is generated, one obtains the one hundred and eight seeds of the afflictions that are included in the abandonment of the one hundred and eight conceptual thoughts of the desire, form, and formless realms, which are the four types of conceptual thoughts of apprehendeds and apprehenders, each of which has nine aspects.üîΩBy the reality of dependent origination, one obtains the abandonment of the one hundred and eight seeds of the afflictions that are included in the abandonment of the one hundred and eight conceptual thoughts.

original: mongs pa brgya rtsa brgyad spangs pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos nyid kyis 'thob po de'i 'og tu de la dbang du byed pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsungs pa /üîΩde nas seng ge rnam pa sgyid pa'i //
analyzed: mongs pa brgya rtsa brgyad spangs pa ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos nyid kyis 'thob po de'i 'og tu de la dbang du byed pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsungs pa / de nas seng ge rnam pa sgyid pa'i //
translated: After that, the samƒÅdhi that is mastery over that is stated:

original: ting nge 'dzin la snyoms zhugs nas //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la snyoms zhugs nas //
translated: Then, having entered into the samƒÅdhiüîΩOf the aspect of the lion,üîΩOne realizes the forward and reverse

original: rten cing 'brel 'byung lugs mthun dang // lugs mi mthun la rtogs par byed //üîΩces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel 'byung lugs mthun dang // lugs mi mthun la rtogs par byed // ces bya ba'o //
translated: Processes of dependent origination.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam par rtog pa @61a * //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam par rtog pa @61a * //
translated: The conceptual thoughts that are discordant factors

original: bzod pas nye bar bsal ba'i de ma thag rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis bag tsha ba med pas seng ge rnam par bsgyings pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas dus phyis bsgom pa'i lam du gtogs pas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba
analyzed: bzod pas nye bar bsal ba'i de ma thag rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis bag tsha ba med pas seng ge rnam par bsgyings pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas dus phyis bsgom pa'i lam du gtogs pas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba
translated: Through the power of patience, he enters the meditative stabilization called the lion‚Äôs sport, which is free of the anxiety of conceptual thought.

original: la ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed do zhes pa la sogs pa lugs dang mthun pa dang / skye ba 'gags pas rga shi 'gag go zhes pa la sogs pa lugs dang mi mthun par yang dag par rtog par byed do //
analyzed: la ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed do zhes pa la sogs pa lugs dang mthun pa dang / skye ba 'gags pas rga shi 'gag go zhes pa la sogs pa lugs dang mi mthun par yang dag par rtog par byed do //
translated: Later, he enters the path of meditation and correctly analyzes dependent origination in forward and reverse progressions, from ‚ÄúConditioned by ignorance, there are actions‚Äù and so on in forward progression and from ‚ÄúWhen ignorance is stopped, actions are stopped‚Äù and so on in reverse progression.üîΩThe path of meditation is so called because it is the path on which the meditation of the peak of the path of seeing arises.

original: de ltar mthong ba'i lam gyi rtse mo thob pa las bsgom pa'i lam 'byung bas bsgom pa'o lam gyi rtse mo gsungs pa /üîΩ'gog dang bcas pa'i snyoms 'jug dgur //
analyzed: de ltar mthong ba'i lam gyi rtse mo thob pa las bsgom pa'i lam 'byung bas bsgom pa'o lam gyi rtse mo gsungs pa / 'gog dang bcas pa'i snyoms 'jug dgur //
translated: The peak of the path of meditation is taught:üîΩHaving gone and returned twice

original: rnam pa gnyis su song 'ongs nas //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis su song 'ongs nas //
translated: in the nine meditative attainments with cessation,

original: 'dod par gtogs pa'i rnam par shes //
analyzed: 'dod par gtogs pa'i rnam par shes //
translated: the consciousness belonging to the desire realm

original: mnyam gzhag min pa'i mtshams bzung ste //
analyzed: mnyam gzhag min pa'i mtshams bzung ste //
translated: is arrested in the meditative equipoise.

original: thod rgal du ni snyoms 'jug pa //
analyzed: thod rgal du ni snyoms 'jug pa //
translated: One who skips enters meditative attainment by skipping over.

original: gcig dang gnyis gsum bzhi dang lnga //
analyzed: gcig dang gnyis gsum bzhi dang lnga //
translated: One, two, three, four, five,

original: drug dang bdun dang brgyad rgal nas //üîΩ'gog pa'i bar du mi 'drar 'gro //
analyzed: drug dang bdun dang brgyad rgal nas // 'gog pa'i bar du mi 'drar 'gro //
translated: six, seven, and eight

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: one proceeds to the dissimilar, up to cessation.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni ting nge 'dzin gyi rtsal sbyangs pas snyoms par 'jug pa la dbang ba nyid kyis bsgom pa'i lam phul du phyin par bya ba'i phyir rtog pa dang dpyod pa la sogs pa'i yan lag lnga dang ldan pa bsam gtan dang po dang
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni ting nge 'dzin gyi rtsal sbyangs pas snyoms par 'jug pa la dbang ba nyid kyis bsgom pa'i lam phul du phyin par bya ba'i phyir rtog pa dang dpyod pa la sogs pa'i yan lag lnga dang ldan pa bsam gtan dang po dang
translated: Bodhisattvas, through training in the power of concentration, have mastery over meditative attainment and in order to perfect the path of meditation, they enter the first absorption that possesses five branches such as investigation and analysis,

original: / nang yongs su dang ba la sogs pa yan lag bzhi dang ldan pa bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / btang snyoms la sogs pa yan lag lnga dang ldan pa bsam gtan gsum pa dang / dran pa dang shes bzhin la sogs pa yan lag bzhi dang ldan pa bsam gtan bzhi pa rnams dang /
analyzed: / nang yongs su dang ba la sogs pa yan lag bzhi dang ldan pa bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / btang snyoms la sogs pa yan lag lnga dang ldan pa bsam gtan gsum pa dang / dran pa dang shes bzhin la sogs pa yan lag bzhi dang ldan pa bsam gtan bzhi pa rnams dang /
translated: the second absorption that possesses four branches such as complete internal clarity, the third absorption that possesses five branches such as equanimity and the fourth absorption that possesses four branches such as mindfulness and introspection.

original: nam mkha' dang rnam shes mtha' yas so zhes pa mos pa sngon du gtong ba can nam mkha' mtha' yas dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / ci yang med pa nyid dang / yod pa yang ma yin pa med pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba sngon du gtong ba can ci yang med pa dang /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang rnam shes mtha' yas so zhes pa mos pa sngon du gtong ba can nam mkha' mtha' yas dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / ci yang med pa nyid dang / yod pa yang ma yin pa med pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba sngon du gtong ba can ci yang med pa dang /
translated: The base of infinite space and the base of infinite consciousness are preceded by the aspiration i will attain the base of infinite space or i will attain the base of infinite consciousness.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched rnams dang / tshor ba dang mtshan mar 'du shes pa 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi skye mched rnams dang / tshor ba dang mtshan mar 'du shes pa 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
translated: The base of nothingness is preceded by the aspiration i will attain the base of nothingness, which is the state of neither perception nor nonperception and the meditative attainment of cessation that has the nature of the cessation of feeling and discernment.

original: de ltar yul rnam pa dgu la bsam gtan dang po nas bzung ste 'gog pa'i bar du yar song ba dang / @61b 'gog pa nas bzung ste bsam gtan dang po'i bar du 'ong ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar yul rnam pa dgu la bsam gtan dang po nas bzung ste 'gog pa'i bar du yar song ba dang / @61b 'gog pa nas bzung ste bsam gtan dang po'i bar du 'ong ba ste /
translated: Thus, in terms of the nine objects, one ascends from the first absorption to cessation and descends from cessation to the first absorption.

original: de ltar lugs dang mthun pa dang mi mthun pa 'gro ba dang 'ong ba seng ge rnam par bsgyings pa bstan pa gnyis dang / yang bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa rim gyis 'gog pa'i bar du snyoms par 'jug pa khyad par can gyis 'gro ba dang /
analyzed: de ltar lugs dang mthun pa dang mi mthun pa 'gro ba dang 'ong ba seng ge rnam par bsgyings pa bstan pa gnyis dang / yang bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa rim gyis 'gog pa'i bar du snyoms par 'jug pa khyad par can gyis 'gro ba dang /
translated: Thus, he goes and comes in forward and reverse order through the absorptions and formless states and he goes and comes through the special meditative attainment of the first absorption and so on up to the meditative attainment of cessation.üîΩHe goes by alternating each meditative attainment of cessation with each level from the first absorption to cessation.

original: de'i 'og tu bsam gtan dang po nas bzung ste 'gog pa'i bar du 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa re re spel bar 'gro ba dang / yang 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs nas de las langs te 'gog pa gcig pur dor nas de ma thag pa'i yod min med min gyi skye mched la snyoms par 'jug cing /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bsam gtan dang po nas bzung ste 'gog pa'i bar du 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa re re spel bar 'gro ba dang / yang 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs nas de las langs te 'gog pa gcig pur dor nas de ma thag pa'i yod min med min gyi skye mched la snyoms par 'jug cing /
translated: He goes by entering meditative attainment of cessation and then rising from it and discarding that single meditative attainment of cessation and immediately entering meditative attainment of the base of neither discernment nor nondiscernment.

original: de las langs nas 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rnam par shes pa mnyam par ma bzhag pa mtshams su gzhag ste /
analyzed: de las langs nas 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rnam par shes pa mnyam par ma bzhag pa mtshams su gzhag ste /
translated: He goes by rising from that and placing the unobscured, nonconcentrated consciousness of the desire realm in equipoise.

original: thabs mkhas pas de nas 'gog pa la'o //
analyzed: thabs mkhas pas de nas 'gog pa la'o //
translated: He goes by means of skill in means.

original: de las langs nas mnyam par ma bzhag pa la'o //
analyzed: de las langs nas mnyam par ma bzhag pa la'o //
translated: He goes by rising from that and entering the unobscured, nonconcentrated state.

original: de nas gnyis dor nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched la'o //
analyzed: de nas gnyis dor nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched la'o //
translated: Then, having eliminated two, he enters the base of nothingness.

original: de las langs nas mnyam par ma bzhag pa la'o //
analyzed: de las langs nas mnyam par ma bzhag pa la'o //
translated: Having arisen from that, he enters the non-concentrated state.

original: de bzhin du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa la mar babs pa'i tshul gyis mnyam par ma bzhag pa rab tu spel te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa la mar babs pa'i tshul gyis mnyam par ma bzhag pa rab tu spel te /
translated: In the same way, he enters the base of infinite consciousness and so on, gradually descending, and increases the non-concentrated state.

original: gsum dang / bzhi dang / lnga dang / drug dang / bdun dang / brgyad dor nas bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: gsum dang / bzhi dang / lnga dang / drug dang / bdun dang / brgyad dor nas bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: Having eliminated three, four, five, six, seven, and eight, he enters the first concentration.

original: de las langs nas mnyam par ma bzhag pa la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: de las langs nas mnyam par ma bzhag pa la gnas pa ste /
translated: Having arisen from that, he abides in the non-concentrated state.

original: de ltar mi 'dra bar 'gro bas thod rgal gyi snyoms par 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar mi 'dra bar 'gro bas thod rgal gyi snyoms par 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Thus, because of proceeding in a different way, it is the alternating meditative attainment.

original: bsgom pa'i lam des spang bar bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam des spang bar bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the conception to be abandoned by that path of cultivation?

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi las re zhig gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi las re zhig gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po gsungs pa /
translated: From among the four types of conceptions that are its counteragents, first the conception of the apprehended is stated:

original: mdor bsdus rgyas dang sangs rgyas kyis //
analyzed: mdor bsdus rgyas dang sangs rgyas kyis //
translated: In brief, extensive, and buddha-related.

original: bstang bas yongs su ma bzung dang // dus gsum yon tan med pa dang / legs pa'i lam ni rnam gsum la //üîΩgzung ba'i rnam rtog 'di gcig ste //
analyzed: bstang bas yongs su ma bzung dang // dus gsum yon tan med pa dang / legs pa'i lam ni rnam gsum la // gzung ba'i rnam rtog 'di gcig ste //
translated: The three virtues are the virtues of the past, present, and future.

original: sbyor ba'i rnam pa'i spyod yul can //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i rnam pa'i spyod yul can //
translated: The three paths are the path of accumulation, the path of application, and the path of seeing.

original: zhes bya ba'o //üîΩgsung rab kyi don gang yin pa de bzhin nyid la sogs pa mi shes pas chos mdor bsdus pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid mi shes pas chos rgyas pa dang / ji skad bshad pa'i don la nan tan mi byed pas sangs @62a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o // gsung rab kyi don gang yin pa de bzhin nyid la sogs pa mi shes pas chos mdor bsdus pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid mi shes pas chos rgyas pa dang / ji skad bshad pa'i don la nan tan mi byed pas sangs @62a * //
translated: The three virtues are the virtues of the past, present, and future.üîΩThe three paths are the path of accumulation, the path of application, and the path of seeing.üîΩThe three virtues are the virtues of the past, present, and future.üîΩThe three paths are the path of accumulation, the path of application, and the path of seeing.üîΩThe three virtues are the virtues of the past, present, and future.

analyzed: rgyas kyis bstang ste yongs su ma bzung ba dang // phyir mi ldog pa la sogs pa sbyor ba'i lam gyi yon tan med pas 'das pa'i yon tan med pa dang // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid mthong ba'i lam gyi yon tan med pas da ltar ba'i yon tan med pa dang /
translated: The three paths are the path of accumulation, the path of application, and the path of seeing.üîΩThe three virtues are the virtues of the past, present, and future.üîΩThe three paths are the path of accumulation, the path of application, and the path of seeing.üîΩThe three virtues are the virtues of the past, present, and future.üîΩThe three paths are the path of accumulation, the path of application, and the path of seeing.üîΩThe three virtues are the virtues of the past, present, and future.üîΩThe three paths are the path of accumulation, the path of application, and the path of seeing.üîΩThe three virtues are the virtues of the past, present, and future.üîΩThe three paths are the path of accumulation, the path of application, and the path of seeing.üîΩThe three virtues are the virtues of the past, present, and future.üîΩThe three paths are the path of accumulation, the path of application, and the path of seeing.üîΩThe three virtues are the virtues of the past, present, and future.üîΩThe three paths are the path of accumulation, the path of application, and the path of seeing.üîΩThe three virtues are the virtues of the past, present, and future.üîΩThe three paths are the path of accumulation, the path of application, and the path of seeing.üîΩThe three virtues are the virtues of the past, present, and future.üîΩThe three paths are the path of accumulation, the path of application, and the path of seeing.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par bsgom pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid bsgom pa'i lam gyi yon tan med pas ma 'ongs pa'i yon tan med pa dang / phyin ci log zhi ba nyid la sogs pas mya ngan las las 'das pa la sbyor ba legs pa'i lam dang /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par bsgom pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid bsgom pa'i lam gyi yon tan med pas ma 'ongs pa'i yon tan med pa dang / phyin ci log zhi ba nyid la sogs pas mya ngan las las 'das pa la sbyor ba legs pa'i lam dang /
translated: Since it is the path that connects one to nirvana through the pacification of error and so on, it is the excellent path.üîΩSince it is the accomplishment of emptiness itself, it is the excellent path that sees thatness.

original: stong pa nyid mngon par sgrub pa nyid kyis de kho na nyid mthong ba legs pa'i lam dang / rang bzhin med pa goms par byed pa nyid kyis yang dag par bsgom pa legs pa'i lam mi shes pa ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid mngon par sgrub pa nyid kyis de kho na nyid mthong ba legs pa'i lam dang / rang bzhin med pa goms par byed pa nyid kyis yang dag par bsgom pa legs pa'i lam mi shes pa ste /
translated: Since it is the cultivation of the absence of intrinsic existence itself, it is the excellent path of correct meditation.

original: de ltar gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po bsgom pa'i lam gyi sbyor ba'i gnas skabs kyi yul can rnam pa dgu'o //
analyzed: de ltar gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang po bsgom pa'i lam gyi sbyor ba'i gnas skabs kyi yul can rnam pa dgu'o //
translated: Thus there are nine types of subjects that are the objects of the first conception of the object of meditation on the path of meditation that is the stage of preparation.

original: de'i rjes la gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis gsungs pa /üîΩgnyis pa sems dang sems byung rnams //
analyzed: de'i rjes la gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis gsungs pa / gnyis pa sems dang sems byung rnams //
translated: After that, the second conception of the object of meditation is stated.üîΩThe second is asserted to be the subject

original: 'jug pa'i yul can yin bzhed de //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i yul can yin bzhed de //
translated: that engages minds and mental factors.

original: sems mi skye dang byang chub kyi //
analyzed: sems mi skye dang byang chub kyi //
translated: Not generating the mind, not attending to the essence of enlightenment,

original: snying po yid la mi byed dang // theg pa dman pa yid byed dang // rdzogs pa'i byang chub yid mi byed //
analyzed: snying po yid la mi byed dang // theg pa dman pa yid byed dang // rdzogs pa'i byang chub yid mi byed //
translated: attending to the Individual Vehicle, not attending to perfect enlightenment,üîΩmeditation and nonmeditation, the opposite of those,

original: bsgom dang bsgom pa med pa dang // de dag las ni bzlog pa nyid dang // ji bzhin don min rnam rtog pa //üîΩbsgom pa'i lam la shes par bya //
analyzed: bsgom dang bsgom pa med pa dang // de dag las ni bzlog pa nyid dang // ji bzhin don min rnam rtog pa // bsgom pa'i lam la shes par bya //
translated: and conceptualizing a meaning that is not as it is

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: should be understood as the path of meditation.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pa dang bral bas byang chub tu sems mi skyed pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi rjes su mthun pa nyid kyi bsod nams khyad par du 'phags pa med pas byang chub kyi snying po yid la mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pa dang bral bas byang chub tu sems mi skyed pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi rjes su mthun pa nyid kyi bsod nams khyad par du 'phags pa med pas byang chub kyi snying po yid la mi byed pa dang /
translated: Not generating the mind of enlightenment due to being separated from spiritual friends and so on, not attending to the essence of enlightenment due to the absence of the superiority of merit that is in accord with the Buddha,

original: 'khor bas 'jigs pa nyid dang gzhan don la mi ltos pa nyid kyis theg pa dman pa yid la byed pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par sgrub pa med pas rdzogs pa'i byang chub yid la mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: 'khor bas 'jigs pa nyid dang gzhan don la mi ltos pa nyid kyis theg pa dman pa yid la byed pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par sgrub pa med pas rdzogs pa'i byang chub yid la mi byed pa dang /
translated: the attitude of not aspiring to perfect enlightenment, because of not accomplishing the perfection of wisdom,üîΩthe attitude of meditating, because of wanting to attain omniscience through meditating on the perfection of wisdom,üîΩthe attitude of not meditating, because of wanting to attain it without meditating on it,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'dod pas bsgom pa dang / de nyid ma bsgoms pas thob par 'dod pas bsgom pa med pa dang / bsgoms pa dang ma bsgoms pa gnyis kas thob par 'dod pas gnyis ka dang /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par 'dod pas bsgom pa dang / de nyid ma bsgoms pas thob par 'dod pas bsgom pa med pa dang / bsgoms pa dang ma bsgoms pa gnyis kas thob par 'dod pas gnyis ka dang /
translated: the attitude of both, because of wanting to attain it through both meditating and not meditating,üîΩthe attitude of neither, because of wanting to attain it neither through meditating nor through not meditating,

original: bsgoms pas kyang ma yin ma bsgoms pas kyang ma yin pas 'thob par @62b 'dod pas gnyis ka ma yin pa dang / phyin ci log tu zhugs pa nyid kyis don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: bsgoms pas kyang ma yin ma bsgoms pas kyang ma yin pas 'thob par @62b 'dod pas gnyis ka ma yin pa dang / phyin ci log tu zhugs pa nyid kyis don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa 'dzin pa ste /
translated: and the attitude of apprehending things in a way that is not in accordance with reality, because of being mistaken.

original: de ltar gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa bsgom pa'i lam gyi sems dang sems las byung ba 'jug pa'i skabs kyi yul can rnam pa dgu'o //
analyzed: de ltar gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa bsgom pa'i lam gyi sems dang sems las byung ba 'jug pa'i skabs kyi yul can rnam pa dgu'o //
translated: Thus, there are nine aspects of the subject in the context of the path of cultivation, which is the second conception of the apprehended.

original: de'i 'og tu 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang po gsungs pa //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang po gsungs pa //
translated: After that, the first conception of the apprehender is stated:üîΩThe sphere of the designation of sentient beings,

original: sems can btags pa'i spyod yul dang // chos btags pa dang stong min nyid //
analyzed: sems can btags pa'i spyod yul dang // chos btags pa dang stong min nyid //
translated: The designation of phenomena, and non-emptiness,üîΩAttachment, differentiation, identity,üîΩMaking things real, the three vehicles,üîΩAnd impure qualities,üîΩDisturbance in conduct,

original: chags dang rab dbye bdag nyid dang // dngos por byed dang theg gsum dang // yon ni dag pa ma yin dang // spyod pa rnam par 'khrugs pa dang // 'dzin par byed pa dang por te //
analyzed: chags dang rab dbye bdag nyid dang // dngos por byed dang theg gsum dang // yon ni dag pa ma yin dang // spyod pa rnam par 'khrugs pa dang // 'dzin par byed pa dang por te //
translated: The first is the apprehender,

original: shes par bya bar bsgrags pa yin //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes par bya bar bsgrags pa yin //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
translated: Proclaimed as what is to be known.

original: rdzas su yod par mi skye bas sems can du btags pa dang / snang ba tsam du zad pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i chos su btags pa dang // gang zag dang chos don gzhan gyis stong yang rang gi ngo bor gnas pas stong pa ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: rdzas su yod par mi skye bas sems can du btags pa dang / snang ba tsam du zad pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i chos su btags pa dang // gang zag dang chos don gzhan gyis stong yang rang gi ngo bor gnas pas stong pa ma yin pa dang /
translated: It is designated as sentient beings because it does not arise as a substantial existent, it is designated as phenomena such as form because it is merely an appearance, it is not empty because it is empty of other objects, persons and phenomena, but it exists as its own entity.

original: de dag la dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa nyid kyi sgo nas lam la chags pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid so so ba nyid kyis rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang / ji skad bshad pa'i ched du bya ba mi byed pas dman pa 'chad du bya ba byed pa dang /
analyzed: de dag la dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa nyid kyi sgo nas lam la chags pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid so so ba nyid kyis rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang / ji skad bshad pa'i ched du bya ba mi byed pas dman pa 'chad du bya ba byed pa dang /
translated: It is the path of attachment because it is the object of observation and nonobservation, it is the thorough differentiation because it thoroughly differentiates the individual characteristics of form and so on and it is the activity that is to be performed because it does not perform the purpose as it is explained.

original: gzugs la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir theg pa gsum gyis nges par 'byung ba dang / yang dag par rab tu ma zhugs pa nyid kyis yon dag pa ma yin pa dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa 'khor gsum du dmigs pas spyod pa rnam par 'khrugs pa'i gang zag yod par 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir theg pa gsum gyis nges par 'byung ba dang / yang dag par rab tu ma zhugs pa nyid kyis yon dag pa ma yin pa dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa 'khor gsum du dmigs pas spyod pa rnam par 'khrugs pa'i gang zag yod par 'dzin pa ste /
translated: Because of not apprehending form, etc., there is the person who holds to the three vehicles for emancipation, and because of not correctly engaging, there is the person who holds to the lack of purity of the perfections.

original: de ltar 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang po bsgom pa'i lam gyi sbyor ba'i gnas skabs kyi yul can rnam pa dgur shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang po bsgom pa'i lam gyi sbyor ba'i gnas skabs kyi yul can rnam pa dgur shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should understand that the first conception of holding is the nine aspects of the subjective side of the path of meditation in the state of preparation.

original: de'i rjes la 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa mdor gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i rjes la 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa mdor gsungs pa /
translated: The second conception of holding is stated in brief:

original: sems can btags dang de rgyu yi //
analyzed: sems can btags dang de rgyu yi //
translated: The object of the conception of sentient beings and its cause

original: yul can de yis rnam 'joms pas //üîΩbsgom pa'i lam dang 'brel ba yi //üîΩmi mthun phyogs gzhan rnam pa dgu //
analyzed: yul can de yis rnam 'joms pas // bsgom pa'i lam dang 'brel ba yi // mi mthun phyogs gzhan rnam pa dgu //
translated: are destroyed by that subject,üîΩand the other nine aspects

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: of the discordant class are related to the path of meditation.

original: so so'i skye bo dang 'phags pa'i gang zag tu btags pa dang / der rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu ma rig pa dang ye shes kyis bsdus pa'i phung po'i rgyun la mngon par @63a * //üîΩzhen pa'i yul can bsgom pa'i lam gyis yang dag par gzhom par bya ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dang 'phags pa'i gang zag tu btags pa dang / der rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu ma rig pa dang ye shes kyis bsdus pa'i phung po'i rgyun la mngon par @63a * // zhen pa'i yul can bsgom pa'i lam gyis yang dag par gzhom par bya ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: The conception of the person as the basis of the aggregates, which are included in ignorance or in transcendent wisdom, is the conception of the person as the basis of the aggregates, which are included in ignorance or in transcendent wisdom.

original: lam de dang 'brel ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa rnam pa dgu yin no //üîΩji ltar rnam pa dgu yin zhe na /üîΩbar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa gsungs pa //üîΩthams cad mkhyen nyid gsum dag gi / bdag nyid ji bzhin sgrib rnam gsum //
analyzed: lam de dang 'brel ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa rnam pa dgu yin no // ji ltar rnam pa dgu yin zhe na / bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa gsungs pa // thams cad mkhyen nyid gsum dag gi / bdag nyid ji bzhin sgrib rnam gsum //
translated: The conception of the person as the basis of the aggregates, which are included in ignorance or in transcendent wisdom, is the conception of the person as the basis of the aggregates, which are included in ignorance or in transcendent wisdom.üîΩThe conception of the person as the basis of the aggregates, which are included in ignorance or in transcendent wisdom, is the conception of the person as the basis of the aggregates, which are included in ignorance or in transcendent wisdom.üîΩThe conception of the person as the basis of the aggregates, which are included in ignorance or in transcendent wisdom, is the conception of the person as the basis of the aggregates, which are included in ignorance or in transcendent wisdom.üîΩThe conception of the person as the basis of the aggregates, which are included in ignorance or in transcendent wisdom, is the conception of the person as the basis of the aggregates, which are included in ignorance or in transcendent wisdom.

original: zhi lam de bzhin nyid sogs dang // mtshungs par ldan dang mi ldan dang // mi mnyam sdug bsngal la sogs dang // nyon mongs rnams khyi rang bzhin dang // gnyis su med la kun rmongs la //
analyzed: zhi lam de bzhin nyid sogs dang // mtshungs par ldan dang mi ldan dang // mi mnyam sdug bsngal la sogs dang // nyon mongs rnams khyi rang bzhin dang // gnyis su med la kun rmongs la //
translated: The conception of the person as the basis of the aggregates, which are included in ignorance or in transcendent wisdom, is the conception of the person as the basis of the aggregates, which are included in ignorance or in transcendent wisdom.üîΩThe conception of the person as the basis of the aggregates, which

original: rnam par rtog pa tha mar bzhed //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa tha mar bzhed //
translated: The last is the conceptual.üîΩ

original: ces bya ba'o //üîΩrnam pa thams cad ma shes pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sgrib pa la kun tu rmongs pa dang / lam thams cad rnam par ma shes pas lam shes pa nyid kyi sgrib pa dang / gzhi thams cad rnam par ma shes pas gzhi thams cad shes pa nyid kyis sgrib pa dang /
analyzed: ces bya ba'o // rnam pa thams cad ma shes pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sgrib pa la kun tu rmongs pa dang / lam thams cad rnam par ma shes pas lam shes pa nyid kyi sgrib pa dang / gzhi thams cad rnam par ma shes pas gzhi thams cad shes pa nyid kyis sgrib pa dang /
translated: The last is the conception of the knowable.üîΩThe obscurations to the knowledge of all aspects, due to not knowing all aspects; the obscurations to the knowledge of the path, due to not knowing all paths; the obscurations to the knowledge of bases, due to not knowing all bases;

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par ma shes pas thams cad zhi ba'i lam dang / gzugs la sogs pa dang de bzhin nyid yongs su ma shes pas de bzhin nyid la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang mi ldan pa dang /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par ma shes pas thams cad zhi ba'i lam dang / gzugs la sogs pa dang de bzhin nyid yongs su ma shes pas de bzhin nyid la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang mi ldan pa dang /
translated: the obscurations to the knowledge of all, due to not knowing the perfection of wisdom; the obscurations to the path of pacification of all, due to not knowing form and so on and suchness;

original: bdud la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo yongs su ma shes pas mi mnyam pa nyid dang / don la sgra ji bzhin par 'dzin pa nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba'i bden pa la sogs pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa'i ngo bo glo bur ba nyid yongs su ma shes pas nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin dang /
analyzed: bdud la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo yongs su ma shes pas mi mnyam pa nyid dang / don la sgra ji bzhin par 'dzin pa nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba'i bden pa la sogs pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa'i ngo bo glo bur ba nyid yongs su ma shes pas nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin dang /
translated: Since they do not fully understand the nature of demons and so on, they are confused about the reality of suffering and so on and the nature of attachment and so on.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su ma shes pas gnyis su med pa la kun tu rmongs pa ste /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su ma shes pas gnyis su med pa la kun tu rmongs pa ste /
translated: Since they do not fully understand the characteristics of apprehended objects and the apprehending subject, they are confused about nonduality.

original: de ltar na 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa tha ma bsgom pa'i lam gyi sems dang sems las byung ba'i gnas skabs kyi yul can rnam pa dgur bzhed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa tha ma bsgom pa'i lam gyi sems dang sems las byung ba'i gnas skabs kyi yul can rnam pa dgur bzhed pa yin no //
translated: Thus they assert that the nine aspects of the object are the antidote to the last of the four types of conception, which is the conception of the path of meditation.

original: de'i phyir bsgom pa'i lam gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam pa bzhi po de dag gi dbye ba kho nas gnyen po rnam pa bzhi tha dad pa'i dbye ba yang khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir bsgom pa'i lam gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam pa bzhi po de dag gi dbye ba kho nas gnyen po rnam pa bzhi tha dad pa'i dbye ba yang khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: Therefore one should understand that the four types of antidote are differentiated by the four types of discordant classes of the path of meditation alone.

original: de ltar na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi po so sor dgu nyid @63b 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi dbye bas rnam par rtog pa brgya rtsa brgyad spangs pa na de dag gis bsdus pa'i nyon mongs pa'i
analyzed: de ltar na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnam pa bzhi po so sor dgu nyid @63b 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi dbye bas rnam par rtog pa brgya rtsa brgyad spangs pa na de dag gis bsdus pa'i nyon mongs pa'i
translated: Thus, when the four kinds of conceptualization of object and subject are abandoned, each in its nine aspects, by the division of the realms of desire, form, and formlessness, there are one hundred and eight conceptualizations.

original: bag chags brgya rtsa brgyad dang bral ba ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos nyid kyis 'thob bo //
analyzed: bag chags brgya rtsa brgyad dang bral ba ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos nyid kyis 'thob bo //
translated: When these are abandoned, one is freed from the one hundred and eight latent propensities of the afflictions that they comprise. This is attained by the reality of dependent origination.

original: de bas na bsgom pa'i lam de'i byed pa gang yin pa spang bar byas pas rnam par dag pa mthar thug pa'i sgo nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bas na bsgom pa'i lam de'i byed pa gang yin pa spang bar byas pas rnam par dag pa mthar thug pa'i sgo nas gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, the function of that path of cultivation is taught from the perspective of the ultimate purity, which is the abandonment of the afflictions.

original: yams nad 'di rnams zad nas ni //
analyzed: yams nad 'di rnams zad nas ni //
translated: When these epidemics are exhausted,

original: yun ring lon nas dbugs phyin ltar //üîΩrnam pa kun tu 'gro ba yi //
analyzed: yun ring lon nas dbugs phyin ltar // rnam pa kun tu 'gro ba yi //
translated: after a long time, one is relieved.

original: bde sgrub yon tan phun tshogs kun //
analyzed: bde sgrub yon tan phun tshogs kun //
translated: All the qualities of the attainment of bliss

original: rgya mtsho che la chu bo bzhin //üîΩ'bras bu mchog gis rab mdzes pa'i //
analyzed: rgya mtsho che la chu bo bzhin // 'bras bu mchog gis rab mdzes pa'i //
translated: are like the four rivers in the great ocean.

original: sems dpa' chen po de la ni //
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po de la ni //
translated: The great being who is beautified by the supreme fruitüîΩis like the moon in the sky.

original: rnam pa kun tu sten par byed //
analyzed: rnam pa kun tu sten par byed //
translated: One should always rely on it.

original: ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o //
translated: This is the verse.

original: rgyun ring du legs par goms pa'i stobs kyis rnam par rtog pa'i rims 'tshe bar byed pa nyid kyis yams kyi nad du gyur pa 'di rnams zad nas gnod par byed pa med pa nyid kyis dper na nad las thar pa'i skyes bu ring zhig lon nas bdeüîΩbar gnas pa thob ste dbugs phyin pa ltar /
analyzed: rgyun ring du legs par goms pa'i stobs kyis rnam par rtog pa'i rims 'tshe bar byed pa nyid kyis yams kyi nad du gyur pa 'di rnams zad nas gnod par byed pa med pa nyid kyis dper na nad las thar pa'i skyes bu ring zhig lon nas bde bar gnas pa thob ste dbugs phyin pa ltar /
translated: By the power of long-term good practice, these afflictions that harm the plague of conceptualization are exhausted. Without being harmed, it is like a person who has recovered from an illness and after a long time attains a state of well-being and relief.

original: snying rje dang thabs mkhas pa'i dbang gis rnam pa thams cad du rtse gcig pas 'gro ba'i bde ba mngon par bsgrub pa la rab tu mkhas pa theg pa gsum gyis bsdus pa'i yon tan phun sum tshogs pa ljon shing ltar rgyas pa thams cad rgya mtsho chen
analyzed: snying rje dang thabs mkhas pa'i dbang gis rnam pa thams cad du rtse gcig pas 'gro ba'i bde ba mngon par bsgrub pa la rab tu mkhas pa theg pa gsum gyis bsdus pa'i yon tan phun sum tshogs pa ljon shing ltar rgyas pa thams cad rgya mtsho chen
translated: By the power of compassion and skillful means, in all aspects with single-pointed focus, one becomes skilled in accomplishing the happiness of beings. All the perfect qualities included in the three vehicles, like a flourishing tree, flow into the great ocean

original: po la chu bo tha dad pa'i rgyun 'bab pa bzhin du //
analyzed: po la chu bo tha dad pa'i rgyun 'bab pa bzhin du //
translated: like the flow of different rivers.

original: byang chub sems dpa' bsgom pa'i lam rab kyi mthar son pa'i 'bras bus yang dag par mdzes par gyur pa'i bdag nyid chen po de la rnam pa thams cad nas rnam pa thams cad du mngon par 'ong ba'i rnam pas sten par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bsgom pa'i lam rab kyi mthar son pa'i 'bras bus yang dag par mdzes par gyur pa'i bdag nyid chen po de la rnam pa thams cad nas rnam pa thams cad du mngon par 'ong ba'i rnam pas sten par byed do //
translated: The great being who has reached the culmination of the path of cultivation, the result, is served by the bodhisattva in every way, in every respect, with a form that appears to him.

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyi rtse mo thob pa las bar chad med pa'i lam 'byung bas bar chad med pa'i rtse mo gsungs pa /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyi rtse mo thob pa las bar chad med pa'i lam 'byung bas bar chad med pa'i rtse mo gsungs pa /
translated: Since the uninterrupted path arises from attaining the peak of the path of cultivation, the peak of the uninterrupted path is stated:üîΩThe merit of beings in a billion worlds,üîΩthe ≈õrƒÅvakas,üîΩthe pratyekabuddhas,

original: stong gsum skye bo nyan thos dang // bse ru'i rtogs pa phun tshogs dang// byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med la //üîΩbkod pa'i dge rnams dper mdzad nas //
analyzed: stong gsum skye bo nyan thos dang // bse ru'i rtogs pa phun tshogs dang// byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med la // bkod pa'i dge rnams dper mdzad nas //
translated: and the bodhisattvas‚Äô faultlessüîΩare taken as examples.

original: bsod nams mang po nyid kyis ni //
analyzed: bsod nams mang po nyid kyis ni //
translated: By the mere accumulation of merit,

original: sangs rgyas nyid thob par med de //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid thob par med de //
translated: buddhahood is not attained.

original: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin //
translated: The uninterrupted samƒÅdhi

original: de ni rnam pa kun mkhyen nyid //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa kun mkhyen nyid //
translated: is the knowledge of all aspects.

original: ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o //
translated: This is stated.

original: skyes bu gang gis stong @64a * //
analyzed: skyes bu gang gis stong @64a * //
translated: The merit of beings in a billion worlds,

original: gsum gyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la bkod pa'i bsod nams mngon par 'du bya ba gang yin pa de dper mdzad nas de bas ches khyad par du 'phags pa'i bsod
analyzed: gsum gyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la bkod pa'i bsod nams mngon par 'du bya ba gang yin pa de dper mdzad nas de bas ches khyad par du 'phags pa'i bsod
translated: Having taken as an example the merit that would be created by establishing all the sentient beings of the three world systems in the faultless states of the ≈õrƒÅvaka, pratyekabuddha, and bodhisattva, the Buddha said that the merit of the first instant of the path of seeing is greater than that.üîΩBy that much greater merit, one attains buddhahood.

original: nams mang po nyid kyis sangs rgyas nyid 'thob pa la gzhan gyis bar du chod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: nams mang po nyid kyis sangs rgyas nyid 'thob pa la gzhan gyis bar du chod pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: That is the concentration without obstruction by others.

original: de ni dus gnyis par ni rnam pa kun mkhyen pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ni dus gnyis par ni rnam pa kun mkhyen pa nyid yin no //
translated: That is the knowledge of all aspects in the second period.

original: de'i dmigs pa la sogs pa mtshan nyid ji lta bur brtag ce na /
analyzed: de'i dmigs pa la sogs pa mtshan nyid ji lta bur brtag ce na /
translated: What are the characteristics of its object and so on?

original: bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pas mtshan nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pas mtshan nyid gsungs pa /
translated: The characteristics are stated in an intermediate verse:

original: 'di yi dmigs pa dngos med de //
analyzed: 'di yi dmigs pa dngos med de //
translated: Its object is non-entityness,

original: bdag po dran pa yin par bzhed //
analyzed: bdag po dran pa yin par bzhed //
translated: Its ruler is mindfulness,

original: rnam pa bzhi nyid 'di la ni //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi nyid 'di la ni //
translated: And it has four aspects.üîΩThe proponents of the highest

original: rab tu smra rnams brgyud mar rgol //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu smra rnams brgyud mar rgol //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
translated: argue in succession about this.

original: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di'i dmigs pa'i yul ni chos thams cad dngos po med pa yin no //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di'i dmigs pa'i yul ni chos thams cad dngos po med pa yin no //
translated: The objective reference of this uninterrupted concentration is the unreality of all things.

original: bdag po'i rkyen ni sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste yid la byed pa phun sum tshogs pa dran pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen ni sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste yid la byed pa phun sum tshogs pa dran pa yin no //
translated: The dominant condition is the perfect mindfulness of mental attention, beginning with the generation of the thought of enlightenment.

original: rnam pa ni rang bzhin gyi spros pa nye bar zhi ba nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa ni rang bzhin gyi spros pa nye bar zhi ba nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: The aspect is the pacification of the elaborations of intrinsic reality.

original: gnas 'di la ni gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir rtog ge rab tu smra ba rnams kyi log par rtog pa'i klan ka'i rgol ba brgyud mar 'byung bas thabs la mkhas pas de dag bsal bar bya ste /
analyzed: gnas 'di la ni gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir rtog ge rab tu smra ba rnams kyi log par rtog pa'i klan ka'i rgol ba brgyud mar 'byung bas thabs la mkhas pas de dag bsal bar bya ste /
translated: In this matter, the succession of objections of the logicians who are prone to false notions is difficult to fathom. Therefore, one should clear them away by means of skill in means.

original: 'dis ni 'di zab pa nyid bsnyad do zhes bya ba dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di zab pa nyid bsnyad do zhes bya ba dgongs pa yin no //
translated: The idea is that this is the very profundity of this matter.

original: log par rtog pa de dag gang gis bsal bar bya ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: log par rtog pa de dag gang gis bsal bar bya ba yin zhe na /
translated: By what is that false notion cleared away?

original: dmigs pa 'thad pa de yin ni //
analyzed: dmigs pa 'thad pa de yin ni //
translated: The objective reference is tenable.

original: ngo bo nyid nges gzung ba dang // rnam kun mkhyen pa nyid ye shes dang / dam pa'i don dang kun rdzob dang // sbyor dang dkon mchog gsum po dang // thabs bcas thub pa'i rtogs pa dang // phyin ci log ni lam bcas dang //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid nges gzung ba dang // rnam kun mkhyen pa nyid ye shes dang / dam pa'i don dang kun rdzob dang // sbyor dang dkon mchog gsum po dang // thabs bcas thub pa'i rtogs pa dang // phyin ci log ni lam bcas dang //
translated: The realization of the Sage together with the means,üîΩThe four inversions together with the path,üîΩThe antidotes and the counter-perverse,

original: gnyen po mi mthun phyogs dag dang // mtshan nyid dang ni bsgom pa la //
analyzed: gnyen po mi mthun phyogs dag dang // mtshan nyid dang ni bsgom pa la //
translated: The characteristics and the cultivation,

original: smra ba rnams kyis log rtog pa //
analyzed: smra ba rnams kyis log rtog pa //
translated: The misconceptions of the proponents,

original: rnam pa kun mkhyen nyid rten can //üîΩrnam pa bcu drug dag tu bzhed //
analyzed: rnam pa kun mkhyen nyid rten can // rnam pa bcu drug dag tu bzhed //
translated: The knowledge of all aspects as the basis,

original: ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o //
translated: Are accepted as having sixteen aspects.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dag dngos po med pa nyid kyis dmigs pa 'thad pa dang / rnam pa thams cad du ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid nges par bzung ba dang / tha snyad du @64b dngos po med pa dmigs pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes dang /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dag dngos po med pa nyid kyis dmigs pa 'thad pa dang / rnam pa thams cad du ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid nges par bzung ba dang / tha snyad du @64b dngos po med pa dmigs pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes dang /
translated: The apprehension of the non-existence of things through the conditioned and unconditioned, the apprehension of the nature of things through the non-existence of nature in all aspects, the knowledge of all aspects through the conventional apprehension of non-existence,

original: de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa mi dmigs pa nyid kyis sbyor ba dang / rtogs par bya ba med pa nyid kyi tshul nyid kyi rtog pas sangs rgyas dkon mchog dang /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa mi dmigs pa nyid kyis sbyor ba dang / rtogs par bya ba med pa nyid kyi tshul nyid kyi rtog pas sangs rgyas dkon mchog dang /
translated: The Jewel of the Buddha is the realization that there is no object to be realized,üîΩthe Jewel of the Dharma is the way of being that is characterized by space, free of stains,üîΩand the Jewel of the Sangha is the practice of the six transcendent perfections, the way of being that is the negation of the experience of form and so forth.

original: nam mkha'i mtshan nyid can gyi tshul nyid kyis dri ma dang bral bas chos dkon mchog dang / gzugs la sogs pa la spyod pa bkag pa'i tshul nyid kyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i dge 'dun dkon mchog dang / 'khor gsum mi dmigs pa nyid kyis thabs mkhas pa dang /
analyzed: nam mkha'i mtshan nyid can gyi tshul nyid kyis dri ma dang bral bas chos dkon mchog dang / gzugs la sogs pa la spyod pa bkag pa'i tshul nyid kyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i dge 'dun dkon mchog dang / 'khor gsum mi dmigs pa nyid kyis thabs mkhas pa dang /
translated: The skillful means is to be free of the concepts of the three spheres.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang gnyis ka'i ngo bor rtogs pa bkag pa nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i mngon par rtogs pa dang / mi rtog pa la sogs pa'i spos pa rnam par gzhag pa nyid kyis rtag pa la sogs pa phyin ci log dang /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang gnyis ka'i ngo bor rtogs pa bkag pa nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i mngon par rtogs pa dang / mi rtog pa la sogs pa'i spos pa rnam par gzhag pa nyid kyis rtag pa la sogs pa phyin ci log dang /
translated: The error of permanence, etc. is established by the arrangement of non-conceptualization, etc.üîΩThe path is established by the non-actualization of the result of the cultivation of the path.üîΩThe counteragent and the counteracted are established by the mere arrangement of the path, and by the characteristics of rejection and acceptance.

original: lam rnam par bsgom pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du mi byed pa nyid kyis lam dang / lam gyi rnam par gzhag pa tsam gyi dor ba dang blang ba'i mtshan nyid kyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po dang / yang dag par chos can med pa pa nyid kyis chos kyi mtshan nyid dang /
analyzed: lam rnam par bsgom pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du mi byed pa nyid kyis lam dang / lam gyi rnam par gzhag pa tsam gyi dor ba dang blang ba'i mtshan nyid kyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po dang / yang dag par chos can med pa pa nyid kyis chos kyi mtshan nyid dang /
translated: The characteristic of the Dharma is established by the non-existence of the real subject.üîΩThe characteristic of the absence of characteristics is established by the absence of the general and particular characteristics.

original: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid med pa nyid kyis mtshan nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bsgom pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid med pa nyid kyis mtshan nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bsgom pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: thabs la mkhas pa'i mtshan nyid rab tu mi shes pa'i rab tu smra ba nyid thams cad kyi log par rtog pas phan tshun 'gal ba lta bur sgrub pa gang yin pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rten can log par bsgrub pa bcu drug po
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa'i mtshan nyid rab tu mi shes pa'i rab tu smra ba nyid thams cad kyi log par rtog pas phan tshun 'gal ba lta bur sgrub pa gang yin pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rten can log par bsgrub pa bcu drug po
translated: The sixteen kinds of wrong practice, which are like mutual contradictions, are based on the knowledge of all things and are the wrong practices of those who do not know the characteristics of skill in means.

original: de dag byang chub sems dpa' blo gros dang ldan pa rnams kyis bden pa gnyis la brten pa'i thabs la mkhas pas rnam pa bsal bar bya bar bzhed do //
analyzed: de dag byang chub sems dpa' blo gros dang ldan pa rnams kyis bden pa gnyis la brten pa'i thabs la mkhas pas rnam pa bsal bar bya bar bzhed do //
translated: The wise bodhisattvas assert that these are to be eliminated by means of skill in means based on the two truths.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi 'grel ba shes rab sgron ma'i phreng ba zhes bya ba las skabs lda pa'i 'grel pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi 'grel ba shes rab sgron ma'i phreng ba zhes bya ba las skabs lda pa'i 'grel pa'o //
translated: This concludes the commentary to the sixth chapter of the treatise Illuminating the Principles of the Perfection of Wisdom, called The Ornament of Clear Realization, called also A Necklace of Gems.

original: rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa thos pas chos dkar po thams cad mthar gyis 'brel bar bsgom dgos pa'i phyir mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa thos pas chos dkar po thams cad mthar gyis 'brel bar bsgom dgos pa'i phyir mthar gyis pa'i mngon par rtogs pa gsungs pa /
translated: The gradual realization is taught because all virtuous dharmas must be cultivated in sequence, beginning with hearing.

original: sbyin pa shes rab bar dag @65a * //
analyzed: sbyin pa shes rab bar dag @65a * //
translated: Generosity, wisdom,

original: dang // sangs rgyas la sogs pa dran dang chos //
analyzed: dang // sangs rgyas la sogs pa dran dang chos //
translated: and mindfulness of the Buddha and so on,

original: dngos med ngo bo nyid kyis de //üîΩmthar gyis pa yi bya bar bzhed //
analyzed: dngos med ngo bo nyid kyis de // mthar gyis pa yi bya bar bzhed //
translated: are non-entities by nature.

original: ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o //
translated: They are considered to be for the gradual type.üîΩThe practice of all trainings is accomplished by the practice of the six perfections such as generosity, which have the nature of the purity of the three spheres, and by the mindfulness of the Buddha,

original: 'khor gsum rnam par dag pa'i bdag nyid kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa rnam pa drug yongs su spyad pa bslab pa thams cad yang dag par sgrub par byed pa dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa don dam par dran pa med cing yid la byar med pa'i tshul gyis sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang /
analyzed: 'khor gsum rnam par dag pa'i bdag nyid kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa rnam pa drug yongs su spyad pa bslab pa thams cad yang dag par sgrub par byed pa dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa don dam par dran pa med cing yid la byar med pa'i tshul gyis sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang /
translated: which is the ultimate non-mindfulness and non-attention in the manner of non-entities such as powers and fearlessnesses.

original: de bzhin du dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rjes su dran pa dang / tshul de nyid kyis 'phags pa phyir mi ldog pa'i dge 'dun rjes su dran pa dang / de bzhin du ma nyams pa la sogs pa'i tshul khrims dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rjes su dran pa dang / tshul de nyid kyis 'phags pa phyir mi ldog pa'i dge 'dun rjes su dran pa dang / de bzhin du ma nyams pa la sogs pa'i tshul khrims dang /
translated: Similarly, there is the mindfulness of virtuous, non-virtuous, and neutral phenomena, the mindfulness of the noble Sangha of non-returners, and similarly, the morality of non-degeneration and so on,

original: zang zing la sogs pa'i gtong ba dang / 'dod pa la sogs pa'i lha rjes su dran pa dang / sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: zang zing la sogs pa'i gtong ba dang / 'dod pa la sogs pa'i lha rjes su dran pa dang / sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
translated: the giving of material things and so on, the recollection of the Buddha, Dharma, and Sa·πÖgha, the recollection of generosity and so on, the recollection of the deities and so on, and the recollection of the mind that first generated the thought of awakening.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa'i sems kyis chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du slob pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yid la byed pa'i sems kyis chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du slob pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The practice of all phenomena as having the nature of non-entityness with a mind that attends to omniscience, beginning from the first generation of the thought of awakening.

original: de ltar na rnam pa bcu gsum gyis dkar po'i chos thams cad rim gyis 'brel ba yongs su rdzogs par byed pa de ni 'dir mthar gyis sgrub pa'i bya bar bzhed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam pa bcu gsum gyis dkar po'i chos thams cad rim gyis 'brel ba yongs su rdzogs par byed pa de ni 'dir mthar gyis sgrub pa'i bya bar bzhed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the gradual connection and completion of all virtuous phenomena through these thirteen aspects is accepted here as the practice of serial accomplishment.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi 'grel ba shes rab sgron ma'i phreng ba zhes bya ba las skabs drug pa'i 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i man ngag gi bstan bcos mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan gyi 'grel ba shes rab sgron ma'i phreng ba zhes bya ba las skabs drug pa'i 'grel pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the sixth chapter of the treatise Illuminating the Principles, called ‚ÄúThe Presentation of the Serial and Instantaneous [Approaches to] the Perfections.‚Äù

original: // / mthar gyis sgrub pa'i mngon par rtogs pa las shin tu goms pa'i bdag nyid kyi skad cig ma gcig pa'i mngon par rtogs pa byang chub pa 'byung ba'i phyir de la mtshan nyid kyi rab tu dbye bas rnam pa bzhi las dang po rnam par smin pa
analyzed: // / mthar gyis sgrub pa'i mngon par rtogs pa las shin tu goms pa'i bdag nyid kyi skad cig ma gcig pa'i mngon par rtogs pa byang chub pa 'byung ba'i phyir de la mtshan nyid kyi rab tu dbye bas rnam pa bzhi las dang po rnam par smin pa
translated: The clear realization of the single instant of the nature of extreme accomplishment arises from the clear realization of the gradual accomplishment.üîΩTherefore, it is said that the clear realization of the single instant of the nature of extreme accomplishment arises from the clear realization of the single instant of the nature of the gradual accomplishment.üîΩThe clear realization of the single instant of the nature of the gradual accomplishment arises from the clear realization of the single instant of the nature of the path of preparation.

original: ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad skad cig ma gcig gis mngon par byang chub pa gsungs pa //üîΩsbyin pa la sogs re res kyang //
analyzed: ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad skad cig ma gcig gis mngon par byang chub pa gsungs pa // sbyin pa la sogs re res kyang //
translated: The clear realization of the single instant of the nature of the path of preparation arises from the clear realization of the single instant of the nature of the path of accumulation.üîΩThe clear realization of the single instant of the nature of the path of accumulation arises from the clear realization of the single instant of the nature of the path of application.

original: zag med chos kun bsdus pa'i phyir //
analyzed: zag med chos kun bsdus pa'i phyir //
translated: The clear realization of the single instant of the nature of the path of application arises from the clear realization of the single instant of the nature of the path of accumulation.üîΩThe clear realization of the single instant of the nature of the path of accumulation arises from the clear realization of the single instant of the nature of the path of application.üîΩThe clear realization of the single instant of the nature of the path of application arises from the clear realization of the single instant of the nature of the path of accumulation.üîΩThe clear realization of the single instant of the nature of the path of accumulation arises from the clear realization of the single instant of the nature of the path of application.üîΩThe clear realization of the single instant of the nature of the path of application arises from the clear realization of the single instant of the nature of the path of accumulation.üîΩThe clear realization of the single instant of the nature of the path of accumulation arises from the clear realization of the single instant of the nature of the path of application.üîΩThe clear realization of the single instant of the nature of the path of application arises from the clear realization of the single instant of the nature of the path of accumulation.
